review_body: No mini bar at room, no slippers provided. We were forsed to ask more than once for getting missing towl sets, and this happened more than once. Any hotel under Hilton name should provide everything Hilton name is known for: service.

The hotel is not really supposed to be walked to - which I find odd in London. It's a rather long walk from the train station that's a bit tricky and not straigh forward. It feels like you're in the middle of nowhere, but then again, the name Docklands doesn't usually conjure up pictures of downtown.The staff is very friendly and welcoming, the rooms are roomy and clean. Don't call the front desk for power and/or towels: the power only works with the key in the slot next to the light switch and the 2. person's towels are in the closet (for whatever reason).Breakfast is included but a mess. They offer everything you'd want to eat and more, but it's presented in such a small space that you have to fight your way through, wait about a 30 minutes for a waffle and if you ever leave your seat, be prepared to lose it in the time it takes you to get another cup of coffee. The most disorganized hotel breakfast I've ever seen.There's a Chinese restaurant and a pub nearby, and the hotel's pub offers some snacks as well.

Convenient situation for the ExCel. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Noise from the very nearby City Airport was minimal inside. Virtually no amenities in the nearby area, all the cafes & restaurants are on the other side of the ExCel (a long walk).

We eventually arrived at the hotel having been given completely wrong directions from central reservations and landed up in not one, but two different Hilton hotels before we reached the correct one. We were fortunately given a free taxi ride, with a little bit of persuasion, from the first wrong hotel as I dread to think how much the fare would have been - probably about £50.The room was clean and the beds very comfortable - nice and hard! The bathroom was good with a very powerful shower but it would have been nice to have somewhere to hang wet towels as had to ask for fresh ones every day as soaking wet.Breakfast was included in the price and very tasty.Not quite so good re lunch. Only snacks available. On the last day I ordered a baked potato which had black bits inside. I asked a member of staff for another one but she came back a few minutes later to tell me all the potatoes were in the same condition. She then asked me what I would like to replace suggesting I had a pizza but I wasn’t prepared to pay the extra price. I opted for a panini with cheese and bacon inside with salad but it wasn’t very appetising. The hotel was well situated opposite London City Airport and about a 3 minute walk from the DLR which made travelling into the City very easy.On my return home I realised I had left my hot water bottle behind which I need for pain relief. I have emailed twice but have had no reply to either emails. Not good.Not sure if I would stay there again.

My wife and I are currently heading home on the train after a 4 night stay and we were both chatting about how great a stay we had.The hotel itself is almost new so very clean throughout with little to no signed of wear and tear.It’s a few minutes walk from the Prince Albert DLR station so access to the tube network is a real doddle. Trips to and from the city centre take ball park 40 minutes using the tube and other public transport.The hotel is also very close to London airport, this is not an issue at all as at no time could we hear the planes as they landed and departed, the same applies to the DLR. We found our room especially quiet and as a light sleeper this was a god send (floor 7 room 723).The hotels real strong point was the staff, they really are a credit to the hotel and the Hampton brand, we received a friendly greeting upon arrival and this continued throughout our stay wether at reception, the bar or when crossing paths with the cleaning team! Sincerely I think you would struggle to find better staff elsewhere!!!The only slight negative for us was breakfast, it was very manic so we would grab a quick coffee and dash rather than face the scrum but again the hotel only cost us £84 a night so an overly busy breakfast area doesn’t change the fact that this really is a great hotel for the price and somewhere we will actively look to book next time we are in London.

We never been to London before so we did not know how far this hotel is. We took tube from airport and used DLR line to get to the hotel which took us more than an hour because we got lost, quite far from London Center but clean place to stay. We arrive earlier than the check-in time but they checked us in because the room was ready. The people at the hotel were nice and the breakfast was sufficient.

Perfect place to stop for our night in London. Comfy beds and decent breakfast. Next door to DLR and city airport. Onsite parking if you travel by car. Usual expected facilities in rooms, tea, coffee etc. Would recommend.

hotel super ok, clean rooms, quiet and spacious, nice staff always ready to help you, very good and rich breakfast.Location is not very good, away from the center and tourist attractions but located in a quiet area

Stayed at this hotel for 2nights, which included breakfast. On arrival we were met by friendly staff and went straight to our room. Our room was all very clean and had everything we needed....apart from, just one little thing - the room could really benefit from a few coat hooks. It's not a moan, because the room was exellent, just a suggestion. Before going out, we had a drink in the bar area, again friendly staff, all good. Breakfast the next morning was lovely, with friendly and helpfull staff. There was a wide choice, ranging from hot food to pastries and fruit. It can get busy at peak times, but there are plenty of different areas to sit. Overall this was a very enjoyable stay and we would book here again. A thankyou to all the staff :)

Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was nice. Although not enough towels given for the two of us. View was amazing! I made sure to pre-choose the room before arriving to make sure I had a view of the runway - I sure did! I recommend room number 600 if you have the option to choose. Food was good in the hotel, including breakfast. Staff were very nice. Only issue was the fact that I’d asked for a late check out (up to 2pm) and around 11:30am, housekeeping was already knocking on the door, and did so about 3 times before we left (around 12:15pm). We did inform them that we had a late checkout but it was a different person every time. This was annoying, so we left early.Hotel very close to DLR, (Royal Albert). Thanks for a good stay.

Stayed for a night whilst seeing MUSE at London Stadium, Stratford (fairly close by DLR).Great little hotel in a brilliant location opposite London City Airport. If you like wide open spaces and planes, what more do you need? Oh yeah...a Chinese Restaurant across the road. I would definitely recommend. No fuss, clean, friendly staff, late night food served.Would we stay again? Oh yes!!

I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights along with My parents and brother... We had a twin room and a queen accessible room and they were interconnected... that was a plus... Rooms were of Very decent size.. Plenty of space to move around.. The only thing we found that can be made better is the bedding for the accessible room.. it was a little bit too high for my dad.. Maybe a lower bed in these rooms might be better... Rest of the things was all good... Staff members were pleasant and helpful, buffet breakfast was great...a few restaurants were at a walking distance from where one can enjoy watching planes taking off and landing at the city airport

I had a very pleasant stay at the hotel. Rooms are modern, good sized, clean. Especially liked the large shower and the windows wich let the daylight in.*great gym*delicious breakfast*friendly and welcoming staff*good quality beds*huuuuge towelsOnly minus is that the Dockside area is quiet with not much interesting things to do. (beautiful parks nearby though)

My daughter and I stayed at the hotel for Comic Con, it was a short walk to the Excel Centre.The room was clean and the beds were comfy and had great pillows.The breakfast was good my daughter enjoyed the waffles.The staff were very helpful.

Great hotel ideal location for us. We didn’t have one complaint at all. The staff were all friendly and wanting to help. The complimentary breakfast was fabulous with my son particularly loving making his own waffles! Can’t wait to return!!

The location was ideal to the city airport and local amenities. The subway was close by and easily accessible. Loved our stay here and would recommend this hotel to our friends and family. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

We had an absolutely wonderful time at the Hampton. Staff friendly, helpful, and everyday the housekeeping was absolutely spotless. We also accidentally left over £200 on the side and not a single note was touched. Great location for Excel but also the whole of Central London. The breakfast is absolutely wonderful. We stayed for our mini moon and would come again - and again and again!

Spending five days at the same hotel receiving the same level of service is very pleasing ..breakfast is great this ...hotel is located somewhat out of the city but it is quiet and about 20 minutes by DLR and five minutes walk from the train stop and well priced if you are not paying in pounds

Good hotel for the Excel Arena, has a bar and gym. I would not recommend for a visit to London unless you using the Excel Arena. Some of the rooms are excellent, I was given a disability room which had a lovely view of a brick wall! Service was a little slow, but saying that was very friendly and helpful.

Good hotel for an airport hotel. It’s a Hampton so restaurant facilities are limited. The included breakfast is good. Rooms are clean and modern. Cannot hear any aircraft noise from the room. Staff friendly and courteous. Not much around the hotel other than other hotels and a Chinese opposite. Well worth a stay if you have business in the area or for accessing the airport or eXcel.

We spent 3 nights here and felt that the overall experience was extremely positive, particularly keeping in mind that it is a 2* hotel.The staff provided excellent customer service, both on reception and at breakfast.Rooms were a good size with comfortable beds and pillows. You also were able to control the temperature and get a good nights sleep. Despite the planes from City Airport taking off over the hotel, you cannot hear them inside.Breakfast was included and there was a wide range of choices, cooked and continental, along with a selection of teas and good coffee. It would have been nice to have fried rather than scrambled eggs though. We would certainly recommend the waffles.On our first night we had dinner in the bar and whilst the burger tasted good, the chips were oven chips and a bit of a let down.Location-wise, there are not many places to eat nearby, but there is a DLR station at the end of the road (few mins walk), only a couple stops from the Excel Centre and maybe 20mins from Tower Gateway station.Thank you for an enjoyable stay.

Hotel caters for gluten free at breakfast to set the day off, and staff were well briefed on what was and wasn't suitable. Clean and tidy rooms and reception area and well located for the Excel arena where there is a cable car across to the O2. LDR stations near by so getting anywhere is easy.

Stayed here for 2 nights while watching a show at the O2 arena. Great for access to the O2 via the Emirates Skyline. Easy access into London via Thames water taxi or Tube. Rooms were great and clean a d tidy. Breakfast was really nice with enough choice. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Looks like a newer hotel. very clean, very modern. great breakfast. Gym is pretty good. Bar open until 1. Serves pizzas 24hr. Not much around the area but the hotels and a bar and convention center. ..

The hotel had very efficient staff, the rooms are neat and clean, the food options are limited but we found what we needed, so they cater to everyone. Breakfast was good. It has a tube station nearby that can take you to central london.

I stayed here with my wife and daughter for one night. It’s in a good location for the Excel and London City Airport. It’s also close to the DLR. The room was comfortable with a sofa bed for our daughter on request. The customer service from the staff was excellent and the breakfast was very good.Would definitely stay again.

Lack of Air-Con control from the room.Cooked Breakfast options a bit limited.Bathroom was cleaner than most other hotels we've stayed at which was a very good plus point.Would've been nice if the Hotel had other leisure facilities, i.e. Pool Steam/Suana etc.

Nice good value hotel, stayed 5 nights for a convention at excel, very handy 10 min walk, good staff, nice room! BUT!!! Beware parking I had my car stolen on the second night from the hotel car park at the rear! NO CCTV which I find unbelievable! Park close to the hotel entrance!! NOT AT THE REAR!! and by the look of all the glass on the floor I wasn’t the first

Excellent service, excellent staff, excellent conditions (room, cleaning, reception, bar, breakfast space) and excellent breakfast. Everything excellent. An hotel that I will recommend to anybody who travel to London.

Stayed at the Hampton for a week whilst on business. The staff are very friendly and courteous. Rooms are very neat and the facilities caters for all types of guests. They have a lovely buffet breakfast included in the rate. Highly recommend especially if you attending an event at ExCel London, as it’s only a short walk to the venue from the hotel

My only complaint is that I had to pay a £50 deposit when I checkedin(that I didn't know about when I arrived) but I got it back as soon as I checked out. Great selection and plenty of choice for breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff.

This is the 3rd time stopping here as the prices are really good and the location is amazing if you are seeing a show at the 02. The breakfast is always great and free. The rooms are always clean, but on this stay I was annoyed when we can to the day we were checking out. We had a knock on the door, it was the housekeeper telling us our check out was today. This was 10:00am. We told her we know and will be out soon. 11:00 came, another knock housekeeper again asking us when are we leaving. Check out is not till 12:00. I found this inappropriate, I know they have a job to do but we didn't over stay. Maybe the management could let the housekeepers know to know there boundaries for our next visit. I would stay here again as the location is great and great transport link with the DLR and then the tube in Canning Town.

Clean, comfortable, free breakfast, easy to find. Ticked the box. There's nothing much within walking distance so we ate at hotel which was ok but very limited menu, did the trick for a one night stop over, family room, parking, pleasant staff.

Stayed for a business trip for 3 nights having previously stayed at The DoubleTree 100 metres away.The lobby and reception area were pretty basic and what you'd expect of Hilton's budget arm.The staff were fantastic when we checked in and more than accommodating throughout. The breakfast was great for me (always opt for continental) however my colleague said the cooked was lacking a little.The rooms were better than the aforementioned hotel across the road; clean, bright, spacious and very well specced.For the price you pay I would definitely recommend staying here.

Stayed here on a number of occasions. It is very hand for LCY airport and indeed for the ExCel Conference facilities. Rooms are simple, clean and beds are comfortable. I choose a high corner room as you get a view of the airport and up the river too. Breakfast was sufficient for my needs, wifi was a simple click to get on instead of trying to get a password etc, and staff were friendly and willing to help.My digital room key half worked - It opened the floor door but not my bedroom door, so only snag of the stay.Visited the Chinese 100 yards away and had a very good meal.I've returned a few times and even taken my family there too as was convenient for the Emirates sky cable car and easy to get into/out of London and lower cost of being in town.

Good budget option for VidCon London at Excel.10 minutes walk To East side of Venue.Clean room, comfy beds. Fine for 2 night stay.Breakfast was ok. Pastries were a bit hard. Waffles great.It was hard finding places open late for dinner. It is quite a walk through Excel Centres far side.

My second stay and definitely my go to hotel when i need to stay over in town. While it’s a little way out from the city, I found it as I refused to pay over £200 for a travel lodge!!! It’s very well equipped and includes a decent breakfast buffet. Very good value for money. If you’re using City Airport or visiting the Excel it’s ideally located. Staff were really friendly and attentive. The beds in the room were super comfortable. Room and bathroom is well equipped. Will definitely be back.

We returned to this hotel because it is convenient for O2. Having stayed before we knew what to expect, and the rooms, lobby, breakfast were all good.The thing that makes this hotel stand out is the staff. Everyone we came across was friendly and helpful. We really felt that they had time for us, and were prepared to make an extra effort to do whatever we needed and more.

A great hotel, just a few minutes from ExCel, so it was very convenient. It has all the services and amenities you need. Friendly staff and the rooms are lovely and spacious for working and chilling out.

For Central London, to have great quality at this price (my last minute booking for a queen room was around 90 pounds) is outstanding. The Hotel is recently refurbished to a very high standard. The doors are heavy, so the soundproofing is excellent. The linen was fresh and clean and extremely comfortable. Wi Fi is free and the staff are very well-trained and helpful. The free breakfast buffet was good with thick bacon and lovely sausages. The only very minor downsides were that the only prepared fruit at breakfast were those horrible canned mandarin segments, and the rooms were slightly on the small side. But all-in-all this place is outstanding value and comfort and I am definitely going again.

Modern clean hotel all rooms have modern showers top spec. Big buffet breakfast- there’s about 5 hotels in a row I popped and looked in all of them pick this one. Also internet free and easy dinner food pizza jacket pots etc and good sofa lounge area. Family room double bed plus double sofa.

My family loves staying at the Hampton by Hilton in the US. The breakfasts are worth it on their own, but the rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff if helpful and friendly, and the overall value is very high. This experience was no different, and solidifies my loyalty to this brand. Everything you might want in a hotel for your family.

First of all, the location - this hotel is in a great location for London City Airport and the Excel, O2 Arena, or even Canary Wharf etc. DLR is approx 5 minute walk away for transport into London. Note the DLR from City Airport is a different line, so you need to walk (5-10 mins) or get a cab.Breakfast, complimentary buffet style breakfast. A good selection, fresh and plentiful, layout a bit odd and bit of a free-for-all, but good nonetheless. Unfortunately, that's about it for positive comments.There is no restaurant at this hotel, they offer bar snacks, but you will need to go further afield for 'proper' food. I asked if they had any sort of deals / link-up with the DoubleTree (another Hilton brand) across the road, and got a 'no of course not' sort of response.The free Wifi was very slow and pretty much unusable. Didn't test the premium Wifi. Reception advised the signal isn't great in some areas, but was able to use the business centre computers instead.The bed was pretty firm, yet the pillows far too soft, so you just sank into them. Mattress slipped away from headboard if you tried to sit up in bed, to read etc. Duvet cover was torn, and towels were worn and freyed.The room was clean and neatly presented, though the shower tray in the bathroom was worn and looked grubby/dirty. Otherwise the bathroom was also clean and tidy.Air-conditioning was a nightmare. It was set to 29 degrees (C) on arrival, and the room was very warm. We turned it down to 20 (a reasonably comfortable temperature) and it just started blasting out cold air, eventually we switched it off when the room had cooled down. However we were woken in the middle of the night sweltering hot as it had reset itself back to 29 degrees and the room was like an oven. Again, we turned it down and it blasted out cold air until we switched it off. This happened each night we were there.I raised the issue of the aircon with reception, didn't really get an apology, just excuses such as it must have 'got stuck' on a previous guests settings and that they would reset it. This did not resolve the issue, and nobody bothered to actually check with us if it had or not.Advised reception again about it the following morning, was advised maintenance would look at it the following day!Overall, we had 3 nights of broken sleep in what was supposed to be a relaxing weekend away. This felt like a stay at a poor budget hotel, I expected much more from a Hilton branded property.

Lovely room, super bathroom, friendly staff and the complimentary breakfast was the best in a hotel of this size I've had in ages. Handy for ExCel. £15 for parking. Will definitely stop again if in the area.

I stayed here with my partner for one night on a Saturday as we were seeing a show at the O2 arena. We paid £84 through booking.com which was very good value.This hotel is in a really clean, quiet and safe area opposite London City Airport and is just a few mins walk from the Royal Albert DLR station. We had a queen room which was really clean and tidy, although the net curtain was a bit dirty but this is just a small gripe. There is heating/air con, big shower, huge tv, desk, hairdryer, tea/coffee and all the other stuff you’d expect.The breakfast was really good with lots of choice. They don’t offer room service meals but they have a 24/7 hot snacks service you can order at the bar - the wait for this was quite long but the food was tasty enough for a simple panini. They also do pizza, nachos etc.I’d definitely stay here again for the O2 as it’s really easy to get there from the hotel, and the price was excellent.

Lovely hotel , excellent breakfast, excellent menu for all other times of day , great customer service , hotel very good position for tube ( g l r Albert dock ) hotel is new and it is a great place to stay for all London attractions , parking available at extra cost but well worth it ,will stay here when we visit London again .

Friday night stay.€88.Arrived into London City airport - short 5 minute walk across the Thames to this absolute GEM of a hotel.Extremely fast check-in by some of the most friendly and professional staff I've ever encountered.Room was huge, with very comfortable King Sized Bed.Large Flatscreen TV with excellent selection of channels.Spotless WC with power shower.Basic toiletries supplied - perfect!I was starving when I arrived, so I ordered a pizza from the kitchen (they don't do room service - you have to collect your order from the bar downstairs)Couldn't believe how quickly the delicious pizza was cooked and ready for collection.Washed it down with a nice pint of IPA Slept like a log in a really comfortable bed with plenty of pillows. Can't believe how comfortable it was - seriously!Up for breakfast next morning. It's a buffet style affair, but there's plenty of hot food and cold options available.So...that's all the good things.Now, the downside.......Hold on a minute - there's NO downside.This place is perfect.Its part of the Hilton Chain and, I'm guessing aimed at families, but don't let any part of that put you off.This establishment is truly tremendous....and not just the accommodation and facilities.It's always nice to see smiling staff who are attentive to a customers needs. it's a huge 10/10 from me Great work.....see you again soon!

Coming from the North it is easily accessible (M6 M1 M25 M11 North Circular) Facilities were fine for a budget type hotel. Decent all you can eat breakfast, and five minute walk to the nearest DLR station

I didn't book the hotel myself as it was booked through work, so I didn't know what to expect.The hotel could have more parking spaces available, but land likely doesn't permit this so that's fair enough.The hotel staff were nice, check in was easy, and the reception/lobby was very nice. The room was also lovely. Clean, good sized comfortable bed, big TV and big shower which had good temperature.I was a little worried about the airport, but all the planes stopped flying over around 10pm.There is a pub a 2 minute walk away if you don't want to eat at the hotel, too.Overall, good hotel! :)

Overall, this hotel will do. It's a far ride to the city, about 40 min to central London but the subway isn't hard to use and there's a DLR stop close by. The breakfast is also acceptable as the eggs are those premade powdered kind and tasted pretty gross, but it was free. What I would say is that I didn't see any of the staff smile or seem to be friendly the entire 5 days we were here. They weren't rude, but they weren't especially nice either. We had a small issue with our cards not working on our last night and the manager came out to help and explain that I only booked for 4 days, almost to the point of blaming me for the issue with the cards but not quite. When I showed him my confirmation for 5, he just dismissed the whole thing without further comment and we recieved our cards back, now working. We weren't wished a nice evening, no apology for the inconvenience, no smile. Not a requirement at a hotel in my opinion, but still. I don't ask for much from a hotel, hardly ever drink the free waters or use the coffee pots, and never in my life have I ordered room service but this trip I had a bit of a cold and looked for some of those extra things that make a hotel stay more comfortable. There is no water or ice machine, have to buy water downstairs. There is no fridge in the room. There is no room service. I asked on our last night to use a microwave to warm dinner brought back to the hotel, as we got back early to prepare for an early departure the next day (also knowing there's no room service) , and of course there isn't one for guests. Outside of the lack of hospitality, the walls are very thin and I had to go myself to our next door neighbors, who were in town for a basketball tournament, to ask them to quiet down at around 12am. Stay here if this is a great deal, but I'd recommend looking around and paying a few extra dollars to be closer to the city.

The beds were a night mare, still up at 2:30, all good though cause got breaky in the morning, the hotel staff were helpful and very approachable, I recommend this hotel but might have a better sleep on the floor...

I was invited to this place by management after not being able to get food at their sister hotel across the road.reception staff fairly warm and welcoming bar one or two who choose to be a little distant and snooty.Hotel looks nice and the foyer area is very well comfortable. I like the decor and the ambiance of the place, its a well set up operation and I find few foibles bar the fact they jack the prices up during comic con expo week to levels that are near extortionate the two times per year the expo takes place.Why should we be subsiding airport flight cancellation stopovers which is these hotels meat and veg. I remind Hampton owners that a lot of people who go to comic con are disabled and cannot afford much.The breakfast at £10 is to scream for totally marvellous value for money against the others. Hot and cold buffet breakfast with a waffle maker and toppings galore.My only critique no decaffeinated coffee in the electronic dispenser hot drinks machine, that is a very big no no.This article would have been 4 stars if for one thing? The member of breakfast staff going around shouting and pushing their weight about with the customers and by the way when you let your family in i.e. husband and children to eat food with the customers (presumable they haven't paid) one suggests you keep a low profile and try to cease throwing the proverbial doll out of the pram. It isn't a perk of the job when its affecting resident paying customers and this member of staff stuck out like a sore thumb it was so blatantly obvious.You let yourself down Hampton on one small straw issue that broke the camels back.The management need to get a grip quite fast as you're having the jest taken out of you.This article is my own personal opinion and perception based on two meal visits over two days there a paying customer in a party of 5 at £100 in total.

Stayed here for business. Chose a flexible booking but told that only counted upto the day I booked. Quite disappointing but it was on the booking form. Very limited menu in the 'restaurant' that's mostly Iceland frozen specials by the look of it.Room OK but cold when getting back from work. Keep finding hairs in the shower and on the carpet that aren't mine but that's just par for the course in UK hotels I did have an extra card but that was taken by the cleaners on the first day. There are other options that are available in the vicinity that do the same thing but better. Found most of the staff to be friendly and helpful but not all. Won't be going back if I can help it.OK for London if you are paying 'discounted' price but certainly not worth the usual rates.

Hotel is new, well kept, really good breakfast, friendly staff and 5 minutes walk from the nearest DLR station. Really is everything you need if you’re willing to travel for a bit longer to get in and out of town.

Decamped to this hotel for a weeks stay recently.It is situated right opposite Canning Town transport interchange so getting anywhere is very easy.The hotel has no formal reception, just staff with PDAs. I was met by two ladies who sorted my room card out and I was unpacking in a matter of minutes. When I was in the cafe area later guests were struggling to check in as apart from the bar staff nobody was around.My room was facing the main road and transport hub so was very noisy if I wanted the window open. Aircon was very slow to get going, taking 20/30 minutes to start to pump out cooled air, not good when the temperature was 28 degrees!!The shower was good and powerful, and the bathroom clean. The bed was an absolute joke. Obviously a super cheap mattress had seen better days so a thin topper had been put on top which slipped around if you turned over, and was just plain inadequate for the job.Decent wifi and USB charging points in the room were welcome.My room was serviced every day except one, when the maid was still cleaning at 5pm, so I just got clean towels from her.Bar/cafe area was set out well, non-guests seem to make up a large number of visitors, but somewhere to sit was always free when I wanted it.All in all a decent budget hotel in a good location.

We stayed here this weekend as we were attending the baseball game at West Ham. This is a new, modern hotel. Our room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. We ate here one night too and food was also good and reasonably priced especially for London. Would definitely stay here again.

Lovely hotel. Exactly what you need to stay for a few nights. Extremely clean and great location. Breakfast was good as well and the whole package was value for money. Location is right opposite the rail station.

The hotel is a rather new one. The rooms are big enough for London standards and really clean. Even the bathrooms where an appropriate size.Most basic amenities are available.Check in is a bit confusing since the staff does everything by smartphone, you have to find them.Only thing I didn't like was the breakfast. Everything was plentiful and looked nice but the taste was very bland. Also quality was not great, cheap sausages and eggs. Also for the size of the hotel they would need a much bigger bar area or more separate tables.But all in all I would stay here again for the nice rooms and the convenience of the easy access to the tube.

Excellent hotel! Great location directly opposite the tube with access to the whole of the capital. Smooth, quick check in on foot with friendly, patient staff! Shout out to Beena and Baaba who were fab at their job! The room was spotless, modern and comfortable with a very quiet nights sleep. Breakfast plentiful and delicious. All in all I wouldn’t hesitate to stay again! Great value!

Easy check in and only one stop away from the o2 so it great for concerts. The room looked brand new as if we were the first to stay in it. Free wifi throughout the hotel that was actually a good speed. Plenty of plug sockets, decent size twin room. Quiet room. The room did get very hot in the middle of the night though.

The hotel is perfectly located next to the DLR line with easy access to London City airport and London down town. Very queiet room and breakfast was perfectly fine. The overall price was very reasonable for London

Needed a clean, comfortable and welcoming hotel where everything works well. Found the Ibis on Jubilee Line, close to O2 and turns out we had an amazing stay. I straightaway became a member of the AccorHotels group.Thank you to all the staff at the Ibis.Will definitely be coming back.Thank you

I had been searching for a clean, well priced, comfortable hotel near an underground station close to the 02 arena...and this hotel checks all the boxes!!The hotel is clean, modern and rooms are fresh and comfortable and Canning Town underground and bus station is literally just across the road from the main entrance.If, like us, we were at an event at the O2 then you can see it from the hotel it is that close to the hotel and only one step on the underground on the Jubilee line.There is a lift covering all 9 floors so if any of your party have mobility issues or are just simply tired after a long day no need to struggle up flights of stairs.The twin room we had tea/coffee making facilities, a small closet to hang up clothes, a hairdryer and a big flat screen TV on the wall. The room also had plenty of power points to charge multiple devices if needed.The toilet/shower room is sleek and modern and even has a shower seat attached to the wall if needed.The area around the hotel is less tourist than other places and personally although the food in the in-hotel restaurant was tasty and well priced for London I found the menu to be a little basic there are plenty places to eat and shop at the O2 less than 5 mins away and the high street across the road has a Co-Op and restaurants. Breakfast is available at a cost but chose not to take it as didn’t appear much vegan choices but to be fair I didn’t ask.Great customer service and would highly recommend.

I came with my family to the hotel and there was an all you can eat breakfast buffet. The team leader tahir gave us a great service and he was always taking care of us. We Will be coming back eventually.

We stayed for 3 nights and were glad to see that everything here is as good as it was during our previous visit. The only remark we could have is that tables in the evening aren't cleaned very quickly and properly, so you get your drink from the bar and you're standing in front of tables full of dirt and leftovers, having nowhere to sit. But to be honest, this phenomenon didn't happen in the mornings, probably because of Tahir, the super-friendly breakfast guy who seems to take care of everything and everyone in the most efficient way - always with a smile. (No surprise he was the only hotel employee we could recall from our last year's visit.) Evgenia at the reception was super-friendly too!

We stayed in a rather small yet clean room.The hotel location is convenient ( exactly opposite to Canning Town Station)Friendly Staff. Good Breakfast. Ibis London Canning Town is definitely recommend.

the room was new and the decoration was beautiful, it was small but very clean, and I liked the bathroom also. the hotel is perfect for solo travelers. It's just few steps from canning town station and they have free luggage storage. choose your dates wisely I got it for GBP 60 and stayed there for a night only (the next night was so expensive around 180, I preferred to return home)

stayed one night for Take That concert at 02 arena. Hotel straight over pedestrian crossing from tube, DLR , and bus cobined station. one stop on tube to 02 and 10 mins DLR to tower gate. also 1 stop on DLR to cable car over Themes to excel or 02 arena. Hotel very modern, clean, with smart bar area. Rooms clean, comfortable and slept well.  Would defiantly use again and recommend as good value hotel for the location.

Small but cosy and cute rooms with a nice bathroom. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. From the hotel to the centre of London is around 20 minutes with London Underground: Jubilee Line. There is not much to do in the neighbourhood of the hotel, but it is right next to the subway. Also the breakfast was great. I would stay at this hotel again.

A very adequate room, it’s clean and has everything you need, the bed was really comfortable, the shower was very good, All in all a nice clean and comfortable roomThe cafe was perfectly adequate for a light lunch, I didn’t have the breakfast. Definitely come again.

execellent stay, very nice hotel, fresh, clean, friendly, compare to other hotel ibis maybe less choice on breakfast, very good location, sleeping good no noises, good quality on price, must be seen in london

Nice, new hotel. Cleana md modern. A touch out the way but about 20 seconds' walk away from the jubilee line straight into the action. Decent bar and restaurant in house. Staff are friendly and helpful enough. Breakfast is a bit crowded but decent food nonetheless.

Small rooms that were cleaned daily, and had everything I needed. Delicious complimentary breakfast. Friendly staff in the reception/bar area (shoutout Tahir!). Awesome artwork in the lobby. All around very easy to get anywhere in London via the tube, which is just out the door of the hotel lobby. Thanks again!

This is by far the best stay we've had in a chain hotel. Extremely clean and comfortable, staff pleasant and breakfast was delicious. The only thing that doesn't make my review excellent was the fact our room neighbours were very noisy, playing loud music and shouting from 6pm - to 3am and there were no staff around to tackle this. I completely realise and understand that the behaviour of their customers is not their fault but possibly a few corridor checks could combat any anti-social behaviour and make visiting the hotel comfortable for all customers, not just those who are young and like to get drunk and have a party in their rooms.

Clean room, good service, friendly staff. Good selection of food at breakfast. Good lifts.The only thing I would grumble about is that the coffee machine at breakfast does not provide hot enough coffee.

1 underground stop from the O2 (3 mins)Right outside Canning Town tube/DLRFriendly staffWouldn’t use for a central London trip but handy for dock lands/excel and Canary Wharf Comfy beds Not much around the hotel itself

You must try this hotel in London canning town ....The rooms.are very good ,the food is lovely ,and the drinks are very reasonably....ITransport, its all on your doorstep. Under ground , and bus station.........

Stayed for three nights at this hotel so that I could attend meetings near the Tower of London and at the IET, Savoy Place. Staff were very welcoming and I had a nice relatively quiet room on the fifth floor. I had breakfast each day, which as with most hotels is a little pricey, but you can eat as much as you want and there is a variety of food on offer. Unfortunately I didn't try food in the evenings, but other people seemed to find it OK. If you want to go out to eat, there is a nice Italian restaurant about 5 minutes walk down the road and there may be other restaurants near by. Access to public transport is very good, with the Jubilee Line giving access to Westminster and the western part of London, whilst the Docklands Light Railway (DLR) provides frequent access to London City Airport, the Excel Centre, and central London view Tower Hill.

Great hotel situated directly opposite Canning Town tube, 1 stop to the O2, a few to Westfield and only 20 mins to central London. Well appointed quite room, really slept well in a very comfortable bed. Bar area very contemporary and had a really nice atmosphere and the same can be said when the same area is used for breakfast which was fantastic, don't blow your budget on a central London hotel this place is fantastic well positioned and a fraction of the price. Will definitely use again when in town.

One stop on the Jubilee line from the O2 arena. After the show most people travel west, so going one stop east we avoided the crowds and were back in our room half an hour after the end of the show.Decent stylish hotel. Small room, but normal for london

The hotel is very well located for public transport - just across the road from Canning Town tube station exit. It's a new hotel, the rooms are comfy, clean and well equipped (more comfy than other ibis hotels I have stayed in), and the breakfast had a good buffet selection - I especially liked the fruit salad and that they offered veggie sausages. There's no reception desk, staff in the entrance area check you in/out on their mobile phones but this was done quickly and efficiently. Staff were friendly and helpful, especially Tahir who was making sure breakfast ran smoothly!

Friendly staff, comfortable room, convenient location.Bedside tables would have been useful - there was plenty of room for one and decaf teabags at breakfast! One smallish towel each isn't enough after a shower.

We have been on a 3 night getaway with my girlfriend and chosen Ibis to make sure we receive a quality accommodation. This brand new Ibis was the most budget friendly option and worth every penny: it is clean, the location is perfect (next to the underground, 30 minutes from downtown), the check-in/check-out was super easy and fast, the staff was nice. I have also mentioned upon booking that we are celebrating our anniversary and they have prepared a little amenity in the room - also received a room with a view.Highly recommended!

Stayed here twice so far. The location is very good - cross the street from the station, one stop from o2 and not too many from central London. The hotel feels brand new, the rooms are nice and it has very good service (apart from the restaurant - some times it's very slow).

Very nice modern hotel located across the tube station. The area is being completely regenerated with City Island being constructed just across the bridge. It only takes 15-20 min to get to Green Park on the Jubilee line so easy access to the city. There are a just a few restaurants within walking distance including Zzetta Soul Fired Pizza, but then again London has so much to offer. Rooms are nice and modern, lounge downstairs is also very nice with a bar that is open late. Breakfast is ok for GBP 10.40. Typical 3 star hotel buffet breakfast, we went twice but the first time was better than the last. You have to pay upfront for it.Most of the people who work there are very young (and seem a little unexperienced) but friendly from all parts of the world. The only negative I could find is that the hotel promotes to be environmentally friendly, however they still use tons of plastic, have plastic spoons and cups in the room even wrapped in plastic. There are also no recycling bins available. They say they treasure the environment by not replacing towels unless you want them too, however even though we never put the towels on the bathroom floor they still replaced them every day. Quite a bit of greenwashing.

This is the first time I stay at an ibis hotel. It was a pleasant experience. I stayed in a surprisingly big room (for London standards) for two nights at an excellent price. Everything about the room was fine, efficient design, no frills, looked relatively new. Breakfast costs 10.45 GBP, well worth it. Convenient connections to Canary Wharf

We got the hotel for a really good price and it was in a good location with the underground just across the street. Room was great, comfy beds, nice bathroom and enough space for two people.Breakfast was 10/10 both days we had breakfast, and quick and easy check-in and check-out. Would recommend this hotel if you’re visiting London for a couple of days.

Extremely convenient for Canary Wharf being just outside Canning Town tube. Pleasant staff, very quick and easy check in, nicely fitted rooms and spacious bathroom, very clean, quirky bar. And £lots less than the hotels at Canary Wharf. What’s not to like?

EXTREMELY small rooms. Same with washroom.I stayed 20 nights with them at a stretch. Very difficult to keep luggage, not even a proper almirah present in the room. I stayed for 20 nights at a stretch with them and when I asked for a couple of hours late checkout on the past day, they refused very rudely citing the charges constantly.It might make sense for some if the nighly charges drop and they are only staying couple of nights, but please make sure that you have an idea of what the room size is. Not suited for longer stays for sure whatever the price maybe.

Nice, stylish hotel and a perfect location for exploring London. The subway station is directly opposite the hotel and you need around 15min to arrive in the center of the city. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. The breakfast was good and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.

All areas of this modern, stylish hotel were very clean. The modern way of checking people in, worked well. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. A special mention must be made of the help Tahir gave us. We were a family group staying to attend a funeral. I asked Tahir if some food could be made available for our return. He reserved one of the larger tables for our use and it was set beautifully. He also arranged for pizzas, baguettes and sandwiches to made for our group. He and all the bar staff helped make a difficult day easier.

I have stayed here a few times, it’s fairly new, rooms are clean and perfectly comfortable. The biggest selling point are it’s people all of whom are great and a credit to the hotel and it’s on that basis that I would rate it higher than some four star hotels in the Accor chain.

Best value budget hotel experience of all time. Great value, fab service and delicious pizza ! Staff are incredibly friendly and professional, and a credit to the industry.I and my colleagues will certainly be staying again, when business dictates

I stayed there for the new year. The hotel is a bit far from where the actions are but its close proximity to Canning Town station beats all. The hotel is just across the street from the tube station, from where you can take the Jubilee line or DLR to Central London, O2 or Westfield Stratford. Room is small but clean, quiet and with all the basic necessities that I need. All in all a good stay and I would stay there again if I ever visit London.

Stayed there for the first time, rooms are small but very functional, comfortable beds and with good heating (during our stay London was pretty cold). Tasty breakfast and very good coffee machines with wide variety of coffees. Nice pizzas locally made. Hospitable staff always available.

Needed emergency accomodation after other venue let us down last minute. Have stayed with other Accor hotels before in other locations. Utterly reliable! Easy to book. Nice atmosphere for dinner and drinks in evening. Spotless well thought out rooms and bathrooms. Thanks for saving the day!

I've spent there 3 nights last week and the only description which fits it's ... FANTASTIC !New structure (clean and cosy), great price, good breakfast, fair space rooms (the shower is bigger than most of the complete bathrooms I've been in London) and of course location (underground stop is just on the opposite side of the street at only 20 min from the centre).I will be surely back and I completely recomend it!

I stay here often for work. Really convenient for Canning Town station and it’s literally across the street. Service is always good and friendly and I love the free drink voucher I get through the Accor Le Club scheme.Rooms are really well furnished and very comfortable and quiet.Highly recommended.

This is one of the new style ibis hotels without a reception desk. Instead you are greeted by wandering staff with a company shirt and touch pad to check you in.I arrived at 8:30pm and on inquiring was told the restaurant was open until 10pm and then thereafter there would be their 24 hour menu. I went to my room to do an hour's work and came down to eat just before 9:30pm. When I could eventually attract the attention of the bar staff (how can 3 staff so studiously ignore a customer at the bar) I was told they had shut the restaurant early and there was no food (and no apology).I spoke to the reception staff, who told me the restaurant wasn't their responsibility and if I wanted some food I should try going outside and looking down the high street. I ended up with a sandwich from the local co-op.Now my real complaint is not that the restaurant shut early - for all I know there might have been a good reason. The problem is no one cared. No apology from the restaurant staff, no apology from the hotel staff. Indeed no one in charge who seemed at all concerned about the well-being of residents.I use ibis quite frequently, and generally across Europe they are a reliable chain of hotels. But this particular hotel is one I shall avoid in the future.

Located directly facing the Canning Town Tube/DLR station and bus terminal, this hotel is perfect for anyone attending the O2. It is a new hotel so everything is clean, bright and sparkling. Minimal but appropriate décor makes the room compact and attractive.Check in/out is a bit weird as you think you are walking into a restaurant, as indeed you are. No obvious reception area is to be seen, only what appears to be waiters and waitresses standing around. Look closer at their red attire and you will see Reception printed on them.Staff - very welcoming but the lack of a focal point does create problems. When busy, customers tend to mill around the reception person and it can be a bit of ‘loudest and most aggressive is next’. Arriving early we were given the choice of leaving our luggage free of charge or access to the room a few hours in advance of normal booking for a cost (£10) - Ryanair policies live at Ibis.Room was more than adequate for short stays but I certainly wouldn’t want to have a lengthy residence in what is a small but well laid out accommodation. Desk, wall mounted desk lamp which doubles as the main room light, tea making facilities, hair drier and easy access power point complete with 2 USB points & TV are all supplied with free Wi-fi throughout.Beds are very comfortable and the room was well soundproofed as the area is on the flight path of some pretty large jets. Lifts to all floors controlled by key car.Although we didn’t eat in the restaurant or have a drink at the bar, it did seem that the food was popular but the bar offering a bit limited.General - an excellent value for money hotel.

First time here. Loved it! Excellent staff. Excellent breakfast. Excellent room. Really impressed. My only complaint would be the placement of the power outlet at the mirror. It should definitely be up higher with a little shelf for a flat iron etc. Other than that its spot on.

Great proximity to the underground, bus and DLR. The room was very clean and the breakfast was great. I especially liked Tahir for the breakfast. He was very helpful and the breakfast was very good. Recommended!

Nice enough hotel with good rooms and pleasant staff.There is no reception, but staff with I Phone / Tablet will check you in in the entrance, check in is no problem.But Breakfast is a real pain, There is one queue or Maul with people trying to get okayed for breakfast and others trying to check out, the first morning of my stay it was almost impossible to get out of the lift because of people massed in this area.Breakfast was very poor, its a find yourself a table, find plate and cutlery etc, then find food.What is on offer is nice enough, cereal and breads / Pastries. A toaster if you want toast, and an Egg boiler device with no instructions. Hence at least one person trying to eat a raw egg not realising its cook it yourself.Fresh fruit and yogurt was available with a huge dish of frozen solid red fruits to top your choiceThe Hot offerings look nice enough but because so much is prepared in advance and left piled high under so called heat lamps, the two breakfast i had were best described as warm. The second morning not warm enough to eat.The bacon was terrible - (I have had better bacon in Benidorm) and served laying in 2cm of grease in the serving dish.They also do not seem to have enough salt and pepper pots to go around.The Hotel is Very handy for Canning Town Station and only 2 stops away from Excel.The morning rush and breakfast lets this reasonable hotel down. If they could sort out breakfast so its easier to serve yourself, and make it possible to eat food that is hot my opinion of this hotel would rise.

Its a shame there is no parking available , nor any kind of settlement for it in nearby parkings.I asked for it in the initial reservation and no one answered back.The staff where very nice but were not able to solve it

I wrote a previous review about the service in the lobby. While disappointing because we waited outside banging on the door while the night staff were at the bar, the service markedly improved for the remainder of the stay. The room was clean and the staff were friendly. They didn’t mind putting our stuff in the safes and they tried to make us comfortable. The room is small as is the bathroom, but that’s to be expected for London hotels. The property is updated and clean, and the breakfast was amazing. They met my expectations so I’m revising my earlier review. Well done, Ibis.

Nice new hotel that has a vibrant ground floor area that combines the feel of a cafe and an Apple genius bar with a normal hotel foyer. Modern rooms and novel power extension and charger were welcome, as was the roomy shower rooms (something Ibis has slipped on in the past).It has a number of glitches though. The lack of a delineated reception area coupled with insufficient staff numbers and unclear directions on how to check in, ask for help or check out was incredibly frustrating. Terrible pizza and technical issues with door locks also didn't help. If Ibis sorts out these challenges, this would be a great hotel but beware, patience is needed if you stay there in the short term. I look forward to issuing five stars at some point in the future - just not right now.

It's the first time we had used a hotel with no reception desk, which is a bit disconcerting. We were asked to sit at a table and wait. The reception seems to be run on smart phones! When we were seen the check was very efficient.Our room was an accessible room and would have worked reasonably well for a wheelchair user. It had a bit more space than the standard rooms according to the plan. The bathroom was a wet room, and again spacious. The bed was very comfortable, although the pillows were a bit hard. There were only two tea bags, and the requested replacements never appeared. The towels could be better.Breakfast for £10 is good value and the buffet has most things. When it did get busier it became a bit chaotic.The staff are friendly and helpful. Overall a useful place to stay, but not for more than one or two nights.

Clean and modern hotel. You can tell they are fairly new and have kept the place in top shape. I enjoyed being so close to the Canning Town undeground/DLR station especially on those rainy days. Can get into central London in about 20 mins and easy to get to. Room is very basic- firm bed- more like mattress topper, clean bathroom, and I appreciated the 2 usb plugs provided/hair dryer. Didn't have enough hangers for the small closet but worked it out. Only thing I would suggest is providing a wash cloth with the towels, I had to go out and buy my own. Air conditioning was decent but wished heat went a little higher- was cold one of the rainy nights. Housekeeping was egar to clean my room but did not need services- they provided toilet paper when needed. Breakfast was a great variety for the price- 10.40 pounds, the attendant was friendly and helpful. If you want hot and fresh go around 7 am- no one awake then really. Anything after good luck, it gets busy. The day I arrived was on a Saturday and place was swamped with check in and outs. I would suggest getting more staff during those busy times- the staff seemed to be annoyed with everyone and not very friendly at first. If you arrive before check in and there are no rooms available you can leave your luggage and check in later. I read other reviews to ask for a room regardless and you can pay 10 pounds to magically get into one. It worked. You have to insist you will pay and they will confirm that there is a room available, even if they say it's full at first. Glad it worked for me due to flying for 13 hours and needing sleep. Quiet place for the most part, but if you have loud neighbors you can hear the door slam in your room and will think the neighbors are trying to get into your door. Someone had left a dirty sock on my door one night because I had the do not disturb sign up, pretty sure it was drunk people or kids playing a prank. The lock on my door did not work from the inside but no one came into my room the 6 days I stayed. If you are looking for a clean place to stay, close to the underground, reasonable price, and don't mind the bare necessities I would recommend this place. Also, if you are looking for late night food the bar stops selling food at 9:30 pm. They only have a few options to sell afterwards- crisps, soda, and frozen pizza. Did not get the pizza. You are better off getting snacks and having them in your room. Also, if you are leaving early morning the doors are locked and you have to press a button to get out next to the door. Staff around the morning time usually were busy doing other things.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and overall were mostly happy with our stay. The hotel is in a great location very close to multiple transport links (central line London Underground, London Overground and buses) which is very handy for moving around London.On arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by friendly staff and check in was quick and easy. There are lifts serving all floors. The room is basic (as expected) and was clean. The bed was comfortable. We did not eat any meals in the hotel.Our only issues seemed to centre around the bathroom. The shower had very poor water pressure and at the highest temperature was just about warm. Only one towel for each person was provided and no hand towel so you have to use the towels for drying hands then use them damp to dry yourself after the shower while your wet hair is dripping down your back. The towels are also extremely poor quality. They are grey, thin and threadbare. I certainly wasn’t expecting pure white fluffy towels, but these have definitely seen better days and should be replaced. All in all, we were happy with our stay and would book again.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: This hotel is very comfortable. The breakfast is very good and the guys that work there are very kind, especially Martina that helped us with the language. They are always available for every need. The room was always clean and the hotel is in a very good position to go to central London.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Great welcoming, the rooms are very comfortable, free WiFi and a good breakfast. In a quiet area, with many restaurants and a park, very close from the circle line so we can access to the Hotel very easily from the city center.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Weve stayed here twice when seeing someone at the Apollo, rooms are clean and comfy. Breakfast is good with plenty of choices Can be very busy with coach parties but the service has always been good.Also a plus is the onsite parking
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Stayed here one night. Great location for Westfield shopping centre and the 'tube'. The Hotel staff were lovely and very helpful. Breakfast was ok but hot drinks machine not working. The room..... very basic is it shown in the photos on website. The bathroom was weird.... had to step up into it.... I felt like I was in a caravan. The towels!!!!! what can I say other than they need throwing away and investment in linen needs to be done. We got one bath towel each. No hand towel which I found strange. The 'bath' towel itself must have been white at some time... but after numerous washes was now 'grey' and see through.... it was so thin I could see through it. Tea & coffee making facilities in room great with a kettle that boils fast. would have liked a tea spoon though instead of a wooden stirrer stick.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: A good convenient place to stay if you need somewhere in the area for a few nights. Clean rooms and decent bathrooms, comfortable beds. Short distance from Shepards bush train station and within 5 mins to Westfield Shopping Centre. Breakfast offered on site but didn’t try it with various cafes situated in local vicinity.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Much better than the hotel I originally booked and had to move due to cleanliness and unruly staff. Very clean and modern hotel, great location and customer service excellent. Will be returning next time in London
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: I recently visited the ibis hotel in Shepherd’s Bush for a birthday treat after seeing Jess Glynne at the 02 empire. My daughter booked ahead and informed them it was my birthday (unbeknown to me) On arrival I was pleasantly surprised to find in my room birthday balloons, chocolates, a card and a gift all set up for me. This was such a lovely little touch and much appreciated. The rooms was lovely and we had a nice comfortable stay. The following morning we went down for a lovely buffet breakfast and again the staff surprised me with some chocolates and a slice of cake with a candle in it and sang me Happy Birthday! Would just like to say a Huge Thank You to all the staff at the Ibis for making our trip and stay so memorable. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Hard to fault for the price. Friendly and helpful staff. Smooth check in and out. USB charging sockets in rooms and bar and wireless charging mats on the bar a nice touch.Room was reasonably big for London, with a desk and small sitting area. Bathroom basic but adequate. Didn't have any problems with noise and bed was comfortable.Reasonable breakfast.Great location - bus stop round the corner and Central Line tube station over the road. Loads of eating places and shops around the hotel and within easy walking distance of Westfield shopping centre.Would stay again.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Great Hotel. Good location. Friendly Staff. Thank you to Chloé , i ll certainly come back here I wish to ibis stuf good luck to carry on their job like this room was great and comfortable thanks again
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: The bed, pillows and towels are very hard. It’s extremely difficult to fall asleep due to the conditions. The meal for the breakfast is inconsistent. Must ask staff to replenish. Great location to bus and train. Nice staff.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: The location of the hotel is really nice, opp. to Westfield Mall and the Shepherd’s bush train station. Room and bathroom is basic but very clean. Staff is so so good and helpful. This is not an opulent hotel, but if you are in London and you will be out most of the time, this a good choice. My only concern is that even in this cold weather the hotel was really hot, we had to ask for an extra fan to be put inside our room. Also the “double” bed for 02 adults is pretty small, there were a lot of noise from outside because of a fair going on nearby but that happened because we had to keep the window a little open for ventilation. Apart from these minor glitches, we had a good stay, will surely be back!
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Very comfortable stay.Check in easy,greeted by a friendly,efficient member of staff.Room was clean,comfortable and good decor.Not disturbed at night.Breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold food although the scambled egg wasn’t up to much.Would recommend this hotel.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Perfect hotel if you are attending a gig at O2 Empire as it is across the road. The hotel was clean, modern and adequate for one night away. Staff at reception (Paul) was very friendly but night staff are rude and have no manners. You get the impression the hotel is run my foreign teenagers who simply can't be bothered, they appear very lazy indeed.The breakfast is shockingly bad, cold, rubbery, nasty overcooked food. the hash browns looked like 3 days old and sausages sitting in hot plate for hours. the scrambled eggs had started to go black around the edges. When i asked for some new hot food to be brought out it was received with a huge sigh and i can't be bothered look on their faces. I couldn't finish the breakfast as it was probably the worse i have ever tasted. Ended up going to McDonalds across the road.Other than that, the hotel is adequate for a night drinking in London.WI-FI was fast, shower was good, bed comfortable.That's all really.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Excellent choice. We were a bit sceptical about the really positive feedback from others when booking. But when arriving we found that it is justified. Well situated for public transportation, clean and spacy rooms, very friendly and helpful personnel (thank you, Silvia, for your friendly help and assistance). We can really recommend this place to others who do not seek luxury but a nice place to stay for a good price.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: I’ve been to London countless times and besides the price, the location is my most important issue. This hotel is right next to Tube station on Central line, walking distance to Westfield mall and walking distance to Hammersmith, where you can catch three different Tube lines and there is nice shopping there as well. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The lack pf front desk is at first a little strange but there comes a Ibis guy, whip up his smart phone and check in is swift and easy
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Stayed here for one night having been to a Television Centre production. I wanted something central, reasonably priced with good reviews. This ticked all the boxes. I loved Shepherd's bush - felt very safe, great places to eat and drink with great connections. This hotel is very convenient, we were given a quiet room as requested after a very quick and friendly check in. Would certainly stay here again and recommend it to my friends.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: We were seeing a concert at The O2Empire. Hotel was perfect location. Clean comfortable rooms, very pleasant, helpful staff. When we came back from the concert this was under our door, nice touch. Breakfast was excellent.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: We’ve stayed in the Ibis a number of times and found it a good stay with lovely staff, Elena was one. The rooms are fine and the location just over from Shepherds Bush station is great. We got a very reasonable price to stay here.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: I used to be a regular at the Ibis in Euston, I was really sad when that got closed as it had been my go to hotel in London when I needed to stay over. I like Ibis as a brand, the hotels aren't fancy, but they're usually clean, with comfortable beds and a lot of them have walk-in showers. I had a concert at the O2 Shepherd's Bush Empire and so I was pleased to see there was an Ibis conveniently close to both the venue and the Tube station. My room was very large, far larger than I've had in other Ibis hotels and it had laminate flooring rather than carpet. I thought that might make it noisier, but I didn't notice any noise from above during my stay, though that said, it was a Sunday night, so I doubt the hotel was full. There was the usual pod-style bathroom with the walk-in shower which you get in the more modern Ibis hotels. I like them, the shower floor is sloped just enough so the whole room doesn't get wet and the double doors make it easy getting in and out. The bed was comfortable and the temperature was fine. I appreciated being able to open the window as I like it to be cool at night. Given a choice that's the one improvement I'd make to the Ibis hotels - air conditioning. The system they use can't really cope in the summer when it gets hot, but they do at least usually have a fan available in the room which helps. I didn't stay for breakfast, but I did have a drink in the bar. They do Camden Town Brewery beer on tap, so you can get a decent pint there. All in all, it was pretty much what I expect from an Ibis, clean, comfortable and good value, the brand continues to live up to what I expect.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Went to see Charles Easton in concert and stayed here for one night with friends. Greeted by friendly staff with a sense of humour and found all staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful. Very clean and smart looking and so close to where we needed to be and also close to tube station.Rooms spacious, comfortable, clean and quiet. Didn't have breakfast but nice touch was a basket of croissants/choc au pain sat on the counter for customers which we had on arrival with a cup of coffee. Would definately stay again.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Pleasent staff makes such a differens. Felt very welcome here. Good Ibis standard as you would expect. Really good value. Lots of small shops and deli/restaurants in the area. Nice location close to the underground system. Will be back.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: This hotel's location is very convenient and staff are friendly. Room was clean enough, but only lower point was shower head holder was broken, and not possible to fix during our stay. Hotel staff was arranging other room to move, but there was no same size room, so we didn't move and stayed in same room, finally.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Two night stay between Christmas and New Year. Good room on 3rd floor suited our needs on location as tube station close by. No issues at all.Slept very well with no noise from busy road outside or other visitors .Had breakfast and parked in Westfields shopping centre as cheaper.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: I got a good rate on 2 rooms for 2 nights over Dec 24th and 25th 2018. Family live nearby and it was the perfect solution. The rooms are clean and the bed comfortable. The breakfast looked very tasty and was not expensive at all. Staff friendly and the area is great for shopping and the tube is handy for central London. All in all a great choice and one I would recommend for a basic hotel for short stays.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: I had a lovely 3 nights at the Ibis London Shepherds Bush. The location was perfect, a couple of blocks away from the Central line and an easy trip into the city center.The neighborhood is a wonderful multicultural community with lots of great restaurant options.Hotel amenities were pretty minimal which was to be expected for the price. The room was clean and quiet and the bed was comfortable. That's personally all I need in an accommodation. I'm a very low maintenance traveler.Overall, I would not hesitate to book at the Ibis Shepherds Bush again the next time I'm in London.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Very good location, full IBIS standards in a confortable environment. Smiling and helpful staff, well furnished hall and bar. Nice fresh breakfast with lots of options and good quality. Good value for money
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Hotel is in a perfect location for a trip to Shepherds Bush Empire, and was delighted to find out on arrival that it is a stones throw away from the Westfield shopping centre. For the location the two night stay was very reasonably priced.Rooms are clean and functional with a good sized shower cubicle. Staff were very friendly and helpful.Only criticisms are that the towels are very small, about the same size as my hand towels at home, and the room was extremely warm, despite it being November, with it appearing the aircon disabled, and even with the thermostat set on minimum and the window open as far as the restrictor would allow, it was still too warm at the end of our two day stay. If not for these two points, I would have awarded a 5*.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Was welcomed by Paul who was lovely on reception and let us check in half hour early. Room excellent and clean, the air con was not the best so a little hot overnight and too noisy to open the window. But it is a great location close to the central line, lots of places to eat and drink nearby as well as the Westfield shopping centre which I am told is fab. They do breakfast but we ate over the road on the way to the tube station. We will be back one day I reckon, do not hesitate to book it.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: The hotel is great but more importantly the staff are so friendly & helpful! ! They continue to communicate with you if you have any questions or queries they do all they can to help .certainly went a little extra to put balloons & card in daughters room. And in place like london (knightmare to drive into) so so helpful having carpark attached to hotel walk out car with bags straight into hotel door .loads of shops & earing places on doorstep .Fantastic
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: I stayed here for one night and it was dreadfully overpriced. The room needed refurbishment, the TV didn’t function and the rom also had one of those horrible “ plastic cell “ bathrooms. Simply too much money for such a poor room. Good location for Tube and Westfield shopping centre but otherwise a grubby area
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Only stay here if you have low expectations and just need somewhere to sleep. Good points - near the tube, quiet, cheap parking at nearby Westfield centre, not too expensive (£130 b&b for 2), check in at 2 check out at 12. Bad points - awful breakfast, everything pared down to a price, room very stuffy even with aircon at lowest setting,
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Here are the picture of the fish and chips served to us today at the Ibis hotel. The batter was burnt and the fish inside was grey not white as it should be and it was served with mixed veg and not the mushy peas we ordered.I would not serve this to my dog and when we complained and asked the guy who served us would he eat it he said no way but he did nothing else.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Stayed for one night to attend one conference. One of the best Ibis hotel. Way ahead than many Ibis hotel in this area. Definitely recommend. newly built. cleanliness top notch. Short walk to restaurants and tube stations.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Booked a London Package for our 20th anniversary and didn’t get to choose the accommodations. When we heard 2 weeks out that this was our Property, we were disappointed that it wasn’t located closer to Central London. BUT, it was a very close walk to the shepherd bush-Central Line station which made it more convenient. Many amenities close by as well, restaurants, pharmacy, shopping mall. The staff were all so friendly, the breakfast was an amazing start to each day - so much variety, great coffee & tea selection. If I return to London I will try to stay closer to the heart of the fun but if you don’t mind crazy busy subway stations, this is a decent choice. All in all LOVED LONDON! PS have a pizza at Pizza Express next door, tasty and affordable!
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: We stayed here yesterday for one night, all staff were extremely polite and accommodating. Our room was fine, very clean in all areas, bed comfortable and we had a quiet nights sleep. We felt breakfast was fine, plenty to chose from, we have no negatives. Thank you.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: My wife and I normally stay here when in West London and have always had a very good experience, as have the relatives who have taken up out recommendation of staying here.Our last visit must have something to do with French revenge for the BREXIT campaign. Things had deteriorated since our last stay. My negative review has ABSOLUTELY NOTHING to do with the staff who were polite and extremely helpful.On entering our room, everything was as we expected, clean and tidy. A typical generic Ibis room. Immediately, we were hit by the overpowering smell of whatever the room was cleaned with. Was it a masking agent or just over zealous use of disinfectant? Because we were only staying one night and it was quite late we decided to brave it out. Terrible mistake. We couldn't sleep and we were left with only one option which was to open the window. The noise of the air-conditioning units and traffic certainly diluted the smell but the cost was a noisy and disturbed night. When we returned home our clothes wreaked of the disinfectant?? smell as did our suitcase. To add insult to injury, when we tried to make a coffee we found that our milk curdled the drink. Long life milk past its use by date? Just do not know because the date was not visible.
