Poor show!!We thought things would improve at breakfast but as my wife has an intolerance to wheat and is pre diabetic we knew that we would be able to have porridge (enthusiastically advertised in the hotel). Unfortunately, there is a standard price for breakfast, which would have made this as expensive as the porridge at he Savoy. Maybe.What a pity as our West London bolthole will need replaced by another. Rather galling as an Accors member.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: I have been regularly visiting London for the couple of years. I have stayed at many different hotels in different locations. I have found this hotel to be up there with the best hotels I have stayed at. The staff were friendly and professional, the rooms were clean. The location of the hotel was close to 4 tubes station and also close to Westfields London. I have no doubt that I will stay at this great hotel again.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Location was superb, the staff very friendly and the quality/ price ratio was correct. Rooms are simple, but the correct Ibis standard. Only downside was not many tables at breakfast so I had to sit with others instead of being able to have breakfast by myself.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Good WiFi. Friendly staff. Clean and modern hotel. Good location. Only negative is that maybe a few extra plug sockets beside could be added but staff were friendly and helpful. Bar available and food available.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Visiting this hotel for the second time and definitely good choice.Again excellent staff and room are very clean and tidy.I checked in during busy time but everything was quick and efficient .Following morning I had breakfast with usual continental and cooked which was nice.I will return to my next trip in London.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: We spent 4 days here during the first part of our anniversary trip. The hotel is in a great location. Just steps away from the Shepherds Bush tube station, which made it incredibly convenient for getting around London. We arrived a couple of hours before official check in time, but they were able to check us in early (which was very appreciated after a long flight). The room was bright and clean, a little small, but we knew to expect that in London. We had ample space for everything and were quite comfortable. After checking in we decided to walk around London (trying to stay awake to adjust to the time change). During our check in chat we happened to mention we were there to celebrate our 30th anniversary, when we returned to our room, later that day, we found heart balloons, rose petals on the bed, champagne flutes, a small bottle of sparkling wine and a very nice card. What a thoughtful gesture.We had a very pleasant stay here and found the staff incredibly friendly, room very nice, clean, bright and comfortable (although the mattress wasn't the most comfortable we had ever slept on). But generally we were really pleased with our stay and enjoyed it very much.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: The beds are incredibly small. I booked a twin room and the beds were so tiny I almost fell off several times. Like you can't even roll over. That's how tiny they were. There was spare room between the bedside tables and the actual beds. So you could see how a regular single bed could fit in there but instead they put like, I don't know, 70 cm wide beds? The rooms weren't really big either. If there's two of you, which was the case for me, one person had a place to put their suitcase but the other one just had to put it on top of the table. Next to the other person's bed. It just seems poorly planned. But there were many lil empty spots around the room, so we made it work.The staff were lovely though. The people at reception made you feel welcome and the housekeeping staff were super helpful. Thanks a lot.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: We have stayed at this hotel a few times and even though it is not as convenient as other Ibises we have stayed at we have always liked it because of the customer service. The lady at check in was friendly enough and the lady we redeemed our drink vouchers with was nice enough but the rest of the staff did not smile, did not greet you and seemed generally disinterested in anything. Breakfast which was always amazing was disappointing and sad. There was no bacon, no eggs, and the sausages were over cooked and the entire breakfast staff looked haggard and in a daze. The room was fine and the shower was good as always but someone needs to step in and do a little team building with the staff because let's face it, it's all about the customer service.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Good location, close to Shepherd's Bush station. Efficient checkin at the small reception at the end of the bar. Staff were friendly, especially Elena who offered great service on the bar and was chatty and friendly to the guests.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Been a regular customer several times until the previous visit which has left a horrible experience from the management team in this hotel. We paid almost £2500 in advance for our stays with the late check-in; however, they could not reserve the rooms which we requested and provided us to be in accessible rooms or other hotels at 11pm. Never ever stayed in this hotel again.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Stayed for one night after a conference in Wales before flying back. Chosed by location and accessibility, coming from Paddington. Room was excellent, breakfast acceptable (too crowded and noisy) and food was average. Service is not so good as receptionists also function as cleaning personnel for breakfast and guests pile up to checkin, checkout and ask questions, call a taxi, etc at the booth functioning as reception. Worse is that some receptionists DO NOT KNOW LONDON which is not acceptable. Having no idea about Victoria train station is unbelievable. Taxi company estimate given on the phone of a service to Victoria was 14 pounds, taxi driver wanted 22. the taxi called by the hotel did not have a meter so the driver can squeeze you. so, excellent room, good location but terrible service. You have to know London not to depend on the service the hotel personnel cannot provide...
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: I loved everything about the hotel. it is close to the subway station on the center line. the attendance was a special chapter and Adrian a professional with great attention and I recommend it with 5 stars.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: This hotel is fine for those travelling on a budget. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the water was hot. The hotel is very close to an underground station giving easy access to central London, and there were lots of places to eat close by.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: A nice hotel, very clean and modern but the staff stand out as some of the friendliest and accommodating I have ever come across. They deserve great praise, thank you for making our stay enjoyable, we will be back.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Stayed here for just over a week in early August 2018. Would do it again. Good access to public transport, comfortable quiet rooms, and considering London prices, good value for money. If optional breakfast is taken, give the room service staff a break and don't have your bed made up or towels changed. You'll be rewarded with a card that gives you nearly half off the standard price.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: The hotel is in a strategic position of the city near the Shepherds Bush tube.All the staff is kind and pleasant. Martina speak also italian and is disposable to give you information and any kind of suggestions you need. Very suggested! I surely come back again! Thanks to all!
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Extra efficient check in, excellent customer service, friendly staff and management, clean rooms, close to the underground and shopping is great as Westfield is close by and the breakfast is good .....
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Stayed for one night, double room, good location, good price, nice and clean, very polite and helpful staff.I would have given 5 stars but the bathroom was poor and had a noisy floor when you stepped on it.
hotelName: Ibis London Shepherds Bush - Hammersmith Hotel

review_body: Set in a Poplar backstreet this is probably the smartest boutique hotel I've stopped in. Got a great deal through their own website and booked for a Friday night with breakfast. On arrival we were greeted by Zuber who made us feel very welcome and gave us all the information we needed. The room itself was amazing with modern one touch light SWITCHES, A modern TV with full Entertainment system and a mobile phone that can be used for free calls and internet inside or outside the hotel. We decided to eat in the restaurant and weren't disappointed. As we were the only ones in there we received great service. The menu offers five or six starters, mains and desserts and our Calamari, Nachos, Fish and Chips and Chicken Burger were all freshly cooked and were clearly not freezer food. The cocktails we had were very strong and reasonably priced. The only minor issue we had was with the breakfast. I booked for pre paid bed and breakfast on the Lansbury website only to be told by Zuber that our booking was shown on his system as room only. After showing him my booking he kindly waived the breakfast charge and assured me it was an IT glitch with their system. Saying that the buffet breakfast was very nice with all the usual items and staff were again very helpful and polite. Don't be put off by the location as you are only five minutes walk to All Saints or Poplar DLR. I will definitely be back.

This beautiful hotel is an oasis close to Canary Wharf. Easy access to the Poplar tube stop (DLR line). The building & rooms are beautiful - staff is very friendly & breakfast is good with coffee, juice, pastries, ceral, yogurt. We enjoyed our stay!

We Couldn't fault the hotel or staff. beautiful rooms and staff were very helpful. breakfast was great and so was the service. We didn't use the spa but it looked nice. Will definitely be using again.

The hotel itself was reasonably OK. The room and bed were quite nice. The bathroom was small but the shower worked well. TV was fine.Tea and coffee in the room. However, the window did not open at all so the room got stuffy and airless.The air con was noisy and we couldn't get it to work properly. There was a gym and sauna downstairs. This was supposedly open till 10pm but when I went at 9pm, they had turned it off. There was no apology but they turned it on although it didn't get hot before 10pm. The main start switch on the treadmill in the gym didn't work but someone came and showed me how to get it to work.The breakfast and lunch were fine. Nothing special but quite OK. The restaurant was a bit dark an airless in the basement. The staff were lovely throughout: very friendly and helpful. However, there didn't seem to be any overall manager overseeing things.The hotel was excellent value for London - around £110 including breakfast for 2.The main drawback was the location. It was quite a nice hotel right on the edge of a Tower Hamlets housing estate. There were no restaurants (except fried chicken) and although the DLR was very close, the tube was a 15-20 minute walk navigating a huge road. Uber was at hand and we did get about that way.

Good hotel, nice staff, good breakfast, very comfortable bed, quick check-in, a few minutes tonthe DLR Poplar station and Canary Wharf. Only limitation was the very slow WIFI in my club room which was a shame if you are staying there for business purposes.

We spent the night here in order to explore the Docklands area. Our room was a double, quite small but very well decorated, well fitted out with everything we needed including a decent sized telly.The room has a high ceiling so you didn't feel cramped and it was spotless.There is a small spa and bar/restaurant. We didn't have dinner there but the breakfast was good.As a quiet place to use for a jumping off point for the whole Docklands area it was great.

A lovely find, convenient for the O2 arena. Beautifully decorated, very comfortable and delicious breakfast. Really lovely hotel, reasonably priced and would highly recommend! Unique mezzanine style also a quirky addition.

I booked to stay hear last minute as we had tickets for a concert at the o2. I must say I was very pleasantly surprised, I normally stay at the rosewood when in London but wanted somewhere a bit closer this time as we didn’t have lots of time for commuting.Direct access routes via the DLR to get to the hotel. The DLR only takes about 10 mins also to get to and from London city airport. Great location for events at the o2 approximately 20 mins via DLR and underground. More importantly about £16 back in a taxi from the o2 to avoid the massive underground queues.The hotel it’s self was immaculate, very clean everywhere. Front of house staff are also very welcoming and helpful.The room itself was very nicely decorated and well equipped, I have spent a lot more money in other hotel and got a fraction of the luxuries and service that we got here.I don’t really have any negative things to say but maybe just a bit of constructive feedback that may be helpful was that my room on the ground floor wasn’t the quietest of rooms. I couldn’t figure out if it was the plumbing above that was very noisy when the toilet or taps were being used. Finally the info booklet informs guests that room service is available to 11pm for some items. I called for room service at 10:40 and was told the kitchen was closed. However I do feel the last point is understandable if it’s been a quiet night for the chef to let them get away.All in all I was very pleased and felt that the hotel was great value and served its purpose well. I wouldn’t hesitate about staying again if I was attending another concert at the o2.

The afternoon tea was nice, the ambiance was perfect for a special birthday. The staff were lovely, very attentive. The scones were amazing and the compote complemented the clotted cream. Our kids loved all the cakes, thank you so much.

Enjoyed a one night stay here while visiting a show at O2 Arena. Beautifully finished room, although layout a bit quirky (on 2 floors). Kettle for tea and coffee, iron and board, bathrobes and good quality toiletries all provided. Bed and bedding very comfortable although pillows could do with replacing (very hard). Great breakfast and very friendly reception and staff. Would stay again although not too convenient for O2 arena.

We stayed for 4 days while in London. Loved this place. Very beautiful, clean, comfortable, good breakfast. Close to public transportation and Canary Wharf shopping & restaurants. An elevator! The staff was fantastic.

We found this hotel as we got last minute tickets to a concert at the o2 and didn't want to have to travel back to Bedford after. We saw reviews stating it was a 'little gem' and couldn't agree more. 15 mins walk from canary wharf tube or 6 pound in an uber it was so easy getting tot the concert. The hotel itself is lovely. Reception where very helpful. Room was clean tidy and well equipped. Even a mobile phone for guests to take and use while staying! The shower was a lively walk in shower and the breakfast was excellent. We are definitely going to stay here again next time we visit the o2.

my wife and daughter stayed at this fantastic hotel for 3 nights wilst going to 3 nights of concerts at the O2 my wife is a wheel chair user they had a ground floor very well appointed room the staff could not be more helpful they had a great stay we will use again

We were attracted to the Lansbury Heritage Hotel by its Victorian architecture and its history. The rooms were beautifully rendered and spacious. The restaurant is the best in the Docklands area that we saw. And the breakfast was probably the best we've ever had traveling in London (over 40 times). We also wanted to see a new part of London we had not seen, and got to know the Docklands Light Railway which became an easy way to get into Victoria and Knightsbridge. Personnel and staff were outstanding and dedicated individuals. We enjoyed the spa with excellent massages to start off our trip. All in all, we would definitely stay again and recommend it highly.

Wanted a hotel near to o2. Enjoyed our stay. Room was small but immaculately clean and finished to a high standard.Very quiet area. Staff very friendly and welcoming (particularly Zumber).Breakfast was very good - plentiful supply of hot and cold items. We would definitely stay again

Great welcome from Zuber. Left our luggage until we went back in the afternoon.Lovely bedroom, well-equipped with hairdryer, iron, ironing board, safe, fridge... complimentary bottle of water. Clean and comfortable. Bed very comfortable.We enjoyed drinks and a lovely meal in the bar. Good choice for breakfast. Staff very welcoming and keen on client satisfaction. Will definitely go back.

What an amazing hotel, from the very warm welcome from Thomas on arrival, everything was perfect. The rooms and hotel is stunning and everything is done to a great standard. It also smells lovely! Will need to think of some more excuses to visit Canary Wharf to take advantage of this hidden gem.

I spent one night at the Lansbury in a Mezzanine room. It was very pleasant stay. The staff were particularly helpful & nice. The breakfast was tasty. The room itself was very nice, clean & comfortable. The only annoyance was a 'running water' noise from the air conditioning unit. It was convenient for work (office in Canary Wharf). All in all, a very enjoyable stay & I would recommend it.

Great hotel! Friendly, helpful staff, comfortable bed, quiet. Tasty breakfast, clean, easy access to London City Airport. We were just in London for a day- in transit from San Francisco to Florence. We would love to return one day to check out London and would stay here again!

Stayed here for my sister's wedding, the staff and facilities were exemplary, lovely breakfast, very good value for money 10/10 would stay again in a heart beat. Very kind and helpful staff, couldn't do enough for us during our stay, all rooms were beautifully kept and spotless.

Ideal location for DLR and all routes to the main stations.Beautiful, modern hotel with excellent facilities. Restaurant and bar facilities, room service, 24hr reception. Couldn't fault this hotel at all

Great hotel offering a very quiet stay in the heart of Canary Wharf and Docklands. A first class set of rooms and a very pleasant team of staff who without exception made our family wedding visit a huge success. Thank you Lansbury

Had a wonderful stay. The hotel is immaculate very modern and clean state of the art room central controls via the tv We had a girlie birthday weekend and had a ball. Zuber was our outstanding, really friendly helpful reception staff member who was really helpful both before we came and on our stay. We had a superior room. Which is worth paying extra for The spa is compact in a small area and they didn’t seem to be able to fit us in for hour appointments for treatments but there never seemed to be any customers in there having appointments which was puzzling.

The best hotel in Canary Wharf in London is the Novotel, from all aspects. But the second best is the Lansbury Heritage hotel in Poplar 15 min walking distance from Canary Wharf. The hotel looks like castle and is truly a boutique hotel. The staff is friendly and informed, rooms are amazing: clean, big, with a lot of natural light, high ceilings, everything is digitally controlled, great bathroom. I did not give it a five star rating because the restaurant could be better in terms of non-meat dishes. Anyhow, meal was quite good. Good value for money.

had 3 days at this hotel in march with friends for a 40th birthday. it was a bit of a struggle to get to on and off 3 tubes for us and a 10 min walk from poplar station but the hotel is gorgeous and smells amazing !!we had a mezzanine room, bathroom downstairs bedroom upstairs. very cool really nice room, amazing shower, terrible views but we didnt choose it for the views. very close to canary wharf ( you must eat at big easy ) wow. the only issues i had were our room was not cleaned one day just towels folded and everything else left as we had left the room also i asked for milk for tea on 4 occasions over 3 days before any arrived..not a huge problem but there seemed to be a disconnect between reception and housekeeping and if tou speak to 4 different receptionists and nothing is done you feel ignored but as i say not a huge issue.yes i would stay here again breakfast was buffet style and fantastic, also breakfast staff were so helpful ( well done guys ) so id say 4 star due to service issues

I have never stayed in the hotel before and was so impressed with it's appearance and location. The staff were very polite and helpful, the decor was first class and the room very clean and fitted to a high spec. I will definitely stay here again. Loved, too, the photographs and historical links to the Lansbury family and the building's past.

Hotel is very nice, friendly and helpful staff on arrival. We stayed in room G02 which was lovely and spacious, very modern and comfortable. Breakfast and room service also good. Catered for gluten free no problem at all. 5 min walk to poplar DLR station offering links to Canary Wharf tube. Only downside is to walk to the DLR station, you have to walk through tower hamlets college, which sometimes consisted of groups of mainly male students outside with hoods up and could be quite intimidating to lone females, older people etc. On the whole hotel itself was lovely and would stay again and recommend to people as a great hotel to stay if visiting the 02.

Stayed here one night for a convention at the excel. Fabulous mezzanine room. Staff all very lovely. The tech is all very snazzy but the bathroom light is not on the wall next to the bathroom and there is no way to know which light is the bathroom and which one is the hall. Also the AC was not strong enough to keep us cool overnight. Silly niggles aside this is a wonderful hotel and I’m sure we will be back.

We would recommend this hotel the decor rooms and service are excellent. Breakfast was a good standard and all guest areas tastefully designed. We stayed whilst attending a concert at the O2 arena it is a tube ride away and not really walking distance. We will stay here again

While the hotel is beautifully decorated to a high standard, the food is a real let down. Ordering room service via the in-room smart phone technology did not allow me to order a drink with my meal. The food was very average; calamari was tough and greasy and the chicken burger was missing the homemade coleslaw and was quite tasteless. Again, for breakfast, there was no opportunity to order a drink and the breakfast was delivered with a very creamy cafe latte ( as opposed to the black coffee that I would have ordered).Unfortunately the food really lets the hotel down and means that I would avoid staying here again.

I had booked 2 eating experiences in London and we decided to stay for a couple of days in the city. After a long search we chose the Lansbury hotel. We were not disappointed. We decided to use the underground instead of the car . The Lansbury is approx 5 mins walk from Poplar station and was a perfect base to explore London before our 2 evening meals out. What a lovely hotel. Decor superb and very attentive staff. We couldn't fault it.

Stayed for one night on 11th February (first time). This is a very comfortable hotel situated very close to Canary Wharf and is definitely one of the better hotels in this area. Check in was efficient and friendly. Rooms are very well furnished and of a high standard.TV is good size and there is complimentary bottled water on arrival. Breakfast was included though I didn't have any. There is a gym which is functional. Overall, a good experience and I would definitely stay again.

I booked my parents a night here for Christmas. They checked in early, and the was not ready which was fine as they were happy to go for a drink. Reception staff need to improve their manners though a 'good afternoon' would of been nice!Bar staff didn't know what a Southern Comfort was, and a barman couldn't open a drinks cabinet. In the end my mum had to go behind to try and help.Not the fault of staff but management need to provide adequate training.The Octaganal room and spa was lovely! And the food was very nice. On leaving the hotel to go for dinner and 02, my mum was asked for her credit card and because it didn't match the card that it was booked by (I booked it for Christmas for them- all paid for) the lady said she needed my details. My mum explained that I was at work and would not be able to answer the call. The hotel had been all paid for! And card details had all been given.In the end the lady had to transfer the money back to my card for my mum to pay the £173! This upset my mum greatly, and not what they needed on the way to their show.

Lovely hotel in a handy location. The building is quite old and has lots of character. The room was large and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was ok, good choice.

My partner and I stayed at this stunning hotel a few weekends ago. The room we stayed in was well presented and detailed. It was beautiful.The only minor downsides we found was that the shower was not as hot as we would have liked and the area was a bit iffy. But other than that it's close to local amenities and the DLR and all staff we interacted with were very pleasant.

We’ve stayed twice now at this hotel and found it excellent on both occasions. Rooms are luxurious and well thought out. The staff are helpful and professional. We had a problem with the AC (it didn’t want to drop below the boiling point of titanium) which was fixed instantly when we reported it. The photos and bas relief carvings and chandeliers all add a touch of opulence for what is essentially a bargain priceThe only suggestion I’d make to the management would be to buy some teapots for breakfast - we had to make tea in the (small) cups which is quite labour intensive and wastes tea bags. It’s a bit off the beaten path and the walk from Canary Wharf isn’t pleasant but it’s well worth the inconvenience.

Just stayed at this hotel for one night whilst working in Canary Wharf. A real find!Very clean, beautifully decorated, comfortable rooms and friendly staffI would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again whenever possible

A lovely modern hotel opened I believe about a year go. Rooms very well equipped. Staff extremely helpful. I did not have dinner there, but breakfast was very good and a snack lunch of shepherd's pie delicious. I was part of a large wedding party and heard nothing but praise from the whole group. The bar is pleasant - the only thing missing, perhaps, is some sort of lounge.

This hotel is worth the 'extra' walking distance (Tube vs DLR). It's lovely, warm and welcoming...and Malick at the front desk is awesome, very accommodating and ready to assist. He made our trip memorable! I will opt to stay here in the future.

I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. I stayed overnight whilst attending an event at the O2. From the location to the facilities to the staff I have was made to feel very welcome and comfortable.

Well....... what a spectacular hotel. One of the best hotels in London! I highly recommend this hotel as its location is extremely easy to find ( even if your not from London) it’s short walk from poplar station. The entrance is truly breathtaking, the staff are extremely pleasant and helpful. The restaurant is very nice and has a calm atmosphere, they serve food and drinks and until late. The room was very modern, but had sophistication. It’s Extremely clean and well thought out. You can pretty much do everything you need to do from the tv/Remote control. From turning lights on and off to controlling the room temperature. Everything is easily accessible. The room was very spacious and so was the bathroom. It was like being on a luxurious holiday for the day/night. The breakfast was undeniably amazing, everything was fresh and seasoned so well! Fresh orange juice and fruit.There’s plenty of shops and restaurants near by. I would Definitely recommend this hotel whether it’s business or pleasure!

Loved this place! It was an over night stay after seeing Andrea Bocelli at the 02. We managed to get parked directly outside which was a bonus as they don't have parking at his hotel. Lovely friendly warm welcome, beautiful entrance to the hotel and the mezzanine room was lovely. Breakfast was ok we came down five mins before closing so some food had gone and eggs were cold but it was late so no complaints! The girls made us a new pot of filter coffee which was really nice. Spa was small but nice. I would 100% stay again.

We stayed here for 2 nights in one of the tower rooms whilst visiting London for the weekend. From Canary Wharf station it is a short walk to the DLR, and then 2 stops (to cross over the busy road) before a 5min walk to the hotel. We received a warm welcome and staff were very professional and courteous throughout our stay. The hotel is smartly decorated, and the room was very well presented. The room contained a TV with the usual channels, and also a free to use mobile that could be taken out whilst staying at the hotel if needed. The room was very quiet at night. Breakfast was very good, with a hot and cold buffet, including English breakfast. I would recommend this place for a weekend visit.

Wanted a hotel near the O2 arena. Booked this one as usual ones I use we’re booked.What an absolute gem, clean, great staff, good food and a great nights sleep.Will definitely use again.Good customer relations, booked taxis which arrived on time.Don’t miss this fabulous place.

A real gem of a place. Fabulous staff both on reception and in restaurant, delicious dinner and loads of choice at breakfast, very attentive & polite staff, didn't use the spa as ran out of time but looked lovely. We were in a classic room which was small but luxurious and had a nice size bathroom and all we required.

IT WAS SOOO GOOD LOVED IT, the food was well done and Afshan the massage therapist was well good can not wait to go to her Classes. also the room was so clean and the hotel smelt soo refreshing i felt calm.

The hotel is located roughly half between London City and City Airport connects by DLR (2 minutes footpath) or underground (if you walk 10 minutes). Great rooms with a lot of space - untypical for London - great bath and a lot of nice features. I had a high ceiling room which was absolutely fine. The hotel has a fitness room and sauna included, and a to be paid for spa.The breakfast was very good, both full English as continental style. Selection is good although fresh non toast bread might be a good add-on. Staff was very friendly and helpful. In total this one is on my list for future London Trips, business as well as private ones.

Hotel is immaculately clean and rooms are stylish period with excellent modern touches. Clever eco-friendly room controls and lighting. Pleasant staff and a nice restaurant menu - all freshly cooked to order.

I could not fault the room or any of the facilities at this hotel. They were as fantastic as all previous reviews led me to believe. The location is wonderful. Very well connected but a very quiet street. The building is a lovely sensitive conversion of a listed property. The bed was comfy and the room was spacious. The breakfast was very good and plentiful. The only thing I would say is that don’t expect the staff to do anything beyond their minimum obligation. We had booked the hotel for our wedding night as we were getting married in Greenwich and wanted something a little bit special. We always try to support smaller hotels particularly as this one seemed to be of a very high standard. When booking I asked if we could possibly check in any earlier as check in was at 3 and I was getting married at 4 so would need to do so before then. I was sent email by staff telling me they would be able to let me know nearer the time. Perfectly reasonable. I rang the week before to be told it wasn’t possible and I would have to arrive at 3. Too late by this point to book elsewhere. We’ll run with it. I rang on the day and was told my room wouldn’t be ready till 3 but they would happily store bags if I arrived earlier. Would they put them in the room as I wouldn’t be back till gone midnight because of the wedding celebration. They said they would try to do that but couldn’t guarantee it. I arrived at 2 expecting to just drop my bags and was told my room was ready and nobody thought to call me and tell me that. Not once did any member of staff wish me or my new wife congratulations on our marriage despite the fact I hold told them several time the purpose of our stay. For that reason I wouldnt stay again. It was very nice but ultimately staff make a hotel. Not facilities.

I only stayed for one night at this hotel while I attended a gig at the O2 arena. The service was impeccable and nothing was too much trouble. The room was spotlessly clean, beautifully decorated with plenty of handy features that make this a luxury stay. It was very comfortable and fairly quiet considering it's on Poplar High Street. The reception ordered a taxi for me to get me to the event and again the service was amazing, not your average cab and they work exclusively with hotel and business clients. The Breakfast was plentiful with a good variety of choice and served for a good length of time. Standard Check out is 12pm which is longer than most hotels. All staff were incredibly helpful and the hotel should be proud of the overall experience they provide.

Catia at the reception was very helpful - especially when we needed a taxi in a hurry! Thanks Catia. I had a spa treatment (facial and indian head massage) - I would highly recommend it. I was so relaxed I think I fell asleep during the treatments.. I had chicken briyani for dinner (room service), that was excellent too. Beds clean and comfortable. I slept like a baby. Overall, wonderful hotel.

Stayed here whilst we were at a concert near Canada Water (Printworks).Hotel is about 15 minutes walk from Canary Wharf tube. Staff were extremely helpful and provided us with recommendations about travel etc. Lovely Hotel, beautifully decorated inside- rooms are spacious and comfy, with nice lightning options and a great bed and shower.The rooms despite being comfy seemed to suffer from exterior noise; I couldn’t hear the roads at all, but I could quite clearly hear the room above and the room to the right moving around, which disturbed my sleep a bit.Breakfast was very tasty, the staff didn’t really seem very interested however, they did not acknowledge us coming in or asking us if we needed anything etc. Overall though, pleased, the room was great value for money and the bed was comfy, all I needed really!

nice room, everything is clean and newthe bed was very hard and not comfortable breakfast is nice and the staff is very politebreakfast time is really busy though and cramped. there is too many table for a small room.the room has stairs bedroom at the top with the toilet at the bottom. they should warn guests who come to stay that there are stairs. my partner sleepwalks and it is too late to change room. had we have known about the stairs we would not have picked this hotel. for future the hotel must tell the guests in advance that there are stairs because my partner could have fallen down and injured himself, we had to put a barrier there in case he did sleep walk in the night

We stayed at the Lansbury for two nights, the rooms were excellent very well decorated, the lights and the air-conditioning could be controlled from the tv remote and sensor controls on the walls. Tv had options for local restaurants,places to visit and other info.We dined in the hotel restaurant both evenings after visiting various places in London via the DLR ( the station was very close) the food was excellent and we were well looked after by Assain(spelling may not be correct) and Kalim on front desk was excellent. All the staff were pleasant and helpful. The hotel has been tastefully decorated and I would recommend staying here, we look forward to a return visit.

Stay was comfortable and all the amenities are great. I have not booked breakfast at the time of booking however they have given me complimentary breakfast as well. Rooms are clean and staff is very polite.

We booked 4 rooms for 2 persons in this hotel. Staff was very friendly. The hotel is situated nearby the underground Earls Court which is very practical. Rooms are small but all the comfort is present, beds are very good, bathroom is very clean. We did not take any breakfast. There are plenty of coffeebars in the neighbourhood. Good value for your money!

Recently stayed here with my friend for a night as we were going to the theatre. Hotel has a great central location, with plenty of food places surrounding it. It's a couple of minutes walk from the tube line which is ideal when you have luggage. Hotel itself was lovely, rooms were a decent size for central London, reception staff were lovely throughout the stay. We were able to leave suitcases there all day after we checked out which was an added bonus. We had read reviews about the stairs/lack of lift, we stayed on the 3rd floor, but the staircases aren't huge and even with suitcases it was no problem. All in all I think this is a cracking little hotel, perfect for a couple of nights exploring the city, definitely recommend!

Great Location, very discrete but cozy and comfortable. Only a few minutes walk from Earl's Court Stn. Many eating and drinking places around. Friendly staff. Rooms are medium sized but well appointed. Good Value for Money.

The London Court Hotel is a quick 2 minute walk from the Earls Court Underground station (exit and go left). The registration process was quick. We booked this hotel for a 3 night stay, then decided to add a day at the beginning of our trip. I contacted the hotel and was about to keep the same room for all 4 nights. The hotel was quick to respond and take action.Upon arrival to our room, we noticed it was clean, modern, looked like the photos, and small (as to be expected). We were assigned room 307. As there is no lift, the climb to the top floor got old very quickly, and I found myself dreading the thought of returning to the room each day. There were coffee and tea making facilities in our room, a hair dryer, 2 USB ports, plenty of channels on the TV, and speedy free Wi-Fi. Some of the negatives: not enough hangers (we did not ask for additional); tiny waste bins; and the safe was locked (again, we did not request it be opened). There were no drawers for clothes storage, so I left my suitcase open and slid it under the bed to conserve space.Earls Court Road in that area is full of restaurants. There's a Nando's, McDonald's, Izzi (Italian), Prince of teck (pub), Pret, and Co Op (market) all on the short walk from the tube station. We also walked beyond the hotel to have dinner at The Hansom Crab (pub) for fish and chips.All in all, the hotel was a fantastic value, and I would love to stay there again.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. It was very nice! The room wasn't big, but its size was more than acceptable by London standard. Most importantly, though, it was very clean (I'm asthmatic and I had no problem at all with this hotel). The staff was cordial and pleasant to deal with. There was only one small issue: the stairs. There is no lift and the stairs are quite cramped, so don't bring heavy luggage :-P

A good choice if you're after the location and convenience. The only setback I can think of is the elevator. Its very small. But everything was great especially the girl who serves us well every morning. Her name is Tigi

Clean, friendly, relatively easy to find and quiet given it's right on the main road at Earls Court. Only thing I'd improve is a slightly comfier bed but if you like beds hard, you'll love this place. For the price, this may become a regular go-to for me.

no iron in room was disappointing.Good windows kept out 90% of street noise. Creaks from movement in room above was annoying when sleeping.staff were very nice and rooms were clean. For the price overall nice place.

I chose this hotel for the location and the price. It is right by the Earls Court stop on the tube making it a short (30 minute) trip to Heathrow and I was planning to head to the airport in the morning. As most things in London can be quite pricey, the cost of the room was about 100 GBP per night. Though the staff was friendly, the room itself can use some improvement. The carpets were stained, one of the sheets on the bed had dried blood (we called downstairs for a replacement), and found a dead roach under the alarm clock. Positives about the room -- nice bathroom and free bottled water.

The pros: located at less than 100 mt from Earl Court Tube Station, very nice reception staff, clean, functional, modern deco, good bathroom.The cons: minimalist hotel (reception in first floor, narrow stairs, no elevator), with tiny rooms. Carpet had stains. Definitely a good choice if on a budget.

I stayed here a couple of nights for business. The price is competitive and for the most part the room was clean although the carpets could have been better and had a number of stains. The main issue I had was from traffic noise. I'm an incredibly heavy sleeper and am not usually bothered by noise, but even I was woken up at 4am and I know my wife would have struggled to sleep at all.On the positive side it is in a good location close to restaurants, cafes and the tube station to take you into the heart of London in only a few minutes.

Yes, this hotel is great for its location being very close to a Tube station, but that's about it. There's no elevator. I came with three suitcases and had to haul them up a flight of stairs just to get to the reception desk, where the receptionist offered to carry one up to the third floor of our room. No outside calls are permitted on the room phones. The safes are only large enough to store jewelry. This is inconvenient when traveling with laptops and such. My only option was to pack electronics and valuables in a suitcase and leave it in the reception area in plain view near the place guests can help themselves to coffee. I was assured it was perfectly safe there. It was either that or leave it in my room. So, each night, after walking and sight seeing all day, I would have to come back to the hotel and carry the heavy suitcase back to my room. No breakfast, bar, laundry services. I would not stay here again.

Stayed for 5 nights in June. The hotel is in a great location – Earls Court is easily accessible by the underground, and there are great cafes, restaurants and supermarkets just outside the hotel. The room was a good size for a 'single room' – the bathroom wasn’t crowded, and there was enough space for my luggage. It was clean and modern, although the bed sheets felt a little old. There’s no lift but the staff will help you with your luggage. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

We recently stayed for 4 nights. The rooms are small but have everything you need. Just note there is no lift so had to carry our suitcases up and down the stairs. The location is great, just outside of the London city, with the underground a 1 minute walk. The lines on the Earls Court underground take you straight to the city Centre or airport so that is a big plus. The street the hotel is on is full of restaurants, pubs etc so no shortage of food options.

This is a boutique hotel located right by the Earl's Court Metro station in London. The hotel is fine and offers clean room and comfortable bed. But if you have a lot luggage, be aware that there is no elevator in the hotel and consider climbing the stair as daily exercises. This hotel does not have a restaurant but there are plenty of good restaurant options within walking distances.

I booked here as it was easy to get to, close to the tube station and within walking distance of the Royal Albert Hall. There are few facilities, but the reception staff were very friendly, the rooms clean and the prices reasonable

In a good location, close to Earls Court station and we really walked almost everywhere; Royal Albert Hall, museum of Natural History etc. Lots of good food nearby. Not too noisy due to the small street, but not much more to stop noise from other rooms or the street. I guess that is the case in most London hotel. Recommend for young people, due to the fact that you have to climb up a narrow and steep staircase to get to the hotel. The hotel door might be hard to spot! Passed it once, cos its really just a tiny door in the middle of store windows.Was very sufficient for a long weekend!

Everything you need. Clean hotel with two minutes walk to tube, which takes you to most important places. Comfy bed to sleep after long day walking around city. Best of all enough plugs to charge eg. phones beside your bed. Even one USB. Good shower. I can recommend.Downsides:Very tiny room, but we of course knew it and saw pictures before hand. Enough for two persons with small lagguages. Anyhow it was priceworthy.But: No instruction for safety, like you have to reset the earlier code (never in another hotel before) and how to lock and open it.For to use hairdrier like press the button in the mirror.Piece of information would be nice in the room or personnel could advice when you check in. Silly me not knowing.

This gem is not too far from the underground station and lots of lovely restaurants and cafe’s nearby.Clean and very comfortable place.Highly recommend and this has been the best budget hotel I’ve been in the area.

I have to admit that when I first found The London Court House on a booking website I was initially suspicious. The score was unusually high in terms of satisfaction and value for money, and yet the price per night - despite the additional factors of central location, close proximity to a tube station, and amenities in the room itself - was relatively low. Having been burnt before at other 'hotels,' I did my best to uncover the catch with no luck so I booked a room and crossed my fingers.When I arrived, I was more than pleasantly surprised and a little relieved. The only thing I could find to detract from the place was the stairs, which could have been an issue for older or impaired guests. There are no lifts and to reach the lobby or any guest rooms you have to climb a couple of flights of stairs. I arrived with several heavy bags, which the hotel staff kindly helped me with upon arriving and departing. In fact, the staff were wonderful and couldn't seem to do enough for me during my stay. They were endlessly friendly and pleasant, greeting me during my frequent comings and goings.The gentleman working on reception when I arrived kindly stored my bags in the reception until I could check in to allow me to explore London, then helped me to carry them to my room upon my return. The room itself was unusual but very comfortable. There were stairs from the doorway down to the room itself, which featured every expected amenity. There was a single (very comfortable!) bed, a television on the opposite wall, a small desk and chair, a wardrobe, small safe, a small fridge, a kettle and a good supply of tea and coffee. There was even a complimentary bottle of still water in the fridge every day once the room had been serviced. The bathroom was very modern and clean.I stayed for a total of three nights, and couldn't fault my stay! The location was very useful for comings and goings, there was no noise to speak of from other rooms or outside, the wi-fi was reliable and the staff, as I stated, were excellent. I would highly recommend this hidden gem and wouldn't hesitate to book with them again. Thank you for an enjoyable stay!

We loved this hotel and stayed there three nights. It was about 30 seconds walk from the Earls court tube station. Look left coming out the station and you'll see it. The rooms are small but really nicely decorated with great air conditioning/heating unit, safe, fridge, lovely bathroom and are absolutely spotless. Free bottles of water are provided everyday and there is free tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms and there is a nice coffee machine in reception which can be used any time. Yes it is up a good few steep stairs and obviously wouldn't suit anyone with mobility issues but otherwise, it's not a problem in that you're only bringing your cases up and down once and other than that would only go up and down them once or twice a day. But it actually makes it quieter as you're up off the main street, so it's not a bad thing! It doesn't have a bar or restaurant, it's only bedrooms but in London with so many places to eat, we wouldn't want to eat where we are staying anyway. The lady who did the cleaning was really nice and did a very good job but special mention has to go to the two gentlemen on reception. They were so nice and helpful and couldn't have done more. We used to get a little wave every time we passed reception. It really made us feel at home! They really are a great asset to the hotel. We will definitely stay there next time we're in London.

Extremely disappointed with the poor service and response to our request from this property & their booking agency, regarding a reservation 6 months away. London Court reservation staff have been of little assistance & left us with concerns about actually staying at this property.

Great hotel with one big exception - no hot water in the shower due to a problem with the boiler. Staff would not compensate us for no hot water except to say that we could get a discount on our next stay there. We explained that we will not be returning to London. It was unfortunate, because the hotel is quite nice, everything looked new and it was easy access to the tube and restaurants.

London Court Hotel is located a mere 1 minute's walk from Earl's Court station - wonderful location. The station itself hosts both the Piccadilly and District lines, which are already sufficient for getting to most places. When exiting the station, head left and you'll pass Co-op, Nando's and Costa before arriving at the hotel. The hotel entrance is easy to miss since there is no frontage beyond a single door. If you see Starbucks, you've missed it and should double back.A word of caution though, the hotel has no lifts and you'll need to drag your luggage up several flights of stairs. This should not be a problem for most, but is still good to know in advance.The room was very comfortable and there was generally ample room. The bathroom was reasonably sized as well. The only drawback to this hotel was the poor condition of the beds; they were far too soft.All things considered, an excellent choice if you just need a convenient place to base yourself for exploring London. Recommended!

Two of us stayed here over the bank holiday weekend for SW4 and carnival. The location was superb, right by Earls court station. There are a number of places to eat and drink around the hotel as well as local supermarkets. The two pubs we went to near by were friendly and had great service. The gentlemen of reception was incredibly welcoming. I asked via email if we could check in early as we had to change before SW4, and he got the room ready early for us at no extra cost. A fancy room at a reasonable price. Much fancier than any other room I've stayed in in London for the same price. Two things to note - lots of stairs and no lift, so it is not suitable for people who can't access stairs. Also, the bar is alcohol free (but the pub over the road is neat)

Had a wonderful five night stay. It is only two blocks from the Earl's Court station. Very easy to get to/from Heathrow on the Piccadilly line (station has elevator). Discreet hotel sign, just look for the Costa Coffee, the door is next to it. William was able to check us in early, so helpful and able to answer all our questions. Had read the reviews about no elevator, requested and received a lower floor. The deluxe twin room was larger than I had expected for London and worked perfectly for our needs. Across the street is a good restaurant for breakfast, Bokado. Fast service, friendly and amazing croissants.

Clean, brilliant location, very pleasant staff. The shower works well. in-room supplies replenished daily. Comfortable mattress. Air conditioning works and is unusually quiet. The double glazing works well against traffic noise. Fridge in room (mine wasn't working but I didn't need it so forgot to report it). Would happily stay again. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby.

This is by far one of the best value oriented places to stay in London. Located within a block of Earls Court station next door to a Nandos and a short walk to a 24 hour Tesco. Even closer is the M&S and a Coop grocery market.The rooms are small (I stayed in the single) and very clean. Windows are well insulated from the street noise. There is a kettle, safe, iron and hairdryer and reliable wi-fi. Front staff is very helpful and are willing to help haul luggage up from street level to your room. Why? I will talk about accessibility next.This establishment has no guest elevators and is not meant for families with strollers (unless you collapse it at the front door and carry it up along with the kid) or guests with physical disability as it is a stairmasters routine to maneuver around. I had a full size suitcase and needed the man at the front desk to haul it down 3 flights of stairs so that I don't pull a muscle or injure myself. I look forward to my next stay here. It's also right on the Picadilly line to Heathrow.

It's right next to the Earl's Court subway station so it's easy to travel around.Room is modern, neat and clean. Large shower/bath room.24 hrs reception is great and the receptionists are very helpful. Free coffee machine available from reception is nice.No lift/elevator with narrow staircase may be an issue for some. The receptionist was more than happy to offer help.

We stayed at London court hotel for 3 nights. The location is perfect as 2minute walk to tube station. The room is modern, neat and tidy. Bathroom is very modern with a great shower. Air Conditioner and wifi both in great working order. Many cafes, restaurants etc close by. Would stay again for sure.

This hotel is great value. The property is brand new. The receptionist is very efficient and helpful. I stayed in one of the single rooms with shared bathroom. The room was the perfect size for a solo traveller, and it had all you need, even a small sink. The furniture is modern and practical. The bed is comfortable and the sheets are a nice quality. There is a full length mirror, some clothes hanging space, a safe and a fridge. The shared bathroom is only a few steps away and it has everything you need. I think is only shared with one other guest. The neighbourhood is lively, with lots of shops and cafes and the subway is a few metres away. At the same time is not packed with tourists which I personally prefer. It feels also quite safe when travelling solo. If I come back to London I know where to go!

We stayed here for 3 nights in May. It's in a very convenient location when arriving from Gatwick. We picked up a visitor Oyster card at Gatwick and then hopped on a Southern train into Victoria Station and then transferred to the tube to Earl's Court. Earl's Court is Zone 1/2 so if you're heading into central London, you only get charged for 1 zone. The reception at the hotel helped us carry our luggage up and were very pleasant throughout our stay. We did not mind that they did not have a lift as we did not have heavy bags. We had pizza at Franco Manca (4/5), burgers at Gourmet Burger (5/5) and Thai at Addie's (3.5/5). There's good coffee at Over Under Coffee. We booked on the hotel website and were given a room that faced a lawn so it was very quiet. The beds were very comfortable and the washroom was a decent size. I would definitely stay here again!

Simple straightforward checkin process. Friendly receptionist. Room on the small side but adequate. Only negative was Road noise which disturbed me after 0430! Comfortable bed.Location is convenient. Reasonable value but there are better locations in the vicinity.

Modern rooms in a nice part of Earls Court close to lots of facilities and tube. Reasonably priced. Free WiFi and coffees in reception including great latte.Rooms quite small but well designed with everything one needs Would definitely go again. Nice and quiet almost like your own home in London

This was in a great location for a friend's party in Earls Court. Also convenient for sightseeing the next day. Clean, modern, as described on the booking site. Would go again if needing to stay in the area. Free wifi that worked.

Comfortable beds, free bottled water in room, free coffee in reception area, helpful staff. Great location: maybe not even a minute walk to Earl's Court tube station, lots of restaurants and coffee shops.

Perfect hotel, clean, modern, decor lovely.. staff really welcoming and helpful. In a perfect location with loads around. Only a few doors down from Earl's Court. Easy access to everything. Would highly recommend london court hotel! Thanks for a great stay!

Very good value for money. Comfortable bed, nice decoration, clean. Good storage for clothes. The space is used in an intelligent way, did not feel small. Very friendly reception 24/7. Close to the underground. I would stay again.

Really please with this hotel from start to finish. Some have mentioned small rooms, really didn't see the issue. Yes the room was a touch smaller than most, but it fulfilled the need we had 100%. Plenty of space for bags, getting ready, etc.. Everything was as you would hope for a hotel. Combine that with the really respectable price and you're on to a winner!

I have been here couple of times, and staff was really nice to me and some room are really small but some are alright. Room was clean and location was great, there are a lots of small supermarket and restaurants

I have reserved a little room for the weekend. The Hotel is 2 minutes away from Earl's Court Station, ideal to explore the Empire using trains and subway. Plenty of fast food and little restau if you wanna have a quick meal before starting the adventure. Reception 24/7

I stayed one night mid week for business. I found the reception area clean and helpful. My room was very small but ultimately very clean. Parking was a pain due to permitted parking on all roads in the area, so had to find the nearest public car park (20 min walk away)

Great location near enough right beside Earl's Court Station and handy to Royal Albert Hall too. Plenty of shops / cafes / pubs / restaurants nearby.We only met one member of staff - the receptionist. He was very friendly and helpful. We were even able to check in early which was brilliant. The room was quite small but adequate and probably generous compared to some London hotels. Good sized bathroom. Complimentary tea and coffee is a nice touch. Would definitely stay again and would recommend to anyone looking to stay in that area.

This is a small hotel just yards from Earl's Court Underground station. It offers a perfect location for a good night's sleep within easy access of the City Centre and many major attractions including the Royal Albert Hall. Rooms are extremely clean and very quiet (triple glazing sees to that). Accommodation is on the basis of bed only, however there is a vast selection of establishments offering a variety of foods right beside the hotel. The staff are always very pleasant making residents feel valued and welcome. Although there is no lift, the staff always offer assistance with luggage to the rooms. This was our second visit, and we have now booked a third visit for July. That, in itself, says enough.

My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay I this fantastic hotel. At less than a 2 minute walk from Earl's Court station, the location in fabulous. Earl's Court road has all of the eating options , with convenience stores in abundance right outside the hotel. The hotel itself is a little missable from the road, with no frontage as such as the reception is not at ground level. Nothing that a quick look online wouldn't solve. Up a flight of stairs to be greeted by the very friendly reception guy who checked us in, welcoming us to tea, coffee and complementary water. We had booked a twin room as the location was perfect and it was all they had and I can honestly say, contrary to the reviews I read beforehand, the room had ample space for the two of us. Extremely clean bedroom and beautiful bathroom with hair and body wash included and refilled every day. Beds were very comfortable and spotlessly clean. Rooms had always been cleaned once we had returned from a day of sightseeing.Tea and coffee making facilities in the room also as well as at reception. Water was provided in the mini fridge in the room. iPod dock was a bonus and good size tv with lots of channels. Yes the hotel doesn't have lifts but it really wasn't an issue for us with it only being 3 floors!All in all, fantastic and very clean hotel in a great location with friendly staff who always greeted us with a smile. I will recommend to everyone!

This is a nice hotel, located right next to the Earls Court tube station, with clean modern rooms. rooms are not very big, but are comfortable and the bathrooms are new with good water pressure. Better than most other hotels of similar range in the area, only drawback no elevator, so if you have a lot of luggage probably not the best choice, The doorway is small and you might almost miss it on the street, and need to walk up a flight of stairts to get to reception.

Good price, clean and tidy.Very nice and secure area. Internet is not too fast.The staff very polite and helpful.Breakfast: nothing special but OK. Our room was very nice, clean and bright. The elevator a bit slowly and working in a "collected style", stop every floor automatically. Tube station (Earl's Court) and shoping opportunities are also very close.

Arrived there at about 8 PM after a 17 hours flight to London. Love the location of the hotel, you can see many coffee shops and restaurant surrounding the hotel, Nando's, local burgers, starbucks, also some pubs at the corner. Almost everything opens until pretty late, so it was good for our hungry tummy after a long flight.But for some reason, might have missed the details about the hotel when i read the review. Once we enter the hotel we were pretty surprised that there was no lift, while the 2 of us were bringing 3 baggages (due to last minutes packing, we just chuck everything we had for winter) haha anyway the receptionist is located on the 1st floor, very kind guy saying that he will bring all of our baggage up, still we feel bad so we also carry the bags up.After registration and all, we finally get our room.. on the 3rd floor. We didnt think that we have more energy to go all the way up to the 3rd floor with all of the bags. So we decided to leave the big bags at the reception and take whatever we need to the room. Coffee machine is located at the receptionist and its open 24 hours a day. The room is nice, nice comfy double bed and proper bath room, overlooking the pretty busy earls court rd since it was saturday night. Another + point is that its located 3 mins away from the tube. Which makes it easy for you to go anywhere. Overall, Superb location, nice hotel and service..too bad it doesnt have lift and also rather expensive on the night that we booked.

Great location with the tube in walking distance, quite a few restaurants around, and a coffee shop right next door (although they do offer free coffee themselves). The staff was very helpful.The room was small, but cozy. I didn't feel cramped. The bathroom was a good size as well. Everything looked new and clean. Wi-fi was good and no noise issues. I was very satisfied with my experience and would definitely book again.

Firstly it is what it is. It's a cheap, no frills hotel in a decent neighbourhood in the centre of one of the most expensive cities in the world, so you set your expectations accordingly.I needed a one night stay for a business trip knowing I'd get in there early evening and be gone by early morning and for £68 it did the job.I booked a single room with shared bathroom so was a bit apprehensive about what to expect but the room was adequate, it was at the back of the hotel so no road noise and the bathroom was up a couple of flights of short steps, taking me about five seconds to get there so it wasn't an issue. The shared bathroom is key controlled so it's not as if everyone could use it and you shared it with one other single room user. Lots of places to eat right outside the hotel, some nice pubs over the road and the tube stop was about 30 yards away. Only negative was the carpet was a bit grubby and had seen better days so I didn't take my socks off but for the money it did the job and I'd use it again if I needed a short stay.

We were given a anniversary gift for Cinema night with glass of Champagne, through the Virgin Experience. Went there last night (26/11/16) to see The Apartment. All very well organized and the Champagne was not a cheap one. Really enjoyed this experience with my wife.

Three days business trip was quite started nicely when the room was given me three hours early so I could iron my shirt before meeting. Everything was in excellent condition and even though the room size was very Londonish it was more than ok. Personnel was very helpful and the location... 50 meters from underground station, what else you can ask?

London Court Hotel is a boutique hotel situated in the heart of Earls Court. This is the best hotel I have stay in London and probably newly build. It is conveniently located just 2-3 minutes walk from the Earls Court tube station in Zone 1 London and near restaurants (kebabs, Nandos, wagamama, masala zone, Mc Donald's, Burger King, KFC, Subway, Chinese, Thai and Indian Food etc) even the supermarkets and Boots and just minutes walk away. When coming from the airport, it's the first stop in London Zone 1 (Earls Court Tube Station - and it's the station with a lift so you don't have to carry your bags through massive flight of stairs ) Earls Court is a convenient location in London and accessible to all major tourist attractions nAside from the perfect location, they have the most hospitable staff. Thumbs up to both Ali and William!! (A job well done, you make my stay a memorable one) I was totally smitten by their warm welcome (early check in/assistance with my luggage to the room) and their assistance throughout my trip. You would notice that the staff in the hotel are genuine people rather than putting up a front and they would go out of the way to assist you . Being a frequent traveller to London and staying in Earls Court area most of the time, you will never get such service or even such good/clean room in other hotels around the area. (Some hotels around that area even charge you £5 pounds just to keep your luggage ) Hence their great reviews. I have listed out the points, hope this helps you :) 1. My room was well lit and the place was properly used. Toilet Amenities was great and the bed was extremely comfortable. There is also an air condition in the room, so you would not feel stuffy. 2. The place looks and smells cozy!! Like your home. 3. The staff are well trained (even the Housekeeping staff are extremely professional, polite and do a great job to make your stay even more comfortable - having your free bottles of water in the fridge. 4. There is complimentary coffee and tea daily in your room as well as great cappuccino and other coffees complimentary at the reception. 5. The wifi is free and it's strong, it doesn't disconnect and you could easily use if even for Netflix and YouTube in the evening.6. The have cable TV in the room with all channels, and after a Long day in London.. You will be able to just lay on bed and be spoil for choice . Will Definitely be back Again !!!! Thanks for such a wonderful stay.

Not really knowing what to expect with the prices being so low compared to hotels in London we arrived at the main guest house and it was explained their business is spread between multiple buildings in the road. We were shown to our building just a few minutes walk away, the outside looked a bit grim and old, once we were inside we were pleasantly surprised with our room. Really high spec bath room and quite spacious room. Plenty of storage for clothes and the thing all three of us quickly pointed out was not only was it clean but immaculate! It looked quite recently decorated. We had tea/coffee making supplies along with a hairdryer. We had to go back to the main house for breakfast which had a decent selection of food to choose from. I was really impressed with this place and if I was going to London again I would check the availability here first over a hotel.

This is a bunch of old 2 story cottages with a single reception and dining room, so take into consideration in bad weather. The room and shower are clean but the entrance corridor is shabby and smells of damp. The doors slam loudly and you can hear the ceiling squeeking when upstairs lodgers walk.We forgot electricity adaptor and reception suggested to sell one for 4 pounds. Same for body soap - propised to sell us!! Even had the nerve to say that we should be grateful for the towels!!Breakfast waitresses were very attentive and pleasant.Close to public transportation, however mind the noise of trains passing!Over 100 pounds a night is excessive for this place!!

I'm a seasoned traveller and what an absolute gem of a place to find. For the price available, for the location, for the service, the staff, the cleanliness............totally fabulous and makes it possible for me to travel frequently to my beloved London. The location is just amazing and vibrant, very cosmopolitan, and you can get to any part of london from here. I just would not consider staying anywhere else, and I am so delighted to have found the Charlotte Guest House.

I deliberately chose to stay in a more residential area outside of central London. Decent transport options. Pretty easy from the airport on the Piccadilly and Jubilee lines (although steps at West Hampstead station) and easy to get to Hampstead Heath. As well as the tube, there are also buses that head into the touristy central London area via Abbey Road which is a scenic trip. There's a Tesco nearby on the main street.The house is actually several managed properties spread out on several streets. Stayed in a single room in a building down the street from the main house. Had kettle/tea/coffee, hairdryer and TV although no bodywash/shampoo/conditioner (luckily I always bring my own). There was also no in-room safe, and my room was in the basement level which was a bit unsettling when I first saw it. The stairs down were pitch black at first until I realised the light automatically turns on when you head down the stairs. The room had a window that faced the next-door building under construction. Small, as are most places in the UK, and was a bit old and had dated furniture. But fairly clean and was comfortable. Selection of hot food and cereals at breakfast which was in a nice (but extremely warm) breakfast room. Never had a problem getting a seat. WiFi worked fine.5GBP deposit when checking in which you get back when you return the key. Friendly service. Overall this was a decent stay for two nights and good value for money.

When we arrived at the guest house, it was as we expected from the picture. However after checking in we were marched back out the front door, down the road, across the road and up another road to another property which apparently they own too. Then we were told they had approximately 5 properties in the area.When they showed us to our room ours was on the ground floor whereas out daughter was put on the top floor, three floors up. Our room was clean and had a new bathroom, but unfortunately is was very poorly lit, there was no dressing table or hair dryer, but most of all the furniture and bedding although they were clean, they were very old and outdated. When we looked outside out window all we saw was a brick wall, which was the side passage!When we checked our daughter's room, although it was brighter, it was like going back to the 50's and that is how old the furniture was and the bathroom was awfully worn out, having to prop the shower head against the wall to even have a shower.We also had a very noisy evening with other guests going in and out of their rooms all night long, and to finish off having to walk two streets with our bags to go and have our breakfast and then check out, which is not what we had expected at all!! (Overall we did not actually stay at the Charlotte Guest House as advertised, but some house down the road).

All of the rooms are clean, so that's good. Some of the rooms are also very nice, which is even better. On the other hand, some of the rooms are terrible, and I can tell you at least ONE of the rooms has NO WINDOW (which I thought was against the law)!!! I'm gullible enough to have been coming here for seven years, but I don't feel I can carry on taking the risk of getting a horrible room and a totally shameless response from stroppy desk staff with bad attitudes. All they actually care about is your money. They don't care about breaking promises. They don't care about messing you around. They don't care about ruining your holiday. Basically they don't care. The rooms are clean, but after that I'm struggling to think of reasons to give these people my money ever again. They don't care (except they do care about taking your money).

Had the pleasure of staying in this little gem last May. Our room were spotless and big and the service was outstanding. Breakfast was plentiful and served with a big smile It’s so close to public transport to go anywhere in London. If I am back in London I will be staying here again.

Good size room, very clean and staff very helpful. Great transport options into the centre of London just a short walk away. Extremely good breakfast. I told them I had mobility issues and I was placed on the ground floor but note there is no lift to upper floors.

Good size rooms, comfy bed, lovely bathroom with a bath and shower. Friendly staff, tasty breakfast with lots of variety and SUCH A BARGAIN! Easy access into central London, I've already recommended it to friends and will definitely be back.

If you're looking for a nice place for a good value this is the place for you. This is my second time staying at the property. I've stayed in the same building both times but in different rooms with shared bathroom. There isn't a lift and I was on the 2nd floor so I wouldn't recommend staying here if you have mobility issues. The rooms and bathroom were clean and comfortable, and I didn't need to queue for the bathroom at all. They don't provide shampoo/soap for the shower but are available in reception for purchase. There was a good selection for breakfast and they provided a good sized portion. It's close to the tube and in a beautiful neighborhood. The staff has been friendly and helpful both times I've stayed.

Stayed here for 3 nights. En suite room lovely and clean bit tight in the shower area but just enough room to do what's needed. Again nice and clean. Breakfast was spot on. Close to tube for getting around central London. Excellent price. I recommend this place 100 per cent and would definitely return.thankyou Charlotte guest house.

The rooms were spacious, clean, comfortable. But we were dropped off at reception, and the rooms were in a house 2-1/2 blocks away, across a busy street. And once we got there, we had to lug our bags up 5 flights of stairs. My parents who were traveling with us are in their late 70s and early 80s, one with a recent hip replacement, the other with shoulder issues. The other two of us aren't young either. Breakfast was in the building with reception. And a few days there were waits to get seating for breakfast. Most mornings, we either waited for seats or were guilted into hurrying our breakfast to make room for others.But we got extra towels when we asked and the rooms were clean, spacious, and comfortable. The ladies at reception connected us to a car service for rides from and to the airport.

We stayed here for one night in September, chosen based on the reviews here and its price, not for the location.It's unusual in that there are several buildings in the area that are used, but with breakfast in the main building, but only a couple of minutes away. We were in Lymington which is over a relatively busy road (in the morning at least).The room was large but shared a bathroom with several other rooms so access was a problem in the morning when people were having showers.The breakfast was OK, what you'd expect in a guesthouse anywhere in the UK.Note that check-in is only until 10pm.Overall it was good value for London.

Great.The room was nice and Clean,the friendly staff wee very helpful and great with advice and directions to London areas., nice clean and powerful shower and free parking at the weekend that's a bonus for London. Good breakfast with all the usual cereal and drinks.And my favourite thing a kettle in my room,I love having a kettle in my room .not in France.

This guest house won't knock you over with it's superficial appearance but the room was spacious and clean. The bathroom is very modern and appears to have been done over in the not too distant past. The highlight of the place is the staff. Dipack, the manager, bent over backwards to address any of our concerns. Anna, our primary server and breakfast and cleaner of our room was also outstanding. The people at the desk and kitchen all seemed to be determined to make you happy. The area had many decent restaurants and it was a short walk to the Jubilee line on the tube. To top it off their prices are quite reasonable.

Great location, ideal for our two days at Monsters of Art. Such friendly and welcoming staff, rooms basic but do what they say and are clean. Breakfast freshly cooked to order - highly recommend The main reception and breakfast room is in a different house to the one you will be staying in - they own a number of houses in the same street - his wasn’t a problem though.

We really liked our stay here.
