The room was cute, the service was great, and the breakfast was also really good.PROS: If you're wanting to be in the West Hampstead area, this is a great location with lots of good restaurants around. Really friendly staff. The breakfast was great, but the fruit juices were gross and kept at room temperature. Comfy accommodations and really reasonable rates.CONS: We arrived after checkin time, but our room still wasn't ready. That was frustrating as we'd had a really long day and really long flight. We had to walk around the neighborhood for a couple hours. Also, it was 85 degrees in the summer and the room was very hot - not really the guest house's problem but it was hard to sleep.Overall, I'd still recommend staying here (in the winter!) and it was a great, inexpensive experience.

This guesthouse is so lovely and the service is wonderful! Sara helped us so good with the check-in, she was so lovely and understanding. I took my flipflops with me because I knew I had to share a bathroom with some other people. But the bathroom was so clean, I didn’t even use them. All the people there are so kind and if you need something extra you just have to ask them and they fix it for you. The breakfast was really good and it was a menu with much variety. Including the traditional English Breakfast ofcourse. This was my second time at Charlotte Guest House and it was my second exellent experience!

I stayed here overnight whilst traveling through London. It is very easily accessible by the tube and overground: west hampstead, Thames link.It is a budget guest house but very comfortable and clean. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was great with lots of choices and it was fantastic to be able to sit outside on a mild morning.I’ll stay here again.

Had a fantastic couple of nights at this charming B&B in a quiet road just off the main street in West Hampstead. Reason for giving 4 stars instead of five -Lighting in the room wasn't great (putting on make-up was very difficult!) Maybe put a brighter light over the dressing table and/or in the bathroom. The door just outside our bedroom had a very strong spring, and so was a bit noisy as it slams every time anyone went through it.Major plus points - The location is very good, a few minutes from the tube and overground. Staff helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble, all very clean. We had a good breakfast, coffee refills and nobody rushed us out so it was very relaxing. Most of the guests had been to see Ed Sheeran at Wembley, so having breakfast in the garden the next day with everyone chatting about their experience was really lovely! I would definitely book again for the next time we do a London trip - thank you Charlotte Guest House, we loved staying with you!

Family journey (2 adults + 2 children).Excellent stayKind and attentive staff!The breakfast is very good and served promptly (despite the fact that the Guest House was overcrowded).The only very small drawbacks: a Wi-Fi a bit weak and the bedding is good, but nothing more. (Some would add: lots of French persons know the address... ;-D )West Hampstead is a very pleasant and living area, with lots of restaurants.Tube, Overground and railway station permit a quick access to the very heart of LDN, but also attractions located around (Camden Market, WB Studio...)The staff proposes also cheap taxi services, notably to go to the airport.Definitely recommended!!!

I came here last year on my first trip to London. The room isn’t anything to rant about but the room and bathroom were very clean. It was small (I’m ok with tiny spaces) but both buildings felt close and I’m not sure how to explain the whole place was very comfortable. What really made it special is the service. The front desk attendants are amazingly sweet, and very helpful when getting around I would talk to them and they always treated me like I wasn’t bugging them at all! Always extremely welcoming. Next was the food. I cannot explain how much I love the food. I go down and the dining area was almost always full because they didn’t just offer cereal and juice, they gave you meats and eggs and more! I chose this place because it was inexpensive and ended up being very happy! The cost was less than an overnight stay in any hotel in America with better food and service. I will be visiting again when I can because I miss it!

Stayed here and found it an incredibly enjoyable experience! The owner is a lovely great man, rooms are clean. Breakfast is provided, great location. WiFi. Everything you need in a quaint little guesthouse

A lovely place to stay in leafy West Hampstead, at a relatively reasonable price. Very convenient to West Hampstead tube stop, with lots of cafes, restaurants and supermarkets nearby. The breakfast is great and the staff are friendly. My room was fresh, clean and modern.

I stayed 3 nights and had a nice double bed with shared bathroom. The breakfast was fantastic and very filling. I highly recommend this place. I had a great time in London and it had fantastic travel connection so you are able to get anywhere.

Booked for an overnight stay, not expecting much. Wow, plain CLEAN rooms, refurbished bathroom, warm and comfortable. What more could I ask? The staff are a joy. Pleasant and smiling. Then we come to breakfast. Full English- and nothing seemed to much trouble. The experience was superb.

We stayed here for 2 nights, a weekend visit in London. The room was absolutely clean, the interior is modern and beautiful. Looking from outside, it’s a typical english house. The service was maximally kind.

This is the second time we come here. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are clean and the en-suite bathroom is very modern. The bed however is a little narrow and there is no curtain for the little window above the door to the little kitchen. You have to go through the kitchen to get to the bathroom, in winter this can be a little cold.

I came to stay at The Charlotte on the 6th Jan for 1 night with my daughter and grand daughter,we arrived early and was greeted by the lovely lady on reception who told us that our room was ready, it was in the building straight opposite. The room was on the ground floor, clean, nice size ( with a double and single bed) and a lovely little en-suite. We were going to the theatre later that day and the taxi was arranged by the lady on reception, the same company picked us up and took us back to the guest house. On Sunday we went to breakfast which was in the main building opposite, the breakfast area was very busy and a little cramped but again the staff were friendly and cheerful. The cooked breakfast was really nice and plentiful, I would definitely stay here again, its very good value for money, the staff are friendly and helpful and rooms are a good size and clean. On leaving the Charlotte we were going to visit Camdem and was told by the lady on reception that we could leave our luggage there and collect it later! Really couldn't fault the place!

The staffs in the receptionist and the breakfast room were really nice. The big breakfast were always delicious. The towel dryer was very useful. Room 197/2 was a lovely room, with modern and very clean bathroom. The location is 3 minutes walks to West Hampstead Thameslink station, Overground station, and Underground station, which was perfect to explore central London.

Booked here as a fairly cheap place to stay the night instead of having to travel home late after a concert. Room was large and very clean. Bathroom appeared to be brand new. Although the furniture and decor was dated, it was a comfortable stay for the night. The best bit was lack of noise - usually kept awake by neighbours in larger hotels with thin walls - but didn't hear anything here. Staff really lovely and friendly and good breakfast provided in the morning.

Stayed here on a three night break to London, and found the accommodation to be homely and comfortable. The breakfast also fantastic with a great range of things to choose from to start your day. A fantastic location, too: a few minutes walk to the tube station, and plenty of restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. I'd highly recommended the Railway Pub, which is around 5 minutes walk away. Excellent food and ales, and music fans may be interested to know that Cream, Hendrix and the Stones all played there.

I was in London on my own for one night and so I wasn't too particular as regards accommodation - all I needed was somewhere to sleep that was convenient to the centre and good value. What could I expect for £57? Not much, I thought. I was pleasantly surprised.I was assigned Room A at 165 Sumatra Road (a few hundred yards away from the main house - the nice girl at reception walked with me there and made sure I knew the layout). As expected (and as indicated when booking) it was small but perfectly adequate. It was a cold night in London but the room was nice and warm.The bed was comfortable, the room was spotlessly clean and the en-suite shower/toilet very convenient (some other rooms have shared bathroom facilities). Noise-wise, the rumble of trains from the nearby station was obvious until about 11pm or so but thereafter, until 6:30am, it was silence. Neither could I hear any of my neighbours or traffic ( the house is on a quiet road). It made for a perfect night's sleep.Breakfast was at the main house and there was a good choice - Full English, scrambled or poached eggs, or Continental plus the usual juices and cereals. All the hot food was freshly made to order. My scrambled eggs and coffee were perfect.All in all, ideal accommodation for the budget-conscious traveler and it will be my first choice for my occasional visits to London from now on. The area is safe and there are good pubs and restaurants in the vicinity (I recommend the Railway Bar which has excellent food). West Hampstead Tube Station is only a few minutes walk away and so very convenient for getting into town.

4 days in London in a beautiful location, near underground, overground, thameslink and bus going to the city center. Good quality/price ratio. Fresh and delicious english, continental or vegetarian breakfast. Nice and kind staff. What else ??

I did't realise the rooms are across different buildings when I booked the hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised as my room was big with a comfy bed and excellent shower. The staff is friendly, ready to give information and help with all queries we had. Overall good value for its price and the breakfast was tasty and various. Would definitely recommend.

This property is unique. Basically two old Victorian terraces made into a hotel. Note what I’ve said there. They haven’t knocked through they give you a key and you can be asked to leave and go next door. Odd.The hotel is off the main area for trendy bars and near the tube line so location is good. The area can be a little imposing at night. Remember you are surrounded by faceless predominantly bed sits and flats. The street isn’t particularly clean.So our visit started off meeting the receptionist who was professional and polite. She got us a cab sorted.We had to leave the reception out of the door and into next door. The stairs had stairs going down to a very dingy looking basement flat area not very inviting. We were first floor. The hotel seems like beds it land I guess it probably was. We laughed when we opened the door. It was like being transported back in time. 1960-70 era furniture. Yes it was clean but not exactly modern. The bed felt soft. Compact and bijou is the ideal terminology.The TV is minuscule more like a computer monitor high up on the wall. Worked ok but for this age poor. Wi if was acceptable.The bathroom was very modern and of a good standard although there was an odd smell. There is no shower gel provided and two thin towels. I noted that the outside of the basin had toothpaste residue on it. Two beakers were provided.We went out most of the night. You are given two keys, one for the front door. It was quiet when we returned at midnight.We had a terrible nights sleep. The mattress is sub standard. I literally was touching the bed frame when lying down. We missed the sign saying we could ask for extra pillows. Boy did we need them. We ended up using two lumpy decorative pillows as well as the well used ones provided. We were constantly waking up in agony. We both have low back pain today. This is not the place for a romantic interlude. We both said a park bench would’ve given us a better sleep.Noise from the underground is minimal.This is written pre breakfast. Why ? Because I can’t get back to sleep. And on the day when the clocks went back, another hour in here. The bedroom was warm, there are tea and coffee making facilities.Overall impression. If you are on a budget use it. No more than a night. If not don’t buy the last round upgrade somewhere else. Lastly if booking with booking dot com book and then check prices a few days before coming. We did this cancelled and rebooked saving £16.

Great location, only a 5 minute walk from under and overground transport. Cute little townhouses, divided into multiple rooms. We stayed in a private bathroom suite, which was small (room for a bed, dresser, and shower/toilet), but it was all that we needed. We were gone during the day, and just needed a bed to sleep in at night. The buildings are old, and have thin walls, but they are charming. The breakfasts were delicious! And the wait staff were kind and helpful. I would recommend if staying .

Great location with easy access to the city and the airport. Rooms and bathrooms newly renovated, staff welcoming and attentive, excellent breakfast. Exactly what I needed for my trip. Would recommend to others!!

Stayed here for 6 consecutive nights in a double room, shared bath. It was nice and quiet. The incuded breakfast was amazing and the staff and service was great. It is conveniently located near a main street and a short walk away from public transportation. The only thing that could have been better was the bed, it was uneven.

Charlotte Guest House, is an ideal location for short stays in London. I regularly visit during the week when I'm in the city for work, and am yet to have a bad experience. Situated on Sumatra Road in the affluent area of West Hampstead, it is only a short walking distance away from an array of bars and restaurants, as well as West Hampstead Underground, Overground, and Thameslink stations. There are also frequent bus services from the adjoining B510 road. This renders it a great location for travelling to virtually any part of London. The rooms are basic, but well maintained and clean. All benefit from a TV, tea/coffee making facilities, wash hand basin, and either an ensuite or shared bathroom. Rooms with the latter can be as cheap as £43, so if you're looking to save money on your trip and have no problem sharing, this would be ideal as you're not likely to find anywhere else this good, for this price in London. All guests benefit from a complimentary breakfast, served in the dining area next to the reception. A decent selection of food and drink is available, and is served by polite and diligent staff, who work very hard to ensure that you enjoy your stay. It's easy to make a reservation on their website; so if you're planning a trip to London, I'd strongly recommend you consider this place.

On arrival reception staff very welcoming. Stayed for two nights, had a single room small but very clean, shared a bathroom which where very modern and spotless clean. Breakfast took place in the main house across the road, a good selection on the menu (full English, Continental etc) which is included in the price. Great value for money. All the staff where friendly and helpful. Round the corner from the station. Plenty of eateries on the main street in fact there is everything you need within a few minutes walk. Certainly would go there again.

I stayed here five nights and got an amazing deal on the room. The location was perfect – West Hempstead – a few blocks walk to the Underground, Overground, and Thameslink. There are great bus services nearby but I didn’t use them as the trains were sufficient. There’s a Laundromat a few blocks away on the high street should you need to do laundry. Reception was super friendly and accommodating. My room was cozy and clean, with a kettle, a television, and a sink. I booked the single, so it was a twin bed, and although the room was on the small side, I didn’t feel cramped. I was on the top floor, which wasn’t a problem either, but since there’s no elevator, if you cannot do stairs I would speak with the hotel beforehand to see if you can be placed on a lower floor. I had no issues with the Wi-Fi, nor with the television in the room. The bathrooms are shared and they are kept clean, but bring your own toiletries. I don’t know why others are complaining on here about the key deposit, but yeah, you have to leave a £5 deposit, which isn’t the worst thing in the world and you get it back at the end of your stay, but I digress. I stayed in one of the houses directly across the street from reception. Just so you know, Charlotte Guest House is more of a B&B type of establishment and is made up of several houses on the street. You’ll breakfast in the main reception house. The breakfast was perfect, with many hot and cold choices on offer. The breakfast room is small so it gets crowded and can be chaotic, but that is to be expected when you're all clamoring to eat at the same time in the morning. London is so expensive, but Charlotte Guest House was an excellent value for the money.

Stayed there with my 11 year old son. Super nice staff. A clean room, reasonable size, nice recently renovated bathroom. Wifi, good tv. Safe neighborhood. I liked the made to order breakfast in the conservatory. An as-advertised pleasant simple guest house. Restaurants, bars, cafes, grocery stores, everything... plus train, tube, and bus, just around the corner. What more could you ask for at this price? The only minus might be the mattress (a bit worn), but I slept fine despite that. Pleasantly surprised that the nearby rail did not disturb our sleep at all.

We spent three days at the Charlotte Guest House. The property is spread over a number of adjacent buildings so we had to walk along Sumatra Road to the main premises for breakfast. Breakfast was ok but not memorable. Dining room felt cramped.Anna was helpful on our arrival and made us welcome. Our room up a steep flight of stairs was fairly compact with our two suitcases. However, the room and the small bathroom were clean. The room was serviced daily to a good standard.For us the room was just somewhere to sleep as we spent most of our time out and about. It wasn't a place I wanted to linger in during the day.The property is handy to underground stations and there are a number of eating places in the neighbourhood as well as a couple of handy supermarkets.Overall, the Charlotte isnt a top of the range property and what you get is a reflection of the price you pay in the London market.

Great staff.. the key to any place... good location for getting anywhere in and around London, underground, overground, Thameslink and busses all within a short walking distance.This is not the Ritz it's a very reasonably priced B & B and you will get a friendly welcome, a clean and comfortable room a great breakfast with some amazingly hard working people making your stay a real pleasure.... all for less than afternoon tea at the Ritz..!! (no offence to the Ritz, it's a very nice tea...)High points... very comfortable bed, excellent choice for breakfast... all made to order and great staff.For the price no real bad points... could have done with a sheet as it was a little warm for the duvet, but I have no doubt that if I asked I would have got one... fatigue took over... very comfortable bed..!!!We will definitely stay again when we have our next break in town....

Staff very friendly, rooms are clean. Very well situated fir those flying to Luton. A shame that the breakfast coffee & hot chocolate are instant.... would have appreciated some shampoo... shower gel....

Please bear in mind that this is a B&B, so don't expect 5 star luxury, however, for the price you pay it's in a super location (Jubilee line is just round the corner and there's plenty of places to eat and drink) the rooms are huge, the staff are really friendly and the breakfast was great.Special mention goes to the little Polish waitress who completely ran her socks off during breakfast, but carried on smiling right to the end. Would definitely stay there again.

This was a great B&B in London. The reception staff were lovely and friendly, check in was easy, the room was in the house next door to the one with the reception and the breakfast area, but it was fine staying there. The room itself was a good size and was clean and the en suite seemed pretty new and was really clean! The only slight drawback to it was that you could hear the noise of the trains going by. If you're a light sleeper this place mightn't suit you, otherwise I'd say to definitely stay here!The area was also good - the B&B was located near to a number of shops and also to the underground, overground, multiple bus routes and to a train line!Oh one other little thing, left luggage is just in reception, mine was fine when I stayed there, but not everyone might be fond of this.Would I stay there again? Yes, I've even been looking up when I can :)

Stayed here for 5 nightsthis place is really great The staff are very friendly and will do anything to help youthe rooms are a good size and very cleanBreakfast was varied and very good Situated 5 minutes from the underground and the overground train stationsI would highly recommend this place to stay i guarantee you will not be dissapointedWe will definately be back

Have mixed impressions about this establishment. I did not realise when booking that that there were separate buildings and all rooms were not en suite, still that was my fault for not doing enough research.In fairness we rang in advance to check that our room was ensuite, it wasn't but the receptionist Anna changed our room without charge.On arrival we were told we were in the other building, the room was large and had a lovely new shower room, however the furniture and bedding had seen better days. Breakfast was OK and staff were very friendly but the dining room was a bit cramped.

The guest house is a collection of terraced houses. Small, top floor room with no air conditioning nor bathroom. But perfectly comfortable with plenty of wardrobe and drawer space and desk and chair. Toilet and bathroom shared between 3 rooms. 6 electrical sockets, tea and coffee and free wifi. Breakfast included too and available early enough on a Sunday too (0730). Also only 100m from West Hampstead tube and overground stations. A bargain at the price I paid.

A very charming and helpful lady at the reception on arrival. Room are nice, clean and tidy. Breakfast are included but was unexpected to find a large choice included a daily special. Good service too done by 2 very nice waitresses. Highly recommended if you are in the lovely area of West Hampstead.

Brilliant location - close to transport links and the city centreFabulous area of London - felt really safe here!The guest house - well deserved praise as on previous reviews ! Yes it's basic- but it's very clean comfortable and so well priced Can't fault it and would recommend!The staff are lovely - thank you Ana especially for being so kind and accommodating

Not all rooms are based on site - we were in a building a street away on the top floor of lovely house. Room was large and comfortable. A little bit dust around the tv/mirror area but bathroom exceptionally clean. Breakfast was great - staff exceptionally attentive. Quick and tasty food. Reception staff exceptionally helpful too. Be prepared to walk back to main building for breakfast if you are not in that building. For what we required this was ideal - reasonable price, decent room and good food. We will definitely be back

We stayed here for the location to the O2 as we were seeing a concert there. The location is fab, easy for public transport and if you don’t want to do that, the front desk staff (who were lovely) will order a taxi for you. We had dinner and breakfast in the hotel. Dinner was amazing. Great pizza and the cod and chips were fab. Breakfast standard greasy spoon type cooked breakfast. Great croissant though! Unfortunately the bed was so uncomfortable! Awful old mattress and pillows that have left us with achy backs. For that reason alone I’ll think twice before booking here again which is a shame!!

This is the third time my girlfriend and I have visited this hotel in the last couple of years, and it never fails to impress. The hotel is always lovely and clean and the staff are warm and friendly, and never short of good advice. The breakfast is always very good and the restaurant area is lovely relaxed. The DLR is only a short walk away, and it’s a direct route into Bank on the tube networkI will be visiting again soon, if for nothing else, for the warm cookie on arrivalThanks again

Stayed here for one night in Feb this year and managed to get a room for £80 for the night on booking.com which I thought was a great price considering the location and some prices London hotels charge. Room was fairly small but the amenities were really modern and fresh and trendy. Perfect for a stopover and the staff were really helpful and friendly! Also definitely recommend the lamb shank on room service!

Visited here on business. The hotel itself is in an area where you’re not expecting a hotel! The staff were excellent on check in and check out.The hotel room was gorgeous (having recently been refurbished). The bed and pillows were possibly the comfiest I have ever slept on!We did attempt to eat elsewhere, but having walked for 10 minutes and not found anywhere, we arrived back at the hotel. I ordered the salmon, which was one of the best meals I’ve had in a long time!Thank you - a great stay!

This hotel was easy to get to from Greenwich Railway Station or DLR. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. There was an ironing board and fridge in room which was a bonus

We booked in for one night in this hotel and had high expectations based on most of the earlier reviews. On arrival at the check-in desk, the staff appeared to be very busy and it took a while to get our room key, and there was no sign of the supposed 'complimentary warm chocolate chip cookie'. Our room was adequate in size, albeit only for a one or two nights stay and it was a bit of a squeeze to access the wardrobe. Nevertheless the beds were quite comfortable and the room was quiet. However, the biggest letdown was the breakfast in the morning, which is served in an airless subterranean space which is clearly far too small to adequately accommodate the numbers that were endeavouring to eat there. i would have raised this issue with the staff when I checked-out but no-one enquired as to whether we had enjoyed our stay. Perhaps they were not bothered.

Perfect location for Greenwich Attractions. Hotel Rooms are 5 stars, very clean and comfortable. The Staff always have a smile and go the extra mile to make you feel welcome. We had bed and breakfast for 5 nights. Breakfast food is excellent with lots of variety. I would not hesitate to return to this great Hotel. Reception staff namely (Jan) never hesitated to spend as much time as needed to assist us with our questions. He was most helpful.

We chose this Hotel because of its quiet location,, closer to West Greenwich and a 20 minute walk to the Pier.Nice facilities, good food and friendly staff made our stay more pleasant. The room was adequate with tea/coffee facilities, in-room safe & good linen. Found the shower difficult to adjust to the right water temperature & slippery but the Hotel provided a non-slip mat upon request. Would recommend

We booked in for 2 nights before a cruise. The hotel is very nice and the staff lovely. My only 2 complaints is the lighting in the bathroom is dreadful for a woman trying to apply cosmetics. Also no fridge in the room I can understand not having a fridge in the room for environmental reasons but a least have a ice bucket and ice availsble.

Wanted to say what a pleasure it was to stay at the Hilton in Greenwich, from checking in at reception and being talked through the area and the complimentary cookies.The excellent quality room and spectacular views of London. When we got back from a night in Greenwich a knock and complimentary hot chocolate. Breakfast the next morning again good quality and very attentive staff, I cannot fault the experience from start to finish. The only negative is the small amount of parking spaces available but defiantly only a minor issue the rest was just superb.

Great place to stay, very attentive staff, good food. Drinks in the bar are reasonably priced. Made to feel welcome. Booked our taxi to the 02 without any fuss. We were upgraded due to maintenance and thoroughly pleased with our twin suite. The room was clean and comfortable with everything you could need. The only downside is finding it. We came out of the back of the tube station and really struggled. Make sure you come out the front entrance. A signpost somewhere to say we're it is would be helpful. Couldn't fault this beautiful hotel.

Stayed one night in a king junior suite. The room was huge with 2 sofas, nespresso machine, and free soft drinks in the minibar etc Very comfortable and clean with outstanding views with floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom is very big with a double vanity sink. The only negative was the shower lacked pressure. We used the car park which is secure, we had to prebook the space. Found all of the hotel employees very friendly and accomodating during our stay. We had dinner in the restaurant which was exceptional quality and breakfast the following day. The breakfast choice is simple with cereal, pastries and a cooked selection etc but the quality was superb!The hotel is around a 5 min walk to the DLR which takes around 15 mins to get to central london so for the price the locations is excellent. I will definitely stay here again when next in London and highly recommend the hotel!

I picked this hotel expecting a lot because of all the excellent reviews. it was OK and also a bit disappointing. When we arrived, we could not check in because our room was not ready and the reception staff had no idea why. The hotel staff offered free drinks and food while we waited for the room to get ready. I appreciate this but it was very disappointing after a long drive, hoping to check in, freshen up and go for our event. Breakfast was good and I liked the fresh orange juice machine. However, the environment where the hotel is located is strange among residential houses. I'm not sure I'll be back but hotel is Ok, I see no wow factor for all the excellent reviews. I've stayed in much better Doubletree and Hilton hotels nearby

We stay in this hotel whenever coming to London. It is very good value and the public transport to all parts of London is good. Good services and the staff are always friendly and helpful. The evening meal could be more interesting but there are at least 3 good restaurants very near.

The staff at this hotel are so amazing, there is not a rating high enough to match their brilliance, I would especially like to thank:RomyJanMyLinhAliceAndraeJeremy MilanBilal And my special breakfast buddy AbuYou know why you are all amazing, and thank you will never be enough but THANK YOU!!!

Stayed here last summer with my mum and really enjoyed my time here. It's in Greenwich which is not too touristy and a nice break from the crowded areas. It's pretty close to the tube station which will take you anywhere in town. Lots of great eateries, shops and cafe's in the area as well. We had breakfast included since my mum is a diamond member. It's the only hotel I've ever stayed at where you can make fresh orange juice by putting the orange in a squeezer. Can't recommend this place enough.

I’ve stayed numerous times in other Doubletree hotels closer to Canary Wharf, but this hotel is well worth the 12 minute DLR ride. Rooms are spacious and clean, staff is awesome and very friendly. Will definitely come here again.

We stayed for one night when we were going to the O2. Perfect location, within walking distance of Greenwich centre (10-15 mins), 5-10 mins to Deptford Bridge DLR. we took the bus on return from O2, the 188 - could have got a second bus to get us closer, but chose a 15 minute walk to the hotel. The hotel is beautifully furnished, the bar area was particularly wonderful! Breakfast was exactly what you'd expect from Hilton! From Make your own pancakes to full English and made to order omelettes!

Stayed with a friend for a weekend as we were going to the O2 on the Saturday night. Easy check in, clean but small twin bed room and noon check out. All of this contributed to a good stay. Being within easy reach of the O2 and Greenwich market and shops make this a good option.

Great location for access to multiple stations, friendly and helpful staff - cookie on arrival was a lovely touch. Room was small but very comfortable and stylish. Really enjoyed my stay and will be staying again for future trips.

Great Service and breakfast items. They go out of their way to help with a problem. Friendly staff and clean rooms. Close to DLR which is great when needing to get around London. Not many restaurants around the area, but the DLR makes that less of an issue.

The staff was amazing. Excellent hotel Becca use of the staff. Close to the tube and Greenwich. It was a wonderful hotel. Everything was great. Your enjoy your stay. Even the staff in the dinning room was so kind.

The staff are extremely helpful here, going above and beyond. The hotel is elegant, well furnished and clean. The bathroom doors provided a history lesson which was interesting. The food is good, both at breakfast and the room service/restaurant dinners. There is also good WiFi and a decent little gym. Very close to the DLR. Another good Hilton.

I really enjoyed staying here and I do a fair amount of research before staying in a new area of London. I needed to be close to Canary Wharf, but not too close if you know what I mean - so I opted for this hotel in Greenwich seemed to fit the bill perfectly.I expected it to be good, but I didn't expect to be awarding this hotel 5 stars on the very first visit. Aside from the stylish interiors the the breakfast is highly recommend in a peaceful setting that is quite unlike most London hotels. There is a relaxing cocktail bar and the beds are really comfortable too.The staff deserve a special mention though as they were all friendly, but Patricia in guest relations was particularly helpful and professional and is a credit to the team. I will look forward to staying here again.

I arrived late and yet they were ready for me. Made my checking easy, quick and got my cookie. The room was a bit small so a bit surprised but it was very clean and confortable with a good view. I liked it was 5 minute walk to the train station

This was a delight for an afternoon tea that I had an offer on. Was very surprised to find that this was a very beautifully decorated. Walked in and thought wow. The afternoon tea location was near the bar area and was very romantic and cosy. Wasn’t busy when we arrived there was only two other people having afternoon tea was quite spacious and we felt very relaxed and comfortable. We loved the cushions and armchairs. I would recommend this as an afternoon tea as a couples or even as a romantic location. Would return!

Lovely hotel and really helpfull staff ,from reception to bar,restaurant and breakfast all were trying to make you feel as welcomed as possible. Very close and convenient if you need to go Greenwich as is a walking distance and you should walk as the road is full of hidden gems and really interesting place. Will definitely be back whit the first occasion we have.Thanks a million for the amazing service.

Received a very warm welcome when we checked in late on a Friday night. We were given a room on the lower ground floor which offered no view to the outside world. The bathroom was a good size, however the water in the sink had so muckh pressure that it flooded the floor when switched on.

I am a long-standing Hilton customer and this was probably the worst stay in a long time. Rarely write reviews as repeat business is how I prefer to repay good service. I am a diamond member and so would expect my stay preferences on the system to be considered. Instead I got a ground floor room behind the bar. People were smoking outside the room which still managed to come in through a closed window. Woken at 11pm by the fire alarm (not mentioned at checkout). Woken again after that by noisy guests in the room next door through paper thin walls. Breakfast terrible - hot food was cold. Not asked how my stay was at checkout (when I would have gladly told them all this). All in all an absolute shocker and will not use this hotel again.

The highlight at this Hilton was the staff. To a person they were thoughtful, hospitable and helpful. It started with Alice, who greeted us on arrival and introduced us to the hotel and continued at every touchpoint. Thank you team!! We had a light meal in the bar and it was value for money and good to eat (both were salads). My husband was delighted that the kitchen remembered to put anchovies on the Cesar Salad. Our room - a standard king - was comfortable and had all you would expect. I would have no hesitation returning to this hotel but would mention that if you prefer to sleep with your window open look for a room with even numbers as those with odd ones look out over the air-conditioning bank which makes for a constant rumble (only with the window open).

From the moment we arrived, the staff could not have done enough for us. The food and beverages were outstanding, I was on the 9th floor where the views were stunning ! Very generous bedroom with a very comfortable bed, I cannot wait to come back here. We took a long walk around Greenwich there is so much do see !!

Very nice and friendly atmosphere. I like the fact that it was very clean!!. Great location to visit family and friends. Check in was effortless. The front desk Personel was all pleasant and accommodating. We requested an uograde because of my friends ,”DIAMOND “ status and was upgraded without a foss!We would stay here again. love the family room. Lots of space .

We stayed at this hotel for four nights based on a recommendation by family that had previously stayed on an earlier trip some years ago when it was a Hampton or Hilton. Based on American standards, I found the room to be rather small. However, it did offer a king-size bed which was not always available at other London Hilton-brand hotels. There was a small sitting area when entering the room, but we did not use that other than for storage. The bathroom was clean and nice - toilet worked well and the water pressure for the shower was very good. The bed was comfortable. Storage space is limited and you'll probably end up storing luggage under the desk or in the sitting area if you have much of it.My one minor complaint with the hotel room was that it had no bedside outlets. I use a CPAP machine for sleep apnea, but did not find a place to plug it in. Only one of the three or four outlets would not accept my power converter. The outlet at the desk was the only one that would accept a power converter. However, there were some bedside USB ports which I used at night to keep my phone charged.This hotel is not centrally located to the major London attractions, but it is a short 5 minute walk to a Docklands Light Railway (DLR) and was significantly less expensive (£30+) than other more centrally located Hilton properties. I think the benefit to this hotel is that it seems to be situated in a part of London that one would call "real life" - a non-tourist part of London where Londoners live, work and commute. We ate at a great pub (The North Pole) that was about a 5 or 6 minute walk away.We ate room service the first night as we got to the hotel around 11pm. Only cold sandwiches were available and we had to take what was available. Our last night we ate one night in the restaurant and the food was OK, but didn't find it great. However, one afternoon we had creamed tea and it was very good.If you want local atmosphere, this is a great place in my opinion.

We had 5 sisters come and visit from Cape Town and chose this hotel for them. Some have traveled extensively so we were not sure. They were absolutely blown away by the service they received. The staff from the desk to to the dinning room were great.There is always one person who tends to stand out and I would like to thank Abu for the extra help and advice he gave them. Well beyond the call of duty.

Helpful and great service from staff. Room clean. However breakfast wasn’t great, eggs and bacon were like rubber. Not as high quality I was expecting overall, didint think it was worth what I paid, £120 for one night

I really love this hotel. Just the general style of it. i have stayed in a large selection of the rooms though some are quite small they are all quite modern & clean. The restaurant & bar are lovely places to eat & have a drink.The service is always very good. it is a bit out of the way for London but has good links via the DLR & suits where i am visiting. Being doubletree you also always get a lovely cookie. Having stayed in a lot of Hiltons this continues to be one of the best for me .

We stayed for four nights and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel location is great, with super easy access to the DLR & Greenwich rail station. We got tickets to cutty sark, maritime museum & City cruise during our trip and were happy that it was also within easy walking distance of the hotel. The highlight of our stay was the staff who made our stay very enjoyable, they would always give you warm welcome be it in lobby, lifts or public areas. Room was amazing with great views over city. We had meal on 1 night in the hotels restaurant and it was very good.

A well appointed, well decorated, and comfortable property with excellent WiFi and a very comfortable bar area. Well serviced by black cabs and a nice green area right outside the door (to the left - use the ashtrays!). Enjoyed my very short stay. Would recommend. I returned from a meeting in the city late (2330) and had not eaten. There was a very limited room service menu available but I understand that this was a temporary issue. However I was then given my choice from the limited menu for free. Very impressed and super-nice touch by the manager. Well played Sir / Madam! Negative into a Positive

I am diamond member at Hilton and I generally associate the doubletree brand with large spacious rooms, big lobbies etc. This property was however more like an autograph collection from Marriott. It appeared to be an older hotel converted to a doubletree (did not check out the details). It’s tucked away in a residential area so hard to spot from the roadside. A very small lobby and similarly small rooms though well appointed. Breakfast was typical British. It’s in a basement and the tables are all crammed up so did not get a grand feeling and you want to just get it done with quickly. I was disappointed with the laundry service as my suit came back not dry cleaned properly. However I just mentioned this while checking out and they waived away the laundry charges. I got it then redone at my next hotel in my itinerary.

Needed a place to stay for one night near Greenwich. The hotel is about a 15/20 min walk from the Center of Greenwich but it’s a pleasant walk along the high street. Upon arrival I was greeted by My Linh and Andre who were wonderful and so hospitable and gave personal care. The room was brilliant and with so many extra touches it made a business trip feel like a mini break. Breakfast was also great, machines to freshly squeeze juice topped it off. A chain hotel with staff that make it feel like you’re in a 5 star boutique hotel.

The hotel is amazing. And it was great with an amazing view. Very clean and tidy, The reception area is beautiful. And thanks for a lovely staff that checked me, thank you to MyLing for being so friendly and professional and exceptional service. Outstanding service. Thanks for making me feel welcomed and beautiful and cheerful smile.The food was great and the staff was really helpful. I recommend this hotel, you won't be disappointed.I M Definitely coming back in the future.Thank you J

I would 100% recommend this hotel. It’s a short walk from the LDR or a bus stop so idea location.The hotel staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay, often going above and beyond for us.Breakfast is a little expensive, even if you book the cheap rate the night before but you certainly get your monies worth and the food is lovelyOur room was very clean and for a disabled room was bigger than I expected.We had an evening meal which again was lovely. You get a good choice and the prices are reasonable but the food is definitely worth it.Finally the added touch of leaving me a card and some cupcakes for my birthday was a lovely gift.Overall we had a brilliant stay and would love to go back again.

We arrived in London at 7am and went straight to the hotel requesting an early check in knowing it was too early. My Tinh i believe her name was, was not only accommodating to our ridiculous request, she said that since we were a Diamond member, she upgraded us. The room was phenomenal. 9th floor, amazing view, beautifully decorated. I slept like a baby and never heard anyone else in the hotel. The shower, though gorgeous with 4 shower heads and a partial glass door was my only complaint. The over head showerhead had very light pressure and all four on together soaked the wall, door, and floor. Very impressive to look at, just not functional. The breakfast was very nice. We loved the evening surprises left in our room Very convenient location. We found the DLR and tube to be much faster than Ubers. The same sweet girl that checked us in was super helpful on our check out in helping us take the underground to the airport.

Restaurant in hotel has nice ambiance, the menu subtle change from last year, service goid , but they were quiet. Starter of chrizo and prawn was lovlwy. Cod and chips, not what i cal rustic, but more like great chips from favourite chippy, nithing left on plate. Only complaint, no Chardoney alone wine, just blended, hope they change thatOtherwise a very nice meal

We love this hotel and have been using it for some years - previously it was a Mercure hotelIt is so stylish and the location is great for Central London and, of course, Greenwich where we love the market and the Clipper along the ThamesStaff are efficient in all areasHousekeeping is excellentCheck in welcoming We love the bar area and tend to eat there rather than the main restaurant - good food and drinks menuGround floor rooms are best, slightly larger, if not booking a suite, and upper floors have great viewsLove this hotel - always feel ‘at home’ Highly recommended

Visited hotel for afternoon tea and although the hotel looked lovely I was not impressed with the service I received. I was served promptly but not once was I asked if all was ok or if I needed anything else but others dining were asked. The food was pretty basic and the pastries supplied were not great. It was not value for money at all and the service was poor. I will not be returning for afternoon tea but the hotel may be worth staying in.

Very comfortable hotel, convenient for Deptford and New Cross, with good transport links in to the City and central London. It is, however, expensive for the area. They used to offer free parking but it is not clear if they still do.

We booked this hotel as we don't really like central London, but could get easily to where we needed to go with the excellent transport links from this hotel.We had a room on the 9th floor which has excellent views across the city.The staff here could not to anymore for us, Andre especially went above and beyond and it was very much appreciated.The hotel is is a quiet area, but a 5 min walk to Deptford Bridge DLR and 10 mins to Greenwich DLR and mainline stations.The rooms are not huge, but then, you don't come to London to sit in a hotel room! Just be aware that the bathroom floor does get a little slippy, even if not really wet, so you may need to put down additional towels other than the bath mat provided.I do hope to return to the hotel the next time we are looking for London accommodation.

I'm a frequent Hilton guest (diamond status) and I booked this hotel because it was convenient in terms of location and price on my dates. I don't normally book Doubletree, preferring Hiltons, but figured I'd give it a shot.First, the hotel is amazing in terms of appearance - it was an old police station and then a private boutique hotel, and then finally became a Doubletree.Second, the rooms are incredibly modern (probably the most I've seen - and I've stayed at the Conrad in London/St. James 3 times), and while not huge, well laid out and well decorated (there was the history of the crown on the bathroom glass door - really interesting to read!).Finally - the dining room and the bar are the best! Super stylish and well appointed.Service from check-in to bar to check-out were top notch (with one exception - you have to spin a stupid wheel and you win a 'prize' (a free drink, some points, etc.) - kind of takes the class of the hotel down in my opinion to have to do that - just give me a random allocation if you want to do that I guess). The only negative was the location to transport - it was 2 blocks from one and 4 blocks from another one, so not terrible but this isn't the tube, it's the DLR (which means you have to connect), so I took Uber twice because I didn't want to walk.

My first stay at this excellent hotel and, hopefully, not my last. Although the immediate area is quiet and refined, with a small gardens adjacent, the hotel is conveniently sited near Deptford Bridge DLR station and easy reach of Canary Wharf. For history or leisure fans, the O2 Arena and maritime Greenwich are also nearby. Inside, my room was well sized, comfortable and well appointed. The bathroom doors are worth a special mention, being covered in text outlining significant historic royal events in the borough. A nice touch. Add in courteous, pleasant staff and a decent breakfast and you have the recipe for a very pleasant stay. Thank you, DoubleTree!

Great hotel, lack of storage so plan accordingly for luggage. It was a 10 minute walk to the train station and about 3 minutes to the bus stop. The food at the restaurant was excellent and convenient. The staff was extremely helpful in helping us navigate around town.

Our fourth stay. Interesting building with thoughtfully designed rooms. Quiet and calm atmosphere, supported by friendly and professional staff. Feels safe and secure. Room temperature is easy to control and cleanliness standards are high.Good location - and if you're driving there's a good secure car park (£20 a day and must book in advance). Breakfast had lots of variety and decent coffee.

Our late Sunday afternoon check-in was a bit of a disaster. Reception’s backlog and my tiredness were a bad combo but the lengthy process was eventually rescued my a smart young Frenchwoman. Forgive me, I cannot recall her name.Our room was just right: enough room for two, good bathroom, Nespresso machine, decent wifi, excellent housekeeping and suitable urban view. Close to the DLR and a short stroll to the Overground and Greenwich town. Never ate in the restaurant but the bar was fun, with pleasant staff, if a bit faux chic. In a quiet part of town, although, the air con was a bit rowdy.

Really lovely gem of a hotel. Stylish boutique hotel. Love the chillout lounge sessions sounds in the bar (plus has a couple of computers with web access). Local parking difficult so ended up paying the £20 onsite secure parking fee (pre-booking required). Breakfast really good. Bed very comfortable and room really nice. Staff really friendly and helpful. Nice touch with yummie warm cookie on check-out. Only downsides: Noisy aircon, which we had to switch off; Gin & Tonics were £7.50 each, though they did do a quite good value Pre-Show Meal including 2 courses and a drink for £19.99. Didn't check out the gym. Will be back again!

I had booked another nearby IHG hotel earlier this week. Upon arrival, I was informed that the hotel was full and I had been booked into another.Thoroughly annoyed, I was sent to Holiday Inn London - West, where the experience could not have been more different. I was greeted courteously and professionally. My rewards points were posted to my account before I'd even got to the room. This was clean and pleasant, with a great AC system working well.Breakfast was fine - not a big breakfast eater, but fresh fruit was just right - lots of places have unripe fruit, meaning no chance of breakfast. Again, not the case here.Checkout was great - even offered to call a cab to my destination as the other hotel's booking that they'd promised me from the night before was more than 15 minutes late for my meeting.Suffice to say, when I need to be in the Wembley area again, I'll be staying here!

Generally good hotel with good sized, well appointed and clean roomsBut always disappointments here:1. Check in experience poor. Pre authorisation taken but not posted to system resulting in visit to reception when trying to charge to room2. Breakfast is a disaster. Staff too interested in chatting with each other instead of ensuring fully stocked buffet. On first morning there was no orange juice, bacon, hash browns or sausages or plates. When I interrupted the staff members idly chatting one of them brought 6 plates despite the q already bring 9 deep. No point waiting for food refills because they take so long and everything else will be cold by the time they arrive This was mentioned to duty manager during my last visit to this hotel who promised action.No change was evident

The hotel facilities a coffee lounge, with a clean and very friendly team. I use this frequently as it has internet access and a homely atmosphere. Serves lovely food and has media facilities for everyone’s needs.

I have booked this hotel for my parents, as they were elderly and first time to London. I send email to hotel for transportation pre-arrangement and special attention on them. I got reply from Front Office Manager - Tom, he and his team took good care of them during the stay. I really appreciated for the extra miles of service.Further, according to my parents, hotel is conveniently located and room is spacious. Thank you.

I have stayed in this hotel on Saturday as it is relatively close to Wembley stadium ( don't take me seriously) It was the closest hotel left when I went for Pink's concert. But hotel is really nice, modern and beds are so comfortable. Rooms are generous size for London and staff is pleasant.But it is quite far hotel to return too from the Wembley concert at 11pm, however this is not hotel's fault

I’ve recently stayed in Holiday Inn London West with some friends visiting London and absolutely love this place. All staff were very friendly and welcoming from the moment we stepped in. They also arranged a gorgeous welcome amenities as I mentioned that it’s a friends reunion and we’re all flying from all over Europe. The rooms were very comfortable and spotless and also looked to be recently renovated. The location is great as it’s still close to central London and very easily accessible by tube (direct central line access). We also ate at the hotel during our stay and food was very delicious. I stayed in many holiday inn hotels and this one would be my favourite one so far in terms of menu creativity, especially vegetarian dishes. I would highly recommend this hotel based on value for money and excellent customer service!

Top to Bottom our favourite London hotel. Seventh floor view of Gypsy Corner, fourth floor roof terrace looking towards central London and brilliant bar, lounge and restaurant facilities on the ground floor. Choice of excellent coffee, beer and cold drinks. Snacks and meals to suit the time of day. 24 hour cafe for the overnighters and late arrivals. My son has mobility issues and the staff led by Tom Storup, the reception manager went beyond expectations to meet his unique needs.

I have been using this hotel as a base for my commute into central London for work, and its great!This hotel is easily reached by car & has parking, The central tube line a less than a 5min walk, with Oxford Circus only around 25mins away. The hotel itself is modern and spacious with a good sized bar/lounge area & adequate dinning area.Rooms are as expected with Holiday Inn hotels, clean, comfortable beds & pillows and always great powerful showers. On my most recent trip, I was lucky enough to have been given an upgrade, which was really nice. The room was much larger, with a good sized lounge area, great bed & TV at the foot of the bed-a real luxury! Staff at this hotel are also great, nothing is too much trouble, always happy to help and assist & always with a smile. If you are in need of an affordable hotel, with good access into central London, then I would recommend staying here.

I don’t normally leave reviews as stay in a lot of hotels for work. However I feel compelled to leave a review on my recent stays at Holiday Inn, London West. All staff are very friendly, efficient, and clearly confident in their roles. This can only be due to strong management who know how to get the best out of their people. It makes such a difference. I love staying there, the hotel has a great atmosphere. The food is great, a decent choice of beers and wines. The hotel is just great value, near the tube for London and very popular with good reason. Always clean, well looked after. If you stay here you will feel that it exceeds expectations.

We stayed here to go to a concert at Wembley as it was advertised as being near so all good. Checkin was ridiculously slow. Only 2 desks open, and one of them manned by a member of staff who was in training so the queues were ridiculous especially on a Sat afternoon when a bus party arrived .Its not a great first impression. We had a disabled executive room which we were very pleased with. Great bed, pillow choice and toiletries along with the disabled bathroom made it much easier to stay in with my disabilities.Location, There are not many nice food places nearby as it’s just off the A40. However the food in the restaurant was fine for a quick bite before the concert. Bit overpriced but it is “ London “ Breakfast ; very good range and quality to suit most tastes. Bar staff again were slow and seemed too inexperienced to be left on their own to cope with a bar. ordering 4 simple drinks the barman scuttled off , having had to write it down then took 5 mins to make them. Uber to Wembley cost £16 but allow lots of time for traffic, a 3 mile journey took 40 mins obviously due to increased concert traffic. Checkout was as painful as checkin , and staff were confused and tried to charge us for “parking and breakfast” £40 that we had already paid for when I’d checked in the day before. Again not impressed and staff in training. Overall. Good hotel , however staff really let it down. Advice - train your staff on non peak times and have them shadowed/ supported individually.

Very nice, very clean hotel with friendly, professional staff. You got a very good value for the price. It is located at a 5 minutes walking distance from the underground (central line). Would definitely recommend.

Awesome hotel, clean and tidy, staff are brilliant, rooms are very nice especially the executive rooms that cost much more, Food is is good quality and value Parking is reasonable Breakfast is very good with plenty of seating and choice..

Was a little dubious to be staying so far out of the big smoke, but with Ascot on this week, room availability was scarce.However, so glad I took the risk and found this little gem!A few mins walk from the central line at North Acton and the area is absolutely fine for those unsure.The hotel is modern and well appointed.The restaurant was great value too, which was a surprise!I was staying in an Executive Room was lovely.Nothing really to complain about.Only niggle and it is only a niggle was the smell of cigarettes coming through the air con system at about 2am - don’t know why, don’t know how, but lesson learnt for next time and easily fixed - don’t leave the air con on when sleeping.Will certainly stay here again.Great hotel with great staff -

The hotel is located centrally and convenient for people driving in to London. The hotel is quite modern in its decor. The Rooms and bath are good sized, modern interiors and comfortable. The breakfast spread is excellent and very well made. However, the breakfast area is quite cramped with tables laid out very very close to each other; and can be a bit too close for comfort, especially during busy hours. It has a very basic mini gym; but a swimming pool would have really enhanced the experience. Overall, nice modern hotel for business travellers on short visits to London.

I have just returned from staying here whilst socialising in Ealing. I found the price versus the hotels in Ealing much more competitive and the transport links are fantastic with the tube station only minutes walk. Great food, lovely spacious clean rooms, friendly team. Would highly recommend.

A massive THANK YOU to the whole team at Holiday Inn London West who were looking after our family over the Bank Holiday weekend in May. We absolutely loved a welcome surprise in the room and an elephant made of towels. Everyone was very attentive and friendly. We had an amazing lunch in the restaurant. Thank you Chef for a delicious vegetarian burger. Everyone must try it!

We booked 2 rooms. Rooms are clean. Beds are comfy. Wonderful breakfast. Easy access ( 10 minutes walk )to London tube ( train station). All the employees are friendly and helpful. Especially receptionist, Francisca, Zanett, Ana , Seymour & Daniela ( pardon me if I spell any of the name incorrectly). On the 1st day, hotel was full & we didn’t get our rooms on the same level. But on the 2nd day morning I came down to the reception desk around 9 am talked to receptionist Francisca to get our rooms on the same level and I was told they’ll try their best because hotel is pretty full . But she asked me to pack our luggage and leave it ready so that they can move once any rooms available on same floor. I honestly didn’t have high expectation to get new rooms on same floor since the hotel was busy as well as all the employees. However, Francisca and her team got it done my request before noon and switched to 2 new rooms on the same floor even though they were busy. Employees from Holiday inn London West 4 Portal Way , Acton are really awesome and amazing. Francisca and above team members do really take care of their customers. I give 5 stars for their customer service!!!

Just had a great stay. 2 rooms booked. Very clean comfortable. Staff were lovely very helpful. Parking good easy. Would stay here again. Easy access into London. Hotel arranged taxis to and from event at Wembley. Couldn't have been more helpful.

the employees were very welcoming and friendly and extremley efficant the room was brilliant had lovely veiw from window bathroom was amazing layout of room was very open bright and light fekt very warm and charming :)

Firstly, cordial staff with a clean and tidy surrounding. Crazy amount of parking space and pretty good rooms with amenities. A five star it would have been had i liked the food much. Good feels though.

We have used this hotel 5 times over the past 2 months as I needed treatment at the Hammersmith Hospital. Parking is easy, rooms well kept and clean. Food is good and there is plenty of space in the coffee bar, bar/restaurant.However what makes this a gem of a find is the staff. Professional, friendly and always ready to help. If there has been a slight blip (On first stay the tv did not work we were moved rooms immediately without question) it has been resolved quickly and with good humour. Strangers at first to the area the desk staff went out of their way to help us find appropriate transport and explained how paying on London transport works. The surrounding area is under development but no way should this deter people who want a base to explore London. 3 min walk to underground station and 1 minute walk to the bus stop.Feel at home here guys - thank you.

Booked Acton since the Wembley hotel was well overpriced for the FA cup final night.I was very pleasantly surprised. Check in was very friendly and we were able to check in very early. We were given drinks vouchers due to our membership without having to ask.Our room was on the 7th floor. Nice, clean and airy with a lovely view of London! Good amenities too. We had none of the noise issues I’ve read about.I was disappointed with the GF options at dinner. I was given a sheet with the only options available the sauces, mixed vegetables, fruit salad or vegetable chilli. I asked the waiter why I couldn’t have a steak and baked potato but he said they had to be fried. Didn’t understand so I settled with a fruit salad. There are notices around about asking but I don’t think the staff are trained.Ilona looked after us at the bar and breakfast the following morning. She really is a lovely helpful member of staff and I hope you recognise her for me.Breakfast was better than Wembley by far. GF bread was brought promptly and there was plenty of options I could eat.If dinner had been better I would have given 5* but this should be worked on please!

We had a great stay at The Holiday Inn in Acton. The location was great with close links to the local tube station. The hotel was lovely and the staff were great and very helpful, kind and considerate. Nothing was too much trouble. Our room was lovely, well presented and very clean. We would definitely visit again and recommend the hotel to anyone looking for an affordable hotel in west London.

We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and can say affirmatively that it is a great hotel. The executive rooms are spacious, the bed is very comfortable, the staff are very friendly and most of all the breakfast is awesome. We will always stay here whenever we visit London.

Fantastic welcome from the front desk, went to my room which i was upgraded, to my surprise the mirror was decorated with Tottenham Hotspur FC going round the outside of the mirror and the famous Cockerel in the middle, fantastic touch from the staff as they new i was a spurs fan from my hotel profile.Certainly a great start to our stay.But the hotel is not just about that lovely gesture.Bedroom was lovely and comfortable, bathroom very clean, shower worked very well.Service from all the staff was excellent

I have been staying here with work since 2015 on and off the service generally has been excellent since this time with a few blips along the way but that’s to be expected. This weekend went with my partner and kids and the staff went out of there way to make the stay perfect. Special thanks to manager Ben who made the stay very easy as I messed about with different booking nothing was to much trouble. Left poor review earlier this month but was having bad week in general so left poor review out of frustration but have deleted this now due to the work and effort put in by all staff at hotel. Thanks

Stayed here for 2 nights, the hotel was easy to access and a very short walk to tube station. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was fantastic, very clean and a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was hot and delicious. I would definitely stay here again.

stayed here a few times since the full renovation , excellent location , amenities and service at a very competitive London price .I would recommend it without hesitation , check in is swift and the bar is a pleasant place to be for food and a drink , restaurant has a good menu which has recently been updated

Really enjoyed my stay, the night team on reception were really helpful and anything I needed they were quick to respond and did so in a cheerful manner, they are all outgoing individuals and really friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here just one night. Very smooth check-in. I was upgraded to one of the executive rooms on the first floor and it was excellent. Clean, modern, quiet and very comfortable bed. The bar overlooking the busy A40 was modern and comfortable. Sky sports too. Decided to have breakfast the next day and it was good as well..

We visited this hotel at the start of the month and before I arrived I spoke to a gentleman called Rashid over the phone. I was nervous as it was my anniversary and I wanted it perfect for the Mrs. I explained my needs and he said not too worry Ill take care of it personally. He had the room arranged amazingly for us. Honestly I've stayed in a lot of holiday inns but Rashid really made this one special. I hope he sees this. Thank you again Rashid.

Just got back from a weekend stay. First big thanks to Ben Douglas the duty manager who helped us with anything we needed doing including the car park as we were late back from Wembley. Had something to eat both nights and food and service very good. Got upgraded to executive rooms which were lovely and very clean. Can’t fault the stay from start to finish

This is a great hotel that is convenient to North Acton station on the London Underground system, only a seven-minute walk from the hotel. I was very impressed with this hotel's amenities, the bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. There was even a small fridge, which most UK hotel rooms do not have. An HDMI input was easily reachable on the side of the TV, making plugging in a laptop easy and convenient. Lots of USB charging points in the room too. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. I would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to use it again.

Use this venue a lot for a training needs. Rooms and facilities average to above average - Skyline room definiely the best. It is the people that make it though. Dan our dailly conference contact is an absolute star and in the 20 years of touring venues, definitely the best I have met. Will always make sure eveything is spot on, nothing is too much trouble and puts on those little flourishes on the service that shows he genuinely cares! A credit to the business.

We stayed on Friday last on a bed and breakfast basis and were given an upgrade to an executive room on the second floor. We were looking for a Hotel at reasonable prices and easy access to Central London. The room was spacious, clean and finished to a high standard of decoration with en suite bathroom with a bath and separate shower. Free wi-fi is provided throughout the Hotel. There are tea and coffee making facilities in the room and TV. We opted for an additional English Breakfast, it was an additional £18 for a high quality self service with a lot of choice including fruit, cereals toast and continental choices. Parking at the Hotel is an additional £15 per day.The Hotel is located in North Acton and we a little trouble navigating to the rear of the Hotel as it is busy one way roads outside. It is however a 4-5 minute walk to North Acton underground station on the Central line. Change at Notting Hill Gate for the Central line and Central London. A 30-40 minute journey dependent on service. The staff are professional and friendly. We ate dinner at the Hotel which again was good quality food at reasonable prices for London.

We had a large group of high school chorus kids performing in London and spent two nights at the hotel. Cannot say enough about how well we were taken care of-the staff went above and beyond to make our group happy. The food was excellent-try the waffle with Nutella-you won’t be sorry! The hotel is clean and spacious and is more than equipped to handle large groups. Thank you for the excellent customer service.

The hotel is very clean, the staff were all very welcoming and friendly. We had an executive double room which was lovely with tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was large with a separate bath and shower. The room was very clean and tidy. Free wifi throughout the hotel. Parking was on site for £15 per day. The underground was a 5 minute walk from the hotel and took approx 30 mins to get to westminster. The restaurant was nice and the food was nice ,will definately satay again.

Having stayed at this hotel for business purposes in the past , I decided that I would take my partner with me for along weekend.We were not disappointed with the fantastic service from booking in from the staff at check in. They were polite and very welcoming to us and couldn’t do enough for us and made us very welcome.The room was most excellent as we stayed in the executive suite. The room was very clean and welcome with a choice of pillows to choose from, the bed was large enough for three,if required..! The bathroom was also clean with lots of body wash and hair products to keep you fresh and clean. The towels were nice and clean and fresh and made of quality cotton and not some cheap materials.The view from the room overlooked west London and you see central London from a distance, not bad considering the hotel is located next to the A40 into central London. We didn’t eat in the restaurant as we were going out to meet friends in London, but I’ve had a meal in the restaurant before and it was good food. The breakfast in the morning was also very good, with plenty of options from a full English to a continental breakfast and lots of fresh fruit and cereals.Transport links are plentiful too with North Acton tube station a 5 min walk from the the hotel which will take you straight into central London or you can walk to Acton Mainline Railway station and take a train into London Paddington or you could go west to towards Slough and Reading.Overall a great stay and will definitely be staying there again on my next visit to London .Great staff and service, thank you and see you soon.

I would just like to say that Erika and Rashid helped me out with lovely customer service they were excellent and really polite and very fanatic hostpitaly With care and a drink on the house really respectful people Thank you so much From hudaifah abdulkader

I would just like to say I’m not the person to leave reviews however I have to credit Rashid who is a manger at the hotel as well as Erika for the amazing help we were given. Rashid was so professional and generous at the reception making my stay ten times better. I’ve never come across a member of staff at a hotel so eager to know how my days been or what I need help with. Thank you so much for making my stay amazing and allocating me to a room that matched every need. Will definitely be back soon thanks to you! :))

Great rooms, reasonably priced, very comfortable bed, modern style hotel, easy reach of Wembley Stadium and other attractions, friendly and very helpful staff, good breakfast with a wide choice of both hot and cold food, on-site car parking for a reasonable fee, I have nothing but compliments for the staff and hotel.I highly recommend staying at this hotel if you are visiting London, you will not be disappointed. I will certainly be returning,

Having stayed at this hotel several times over the past few months, I have been impressed.the check in staff are very helpful and welcome you with a warm smile.from checkin to checkout cannot fault anyone.Niall Sinasi Sam Ben and Ziggy to name a few are a credit to this hotel very helpful and really do go the extra mile.The rooms are top standard and the Wi-Fi is great.Breakfast is self service with good choice. Evening meals in the restaurant are good with daily specials.the gym on 7th floor is small but has everything you need with GREAT views.The hotel is very close to the North Acton underground station 5 min walk perfect for those exploring London.thank you to all the staff for making my stay enjoyable,I highly recommend this hotel

I have been coming here now for over a year for business. The hotel is suitably located with only a short walk to the tube for central London. The staff are welcoming and nothing is too much trouble, quick and polite service is always at the for front of all the staff. The Guest Service manager, Paula Pinte is always there to assist in any matters that arise and need attention. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a relaxing stay for business or pleasure.

Friendly, helpful and well appointed - the Holiday Inn London West has a fabulous team running it. Sinasi in the restaurant was particularly helpful - really going the extra mile for our group. He even found a meeting room for our High school seniors and really made my job so much easier. A massive thank you to all the staff at this well run hotel

Young impeccable lady I think her name is Lima Went beyond to make my stay comfortable and with ease. I had a few bad stays previously due to noisy corridors and not being able to get an upgraded room as a spire member. Lima found me an executive room on the quiet side and looked after me after by providing a fruit hamper for the inconvenience caused by the previous stays. She went beyond to see to me having a pleasant stay. Fantastic customer service, very polite and well spoken although some of the lady receptionist do need to work on command of english.

Booked here through last minute secret hotels.. wasn’t disappointed to find out it was a holiday inn! - having booked in to find out the secret hotel was only a twin room, the hotel easily sorted this and upgraded us to an executive king room which was a nice touch! The location was superb as was the cleanliness and contents of the room.

Booked this hotel because I couldn't get one nearer central London at a reasonable price. Actually, really pleased I went to this hotel rather than a central London one. This hotel is on the tube, at North Acton. About 7 minutes walk from the tube station. On the walk there's a Sainsbury's Local and Tesco Express if, like me, you needed to get something to eat. I arrived at the hotel between 8pm and 9pm and many were in the hotel restaurant. If you don't want to eat there, nor something from one of the supermarkets nearby, there's a huge Macdonald's across the road from the hotel.On arrival at the hotel, the reception staff couldn't have been more helpful if they'd tried. They even offered me a Kit Kat choc bar, as I must have seemed very tired from that day's work and travel.My room was big. If I was into cruelty, it was more than big enough to swing a cat. The room and bathroom was clean. In the bathroom there was a wet room shower, which was great. I was on the 1st floor, the same floor at the meeting/conference rooms and executive suites, it was quiet all night.The big double bed had clean bedding and was very comfy.Breakfast was included. It was a help yourself type. All the usual choices.The down side of staying at this hotel? The fact that I was only staying one night!
