Room key left in switch from previous guest so door wouldn't open when I was checking in. Staff very friendly and apologetic, specially Miss Erika in reception. The pizza I had at the restaurant was a very soggy and drippy.Got lucky with the weather and the sunlight at the hotel was really nice.

We were using the hotel conference rooms and also staying. We have been traveling during our sales season all over the country for the last 4 weeks and stayed at many different hotels however this one really exceeded our expectations for customer service. From the minute we arrived the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We had a van to unload and although car park gets quite busy we were able to unload easily into the 1st floor conference room mayfair. The room was ready for us and cleaned daily during the stay with water and cups etc refreshed without having to ask and any member of staff we met be it from house keeping to reception always smilled and greeted us. A very ample breakfast and very clean and tidy around all aspect of what is a busy hotel. Any question or query we had was met with a friendly and efficent manner. We had several visitors at the hotel and there needs were also well catered for. It is very near the busy A40 but for ease of getting into or out of London it is very well placed with a tube line nearby. Also to have a car park with easy access despite the current roadworks and not a ridiculous daily rate. As the rooms are elevated above ground level. and well sound proofed so you are not aware of the road.

Having lived here for nearly 3 years on and off I had the pleasure of my first night with Brooke on the bar with Tomas. Tomas his usual brilliant self but Brooke was a great addition to the bar ... great service all week

Our stay was amazing. Francesca was so sweet and accommodating. They had beautiful swans on our bed for the celebration of our anniversary. They kept water in our frig and when we left out converter they gave us one on borrow. We were about 7 minutes walk from the North Action tube station! The rooms were clean and bigger than expected! Beds were comfy and pillows you want to take home. There is a Tesca store, subway, domino's pizza, McDonald's and coffee shop all in walking distance. Great staff all around! I would recommend and stay again!! Thank you again

Stayed here for two night. Checked in by Zsanett and she upgraded me to the executive room (723). Room is big and modern and the view is great. Staff are friendly. The hotel is 10 minutes walking distance from North Acton station. Thank you for the upgrade Zsanett and I definitely will be back!!

Amazing services, very professional staff, one of the best Guest Service Manager that I meet in any Hotel Miss Paula Pinte, thank you to the entire Holiday INN Team. I've been there for a few days everything was just perfect.

I’ve been here for 8 nights and should’ve actually went home. Unfortunately, work didn’t go as planned today, so after having checked out this morning, I checked back in again tonight.Upon walking back in the hotel, a young lady called Paula spotted me and said “shouldn’t you have gone home?”.Now that’s quite nice that a member of staff realises you shouldn’t be here, in a good way. So it’s nice to be nice and I think Paula deserves a mention, as she is always helpful.Hotel ideally located for getting to / from centre and my two downsides are; parking can be a bit a pain at times, as can the noise off the A40.

What a lovely hotel . They have really tried with added extras ,fancy teas and coffees and toiletries. Nice staff that can’t do enough for you. Great location near tube . Welcome change from the usual chain hotels. Will come again .

The front desk staff at this hotel made a real difference to our stay - Benjamin and Anais. They went out of their way to make our stay a very memorable one (help with printing travel tickets, booking cab, additional information on attractions). They were very welcoming and friendly which made our visit a very pleasant experience. The hotel was close to the train station and kept very clean. Would definitely visit again and recommend to friends visiting the area!

The hotel needs urgentst regular maintenance afterparty its restoratian to comply with the discription and pictures mentionned on their website.Location was ok, very close to metrostation. We chose this hotel based upon the good comments and scores by previous guests, however it didn’t reflect the reality at all !?! We wonder who posted those mails.

My wife and I stayed 1 night for a Wembley concert and boy were we lucky to find 55. On check in the place was very smartly presented, very classy. The staff were amazing, nothing was too much trouble and very attentive.The room 201 was great but after a couple of minutes we were given an unexpected upgrade to 207. Very large very comfortable bed in a spacious, spotless room with huge Trv, coffee machine and complimentary water, tea and coffee. A beautiful garden compliments the hotel that I would term as an Oasis in a concrete jungle. The only picky point was the minibar prices, £7.40 for a £2 bottle of wine. But hey ho there's a supermarket outside. All in all great vfm and very enjoyable.Thanks 55 see you again.

Cracking room with kitchen facilities, smart contemporary furnishings and wee outdoor seated area a bonus. Staff encountered were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was delicious. Would stay again for sure. Handy location for Wembley. Uber only £15, hassle free.

Stayed here with my friend as we were going to a concert. Lovely hotel, very clean, great space and the lower was amazing! The only reason why it wasn't a 5 because it was quite cold and the blankets were quite thin, a fluffy blanket or throw would have been a great addition. Also more milk in the fridge please. Check out time was perfect!

We stayed at the hotel after our Airbnb fell through. It was lovely and very reasonably priced hotel which is close to transport links. Don't eat at the nearby pub The Greystoke as it was very poor and not worth the money

We've just returned from our latest trip to London and, as usual, stayed in Hotel 55. Benjamin and the team are such a nice bunch and are genuinely interested in their guests. Because we're regulars, we were upgraded to a garden suite which was such a nice gesture. The hotel is spotless and the rooms are very nice. I'd suggest asking for a Garden Room, if possible, as it's nice and quiet. The hotel is very conveniently located. North Ealing tube is minutes away and only a 10 mins walk to Ealing Broadway. There's a nice Italian and Indian restaurant as well as a pub within a minutes walk of the hotel so all in all Hotel 55 is a real gem.

I loved my stay at this hotel - great staff and a really nice room. It was a very peaceful and quite location, with some shops nearby. I only had a one night stay, to be closer to Heathrow for an early start, and it was perfect.

Hotel 55 is a little gem of a hotel ..it 30 minutes on the tube to central London .the tube station is just around the corner.the hotel is clean and very welcoming . The staff couldn't help us enough .we had a garden room , which was peaceful .we will be going back thank you so much

Fabulous small hotel. Rooms aren't huge but that wasn't expected in an older building like this. Shower pressure is amazing and so is the service. Mike at the front desk is the best and Jan puts forth an amazing Continental breakfast each day. I can't say enough about how much I like this place. Parking is limited, so plan accordingly. But don't miss this place. Very reasonably priced and very much a more homey and intimate experience than a large hotel. I stayed 2 days but would have loved to stay longer. A+

So happy to have found this gem of a hotel. I searched for weeks trying to find a nice hotel with parking and near a tube station and this one definitely ticked all the boxes. Me and my partner stayed here on the 30th March 2019 and loved it, I originally booked a street view room but as it was my fiancé’s 21st birthday I emailed the hotel asking whether I would be able to upgrade.Benjamin was lovely and said that he would leave a note on our reservation for a nice room - so we got there and were put into a garden view room which was lovely.As they knew it was my partners birthday they left a little note in the room and also gave him two bottles of Prosecco and a plate of grapes, strawberries and chocolate - which was a lovely gesture.The hotel is by North Ealing tube station but as Ealing Broadway station was only about a 10 minute walk away, me and my partner used that one because it’s a central line. I’m always a bit wary of walking around anywhere at night but Ealing is such a lovely place, I felt very safe walking to and from the station/hotel at night. When we come back to London we will definitely be booking this hotel again.

Stayed 2 nights in a garden room.Booked due to availability of parking and proximity to Nth Ealing tube.Rooms are really well appointed and small touches such as bottled water, wine and coffee making machine really differentiate Hotel 55 from the more well known chain hotels.Breakfast is excellent and staff very friendly and welcoming Definitely book again

Stayed as a family of two adults and two small children in room 009 which is a suite. It's London so the rooms are not massive but they have been clever with the space and lighting in the rooms. There are very nice l'occitane products which is a nice touch. The room had a small kitchen area in it and owing to the young age of the kids we just bought some milk and honey nut cornflakes in the shop which was less than a minutes walk away.The tube is only a minute or so away and is an easy journey into London on the picadilly line which takes about 20 minutes to reach the centre. The hotel has about five parking spaces but they were pretty much in use the entire time. We just parked the car in the middle, unloaded it and then drove around the corner for free weekend parking. (turn left and then left again at the Italian restaurant and that road has loads of parking)We didn't see many staff when we were there but we didn't have any problems with our stay. We would consider staying again if going got another weekend away here.

Stayed here for a couple of nights as we always enjoy London.The Hotel is quite well located, close to Heathrow airport, from where we flew off and fairly easy to get into the centre by underground. Staff were nice at reception, breakfast offers a wide variety, suitable for vegan as well, as I'm vegan.Room was nice and spacious, the street facing room was absolutely fine, wasn't noisy at all.When in London, we are going to stay here for sure to try the Japanese restaurant on site.

We stayed here for 2 nights for the weekend with our teenage son for a London trip.We had 2 rooms, neither of which looked much like the hotel website rooms but were perfectly adequate.Beds were comfy and rooms nice and quiet at night.Downsides were no milk provided for with tea/ coffee facilities, very sung bathroom and no plug socket near the mirror for my wife to dry her hair. We ate breakfast both mornings and that was adequate although service could have been a little more welcoming ( no explanation to help yourself to continental breakfast or any offer of cooked breakfast- we had to ask). Despite this location is great - station into London right behind the hotel and taking 20- 25 minutes.

Had to find an affordable Hotel in London for the night and so many are sooo expensive in London - so I opted for the Hotel 55 as it was so much more affordable than Zone 1 that's for sure! The Tube (North Ealing) is just a 2 minute stroll away and it is only a 25 - 30 minute ride into the centre. Check-in was a breeze and the welcome was really down to earth and friendly. The Hotel has no lift, but I only had a ruck sack, but the nice thing was I was still asked if I needed a hand with my luggage. My room was of a 4 Star Standard and I slept amazingly well! Plenty of hot water in the morning was great from the power shower - which I could of stayed under all day!.lol... Free Wifi was a bonus and the signal was great. Free Bottled of Water was great to glug and Nespresso Machine was a nice touch too! The Complimentary Continental Breakfast (as I booked direct) was sufficient and filled me up for the morning as it was buffet style - so help yourself was great! The public areas were great - I imagine the garden and its terrace is lovely in the Summer, but the lounge area and its "library" feel is very relaxing. All in all I will be definitely booking as the price was great and the Tube is just £2.80 into the City after 9.30 am! The Staff definitely make the Hotel too..Everyone was so down to earth, no heirs or graces like the big hotel chains..Customer Service skills are to be commended to be honest! I will be back and book again direct because of the free continental breakfast - I love the word free!..Thank you!!

My husband booked this as a present as I'd wanted to visit London. The staff was really helpful and friendly and we had a nice bottle of prosecco and a note from the manager in our room. We will be returning to this hotel, all of the staff are excellent, the breakfast, bar, restaurants, location, and rooms are wonderful.

I stayed here last night. I thought it was ideal until the shower this morning, soo photo. Shower heads need a serious clean. Other than than it was quiet and present. Staff friendly and convenient location.

Booked this hotel for a business trip as location was close to meeting. Price was reasonable, particularly for London. Most surprised at the high quality of the place. It was a cold day and the staff had really warmed the room up in preparation. Beautiful décor and furnishings throughout the hotel including corridors. Added bonus of an in-house Japanese restaurant. All staff helpful too. My colleague that stayed was also suitably impressed.

We had a great week at this nice hotel in West London. Close to the underground. Not far from both the Piccadilly line and central line. Also a lot of cozy pubs and cafes in the area. About 30 minutes with the underground to get to the core of London city.

We had a three-day getaway in London had an amazing time at Hotel 55.I loved the Little room we got at the back of the garden ,really had a unique feel, I often forgot we were in London it was peaceful and quiet.Breakfast was nice, well located, in 20 mins we got to the centre and the surroundings offer good dining options not in the mood for Japanese.Will definitely return, the staff is awesome, never tired or busy enough to help with whatever we asked for.

That is the best hotel i have ever visited.I really enjoyed the comfortable bed and the coffee machine in my room. The breakfast was very nice and the whole place looked beautifull.I will definitely stay here again.P

All in all, a nice hotel, with lovely but small rooms, friendly staff and an upmarket feel. A powerful shower is great in the morning, but my room being on the second floor did tax my knees a little, no lift. I liked the nice touches like a fridge in the room, but the fancy nespresso coffee machine with nothing to use in it confused me. Had to go and ask for normal teabags too, had every type but. The continental breakfast is pretty basic, but adequate for people who want a bowl of cereal and some toast, or fruit. The biggest thing for me was the parking. I was staying the whole week, and not once did I get parked in front of the hotel. It was a case of the station car park or finding one on the street in between permit times. After a day at work, car park roulette wasn't my idea of fun. I was booked for the following week, but cancelled mainly because of that. Great place for a cpl nights, and meters from the local underground, its great for a break, but as a weeks base for work, not so much. I didn't sample the Japanese restaurant on the site, not really partial to that cuisine.

Stayed here with my wife and a couple of friends. The welcome was very friendly, rooms were clean and well equipped. The room was quiet, despite the hotel's location on Hanger Lane. We didn't eat at the Japanese restaurant as we were going out, but we had breakfast the following day which was good. Although the hotel has only limited parking there's a cheap cark park nearby. Can certainly recommend this hotel.

A friend of mine advised me to stay in this hotel for my business trip. I was not disappointed at all The staff was helpful and engaging and the minimalist boutique design is just stunning.My personal favorite was the coffee machine in the room and the chia pudding option for breakfast. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to London.

This is a real find I will definitely be returning to. Conveniently located only one minute walk to North Ealing tube, this hotel is beautifully designed, comfortable, exceptionally clean and well equipped and the best, most warm friendly and efficient service I have experienced all year - I’m really fussy and I travel a lot for business all over the uk. Once inside you don’t remember you’re staying on such a busy road! Great value. Thank you Michai Chisca and your team.

My family have stayed in hotels all over the world, and this amazing place has impressed us all. I initially booked only due to location, walking distance from my daughter. Having two elderly parents, who had just flown in from America, we had many complicated requests, which were all met with smiles. The decor was beautiful, the water pressure better then at home, toiletries luxurious and plentiful, the breakfast fresh and delicious. But the best thing was the staff. Friendly, courteous and constantly striving to go above and beyond. This is not your average budget hotel, and no I’m not a friend of there’s lol.

Had a very nice stay during my visit to London. Staff were nice and the rooms is comfortable. Cannot complain, loved the huge shower. Car parking is limited, however there is a large car park only two minutes walk away. Really important to me to have reliable wifi connection and Hotel 55 did not let me down.I would recommend 203, it was a lovely spacious room with a back facing window so I had a good sleep.

Great hotel, friendly staff, great food. Room was small but perfect for our needs. Eat in the Japanese restaurant and the food was excellent and discounted for hotel guests. Had a fantastic 2 nights and would book again.

Came here for an overnighter, was well received and efficiently given my card to my room, there is only 4 maybe 5 car parking places at the front of the hotel, I believe there is some around the back end of the hotel but not sure. Room was cosy Air Con was switched off, I switched on to get some air and even tho it was on 18 it was blowing really warm, so I switched off and opened a window. Obviously that let in traffic noise as it’s right on the main road. The tube is literally 2 mins away. If you need somewhere to park on a weekend the stations car park is only 2 quid all day Saturday and I think Sunday. It’s just past the hotel and turn right, then it’s slightly to the right I think. Hotel was good a bit pricey for what it was but it’s location mainly, I didn’t eat there so can’t tell you about momo the Japanese restaurant. The tea, coffee and water where free in the room so extra bonus for serving fruit tea too. All in all I would go again especially if you want to visit London.

I stayed here for the night as it is very near my daughter's new home. I was lucky enough to get one of the very few parking spaces outside the hotel but I was told there was plenty of free parking in the road behind the hotel or paid parking at the car park at the tube station.The tube was less than five minutes walk from the hotel (Piccadilly Line) and only 30 minutes ride to central London.My room (007) was pretty small but fine for me, comfortable bed, nice coffee maker and a great shower (again the bathroom was small but adequate).Front desk staff were all helpful and friendly.The only problem was that the corridor outside my room (on the ground floor) was bitterly cold as the outside door was kept propped open and this cold air got into my room. Sound proofing wasn't brilliant but it didn't bother me, a child crying in the room next door woke me up a number of times (not the hotel's fault I completely understand) and I could also easily hear the shower in the room above.Having said that I would certainly stay here again and would recommend.

I got to this hotel late in the evening after the restaurant was closed, and the really terrific front desk guy grabbed me a yogurt parfait from the back fridge. The staff were all super.Be aware that there is no lift in the hotel. It's only two floors, but with a lot of luggage, this could be an issue. A bigger issue for me was the size of my room. There was literally no room for a suitcase - the bed took up the entire room with only a sliver of space in between the bed and the wardrobe and on the other side, the bed and the window. I had to roll across the bed to get from one side of the room to the other! I basically had to keep my (roll-aboard) suitcase closed and in the bathroom, which was equally tiny.I think there are larger rooms but apparently they were in noisier parts of the hotel. It was clean, cool, and quiet (although my window faced some sort of walkway with very bright lights on late into the night) - and I don't mind tiny - but no place to walk in the room, much less work out of it if needed. Nice breakfast in the morning, and a short walk to several lovely restaurants as well.

I stayed here for a single night due to working in the area. It made a great change to the routine of chain hotels (which made up most of the others on offer in the surrounding area). I walked from the Tube station (North Ealing) - it’s no more than five minutes to walk and the hotel was easy to find.At check-in I was greeted by a friendly staff member who was keen to make sure I had everything I needed both for my stay and also for my departure (he wanted to be sure that I knew there would be tube strikes that could get in the way of my travel plans the following day).The room I had was fairly snug, not too small but it could probably be better laid-out for space (there wasn’t a desk, just a narrow dressing table that was already full with coffee machine, kettle, glasses, mugs, tea/coffee). As I was travelling for work a better space for setting up my laptop would have been helpful.At check-in I was warned that the TV reception was poor (they were awaiting an engineer) but the WiFi was working so I didn’t miss not having a good TV service.The room is obviously not newly decorated, but still in reasonable condition, and the decor is modern and well considered.The shower room was adequate, again not spacious, but not the smallest I have encountered.It was noticeable that I could hear other guests (in particular in the corridor outside my room) but it wasn’t sustained throughout the evening/night.Breakfast the following morning was good, a nice selection of cereals, pastries, fruits, yogurt etc.

Stayed here for the weekend of the challenge cup game at Wembley. Bus goes from outside the hotel straight to the stadium so really handy but also easy to walk - about 35 mins & we did this coming back. Hotel room was small but clean, comfy bed & well equipped with water & nice coffee machine. We were in Room 7 ground floor & it was a bit noisy during the night with other hotel guests coming & going & sound of TV in the room next door but to be expected in a small hotel. We parked on Ealing station car park behind the hotel Saturday morning until Sunday lunch £3.90 so great for London & found a lovely little Italian right behind the hotel where we ate on the Saturday evening. All in all a nice stay. The hotel itself has a small front - room for 4/5 cars only. Pictures on website is a bit deceiving & was full all the time we were there! Plenty parking behind the hotel.

Beware , the Rooms are small, Very small. Staff is polite, but they cant help change the room.The marketing was misleading, may lead you to think otherwise. This property is a old house which has been badly modernised.??Issue is that the description could be better. ?? I booked a family room as we had our 11 year old child , we were told family room is available. And that there is free parking.??When I reached there I realised the house ( sorry hotel ) oh !! Sorry the house .. had 4 parking bays for 28 guests..so I went hunting road side parking .??The family room was a small converted ATIC and the SO CALLED GARDEN view was a view of a half grass patch !! And yes while you can shuffle from point A to Point B in the room, in the bathroom you would be lucky to move you hand to brush your teeth.??The only saving grace, it was clean. ??And yes the continental cold breakfast was NOT arranged properly for humans and the flies that were tasting the food made me get up hungry.??So try at your risk.??One good thing worth mentioning though is that the staff was polite and smiling. The breakfast was not impressive.

Our usual London haunt was booked out for last weekend so I googled "hotels close to Ealing Broadway" and up popped Hotel 55. The reviews were mainly very good so we took a chance and we are so glad we did. The hotel couldn't be in a better location for exploring London. North Ealing tube station is literally 2 minutes walk away. For all you theatre lovers, you can get straight into Leicester Square from there within approx 30 mins. Coming from Heathrow Airport, take the Picadilly Line tube to Acton Town and continue on the Picadilly Line to North Ealing (that line branches out but doesn't go directly to North Ealing). Ealing Broadway village is only 10 minutes walk away, where there are loads of shops and restaurants to check out. Now, back to the hotel! The hotel is spotless and is more than a 3 star to be honest. It's immaculate. Our room was small but had everything we needed. Bottled water and L'Occitane products are standard in the room so no need to drag bottles of shower gel and shampoo/conditioner with you as the stuff is lovely! The staff are very nice and friendly and happy to help/provide information about getting around London etc. We've already booked a trip back for October and can't wait! Many thanks Hotel 55 and see you soon!!! :)

This time last year our son moved to London for his year out. I booked to stay in Hotel 55 as it was near to where he moved. I was so impressed that my husband and I went back this year when visiting our son. The hotel is small which gives it a family friendliness which is lacking in bigger chains. It is spotlessly clean and the rooms have everything for a short stay. The restaurant is Japanese and very good quality. The staff are all very friendly and accommodating. It is close to a couple of different tube stations and within walking distance of Ealing town centre. I highly recommend Hotel 55.

We stayed one night in June to visit central London. We chose this hotel due to needing free parking (although is very limited so would confirm and arrive early to secure a spot) and it’s location being extremely close to the metro and in a safe area. This boutique hotel is refurbished to a lovely modern style and our room was lovely with nice clean and shiny shower En-Suite. I must admit I didn’t have the best night sleep due to street noise, too much street/ neighbors lights through the windows (even with blinds down) and a door kept banging shut (perhaps the reception door to the stairs? As we were on the first floor) throughout the night and guests arriving during the early hours... I’m a light sleeper but it didn’t bother my husband, perhaps a room on a higher floor would be quieter. The North Ealing tube station is literally a 2 minute walk around the corner making it very easy to get in and out of central London. Would recommend this hotel for style and convenience, but I’d choose a different room next time.

Stayed here for Ed Sheeran concert .. booked this months ago. Emailed hotel advising that my daughter has Blue Badge & could we have a space outside. No reply so when we arrived we saw the outside parking of approx 4 cars was full so had to park at the Tube Station. Man on reception when we checked in didn’t seem bothered & said although we could park in front of hotel & leave the keys .. he couldn’t drive so that was pointless. I explained how worried I was about leaving car in tube car park with blue badge but he offered no othe.Found our room 110 .. although it was a modern clean room .. it was so small .. everything was miniature! It was a double room with garden view but the view was over some outbuilding then into the garden! There was one chair .. nowhere to put anything & the bathroom was equally small .. it was so claustrophobic that we couldn’t wait to leave the next day.We usually use the Holiday Inn at Wembley but it was full .. for £98 for this hotel I’d definitely look elsewhere as it’s not worth the money.We won’t be returning.

We used this hotel due to going to a concert at Wembely, The staff were lovely and helpful. The rooms are nice and spacious as well as a very comfy bed.We did have a room overlooking the road and didn't hear the noise from the road except for the occasional siren but that is understandable. Breakfast was really good , would be able to have something even if you didn't like certain things. The brilliance of this hotel is that the tube is just round the corner so even though it's not far out of the centre it's easy to get to the centre or even Wembley. Will definitely be using this hotel again.

We stayed here on Friday night as we were going to a concert at Wembley. The hotel is modern, clean and chic. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We booked a ‘Garden Room ‘ for ourselves got a lovely suite! And a “Street View” room for our Son but it still looked over the rear, so very peaceful. There is a pretty, tranquil garden outside the restaurant ( which is Japanese). Breakfast was beautifully laid out and delicious, with all you could want. We will certainly use this hotel again, highly recommended.

Great hotel with excellent customer service. Ideal location for Wembley as the tube station is nearby. The room was clean and well presented,modern with good facilities. The breakfast was fresh and good quality. Definitely recommend this hotel.

My husband, son and I stayed here one night after visiting Wembley. The hotel had free parking which was a bonus. Very clean and modern hotel with a lovely restaurant on site. Mike on front desk was exceptionally helpful. Very nice staff. Rooms were tastefully decorated with some nice in room facilities such as free coffee water etc. Equipped with coffee machine, nespresso pods and bottled water. Kettle, fridge, hairdryer and iron also added to making this hotel one of the nicest we’ve ever stayed in in London. Hotel was situated minutes from train and tube station to take you directly into central London, but there was lots of nice bars and restaurants within minutes walk. Ealing Broadway is a great little shopping centre with nice high street shops and only 10 minutes walk away. A very pleasant and enjoyable stay. Will definitely be returning and recommending. Thank you once again to Mike on front desk who goes over and above his duties to make your stay the best it can be.

The hotel is in a quiet place 20min outside of London and the tube is 2minutes away!Has a great interior and our room was small but cozy and clean !Clean towels every day and bottles of water (really happy for the water!! )Yammy Breakfast !!Helpful reception Nice pub 2 minutes on foot and you can find mini markets , pharmacy and restaurants near by !I really recommend it if you are not a fun of big city noise !I am definitely going back there on my next trip !

we stayed here one night. the room is big and is very modern. we had a nespresso coffe maker in, a kettle, different variety of tea, a minibar, water is complimentary. the room has a really big tv and the bed is kingsize and very comfortable. enough socket to charge everything and free wifi. only annoying thing it kicked out of the wifi when you turn your ipad off. the room has aircon as well. the bathroom was not big but the shower had good pressure and the amenities are great. if you stay request a room away from the street. it was really loud even at night. but other then that I would stay here again. its only 15 minute walk to broadway tube station and 20 minutes to the shopping centre. opposite is a Tesco market and a shell gas station.

Really pleasant hotel with a great restaurant.We had a rear facing room which was very quiet, overlooking the garden area. The window blinds were a bit tricky but soon sorted.The room was well appointed, fresh and spacious enough. Sufficient wardrobe space for a weekend break.The bathroom was a reasonable size, with decent towels provided. The shower was pretty good too with a good water pressure and temperature.The bedroom and en suite were both very clean and well maintained.Parking is limited to 4 spaces, but the bays are a good size. Plenty of off-site parking nearby.The Japanese Restaurant for evening meals was very good and definitely worth a visit.All the staff were helpful.Overall, well worth the money.

Represent the spirit of England , Good Services and warm greeting.. Apparently provide multi languages in the reception , good recommendation for nearby community facilities and shops.. You will quite enjoy your short journey in Western London for take a break as a British as well.

We stayed for four nights, our room overlooked the right hand side of the building, we had read other reviews which had suggested the front rooms could be noisey.We were were happy with our room and had three good nights sleep.The bed was comfy and we had a selection of soft or firm pillows. There was a mini bar, coffee maker as well as a kettle and a good selection of teas. The room although and compact but well equipped with everything needed. Also a very good size TV and wifi. The continental breakfast offered a good selection of cereals, fruits, breads and pastries.There was also a selection of fruit juices teas and coffeesThere is a cooked breakfast option but we did not use it.The continental breakfast is included if you book direct with the hotel, which we had done.We would also like to praise the staff who are extremely helpful and friendly.Our trip was a special one to our daughters graduation.The hotel is ideally situated, near tube and over ground train services.We will be revisiting again and already have rebooked for our trip In March. Looking forward to our stay.

Had a weekend trip with my wife whilst helping our son move to student accommodation in Ealing. Found the accommodation on-line and the booking of it was easy. It is fairly close to Ealing Broadway shopping and tube station, and the tube into central London is just over 20 mins, so is well connected. The hotel has very nice bedrooms that are equipped as you would expect but has a lovely ambience. Very comfortable beds and a nice shower/bathroom. The rooms have minibars available along with a kettle and a selection of teas/coffees The decor is modern and appealing throughout. We did not eat in the Japanese restaurant that is connected but we did have breakfast which was a very nice continental style affair. The only real issue was the lack of parking with only 4 usable spaces available. The reception seemed to be manned 24/7 which is unusual for this size of hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for something different from a Premier Inn or similar and I will be staying there again if we end up going to that neck of the woods again.

Stayed here for 1 night NYE with my fiancé, only 4 car park spaces so had to park in the train station car park and walk round. was less than 5 mins walk so didn't mind to much. Guy on the reception was really friendly and got us checked in really quick. First impression, quirky little hotel, easy to find. nice lay out on inside. room was quite small but was enough for one night. Few things that let it down (not their fault) but it was very noisy, we got back to the room and 2:30am after seeing the fireworks, music was blasting somewhere in the hotel and could hear the traffic noise from outside.few other things, the bed was quite hard, the shower did not get hot act all, even on the hottest temperature setting it was merely over lukewarm and the flush on the toilet was broken. overall an average stay for the night, but those few things let it down, would have stayed here again otherwise

Stopped here with my trusted travelling partner, who I believe has become far more critical than me in his 9 years of travel! We gave this hotel a thumbs up, a pleasant surprise just outside Central London and no more than 2min walk to the tube station. The hotel is on a main road and if the carpark is full on road parking is available. We did not notice the noise of the main road. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. Unfortunately MOMO was closed but it is Christmas and we all need a break at some point. Would I stay here again? Yes. Decor is modern and reflected throughout the hotel not just the lobby as is often the case. We were a 10min drive from white city and with pre payment parked just off Oxford Street for £19 covering twelve hours.....cheaper than tube tickets for the whole family.

Booked the deluxe suite for one night at the weekend. The room had a double bed and a single sofa bed. A bit disappointed as I thought it would be at least a queen size bed. Mattress not very comfortable, linen not great and pillows really thin. Bathroom a good size with l’occtaine toiletries. Kitchen in the living space with 2 tv’s. Surprisingly a little garden outside. Didn’t have breakfast so can’t comment. There is a Japanese restaurant which seems busy. Complimentary water in room.

Cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Service was so polite and helpful! Lovely room, very nicely decorated with some great little extras, like the Nespresso machine, and the gorgeous toiletries.

My daughter and I stayed 2 nights in an accessible room which was made up as a twin. We couldn’t fault a thing. Great AC, really quiet, super-comfy beds, ideal location. The room was plenty big enough for two and I would recommend this type of room if you do not want to share a bed.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: The room at this hotel was very clean, the staff really kind, helpful and professional had two young men called ail & Joao that was very helpful and also made sure to let me know what was going on after an incident happened with my son in his room 1003 on the 11th not only did both of them help me out and also made sure my son was okay the next day i asked them if they new anything to do on our last day and Joao gave us a really good idea of going to the museum next to Tottenham Court road and it was amazing so thank you to you both. The location is excellent and the price is quite affordable for a hotel in central London. Highly recommend..
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Stayed one night before our early start on Eurostar. Wow what a surprise. A very small room with a huge cabin style bed and storage for suitcases. Everything was operated on a touch screen. Bathroom with walk in shower. It was all very clean. Will definitely check this out for our next visit to London. Very disappointed in the area though and the amount of litter on the streets. A disgusting sight for tourists to have to look at.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Good concept, modern, clean - phone signal is shocking so not conducive for work. Good value for money and normally centrally situated. Modern hotels not just for the young but please sort out the phone signal
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Clean, compact, very comfy bed within light, modern pod-style room. Super clean and ultra- well insulated, excellent shower/bathroom facility, sliding desk feature, large wall TV, good modern lighting system. Continental breakfast for £5/person, plus tea/coffee available within reception area. All staff very helpful and friendly.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: I stayed at the hub by premier Inn at King's Cross as I needed to attend a training course on the Euston Road. The location was ideal, the hotel is clean, modern, sleek and fantastic value for money. The hub rooms are compact but with absolutely everything you require. I had a great sleep despite being on the main road and directly across form King's Cross station. The shower room was great. loads of hot water, great pressure, free toiletries, nice big towels and two big shower heads. The £5 continental breakfast was ideal and there is free tea and coffee available 24 hours.#I would not hesitate to recommend the hub and will def use again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: We stayed for two nights the first weekend of July as we were in London for a gig at Hyde Park.First off,for a charity donation we could drop our bags before our check in time as we arrived first thing-nice touch.Our room was small but clean, comfortable, and everything was bright and modern.We were there for the weekend and only slept in the room, so we didn’t need spacious.If you want a suite, and room to sit around, you wouldn’t book a hub room.Breakfast was great for a fiver, we pre-booked it, but you can buy on the day.All you can eat too.Fresh fruit, pastries, toast etc-continental style.Nothing cooked, apart from porridge I believe.The staff were very helpful and couldn’t do enough.If you are after a good clean room in a great location, and not bothered about having somewhere to sit around in, then the Hub @KingsCross is a great option at a very good price.I’ll stay here again the next time i’m in London.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: If all you want is somewhere to park your bags and sleep this place is perfect. The rooms are compact but spotlessly clean and the service is great. No tea and coffee in the rooms but coffee machines downstairs free of charge. Breakfast is continental and a great price. All in all can’t beat it!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Perfect location to start Eurostar journey from St Pancras. Accommodation is quiet, comfortable, immaculately clean. Superb value breakfast. Limited choice of food in bar but excellent pizza restaurant next door.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Great location and excellent price for 1 night stay. Room was compact but in a great funky way. Had everything we needed...well impressed! TV needed reboot but this was resolved as soon as we contacted the hotel team.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: We were attending an event in London's Kings Cross area on a Sunday and didn't have to travel home until Monday. As the Saturday night stay at the Hub was nearly three times the price of a Sunday, we booked for Sunday and arrived early enough to have one of the Hub's breakfasts before booing in at 2pm. The all-you-can-eat breakfasts are amazing value compared with the many chains offering over-priced coffee in the surrounding area. We were also taking advantage of the abundant free on street parking in the area over the weekend but made sure we were back on the road by 8.30am on the Monday when the draconian parking fees kick in. The staff were all very helpful and the rooms immaculately clean. This was our second weekend stay at the Hub in Kings Cross. We've also found the Hub in Brick Lane to be of an equally high standard.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Stayed overnight in a bigger room,was worried about technology side of things but everything easy to work. Room and all public areas spotlessly clean, bed very comfortable and plenty of storage in room. Staff are excellent, very helpful. Breakfast was very good, plenty of choice. Very convenient for Kings Cross and getting round London. Thought I got value for money and will,stay again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Amazing accommodation, so modern and stylish. Rooms are so efficient and fulfils every need. Early check in and lovely staff besides the rude cleaner. Will DEFINITELY be retiring shortly. We love YOU premier inn hub
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Fantastic location (91/390 buses right outside and a short walk to Kings Cross / St. Pancras). Cool rooms with really nice soaps (better than main PI). Staff are REALLY friendly.... all of them even housekeeping. One of the best hotel stays I’ve had in some time. I came on Pride weekend and the decor made it even more welcoming. Thank you all!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Great 2 night break. Staff were ALL really friendly and pleasant. Hub room is compact and funky, ideal for a 2 night break. Bar / restaurant is stylish and the £5 pp buffet breakfast is brilliant !Try the Coal Yard 5 mins north for great bars and dining options that aren't really crowded.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: small room, but who stays in their hotel room on holiday? Perfect for solo - might be a little small for a couple. Clean, modern, convenient to King's Cross/St.Pancras and many the major tube lines. Breakfast convenient, really good if all you want is coffee and a quick snack before hitting the town.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Before arrival I was a bit concerned that the room would be cramped but it was so well designed that this was no problem at all. We had everything we needed and were very comfortable. Because the bed is against the wall it was a a bit difficult for one of us to get out. The staff were incredibly pleasant and helpful and the breakfast was good value. Would definitely stay there again
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Really fresh slick and friendly hotel, very close to Kings Cross station. I slept soundly even though my room was right beside the road, I couldn't hear a thing. My only criticism is that i would of loved a cooked breakfast buffet in the morning even if it was just the very basics available.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Really loved this hotel. The rooms are small but they have everything you need and are laid out so well you don’t notice. The bar restaurant area is very well decorated. All the staff were super helpful.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Would certainly recommend this hotel, staff very polite and always on hand. The location is great as it's very easy to get to major tourist sites and great for going shopping from. Cleanliness was outstanding, we can't think of one thing that is negative with this hotel
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: This is copy/pasted from my review that will go directly to the hotel:The room I was allocated (7) was far too hot and the cooling, set to 18 degrees, simply did not work. After ten mins of listening to the heat exchanger attempt to cool down I discovered only about 1cm in the top right corner was working, suggesting insufficient coolant. I note there were coolant leak detectors at floor level so the possibility and expectation of leaks must have been designed into the building. I asked to move room but the lady at reception tried to tell me the air conditioning to my room might have been off centrally. She told me to go and wait 20 mins in my room (this was around midnight). I returned as there was no cooling effort at all. She said the hotel was fully booked and I couldn't move room, nor could I try to move to a nearby Premier Inn, should one have had room. She said they were separate companies. A manager overheard the conversation and moved me to room 51. On starting the air conditioning, set to 18, within a minute gurgling was heard and slightly more of the heat exchanged became cold than in room 7 (so an improvement), but again, I suspect there was insufficient coolant present. The heat exchanger should get quite cold and wet when in operation in a warm humid environment. The room was far too hot all night. I really was not impressed with my stay and I suspect faults are now starting to appear that are not being rectified now these new-build hotels are ageing.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: This hub is accessible because of its location and price. It is fun because of its use of technology and the tongue in cheek humour of its signage and the warm attitude of the staff. Whilst everything is down to keep the price of the room and breakfast reasonable, the quality of the room and bed is not compromised.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Hub by Premier Inn hotels have always great location. I have stayed in a few in past and this one is in my opinion the best one so far along with the Westminster one. This one has great lounge chill out area and really handy location if you are visiting London and want to stay close to King Cross St. Pancras train station.I absolutely love HUBS!!!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Great stay. Clean rooms with all you need for a short stay. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Very greatful that the rooms had aircon as we stayed on a very hot weekend and it was awesome to come back to a cool room. Cannot fault the experience
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: First time we have stayed in a Premier Inn Hub and we loved it! Rooms are ingeniously designed to cater for your every need despite being compact. Immaculately clean and bed so comfortable. All you can eat continental breakfast for only £5 was incredible value and the lounge area was so pleasant and comfortable. Every member of staff we came into contact with was friendly, courteous and helpful. Cannot fault this place. Strongly recommend. Perfect location only minutes from Kings Cross. Best Premier Inn we have ever stayed in!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Compact rooms are ideal for the singletraveller. Excellent use of space and technology. Price does vary and can be expensive. Short walk from station and easy to get around. No major complaints clean room and shower with decent pressure.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: We had a one night stay here last night. At check in, we were told that 4 of our 8 rooms were not yet ready, despite it being 2.30pm (check in is 2.00pm). This meant that we had to store our luggage and change clothes in our friend's rooms until ours were available. Despite this slight setback, our stay was enjoyable. The rooms are small but ample and the bed had the usual Premier Inn super comfortable trademark. Excellent shower too.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Too much technology, not enough attention to detail. Beds shoved up against the wall so had to clamber over my wife to use the bathroom.No glasses in the room so couldn't have a quiet drinkDidn't bother with breakfast as there was nowhere to sit
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: The rooms were spotlessly clean, modern and quiet. The bed and pillows were really comfortable. Nice bar area down stairs. Conveniently located for Kings Cross.Staff friendly and speedy check in process.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: This was our first stay at Hub. If I could get a decent rate again,then I would consider staying here again. It reminded us of a Scandinavian contemporary hotel. We were impressed by the slick check in process, even if we did need a little bit of help. Our room was quiet throughout our stay despite looking out over Kings Cross station. Breakfast in the hotel was lovely and all we needed for our start to the day.Staff were pleasant, friendly efficient and very helpful which is s refreshing for the Capital. If you're expecting a large room, the this is not the hotel for you. But we loved it having stayed in something similar in Holland a few years ago. Superb
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Very compact. Lots of power outlets. Some effective use of space luke storage under the bed. Aircon that works.Breakfast was fine freshly baked pastries real orange juice. Not a long walk to the Eurostar.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: The Hub is down the street from the Premier Inn (we went to the wrong one first!); it's okay but very much a stop and drop kind of place. It isn't that handy for the tube (but you just have to walk up quite a long street), the rooms are very small and noisy (the plumbing and the air conditioning but the outside noise isn't that bad) but is big enough for one person. There is free tea and coffee but only in the lounge and you get left one bottle of water per visit (so I had one bottle to last both nights!). The staff are friendly and the breakfast (although I didn't have it) is only £5 for a cold buffet. The shower is a rainforest one and is quite large, the ensuite is a decent size. Also the hubs do not have a good night guarantee
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Easy check in, clean room I booked standard fine for one person but squeeze for two to move around in. Worth upgrade to bigger room. Very modern, no road noise or from adjoining rooms or corridor. Enough lifts. Bar great but we drank it dry though to be fair didn't warn them 40 plus attending cocktails which were fab. Breakfast good continenta but one coffee machine broke and queue for toaster. Would stay again
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Stayed for access to Eurostar and had a very good experience. Rooms are very compact but full of tech and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The bar looked great and it’s right next door to a Franco Manca and around the corner from Coal Drops Yard.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: We booked a pretty last minute girls weekend, group of 5 ladies, in London, for fab shows, drinks, shopping and more. This hotel ended up being an excellent choice! The price more than fair, the room was very bright, clean, and comfortable, and we were really happy with the location. Brilliant choice, hope to repeat!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: The hotel is well placed next to King's Cross station. The staff was very friendly and helpful overall. The hotel room is straight forward and very practical too: all the facilities are there without any extra but nothing is missing either.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Just absolutely incredible through and through. From checking in to being in the lift, had 0 problems with our keycards, found our room super easily, housekeeping staff were so helpful and accommodating (we were on -2 room 28 if you could give that floor staff member a big Thankyou), the shower is just sensational - I had the longest shower ever!!, everything was just spot on. Thankyou so so much for looking after us. We’re planning on coming back very soon and staying with you again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Stayed two nights. Great location, very clean and modern. Lovely bar/lounge area. Nice fresh continental breakfast available. Staff very friendly and helpful. Everything you need for a short stay. Would definitely use again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Would definitely be back. Rooms are clean and modern. Location is perfect! Value for the money. Customer service was the best I’ve seen thank you Joao for all the help even when it was busy he still made time to help made my morning so much easier an amazing staff member, much better than American staff you will never go wrong staying here.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: I am loathed to say how good this trip was as I may not get a room next time I am booking! Perfect for business & pleasure and cannot fault value for money, cleanliness, welcome was really lovely and the staff very friendly. I felt safe, secure and happy to be there.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Well place. Expensive for what it is as the rooms are more than basic. Careful if you are claustrophobic, especially with the rooms that below ground! Sheets do not fir the bed. Outrageous that it costs so much for a basic room and yet they cant afford big enought sheets!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Arrived with low expectations only to be blown away. From the greeting to the goodbye I can't fault this hotel. Pristinely clean, compact rooms but well thought out stylish and more than adequate. Friendly,smiley brilliant staff (big heads up to Joao, the Portuguese waiter, who was lovely). Great bar too. Fantastic value and brilliant location if you come in by train to Kings Cross. Cannot fault it.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Don't expect the Savoy. But, do expect friendly helpful staff, superb cleanliness and a wonderful continental breakfast and, a good reasonably priced bar. This was the first time I have used any hub but it won't be the last.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Cool fresh place to stay, staff professional and polite.bar area clean bright and a nice place to be.Rooms bright and modern. Bed against the wall a bit awkward but fine for two nights.Room small but expected.A big improvement to the other premier inns that have stayed in recently.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Attended a wedding locally and wanted somewhere convenient to stay. Hadn't tried a HUB but very pleasantly surprised and will certainly use them again, if possible. Very slick operation with excellent security and facilities and lots of rooms which are small but perfectly adequate for an overnight stay as we did or for a weekend away.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: We thought the Hub was brilliant.The staff couldn’t have been more helpfull, the room was great, we booked a larger room and I think that was the right thing for us to do as we are an older couple and a bed right up to the wall is no good to us, fine for a solo traveler. Would highly recommend.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: I'm a big fan of Premier Inn not because they're amazing but they are absolutely reliable and always clean and comfortable. Was a bit wary of the hub concept but after some reassurance I stayed 2 nights here and found it really good. Single room had a very large and comfortable bed, a clever pull out desk which was perfect for a laptop, and a really nice en-suite shower room. Free tea and coffee 24/7 in the bar downstairs. What more do you need? Only negative was a somewhat noisy room due to a gurgling aircon or drainage system but it didn't bother me really. Would definitely use again for business trips.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: All services great other than faulty aircon in the room. It's very loud and sounds broken. The room was very hot as we had to turn it off to try and sleep. Unfortunately we couldn't get to sleep due to the heat. We slept with no covers on and still were too hot. To top it off the aircon kept turning itself on every so often so when we managed to drift off for a second it woke us back up again so we had to keep turning it off. Room 6004. Nightmare.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: New experience and a great welcome from staff - unlike the premier inn down the road where I went by mistake. Warm, helpful. Good breakfast for the price. Good shower and hotel was in good condition. Couldn’t complain about anything had two wonderful staff members at the bar to greet me when I walked in I think there names were joão and Betina lovely smiles and very helpful could say they made my morning. So I hope I’ve said there names right because they deserve it very nice people both of them even helped with my bags when reception was so busy.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay here. It is a modern stylish setting, supported by friendly helpful staff and excellent use of technology to make your stay effortless and enjoyable. My room was immaculate and very comfortable. Breakfast was simple, fresh and delicious. I genuinely cannot rate it highly enough.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: I was welcomed by an amazingly lovely happy lady named Betina who could not be more helpful! The hotel itself is modern and really nice, with a cocktail bar next door what more could you want!! Everything is controlled by a remote and it’s free WiFi, feels so futuristic almost.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Spent one night here this week and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were small but perfectly formed. Configuration of the double bed wouldn't suit all. Checking in was different [fully automated with someone on standby if you got stuck]. Breakfast for a fiver next day was a revelation. Seemed to be popular with business people due to location and great value.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: It was easy to check in with helpful staffThe room was stylish and very comfortable The bar area was lovely and staff attentive The stay overall was brilliantThe TV had smart features and the whole room had smart featuresI cant fault our stay!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: Me and my partner really enjoyed our stay at the hub it was fantastic would highly recommend it. had a great staff member João that had a few minutes to talk to us about GOSH and convinced us to also leave the tip of five pounds that we wanted to give to him to the charity pot that they had a the bar. That was very lovely to see. for the one night u cant beat it it was perfect location so easy to get to from kings cross clean and tidy comfy bed and lovely bathroom
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London King's Cross

review_body: The room is small, but super clean and fun. It’s right next to the train station called St. James, making getting *anywhere* a breeze. Breakfast was a buffet for only 6£! What a steal!Our room was cleaned every day, minus the one we asked them not to clean. We did laundry in our room using the bathroom sink which worked great. Staff was super friendly, willing to help with any needs, adding to the overall greatness of the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel if you can manage in a bit smaller area. There’s too much to do in the city to do anything but just here sleep anyway... (You can still eat at the hotel even if you don’t stay with them. 6£ is a super affordable for what they offer - not to mention it’s all you can eat.)
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Small, but so worth it! My husband is 6’5” and he was very comfortable. The breakfast was wonderful. The reception was also great; anything we needed from extra towels to a taco was taken care of quickly and politely.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Just what we needed and exactly as described. All staff so pleasant and eager to help. Room very basic but very comfortable and enough room for one night stay. Breakfast was good and nice to have coffee on tap downstairs. Would stay in a Hub again
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. The concept is so ingenious, the rooms are tiny, but efficient, comfortable, clean, aesthetically pleasing and kind of pretty cool with all the gadgets around the bed. I was not sure what to expected but left very happy. The location is excellent, just a few minutes walk away from the Westminster Cathedral, Big Ben, St. Jame's Park and the palace. The staff was very helpful. We arrived at the hotel at 8 am, after an overnight bus trip, hoping they would keep our luggage until the check-in time, and to our surprise they told us our room was ready. Breakfast was just OK since I prefer hot breakfast options. I highly recommend this hotel for those looking for great location for the best price.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: I would definitely recommend this hotel, we had a lovely 3 days there. It's within walking distance to London Eye, Victoria Station, Houses of Parliament, Westminster Bridge. Weather you're going for a show or just to see London, it's the right place to stay.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: For our first time in London, it was overwhelming in deciding where to stay, but based on reviews, we chose this hotel and so happy we did! A truly great and most affordable stay! I will say I was a bit worried about space as my husband and I are more "Pooh" sized, but the worries were for nothing. We booked the bigger room and it was phenomenal! A place for luggage, ample storage and hangers, and the most wonderful, roomy, bed!! It was the most comfortable bed we slept in throughout our entire UK trip!! Plus with the bigger room, you are able to have access to both sides of the bed so no crawling over each other. The lounge was nice as well with complimentary coffee and tea all day/night. After a long day sightseeing it was nice to spend time in the lounge and have some tea and discuss the events of the day. The breakfast in the mornings was a great choice as well, with eggs, sausage, bacon, breads/pastries, fruit, yogurt, etc. for only £6. The location of this hub was excellent with St. James' tube stop less than a 5 minute walk and Westminster Abbey just down the road. There is a Pret-a-Manger before the tube station and a couple of other restaurants and pubs as well. Highly recommend this hotel and the wonderful staff!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: We had a posh do to go to near Trafalgar Square last night so booked The Hub having always liked the main Premier Inn offering. We weren’t sure what to expect but it exceeded expectations. Clean comfortable room, great shower, good bar and lounge to relax in and a terrific breakfast at an amazing price. The staff were super helpful too, they also make great late night cocktails.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The location of this hotel couldn't better - very central and very convenient. As described in their publicity, the rooms are small. Our room had a window (that couldn't be opened); the bed was large and very comfortable; there was enough space to store our suitcase and clothes; the air-conditioning worked well and kept the room chilled; lighting worked very well; bathroom was very clean with an excellent shower unit; the room was very quiet with no external noise at all; with one exception, all the staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. The exception was the young lady who booked us in; she obviously had an agenda and declined to talk to me (a male) and looked and talked to my wife, very obviously ignoring me. A pity she was like this because everyone else was great. The breakfasts are outstanding value! Bacon, eggs, sausages, pastries, fruits, yoghurts, cereals, breads, drinks etc and all for £6.00. There is a large and comfortable lounge/bar. Given the location in the centre of London, this place represents good value for money, without the frills. Highly recommended.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The location was convenient to many attractions and close to the subway station (only a 2 block walk). The room was clean and had everything we could need. The staff were friendly and held our luggage when we arrived so we could start sightseeing before check-in time. We stayed in one of the larger rooms and it had a king size bed and plenty of space.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Located right in the middle of everything, you're within walking distance to just about all the major sights (or a short Tube ride away, as the nearest station is literally down the street). The rooms are compact but there's a place for everything without ever feeling cramped, and I really like the touch-based technology for controlling everything from lights to AC to do not disturb. The staff are friendly and I had a good time exploring London with this as my base.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Knew the room was small when we booked, didn't quite realise how much we'd miss having two sides to the bed. As a couple i'd say a little too cramped. everything was good but the room lost out there. My biggest annoyance was that there are no beverage making facilities in the room. The location is absolutely spot on. If I were to travel alone I'd definitely look at hub again, but not with my partner.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Having stayed at a previous Premier Hub this one exceeded expectations very comfortable bed and staff were very friendly and very helpful. Great value for money. Breakfast only £6 in London can’t be faulted
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: We arrived at the after a short trip on the London Express and the Underground. The St James's Park underground is a block away. Check in was easy. We got the "bigger" room, on the 7th floor (Rm 722). Had a small window, and the A/C worked great (very warm that week). Room was a good size for -2-. Couldn't imagine having more than 2 in that room. Bed was very comfy, and plenty of pillows on request. Bathroom spacious. Room was kept clean for our -7- day stay. We got the breakfast included, and it was well worth it. Eggs, bacon, sausage, breads, coffees , teas, etc. Very good. Out the front door, to the left -1- block is Westminster Abbey and a 5 minute walk is the River Thames and Big Ben. Loved the location. there are plenty of nearby Pubs (Feathers to name our fav) within a block. There is a pub in the hotel, but they ran out of red wine and other liquors. Still, nice place to hang out. We would definitely come back here again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: We were impressed from start to finish with the Hub hotel, check inn through to the room was just what we needed for a short city break.The only negative was with th associated bar, it was under staffed, which resulted in long queues, barrels not being changed, and glasses not being cleared from the tables. Hence why the service mark being low.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Good location Good staffGood rooms small but perfectly designedA perfect place to stay on a visit to London when value for money is a priority the rooms are small but if you are only staying a few nights it is all you need.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: We had a "bigger" room. I think the beds in the regular rooms are up against the wall and allow access to only one side. The small window in our room had a view of the outside through a small corridor to another window. Definitely better than our inside room on the Queen Mary 2, but just barely. We had trouble controlling the lights but could eventually get them to turn on or off. The 6 Lb. (about $7.65) breakfast was great! The American bacon was fried to perfection, but i don't remember seeing any kind of potatoes.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: We booked the Premier hub for the weekend as we were going to see Barbara Streisand at the Hyde Park open air concerts. It was an excellent choice as it catered for our needs right across the board and was populated by delightful accommodating staff. The bedroom was very good, it's small but ideal for the purpose. The bed is extremely comfortable and it was a very relaxing place. If we had used our heads we would have had breakfast there but we assumed it was just a continental breakfast! (Aren't we stoopid?!, accent on the stupid there) It wasn't but never mind we'll know next time. The next time we stay in a hub we will be prepared and have a full English. Excellent location, excellent quality and service. We paid £52.00 for the night in July in the centre of London! Beat that!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: stayed in the hub by premier inn Westminster Abbey on saturday night. was a fantastic location. It was the first time we had used a hub by premier inn and we were pleasantly surprised. nice comfortable room, very quiet for central london. the breakfast is a bargain at £6 each as were the bar prices.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: This was very good location and ideal for the visit for are stay in London, very comfortable and clean and tidy. And the breakfast was an excellent and the price. The staff were very friendly and very helpful.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Great idea of a hotel, just big enough rooms to be used as a base but still comfortable enough. Would definitely use a hub again. Brilliant location close to central London and all the sights. Nice breakfast well worth the £6 for central London.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Good location for Hyde Park and Westminster Food great excellent value for money £6 full breakfast Bar goodStaff excellent very organised and professional friendly but not intrusive Rooms cleanEverything you need for a short stay.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: What can i say. It met all my expectations and more. Its in a fantastic location just a few minutes from Westminster abbey, parliament square, Westminster bridge and the london eye. Its clean, modern and the staff are great. Theres a bar and free coffee and tea in the lounge. Bit of a learning curve for me , not having drink facilitates in the room though. Breakfast is excellent value, I was amazed at the ease that people were served. Busy but relaxed.Im certainly staying here next time im in London. Its a no brainer for me.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: So I’m a big fan of Premier Inn’s, including the Hub brand, and use them often for business and personal travel. Just checked into the Westminster Premier Inn Hub on Tothill Street in London. It’s my second or third time here, and I think the location is great, and perfect for my office. However, just checked into room 114 and the air con was throwing a really horrible cheesy feet smell, as well as hot air (and it’s really warm outside). So I go down and mention this to the front desk, and I get told by the lady on duty that she has reset it. I go back to the room and it has made no difference. Still hot air and an awful smell. So I go back down again and this time am curtly asked whether I’ve used anything in the room. When I reply that I have not, I get told I they will get me a new room if I go and get my stuff. So back up I go a third time, get my bags and come and get the key for a new room. No ‘sorry, about that’ from the front desk. So off to my new room I go - and it is right in the back in the basement, in the absolute bowels of the building. The hall carpets looks unhoovered, no mobile signal and really tucked away. All a bit grim. I get these are cheap and cheerful rooms, and good value for central London, but for £130 a night, I do expect a working AC and a modicum of customer service. If you are tempted to use this hotel for business, don’t bother - leave it to the tourists who are willing to put up with more in return for the central location.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Stayed over three nights in early July - hadn't realised that it was Pride weekend when we booked to attend the Hyde Park concerts but this hotel was reasonably priced and well located so seemed to be worth a punt when the usual suspects were uneconomic.All in, a great stay with a high quality but no frills experience. The ground floor room we stayed in (46) had no window but didn't feel claustrophobic with plenty of well angled lighting and a sense of space with the clean, white decor. The capsule style bed was cozy and plenty big enough for two with clever use of space at the foot end to allow for a desk and plenty of storage below.The air conditioning was very effective, the water pressure in the shower was more than adequate and the quality of sound insulation was better than many London hotels we've previously stayed at.Recommended!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Compact room at reasonable price in great location. Would recommend for a couple of nights maximum due to the compact space. Very well located near to two underground stations and Westminster. We stayed for a concert which was good for travelling as was on the Jubilee line straight to Wembley Park.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Bearing in mind we were in the heart of the city, the hub was really good value for money. It gave us everything we needed for a weekend stay, Clean, fresh and modern. We were also able to leave our belongings while we spent out second day exploring. We will be using this particular hub again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: fab rooms ultra modern very compact. once inside the room it was amazing for sleep total darkness and not a sound to be heard even with the hustle. and bustle of London on your door step. could not recommend this place highly enough
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: As long as you know what you're signing up for in advance and realise the clue is in the name (small rooms) then this is a perfect hotel for a short stay in London. The room features actually put some four and five star hotels to shame.Yes, the rooms are small but if it's just a base for exploring London it's perfect. Check in super smooth, staff are all really friendly and helpful, beds super comfortable, big rain forest showers, air conditioning, big TV, and good storage despite the size of the room.Breakfast is fine for the price and the happy hour cocktails are probably the cheapest you'll find in London.Second Hub we've stayed in and I'll definitely use them again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: For approx £100 a night for a couple and £6 each for a decent breakfast ( not just continental but bacon / sausage and eggs) great location for that event in London - we went to the royal Albert hall others had been to the concerts in Hyde park or pride Easy electronic check in - rooms small but have all the functionality you need. Brilliant air con, shower also good Bar area was busy and they have a late bar, not expensive compared to other places in the area also free tea and coffee from the machines 3 mins walk from st James / 7 mins from Westminster tubes.
