Make sure you go to the tothill address there’s another hub in dacre street and we went their in error 1st and queue of people shouting about rooms not readyStaff all welcoming and efficient - would definitely come again Also the perfect set up for a work trip to London - desk pulls out in the room so you can work
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Needed a comfortable one night stay in London. This was the cheapest we could find in July. Price was right. Great value for money. It was extremely comfortable. Shower big and refreshing. Hairdryer in room. Breakfast great. All staff were more than helpful and very very friendly. Rooms are very small and compact but very well designed providing all you need for a one night stay. Everything here exceeded our expectations. All areas were clean and well maintained. 100% recommend for an overnight stopover.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Excellent central location, within easy walking distance of most attractions and transport. Breakfast was really good value for money. If I was looking for a fault , it would be pretty hard to find. Really recommend.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: We had 2 carry on bags and there wasn't even enough room to open them and this was with the large room. Not even enough room to walk by each other at the end of the bed. I don't know what people with 2 regular sized suitcases would. do. Other than that, the location was great (5-10 minutes from Westminster Abbey, Parliament, Big Ben, Churchill's War Rooms, etc), the staff was very friendly, outstanding and willing to do anything to help (couldn't help us with room size, however). Automation in the rooms was cool, with lighting and room temperature controlled on the bed headboard. Very comfortable bed.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The hotel is very close to the QE11 centre where I was attending an event, and is very convenient for visiting the Abbey or getting into the WestEnd. St James Park tube is a 2 minute walk, Westminster tube is less than 10 minutesI’d recommend paying the small premium and booking a larger room if there are two of you, and packing a couple of extra coat hangers, but the room was incredibly functional and let’s face it, you don’t come to London to sit in your room. The breakfast at £6 is great a value, although the scrambled egg was rather over cooked and dried out, but for I feel I’m being a bit picky at this price.I’ve stayed in other budget hotels in the area but would choose to stay here again if needing a hotel in this part of London.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was small but very well designed. There was a place for everything. The bed was very comfortable. I did not take advantage of the Breakfast but the Bar was a good value and nicely appointed. The location is very convenient, being located within easy walking distance of many attractions and close to three Tube Stations. The hotel was very well kept. I would definitely stay again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: I stayed with my wife whilst in London to visit Wimbledon. We chose the Hub due to good reviews and due to it being at least 1/3rd cheaper than nearby 4* hotels. Whilst not cheap (£200 per night) I appreciate that London prices, whilst always high, are even worse during Wimbledon fortnight.It was our first stay at a Premier Inn ‘Hub’ hotel and we were impressed given the competitive rate. The room, whilst compact, had ample space for us, was spotlessly clean and had a huge and very comfortable bed. A 100% blackout blind, great sound insulation and efficient air con ensured a great night’s sleep.Breakfast, whilst simple, was fresh and tasty and represented excellent value for money at £6. (I hate paying the c £15-20 that 4-5* hotels want to charge for a simple breakfast).The staff were friendly and welcoming. I’d recommend the Hub Westminster and whilst not quite as ‘cool’ as ‘Citizen M’ hotels the ‘Hub’ is a similar concept and very well executed by Premier Inn.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Fantastic location! The room was clean and tidy. Given it's a Hub I expected it to be small and it was (paid for the bigger room upgrade, we had two rooms and one did seem bigger than the other.....). The TV remote was hit and miss which became quite annoying and it was tricky to control the heating. Didn't expect to have to make the bed myself on arrival but perhaps that's par for the course with a premier inn hub. Bed was very comfortable, and the shower was excellent! One of the biggest downsides was the lack of any tea making facilities. If this had been clear when booking, we could have purchased a cheap travel kettle. Free tea and coffee is available but that means trekking downstairs and bringing it back to your room.It's expensive for what it is but then when you consider the location the price is probably just about justified. The breakfast was superb value! By far the biggest plus point is the staff, every member we encountered was professional, courteous and extremely polite and helpful.Knowing what we know now and being able to prepare better we would definitely stay again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: This hotel was lovely, very clean and has an efficient layout. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The location is perfect. Just a block from Westminster Abbey and 2 blocks from the river and cruises.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The hotel is very well positioned in Westminster so was an easy choice when i had a conference nearby. The whole workings are very high-tech but the staff are incredibly warm and friendly so you don't feel like a number. Good value for money and the breakfast is a steal (for London). Rooms are very well apportioned and make the best use of the small space, bed is huge and very comfortable, bathrooms clean and the showers are great! Only thing I'd flag, I had a room with no window, which was okay when i arrived in the evening but found disconcerting in the morning. They do have rooms with windows, so next time I'll request one.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: First time staying in a hub, definitely won't be the last. Was very impressed, although the room was small it had everything you needed and more. Extremely clean and easy to check in and out. Most impressive was just how dark the room was and the amount of choices for lighting.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: From check in to check out the staff here were fantastic and friendly. The rooms are compact without feeling cramped, and the clever lights and air con controls on the headboard panel is very classy. No tea or coffee in the room but complimentary down in the bar which is a nice touch and a bit more social. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning and for £6 you'll be hard pressed to get better value in central London. Even the 2 4 1 cocktails during happy hour (5-7pm) are very reasonable at £6.50. Overall a very pleasant stay and I would happily recommend a stay here, even for a few nights. oh and the shower was amazing. Well done premier inn.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Great Central location. Short walk to places like Westminster Abbey, London Eye, big ben, Leicester Square etc. I have stayed here once previously and have also tried other hotels in London. This will always be the one I stay at from now on. Reasonably priced (well for London anyway). Friendly staff, very clean rooms and a lovely comfortable stay. The only reason I didn't give it a 5* was the kettle situation. I want a cuppa as soon as I wake up in the morning and I don't particularly want to go all the way downstairs through the busy bar to get one. But that's the only negative.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: For to be honest: normally I book cheap hotels and try to get as much as I can for my money. This time this hotel was on Sale and this (and nothing else) was the reason to book it. It was less or more cheap. As we arrived we found it really great then and were surprised what we can get - even in London, where many cheap Hotels offers just a "hole" to sleep - for this money. We really liked our stay and the whole package. Can not find much to complain. Maybe just that the room was small... More than 3-4m2 on the side you can not walk... but all together it was a great stay and (if I can get the same rates again) I would definitely book it again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Nice place to stay if you are after somewhere clean and new. The rooms aren’t large but I’m only in the place to sleep so it’s not a big deal. We chose the larger room options so there would be room for the cases and there was plenty.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Great location and very clean room however the standard double is not suitable for 2 adults comfort. Had the most awful nights sleep! Would love to see Premier Inn's lovely kingsize beds in rooms as they are so comfortable. Lounge bar was good. Staff friendly and efficient.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: This hotel is in a excellent location right in the centre of London the staff were friendly and polite.Rooms were quiet and modern.The breakfast was more than adequate and tea and coffee are available 24/7 had a good weekend and will definitely stay here again
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: I like to walk, not a fan of busses or “tubes”. This hotel is walking distance from basically everywhere. For those that do, the underground station is less than 100m away. Longest distance in walking time was 35 min and it was to tower bridge. Rooms are a bit on the small side for a person over 6 feet, but the room is comfortable, clean and the space is well used. The price was also better than staying in economy options like apartments. It’s great for people that don’t have small kids because of space, or people that like to stay in the hotel for vacations.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: I had a really good stay at this hotel. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed was very comfy and it was nice to lay down and watch movies on the big TV screen. The location was perfect really close to the Westminster Abbey and also the tube station. The Lounge Bar was really nice and the breakfast was very good for £6. Coffee and tea were complimentary 24/7.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: 1st time in a hub altho regular Premier Inn user - will deff use hub again. 3 mins walk to St James Park. Description on website was spot on, rooms clean and very comfortable, enough storage for 2 of us (only stayed 1 night) nice shower room/toilet, hairdryer was a bonus. Pre-booked breakfast and altho it was busy we were quickly found a table - good hot & cold selection, 2 coffee machines kept queues short , i must say the staff were absolutely all over the demand - as soon as something was running low (from mugs to scrambled egg !!) it was topped up - very impressed with how efficient and friendly everyone was - top marks PI
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The location is amazing,close to all the main attractions,all staff catered for are needs and staff in general so helpful,funny and professional at all time the rooms are a lovely layout and the service off the cleaners was brilliant and are stay in general was relaxed and calm, I just want to say a big thank you and will be back soon x
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: If you’re looking for an affordable central London location, then the Hub Westminster is perfect.While not the biggest of rooms the bed is Kingsized and very comfortable. We were greeted with a friendly welcome, which continued over the weekend by all members of staff.Can’t speak highly of our experience and will definitely be using this hotel again
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Excellent stay. Room was clean, fresh and welcoming. Plenty of room of everything you need for a short stay. Light system worked well and due to no window it was pitch black so got a great nights sleep.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The hub is a really well designed room and as a base for a couple of nights is ideal.we have used a hub for another city break and will definitely use one again. The only problem we had and it's nothing to do with the hub. .The underground station close to the hub hotel was not operating on the weekend due to engineering works. It meant a longer walk to use the underground at Westminster. No issue if it's not raining.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Wi-fi wasn’t working. The room was some kind of basement room without any mobile phone reception. Unlike other hub hotels the phone charging socket wasn’t near the top of the bed. There are nicer ones to stay at than this.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: A very modern, comfortable place to stay. Excellent value for money and the most central location to many of London's major attractions. The staff, particularly Queenbee Berniee in the bar dining area are very friendly and helpful.The cocktails at happy hour are great as are the light meal and breakfast choices.Highly recommended.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Stayed for one night. Plus'sTHE STAFF.Everyone, and I mean EVERYONE, was lovely (management take note). We only knew Kiara's name from checking us in but I could have named anyone.LOCATION.Turn right and Westminster Abbey is right there in front of you, about a 3 minute stroll away. St. James Park underground is a 2 minutes walk away, Westminster about 7 minutes. So close to a lot of things but relatively quiet. Within a 15 minute easy stroll, you have Trafalgar Square, Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, London Eye, St.James Park.....it's great.BREAKFAST. £6 for all you can eat, this knocked spots off 5* London hotels I've stayed in (my reviews have been taken down due to change of ownership - I'm not happy). Great sausages, bagels, cakes, fresh fruit salad (not tinned) bean to cup coffee. It's self service but food was replenished regularly. You normally hear someone complain about something, I didn't hear anyone. NigglesTHE ROOM.It's fine and had 5 plug sockets and what looked like a US socket as well....but the bed is a bit high and you have to climb on to it and is up against a wall on 3 sides. A problem if there are two of you and the one nearest the wall has to visit the bathroom in the night. The wash basin is also high and I could imagine water running down the arms of anyone around 5 foot tall. That said, the bed was comfortable and the shower was fine.The in-house bar was still serving drinks in what was a relaxed atmosphere at 12.30am when we left. There are also a couple of pubs nearby. Free tea and coffee is available 24hrs. We've just booked again for September so it can't be all that bad.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: While the location is very good and the rooms small but clean and modern, a problem with the magnetic keys just before departure meant I lost my train back home. The service was good but the technology needs to be looked after.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Stayed at the hub in Dacre street. Very well laid out compact room. Hi tech with touch controls everywhere.A Typical premier inn comfy bed. And free relatively new films on the tv. Breakfast was good quality all fresh on the day. 5 minute walk to Westminster abbey and st James Park. Staff really friendly and helpful. Big shower but bed in alcove so one has to climb over other to leave the bed. Book months in advance for a very cheap room
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Really nice hotel, in a great location. Also extremely good value for money. Staff were great, especially Christina. She was very professional, efficient and friendly and is a great asset to the hotel. Would definitely stay here again and would also recommend anyone coming to London to check it out.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Fab city centre location. The rooms are comfortable and modern. Great value in the adjoining bar and the staff couldn't do enough to help you ot meet your needs. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The only negative when I priced up to come back a year later the price had jumped significantly.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Easy to find straight off the St.James Underground, Victoria and Westminster Underground very close too, incredible location right next to Westminster Abbey and Houses of Parliament. Great value for money. Breakfast £6 was lovely, very high standard and fresh. Would definitely recommend to anyone.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Good quality hotel with great staff nothing too much trouble. Very pleasent atmosphere and good surroundings in a perfect location would definatley reurn to this hotel. Very easy check in and all staff very good at their particular jobs
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: I loved this hotel. The check in process is one of the smoothest experiences I’ve ever had, and I was in my room within five minutes of arrival. The decor is great. The rooms are small but well designed and every inch of space is plotted out carefully. It is budget friendly but so easy on the eyes!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Very comfortable room,mattress and pillows allowed a great nights sleep - room was very clean.All staff had a smile on their face and were all customer service focused especially the Reception and Restaurant/Bar area.Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Room small and next to a lift shaft .room 417 .heard lift moving in the shaft all night  No window at all in the room Bed only access from one side was hard and uncomfortable had everything in it but was claustrophobic .felt like I was falling off the mattress all night Breakfast was good value
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: This hotel was great. Clean good food. Had great staff as well. The room were small but efficient and we had all we needed. The area was great for church at the Westminster Abbey on Sunday. You will feel safe in this area and have all you need.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: This was the first time we stayed in a HUB and it was amazing. The rooms were bright and cheerful, loved the display panel controls for air con, light, Do Not Disturb sign. Bathroom nice, shower was amazing. Bar area was lovely and relaxing and breakfast was good for the price. Nice relaxed atmosphere with lovely helpful staff. Location was perfect, you could walk to most central parts of London in no time but 2 tube stations on the doorstep as well. It was quiet as well. Good nights sleep had after 2 very busy days. Thoroughly recommend.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: We stayed at the hub by Premier Inn for 3 days in June. The hotel is in an excellent location just steps away from Westminster Abby and walking distance to Buckingham Palace. The hotel was very clean and modern. We had a larger room and the bed was at least a king size and was big enough for 2. The front desk workers are very helpful and were able to store our bags since we arrived before our room was ready. We would definitely stay here again if in London.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Very good value for money, good position few minutes walk to Westminster Abbey & Houses if Parliament. Beautiful clean rooms. Staff very friendly & helpful, excellent breakfast.Cant fault this hotel at all, would highly recommend & will definitely stay again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Stayed in this hub several times. Great location handy for all west end shows and major attractions, staff always friendly and helpful. And always very affordable Definitely recommend and I’ll 100% be visiting again.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Hotel, Staff and Breakfast all great. My only dissapointment was that there were no tea/coffee facilities in the room. This meant that we had to go downstairs get a cuppa, take it back upstairs before getting ready for the day.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Will definitely stay again. Rooms are spotless, very comfortable and well equipped. The rooms are really very quiet and had 2 very good nights sleep. The free tea/coffee in the lounge is a nice touch. The ideal hotel in the ideal location.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Booked this trip so husband and I could spend few days sightseeing. Location was in the heart of Westminster so we were able to walk to a lot of the places we wanted to visit. Westminster tube was just along the road although we didn't use this and Victoria tube was about 15 minutes walk. Few bars around although get very busy around end of working day. Very near to Westminster Abbey and close to Downing Street. Rooms we're very good. Clean, comfortable and adequate for a vase to stay. Shower gel provided. And good hairdryer. Good full length mirror in bedroom and large one in bathroom Shower powerful. Towels changed and rooms cleaned as required. Also plenty of hangers. Enough for a free days if you double up and although wardrobe is just an enclosure there are 2 hanging rails. We also had bottled water supplies. Room was very modern and touch display for loghts etc. The only negative is that we wanted to use the hub display and control lights from our phone but engineer didn't know why we couldn't work it. It may have been my fault as I'm a technophobe! Overall a very good hotel with friendly staff always wanting to help. I would stay here again for future trips
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: All you could need in an amazing location. Was able to walk to just about everywhere I wanted to visit from this hotel. Rooms are compact, but thoughtfully designed to feel much bigger than they are. This was exactly what I needed for my stay and I hope to visit again when I’m next in town.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: What a brilliant, quirky hotel! We had a on lovely clean room with a/c that worked very well. There was a a smashing bar/restaurant area. The hotel was in an ideal location next to tourist venues and city centre attractions.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Outstanding hotel with super great friendly staff . Clean, modern hib vibe, excellent service, great value, and if you opt for the breakfast you won’t regret the selection of food. They have two for one drink specials at night certain times and staff are friendly. Rooms with the king size bed have ample room and very quite and dark for a restful sleep.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Air conditioned rooms. Quiet. Clean. 2 minutes from tube station. Bar & restaurant. Friendly staff. Fast Free WiFi. Good shower. Comfortable beds and pillows. Quality towels. Competetive price. Free bottle of water. Hi Tech room. Electric blinds. What not to like? Toilet seat could have soft closing?
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Traveling for business and holiday. This hotel is very conveniently located in central London with all major tourist spots within a walking distance or close to the tube station. Pre-arrival emails were very very useful and the staff checking us in were friendly and helpful. Only slight downside was the coffee and tea amenities are located in the cafe and there’s none in your room. Otherwise very good. I know the cost may be a bit high but your paying for the convenience of staying in central London.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The hotel is in a great location, and the rate Quality versus Price is just perfect. Room was clean, digital. Nothing to say much on a breakfast for 6£ only (bread, toast, eggs, bacon, fruits....etc)!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: First time we stayed in a premier inn hub, great find. The location was perfect, the rooms are smart and compact. They have everything you need. We couldn’t say a bad thing about our rooms. Easy to check in aswell.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The location is perfect to visiting the city and the check-in is 24/7 for every flight you choose.The breakfast is complete to start the day with energy.The price/quality is good at only 6£.I will raccomand to other people premier inn.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: right in the centre of London, Big Ben, St James park all within 5 minutes, excellent price, right next to tube station. breakfast was good, and the room was lovely and quiet, also the aircon was very good.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: If you want to be right in the centre of the city but don't want to spend a fortune then this is a great option.The rooms are well thought out, have exactly what you would expect and feel very modern.The hotel is clean and I found all the staff the be polite and helpful, and if you want a quick breakfast before heading out, the hotels £6 buffet can't be faulted.I would highly recommend this location and will be checking availability next time I'm in London.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: We’ve just spent a lovely weekend in London. The hub was a perfect position. The room, cleanliness facilities, service and breakfast were all excellent. We couldn’t fault it whatsoever. We would definitely recommend for a short sightseeing trip.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Excellent experience at this hotel. We booked one of the larger rooms, which was good. There is no real window, but the room was comfortable, clean and quiet. The lounge bar serves 2 for 1 cocktails for two hours each evening. All drinks are reasonably priced though by London standards. Breakfast was £6 each for an all you can eat buffet. This was a mixture of fruit, yogurt, pastries and hot food. Staff are all friendly and helpful.Would definitely recommend this hotel, and return when we next return to London
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: New, clean, modern, very comfortable, friendly staff, perfectly situated, close to tube links and felt safe as a female travelling alone. Bed high (cabin style) and against the wall, may cause difficulty if you have a mobility problem or if you are couple with reduced ability.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Great place to stay for a visit to London. Perfect central location, modern and quirky, spotlessly clean, fantastic staff, lovely bar also serving up food, value for money breakfast, local pubs and restaurants less than a stones throw. Ticks all the boxes!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: I stay in this hotel almost weekly for one or two nights .It is so easy to use ,location is ideal ,and secure .I arrive very late at night sometimes but the staff could not be more friendly and helpful
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: INCREDIBLE experience in this hotel. Everything was amazing: the location, the friendly staff, the room and service for it's quality/price. I've stayed in this hotel for 17 nights at the end of April - May. Everything worked smoothly since the beggining as I've requested an early check in and a room with a window in advance, and I got all of that without any issue. I've stayed in a bigger room as I thought that the regular room was too small considering that I was there for 3 weeks. First, the location is just perfect as this hotel is at the heart of London: Westminster Abbey is only 1 block away, The Houses of Parliament 3 blocks away, London eye and Trafalgar Square just a couple of minutes walking. The nearest tube station is St James's Park (Circle and District Line), just 1 block away from the hotel, and the Westminster station (Jubilee Line) is about 3 blocks away.About the room, I can see It's exactly how it looks on the pictures posted in this site. It's very well designed, modern and clean. The bed is very confortable and the panel where you can control the lights and temperature is the star of the room. Actually, it's very handy. I've read many comments complaining about the size of the room, and I knew beforehand that it was going to be a small room comparing to other from other hotels, but I never felt it was an issue for me. On top of that, it has a very useful under-bed storage and they provide you with towels and a new duvet every day. Free complimentary water the first day as well. The breakfast it's served on the Lounge and it's very cheao: only 6 pounds! It's a buffet breakfast and it has a lot of options to choose from. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Jorge was super friendly and chatty. Amazing experience. I'm looking forward to go back!!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: We appreciated the impeccable cleanliness down to the smallest things, including changing the air filters in the rooms, the new set of sheets after three days during our six night stay, the unbeatable value of the £6 breakfast with delicious eggs, sausage, bacon and bread and the complimentary coffee and tea. The breakfast option made a huge difference for us as we were on the last leg of a three week trip and having this option was the most affordable for quality meal we could find anywhere in London - the perfect thing to set the day off right (and didn’t close so early that we could sleep in on some days).Not to mention the location! Half a block from Westminster Abbey and from St James Station, it was so central we could enjoy our trip to the fullest using a 7-day Oyster card. We stayed in one of the new “larger” rooms and the only thing we’d recommend is having a second seating option in the room, having more lighting options to have the bed dark but the lights on full in the toilet (so that one person can sleep while the other showers), having the app available to international App stores for those not from the UK (we’re from Canada) and a very minor thing of having the hand soap pump on the same side of the counter as the sink so that there’s less risk of dripping onto the counter. And having tissue boxes available from the vending machine in the lobby (we had allergies while we were there - not a big deal as we just found some at the local Tesco instead).It was wonderful peace of mind staying in a place that obviously thought about cleanliness and with the room layout also very well thought out. Will definitely look to stay here again! Hope to see this chain expand internationally!
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: Great location for visiting all parts of London as only a couple of minutes from the underground and also Westminster Pier. Friendly and very helpful staff. Really good value breakfast. Enjoyed our stay.
hotelName: Hub by Premier Inn London Westminster Abbey

review_body: The entire area is full of accommodations for travellers. It appears that some of the hotels share services or such due to the way they are set up. That said, I felt it wasn't as central as I would have liked but given the price of something "more central", this was quite alright. It is connected to the Phoenix hotel next door in terms of some services but is not physically connected it seems. This front desk is not open 24 hours and in off hours, the service transfers to the Phoenix Hotel. The room was very clean but there was a very slight smell in the bathroom--probably from the shower curtain that needed to be changed/washed. Otherwise, the rest of the suite was well maintained. I would say that compared to other places I've stayed at, this is only average and is not exceptional. There is wifi, the amenities are available for basic stay, the room is clean and tidy and the area is safe. There is not a breakfast included in this one--which is fine (I'd rather no breakfast than something slapped together). The staff are friendly enough but I still found a bit distant. The areas is lovely so going for a stroll is nice. There is a chance to leave luggage after you check out if your flight is later in the day. If you are looking for boutique-y or more personal, this isn't going to fit... it is a good place to stay and sleep.Would stay again if visiting London.

The hotel itself is okay, however there are a few things that would not want me to stay there again. The area is not what it used to be, and this is the main reason. A lot of beggars, homeless and unsavoury type characters now are aplenty down nearby Bayswater. The street is dirty and not pleasant to wander. Some of the restaurants also add (non-advertised or advised) service charges to bills without advising, to me indicating that the area has become a real tourist trap. The hotel was okay, but as previously reviewed, there is no lift and the stairs are quite narrow, the rooms and bathrooms are very small and would only suit a couple for 1-2 nights maximum. There is no lounge or bar area in the hotel, but you can go to the sister property next door. The staff are hit and miss, with some okay, and some not so good.

This hotel is in Kensington square and very quiet.Room was very very small but it was OK for 1 day stay.Reception staff was nice and polite but close reception after 5 pm. So you have to go to next hotel for check in or early check out .Location is very good for bus and subway.

This is an excellent hotel for a trip to London - well-located for tube stations (two lines), comfortable, safe area with lots of shops and restaurants, reasonable rates, and abobe all, friendly, helpful and attentive staff.

Nice room, clean, quit, free wifi, good beds. I was not included freakfast, but it was nearby everything you need. And a short way to the underground. And short way to parks.We liked it there and will be back. One minus was the air con (or fan) on the bathroom. It made a terrible noise when the light was on. But as long as the light was off it was ok.

On arrival, the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. A lovely first impression. Our room was small but nicely furnished and the bathroom nice and clean. The only negative point was that there was lots of dust on all the surfaces, including the skirting boards. The location is good with lots of places to eat nearby and easy tube access to the west end.

This is a smaller hotel in a quite nice and calm area. Near Bayswater tube station, or just a 10-15 min walk to Paddington.The small rooms are just that, small. But the double rooms are quite descent and the bathrooms are newly refurbished.Nothing fancy, but a decent night stay. The hotel next door (Phoenix) manages the check in and also to open the locked door on the outside, which can be confusing at first.

I booked a last minute trip to London and stayed at the Kensington Gardens Hotel for 3 nights. I had a single room which was small, but very clean and the bathroom was modern and in good shape. The property was a close to Hyde Park, Bayswater/Queensway tubes and Notting Hill. I also enjoyed breakfast every morning at the sister property, Phoenix Hotel, just a few doors down. The staff was also very helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend staying here!

The location is just great - quiet at a small park, yet close to a street with many restaurants and also the subway. The reception service was great, room fine too. Only the breakfast was just average and the service there was terrible - hard to reach when needed, speaking very poor English, very noisy at work.

We stayed at Kensington Gardens Hotel for five nights in June 2018. Check-in was easy enough next door at the adjoining hotel. They gave you an actual key (not a key-card) with a room number attached to it. This made it hard to fit in a pocket, but we made it work. Our hotel room was on the top floor, and just like the other reviews, if you have a lot of luggage, it is a lot of work. This was the last leg of a four-leg trip through Europe (where we got engaged!) so we had a lot of heavy luggage that haul up. There is no elevators or assistance for bags, so be prepared. Like a lot of loft-like hotels, there is not HVAC/Air conditioning, instead, there is a fan and a window - just how like it was when I was raised in London! The staff encountered were friendly and were quiet, and the room was immaculately clean. Looked newly renovated and the bed was nice, a little firm, but nice. The room was not too spacious, but that's what you get in most hotels in and around London. The location was perfect for catching the Underground, buses, and the like. Close to shopping, restaurants, and pubs. I would recommend again unless you have a lot of luggage!

Being honest I was a bit iffy when booking this hotel. Given that it’s official rating seems to be 2-star, and it’s very competitively priced, I was worried this might be reflected in standards of cleanliness, service etc., but booked it anyway on the basis of the previous reviews. The reviews were accurate and the rating does it no justice whatsoever! The hotel, room and bathroom were all spotless. It was a lovely location, overlooking a very quiet garden square, and very centrally located in terms of tube access. Bayswater (District & Circle) is a 3 or 4 minute stroll, while Queenswater (Central Line) is just a couple of minutes further, and Paddington is maximum a 15 minute walk.We got a lovely welcome from Rosanne (sorry if this is not correct spelling) who could not have been more welcoming or helpful. Reception is staffed until 5pm daily. After 5pm you book in or collect your keys at the next door sister hotel, the Phoenix Hotel. Really amazing value for London. Am already recommending to family & friends!Only caveat: there is no lift, with rooms on first to fourth floors.

The hotel is centrally located with easy access to west end and Oxford Street ....the staff are pleasant and helpful...the rooms are clean and well kept ...the hotel are generous with amenities ....although the hotel is well secured there are no safety boxes in the room and the staff are only on duty until 5pm...after 5 pm guests have to get their room keys and refer to staff in their sister hotel (which is a few doors away)....the hotel is recommended

Once a year my family visits London, and uses Kensington Garden Hotel as our hotel! The hotel is located just a few stops from Oxford street. The rooms are great if you are on a shopping holiday, but also comfortable. Looking forward to next visit!

My wife and I stayed here for three nights in August and really liked it. Great value and we liked the location. Quick walk to the tube and bus stops. Quick walk to Kensington Palace and gardens. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. You will have to utilize the Phoenix Hotel next door for let pickup at times, but this never felt like a burden to us.

Great location, very quiet, and reasonably priced with easy access to the Bayswater tube. The staff were friendly and helpful and gave me exactly the room I wanted. The free wifi was also excellent. Thank you for a great visit!

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in July. The price according to the quality isn't justified at all. The only good thing is the location as it's next to Queensway and Bayswater tube stations, both useful.As we arrived, we had a £125 charge in our credit card made by them in order to check the availability of the card without permission or any kind of notification for us to know they were gonna do that.We asked the hotel staff if they charged that amount and at first they told us they didn't, we had to ask twice to two different people to find out it was theirs. For that reason, we had to cancel our credit card immediately as we didn't initially know where that charge came from. That was a very annoying mishap as we were abroad.On the second hand, the room was not as clean as expected, and we were not able to use the kettle they offer on their webpage as it was extremely dirty. Same thing with the air conditioning, both things were a bit nasty.Finally, we were accused to have smoked on the room without any clear evidence of it, which was quite offensive and untrue. I don't want to go on holiday and feel uncomfortable and disgusted and pay £500 for it.

Stayed here whilst attending concert in Hyde park. Location could not be faulted, the hotel sits right on the edge of Hyde park. My husband upgraded our room to a suite as I was celebrating a birthday. The room was certainly huge and the view outstanding. I would say that the room needed smartening up a little and one particular point to make is bathroom felt below par with large crack running along wall and some mound in one corner, however on the whole the room was very clean. Housekeeping were quick to respond to requests of additional towels and when we requested a container to transport flowers home that my husband had arranged for the room, they responded immediately. Breakfast is self service and was both plentiful and tasty, with a large selection to choose from. Staff are friendly and helpful. Nice touch was the free minibar and would recommend this hotel for a short stay in London. Would stay here again.

I stayed here for two nights with my sister while in London. It was just ok. It was clean and served it's purpose of being a place to stay. However, the room was incredibly cramped. I am an average sized person and I really struggled to survive with my sister and our suitcases in the space provided. The shower was outside the bathroom and in the bedroom, which was not only bizarre but provided zero privacy. If you're there with a spouse, no problem. But with a sibling or friend, it provides a very awkward situation! There is not 24/7 reception services. When we arrived, we had to check in down the street at the Phoenix Hotel. That wouldn't be too big of an issue except we had to lug our bags with us. You also couldn't enter the building without first dialing reception to let you in...I believe in security, but this added only frustration and was a waste of time every time we wanted to enter the hotel. This hotel needs to get with the modern world and create keys that allow entry on their own. This hotel is also not air conditioned (as many hotels in London aren't). They provided a fan and a window, but opening the window allowed flies in. The window also opened onto an area directly across from another room. So if we wanted fresh air, we had to accept that we wouldn't have any privacy.

I booked through hotels.com & based on the generally good reviews about this property there, assumed I was getting value for my money. Reached at 12:30AM on the day of my check-in, having informed the property, they mentioned I would need to pick up the key from their "sister" property, which is next door, Phoenix hotel. Was given keys (we'd booked two rooms for two nights) to rooms on the 4th & 5th floor of a non-lift(elevator) building. No recourse available- the receptionist at Phoenix could neither offer a room at a lower floor, or; a room at their hotel(which incidentally features an elevator). I literally lifted my heavy bags on my head & hefted them 5 flights of stairs to reach a room, which can charitably be called a "coop", tiny - about 8 ft by 5ft with a bathroom 1/2 this size. Now, None of the reviews on hotels.com had even hinted at this feature of either the room, or; the hotel..which points to a degree of collusion between this stellar agent (hotels.com) & the hotel, in question. So, my recommendation to would-be budget travelers intending to stay at Kensington gardens hotel is to be aware of these aspects which aren't clear

Paid £72 for one night without breakfast.Three minute walk from Bayswater Tube Station, many restaurants, Tesco Express and Sainsbury Local for supplies. Hyde Park a short walk away along with Notting Hill and Portabello Market.We arrived at 7.30 pm so collected key from neighbouring Phoenix Hotel. No lift, we were on 3rd floor, not an issue for us but could be for others.Room and en-suite looked newly renovated, nicely presented, clean and tidy. The room was small but large cupboard for storage. Bed was comfortable.Facilities included toiletries, nice fluffy towels, TV, plenty coffee/tea etc.For the price, we thought it was excellent value and would stay again if similar price.

We spent 1 night at Kensington Gardens Hotel whilst attending Hyde Parks Winter Wonderland. The Hotel is really smart and tidy. The staff could not be anymore helpful, professional or polite. They made us feel really welcome. We had our 10 months old baby with us too. It was a really pleasant 1 1/4 mile walk through Kensington Park into Hyde park. Plenty of Eateries just around the corner from the hotel. The breakfast was served at the sister hotel next door - Phoenix Hotel. Again staff made us very welcome. English breakfast was nice and cooked to order. We would def recommend and also stay here again. Thank you.. Simon, Hayley and little Tilly

We stayed in a triple room at the Kensington Gardens Hotel and loved it! We walked to the hotel from Paddington Station (about a 15 minute walk). We arrived late morning and were warmly greeted by the host (forgot her name, but she was lovely and very helpful). We were a bit too early for checkin, but she grabbed our bags and locked them in her office so we could start exploring London. When we arrived later in the day, we noticed that she had delivered our bags to our room. The room itself was in the lower level. VERY quiet. Not a huge room, but most certainly large enough for the three of us. There was a large window that looked up to the street level. There were plenty of lights, including nice reading lights by the two beds. The bathroom was compact, but very clean and modern. The location was awesome. Within walking distance of the Bayswater tube station, and there are loads of cafes, restaurants, pubs and shops nearby. We enjoyed a couple nearby pubs, some awesome Indian food, and some of the great nearby shops. A short walk away was Kensington Park, Kensington Palace, Hyde Park and more. With three of us, it was actually cheaper for us to use Uber instead of the tube, and it was really easy to get cars in this area. The office at the hotel is open 8a-5p (8a-3p on Sundays). Like most small hotels, they ask you to leave your keys when you are gone. When the office is closed, they run all the keys to their sister property, the Phoenix Hotel, which is a couple doors down. The staff there was great as well - very friendly. This is where there is a bar, and they also serve breakfast here.Overall it was a very enjoyable stay, and we would not hesitate one bit to stay here again.

My mother and I stayed for one night in a twin bedroom. This hotel is beautiful! It's walking distance from Bayswater underground station and an entire street of resteraunts and shops, and even Hyde Park. The bathroom and room itself were very clean and spacious. We had a lovely view of the square infornt of the hotel from the second floor. We did arrive later so we needed to pick the key up form the sister hotEl but this wasn't a problem at all and the staff were very pleasant. An electronic fan was provided in the wardrobe however we didn't need it as we found it a little cold but once we got into bed we were fine. As the windows are old they did not keep out the noise, we heard nearly everything in the street but again this wasn't a problem because the hotel is along a side street which was quiet enough.I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short or long stay and I will most definitely be staying again.

This hotel is a great location - walking distance to Kensington Palace and the shops and areas around, as well as two tube stations. It felt like you were in a more residential area, which was nice. Our guess is that it was once apartments, now converted to a hotel. It is affiliated with the Phoenix hotel next door - which means reception is only there 8:00am - 5:00pm Monday to Friday. So you need to stop at the Phoenix Hotel to either drop off or pick up your room key if you are outside those timeframes. This wasn't a bother, we just didn't expect it. Room was standard sizing for Europe and clean. Staff were quite nice! No complaints at all.

Great hotel in a nice area close to all the shops and the underground station. Hotel was clean, plenty of room and very comfortable. Didn't expect much but was positively suprised. Staff was nice as well.

They very kindly reimbursed my booking although I wasn't technically entitled to do it. I love the hotel but needed to cancel under some complicated circumstances but they understood my situation and cancelled free of charge.

We stayed for a week and enjoyed our stay there. The only real drawback is a lack of an elevator. The bed was very comfortable and the staff especially Rowshanak were friendly and very helpful. Unless you are looking for exercise, ask for a lower floor.

Lovely little hotel near Kensington Palace, Notting Hill, etc. as well as the tube. Got there at 9am after a red-eye flight from the US and my room was ready which was a lovely surprise. Woman who checked me in was very friendly and helpful. My only complaint would be that there is no AC or an elevator. Luckily I was there when the evenings were cool. But my luggage was very heavy so carrying it up stairs was difficult. But all in all a wonderful place.

I stayed here for 3 nights in February when I was in London for a few days. The hotel is in a great location and close to both Bayswater and Queensway tube stations which is good for getting around. The area itself is quiet enough and feels very safe even at night. I had room 16, if I remember correctly, which is right beside reception so I didn't have any stairs to climb.The rooms are quite small but very clean and comfortable and have a kettle, TV and a cosy bed. The wifi was fast enough for me to watch videos on and not have to use my data. The only thing I didn't like was the view from my room which looked out onto another wall of the hotel but this didn't bother me too much as I was there to see the sights, not look out my hotel window. I think the price is very reasonable for what you get, especially for London. Would stay again :)

Close to 2 tubes and walking distance to a number of landmarks, the location is great. The room was clean and comfortable - higher quality than many. Only issue was the noise from neighbouring room and our misfortune of having a heavy snorer who was heavy handed on the tv volume next to us. Maybe a volume limiter on the tv would help.Would stay again.

Stayed here 2 nights while in London to see Tom Petty at BST Hyde Park. Excellent location a few minutes walk from Bayswater tube. Tesco Express nearby.I was in room 10 which is small but had all I needed. Comfy bed, kettle, hairdryer, en-suite shower and a fan which was very much appreciated as weather very warm.Receptionist very helpful as were staff in Pheonix next door. Ok there isn't a lift but I knew this before I booked. Not an issue for me but may be to some.Definitely recommend and would stay here again.

Stayed 3 nights. Check-in is actually a few doors down at the Phoenix. Room 18 was clean, but down in basement next to the street & completely isolated from the rest of the rooms, which was unnerving. Shower head nozzles were clogged & shot in every direction except the way needed, making the bathroom floor slippery. Location is ok if using the tube, but otherwise prepare to walk a distance to attractions. The best attraction is Prince Albert monument near Kensington Palace.

One of the smallest rooms I stayed in but new bathroom, nice decor in the room and quiet location make this a nice place. When it was incredibly hot all day, I slept with an open window without being disturbed. Nice staff who were helpful.Great value even though breakfast was not included. There was no closet in my room and no safe.

Chose this hotel very carefully after reading the good reviews on here. When we arrived the hotel was beautiful very appealing lovely staff and all seemed well. However was told at check in we'd been moved next door to their sister hotel which on impressions of the reception thought ok fine. We couldn't see the room as was too early but they assured us our bags etc would be moved there and all would be well. We were in London to see take that at the 02 .. we got back to the "sister" hotel at 1 in the morning to be shown to a very outdated shabby room with our cases missing ! Guy on reception was very nice and showed us more rooms but to be fair they were all shabby and not like the images we had based our booking on. We were very disappointed this was a treat for my friends 50th birthday and I felt very let down and annoyed this wasn't what I had booked. The positives though were the staff were very professional and nice but the overall stay was spoilt . I would be very careful if you book this place that they take your booking and mislead you by moving you next door.

When in London, we use to go to nearby Phoenix hotel; this time it was full, so we choose its "sister" hotel. And must say that the choice was very good. The hotel looks recently renovated, and the room we had, on the top of the building, was probably the most spacious I ever had in central London, same with the bathroom; very nice decor, beautiful view on the square, in the room there is also a fireplace, to make a better ambience. Very comfy beds. There is no elevator in the hotel, so you gotta climb a bit, but was not a problem at all. The only improvement I could see was the water flow of the shower, and wifi was not regular all the time.The ladies at reception extremely nice and helpful, very good staff at both Kensington Gardens and Phoenix (in the evening the Phoenix reception works for K.G. guests, too). In a nutshell, a recommendable hotel at a reasonable price, in a very nice, central area. Would certainly return.

This is a must stay hotel in London. Minutes from Kensington Palace and Hyde Park. The staff from the time you arrive until you leave is amazing!!!! You can walk to the tube or they can call a cab for you and have better rates than most. I highly recommend staying at this hotel. The rooms are clean and comfy and has private bathrooms and heat and AC in the rooms. Don't miss this gem!!!!

For the price you pay this hotel got everything you need. Very small room but comfy. Everything was perfectly cleaned, upon arrival and during our stay. Located in a nice neighborhood with 2 metro stations close by (5min walking).I definitely recommand it, and will gladly stay there again!

pros.stayed 2 weeks for business. Good location with 2 tube lines (bayswater station & queensway stn) within 5 to 10 min walk. Good variety of food choice nearby. supermarket also. Seems a safe area. clean & comfortable stay for a 2 star hotel. bring your own toothbrush etc. cons.1.staircase not easy for elderly.2.wooden floor (though carpeted) but still not good sound proof ... I guess is not avoidable due to building structure. luckily during my stay upstairs is good. but door closing carelessly and TV may still hv sound pass through. May be a concern for those with good ears.3. no reception during night time, need go to next door Phoniex hotel for assistance.

The Hotel is lovely and well worth the price. I contacted them before I arrived in London to ask if I could tentatively extend my stay from the two nights I originally booked. The wonderful staff contacted me and said they would keep a room if they had a cancelation. I can't speak highly enough of the beautiful lady on reception, she was full of advice and could answer all my questions.The hotel is immaculately clean, the rooms are small but perfect for the solo traveller and the bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is modern and the shower is hot. This hotel delivers everything I required with a friendly welcoming professionalism.

Nicely located near two tube stations, Bayswater and Queensway. Spotless clean, recently refurbished, very nice service and kind people. I stayed in apt. number 10 which is a small single with shower in suite. There are some perks: clean towels, new soap bars, shampoos and conditioner every day. Also the kettle and hair dryer work fine and they supply some biscuits, tea and cocoa powder so you can have a snack if you in a hurry. Only downsides are there is no lift and no 24h concierge, so you have to leave your keys in the lobby of the next door hotel (Phoenix). It is not a big problem, but when you are tired and with packaging it can be a bit of a burden. Will be back for sure.

Lovely Hotel in a very quiet spot. Super old building with decor in keeping with the period. Spotlessly clean rooms and modern bathrooms. Comfy beds, had a great night sleep. Only downsize is no lift and we were on the top floor! Very good value for money, would recommend.

I visited London for the first time and chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. I had a lovely stay here. The location is good as Bayswater, Queensway and Notting Hill Gate underground stations are all within a walking distance. The service was very friendly. The room was very warm and not at all damp, as many buildings in London tend to be. Eveything was clean and the bed was comfy. Would go here again.

Normally I stay at the phoeinx hotel but it was full and I was offered the hotel that adjoins the phoeinx. Both hotels are managed by the same people and I have to say both have the same high standards of service,cleanliness. The location of both these hotels is great ,really handy for tube stations, plenty eating places etc. Everybody really helpful and friend

This was the cutest hotel in Kensington. Great location with it being a few blocks away from the shops and restaurants. It is about 5m walking from the Bayswater tube stop. Rose was great. she greeted me with a smile and made feel at home. There is a breakfast next door at their sister hotel, The Phoenix Hotel. I highly recommend this hotel. I received a great price as well booking through Orbitz

Stayed here for a night on business. Lovely cosy hotel which was spotlessly clean. Easy to get into the City by the nearby tube station and would be great as a base if you want to go sight seeing. No bar or restaurant but just next door is the sister hotel so you can go there and use their facilities. Receptionist was very helpful and welcoming. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to London.

Its in a perfect location to reach the main attractions of London, there are 3 subway stations nearby, restaurants, cafes, 7/11 s. The hotel offers a decent service and accommodation for an average traveler, who is not spending the whole day in the hotel room. wi-fi, shower, heating, TV were ok. I had a great sleep there,stuff were very helpful young people. This is a very good option for its price, considering it's one of the most expensive area of London.

Just returned from our stay we had 3 double rooms booked all clean and well maintained. Staff were lovely and very welcoming. Location was good 2 mins from bayswater tube but that was one of the slowest stations so we choose to use queensway 2 mins further away. Quiet street and will definitely return. Beware of the stairs!!! Very hard trip to top floor after a day of walking

The Kensington Gardens Hotel is a wonderful hotel in a great area. The hotel was very clean and quaint and the staff couldn't be more accommodating. For the price, you can't beat it. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

The hotel is located in a flat in a wonderful part of London. The hotel is close to the action of downtown but also slightly removed. It is on a quiet, tree lined street. It is very close to two tube stations. It was about 20-30 minutes to Tottenham Court Rd and Covent Garden on the tube. I don't recommend taking a taxi or uber from downtown to the hotel as the traffic makes the price too high. The only downside is the room is very small but we expected that coming into the hotel. The bathroom was lovely and very modern. The room was nice and warm. The rug into the hotel was a warm tone and very lovely. The staff was very nice as well.

The greeting on arrival at this hotel was one of the friendliest I've experienced! It's small, quiet and very clean. As previous reviewers have mentioned it's the sister hotel of The Phoenix next door, and after 5pm you pick up your key and gain entry etc via their desk. This arrangement sounded like a bit of a faff, but actually everyone was so friendly and helpful I didn't mind (and a late night phone call to my room was successfully transferred via The Phoenix's front desk). The room was comfortable, warm and clean, with a nice soft bed and good bedding. It was very small but the bathroom was nearly the same size! Shower was excellent. It's on a quiet residential road, but there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby, plus it's only a few minutes' walk to Bayswater and Queensway tube stations. Would recommend.

Lovely setting away from busy Kensington High Street. Service professional and efficient. Food tasty, well served. Good menu selection. Bar service was good, I always like when olive & nuts are served with drinks. Would be happy to recommend.

My friend and I stayed at Kensington Gardens Hotel for 5 nights in the middle of July, and we loved it. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. As it is the sister hotel to Phoenix Hotel (literally right next next door) you do have to go to Phoenix for breakfast (which was like any other hotel breakfast, you could get continental or hot cooked food) but there is so many restaurants and pubs that do English breakfasts that you can choose from on the main street just down the road from the hotel. You also have to leave your keys with the reception staff when you leave and if you get back to the hotel after 5pm be aware that you do have to collect the keys from Phoenix hotel! Also there is no elevator and some may find the stairs to be steep, so if you have many or heavy bags you might want to ask for a lower floor. The rooms were clean (looked recently refurbished) and looked just like the pictures provided by the hotel. We stayed in a room with two single beds with two large suitcases and found that was more than enough room considering we were really only in the room to sleep anyway! There was no aircon or ceiling fan, but we found that if we had the small fan (found in the closet) and opened a window the temperature was perfectly fine (although we are from Australia so we are used to extremely hot weather!). There's free wifi too which was more than adequate for us to use simply for basic internet browsing and uploading some pictures to facebook.Great location too, a short walk from Bayswater station made it easy to navigate around London; short walk to many restaurants and pubs; and obviously a short walk from Kensington Gardens which was amazing. Would definitely recommend and stay here again!

I really wanted to like this hotel... From the 3 flights of stairs (no elevators, and keep in mind in much of Europe it's ground floor then first floor); no AC (ok, I get it, it's UK); to the parties neighborhood kids have until 3am; it's hard not to complain. When I arrived via Bayswater station (quick and easy to get to the hotel), there was no reception. Another traveler had to tell me to go next door to the Phoenix Hotel to check in. That was odd, but I'm flexible and have seen this before. I got my keys and went back next door. "Ok, three flights. How bad can it be?" I'm in decent shape, but after a day of flying, I was huffing and puffing when approaching my room with my heavy carry-on and backpack (I'm on business). It was hot inside (rare to get high 80F sort of weather in London). Good thing I found a fan in the closet. The windows were ajar and fixed to open a certain size for safety. I had really a great view of the garden and the neighborhood building. Quaint and cute. I loved the neighborhood and I feel it really expresses what London is about what the cultural mix. I've been trying to stay fit while in travels so I found an awesome organic supermarket down the street. I needed some meat, so I dropped by a Lebanese restaurant for some chicken taouk (try it). That was my sans carbs dinner. It was perfect to walk more through the area and explore the local scene. By 9pm I was ready to crash and get a good night's rest flying in from SFO via Copenhagen. It was a long day and I needed to get a lot done the next day around town. It's ironic that right when I turned out the lights, kids and their bumpin' cars kept coming and going. Lots of laughter and showing off their stereo system.... Until 3am. I couldn't exactly close my windows bc it's be too stuffy (remember, no AC) and what could the hotel staff do for street clamor? (Sad face)I did not get much rest. The saving grace was that I was able to find some awesome empanadas and a great latte down the street for breakfast. In the future, I wouldn't mind staying in the area again, but not this hotel. Sorry... A good night's sleep Trumps charm.

We normally stay at the sister hotel The Pheonix Hotel next door but were offered accommodation at The Kensington after leaving the booking a bit late! What a treat - lovely rooms and you can still use the bar facilities at the Pheonix.Highly recommended

This is a centrally located hotel close to the tube and major museums. However our room which contained a double bed should have been a single room. The bed was jammed up against the wall and no bedside tables on either side as there was no room. The hotel did offer to change the room but when booking just be aware that some rooms are very small for two people. With my arms outstretched and holding my iPad in one hand I could touch both walls! Otherwise all good. Staff friendly and helpful. Just ask about the room size!!

I stayed 2 nights at the end of May.I arrived early as I came into London on a night flight. I couldn't get a room until noon so I just sat in the lounge until it was ready. Otherwise I was happy with my accommodation. It was a small but clean, comfortable room and surprisingly quiet. I didn't really fancy sharing a bathroom but I knew when I booked, that the single budget room wasn't an ensuite. I would pay the extra for an ensuite if I had been staying longer. Staff were pleasant and helpful. I would stay again if in London.

This hotel was very quaint and the location made it well worth it. Aneel and Eliana at the front desk were exceptional and helpful, the other staff were also very friendly.Our room consisted of 2 twin beds and one full bed, the room itself wasn’t big, but it suited our needs namely sleeping. The bathroom was small but we made it work. The big downside for me was getting into the tub. It was high and I am short, but again I made it work. In the bath room they had the shampoo/conditioner, body wash, hand cream and hand soap.There was no coffee maker but there was electric pot to boil water as there was instant coffee and tea, a small refrigerator but no microwave. The room also had an ironing board, iron and hair dryer.The lobby was nice and there was a small bar and there was an on site Indian restaurant, Light of India. I highly recommend this restaurant if you like Indian food. Only other downside was the elevator (lift) was very, very small. As for location the was the best. The subway (tube) station was caddy corner to the hotel. Down the street there were many restaurants. KFC, Burger King, a Lebanese restaurant, Nandos Chicken (amazing), Starbucks, etc. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel and would truly recommend it.

2 night stay due to an event at the Royal Albert Hall. Easy walking distance from the Royal Albert Hall. On the door step of the Gloucester Rd tube. Staff are excellent friendly and efficient. Room was on 2nd floor had aircon and a window that opened. Good size room with tea and coffee facilities. Good breakfast included don't bother with the extra options.

We had the pleasure of recently staying 4 nights at the Montana and recommend it to anyone visiting London for the touristy stuff.The hotel is a 3 minute walk to the Gloucester Tube stop that can get you anywhere in London with ease. There are enough nearby pubs and restaurants for dinners and the hotel breakfasts are very good. By the way, the onsite restaurant serves delicious Indian food in the evenings; don't rule it out just because it is in the hotel.The hotel itself has the typical small lobby bar perfect for a drink at the end of an afternoon or evening. The rooms are tight but charming with nice linens and comfortable beds, and every employee was friendly and helpful. A gem in this class of hotel, a great value, and I would return on my next London visit.

We arrived about 2pm on a Monday. As everything had been paid in advance, check in took a matter of minutes. We were given a room in the basement, accessible via stairs off the bar. The room had two twin beds, a desk and bureau, small refrigerator, closet, TV, and a bathroom with full bathtub and shower and large medical cabinet. It was incredibly spacious by London standards. Of course, not all was glorious: the room was very warm and humid even with air conditioning cranked as low as it could go, and our window view looked upon a nasty-looking cement drainage basin between buildings. I kept the curtains closed. A minor issue, all considered, but worth noting.The room was nice and quiet. Few rooms were along that hallway so there was little foot traffic, and no street traffic near us at all. I actually slept pretty well.Everything in the bathroom worked without issue. We loved having a fridge in our room--there's a great Waitrose right across the nearest intersection, which made it easy to stash food and drinks in our room! The front desk staff was very pleasant whenever we passed through. Room service did a good job whenever they came by each day.The breakfast buffet was included with our room package. The best way to describe it is "meh," as it largely consisted of generic, made-long-in-advance foods like you'd find at a cheap motel chain breakfast buffet in the US. The only stand-out was the strawberries, which were fresh and fantastic. The staff there was nice and eager to help, but the mediocre food just didn't make it worthwhile to utilize again.The hotel's location is absolutely fantastic. It's just across the street from the Gloucester Road tube station. This was an easy connection point into the city, and on the direct Piccadilly line to Heathrow. Within walking distance are numerous restaurants of various ethnicities and price points, plus several great museums. We enjoyed the short walk up to Kensington Palace and Hyde Park. The neighborhood felt very safe.

Good, clean, basic room with excellent front desk staff and location. Stayed three nights recently. You will get a basic room in a converted townhouse. Since it is not a purpose-built hotel, it has its design quirks. For the price I did not expect luxury accommodations. The room was clean and served the purpose. What really was important was the location. You can practically see the hotel from the Gloucester Road tube station entrance (on the Piccadilly line with direct access from Heathrow) and that is a major plus from my perspective when traveling with luggage -- no taxi necessary. Finally, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful with what seemed like a genuine interest in helping me and my family enjoy our stay in London -- another major plus in this price range. Would stay here again.

Stayed at this great Hotel for 5 days in May 2019. Fabulous Location in Kensington. The Hotel is a 3 minute walk to Gloucester Road Metro, which is on the Piccadilly Line which is a direct line from Heathrow Airport. Very Convenient !!! Bus stop 3 minutes walk away which will take you to a miriad of locations if you prefer overground transport. Excellent eateries in immediate area including Pret A Menger, Starbucks, and 2 great English Pubs. We did not eat in the Hotel Restaurant as we do not do ‘big English breakfasts’ and even though the dinner menu looked very interesting it was Indian cuisine which is not to our taste. The room was excellent. As with most accommodation in London the room was not oversized however it had everything you need. Most importantly for us it had a fridge, safe, tea making and very good WiFi and room to store our luggage. Very clean room and fabulous reception staff. The Hotel did have a LIFT - small but an absolute must for us. Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

I stayed at this hotel twice last year, in July and again in October. The second time, the receptionists recognised me, which was really amazing, seeing they have so many customers. I was recognised again when I stayed with them a few weeks ago. Not only that, but they upgraded me from a room with a shared bathroom to one with en suite. In addition, at first, both in October last year and this again year, they didn't think they had two rooms available for me and the other member of my party for the full time I wanted to stay, but they juggled things around so that we were able to stay there for the whole time (five nights last October, four nights in May.) I can't fault the service, the comfort of the beds, the cleanliness of the hotel, and. of course, the location, which is wonderful. I was given a great deal with the price, better than my travel agent was able to get, perhaps because I rang the hotel direct, I'm not sure, All in all, a great place to stay.

Lovely little hotel, fantastic location to the tube, hop on hop off tour busses, easy to Heathrow via the tube, very friendly staff, lots if neat little restaurants and pubs nearby. Really turned to be a great stay.

This hotel has to have the best staff in London. Helpful, courteous, friendly, they are amazing. Rooms were spacious for London, clean, and the hotel is very close to the Big London Museums. It is also close to Gloucester Road underground, so exploring other areas of London is very easy. One of the London tourist (hop on, hop off) busses stop right outside. Very nice Indian restaurant attached where residents receive a discount, and a nice small bar area where again, residents receive a discount.

Really rather dated (white gloss paint that's lost its whiteness) and really not good enough for the price. Got that unmistakable stale hotel smell. Staff polite. Needs makeover for the 21st century...

A smaller hotel without the extras like a pool...but this is made up for by the Staff. Super helpful & went to great lengths to make us feel at home. Kampus & Iliana were so helpful & personable with great travel tips & tips on everything London! Absolutely will stay at this place again!

We spent four nights in April here and were extremely pleased with the hotel. Decorated in deep reds and gold, and with crystal lighting fixtures and deep mouldings in common spaces, the hotel has a charming, old world vibe. We asked for a quiet room and were delighted with a spacious family room at the back of the hotel - no view, but then we were in the room only to rest and sleep and the quiet room afforded that! As the building is older, rooms do vary considerably, so contact the hotel directly if you have specific requirements or needs. We were well satisfied with cleanliness. We loved the free loaner phone, which allowed us to navigate London streets without draining the battery on our personal mobiles. Staff was uniformly helpful and friendly, but a special call-out goes to Iliana who set the bar high for exceptional customer service! Our room had adequate television, a nice kettle with coffee and tea service, a small mini fridge (great for families!), a table with chairs, and a safe in the armoire. We used the 15% discount in the Indian restaurant on the premises and thought the meal good. Breakfast was probably the only dent in the stay. It was perfectly adequate, but there is an upcharge of £2 per person for full English. I asked if I could pay the charge and get just eggs with continental toast, fruit, and yogurt and was told no. Quality of the continental spread was average. The hotel is just a minute from the tube, a Waitrose grocery store, and the wonderful French bakery chain Paul, and there are many restaurant options nearby. It’s a ten minute walk max to V&A and not much longer to Kensington Gardens and Prince Albert Hall. If coming from Heathrow, you can stay on the Piccadilly tube line the entire way. All in all, we felt this hotel has the best location of anywhere we’ve ever stayed in London. We’ll be back!

The location was perfect - in a great, safe neighboorhood with things to do right there and a tube stop right one block away. The staff were very helpful and welcoming. The restaurant (with 15% discount) was fantastic. London prices being high generally, I think the cost for staying here was reasonable.

Our family stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It is a lovely older hotel. Clean, comfortable and very friendly staff. The train station is steps away. Many wonderful restaurants nearby as well.We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to London

We were not staying at this Hotel but had a fantastic breakfast.The staff were so welcoming particularly Fahid so much so on our next visit to London the Montana would be our choice of Hotel. The property was pristine also great location with Gloucester Road Metro Accross the road

For the past 20 years, I have been staying at the Montana Hotel whenever my travels take me to London. The facilities are clean and of a great standard, the staff are always extremely accommodating and do everything in their power to assist guests to make their stay enjoyable. On my most recent stay, I arrived at the hotel in the early hours of the morning, coming straight from a very long flight from Australia, feeling very tired and in need of a shower. They were kind enough to allow me to have a shower while I waited for my room to become available. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, along with grocery stores, a travel information centre across the street, laundry facilities just down the road and the Gloucester Road tube station less than two minutes from the hotel. I really can't recommend this hotel highly enough.
