We arrived early in Saturday morning and the hotel were happy to look after our bags as rooms weren't ready. They organised tickets for the Original Bus Tour which the stop was literally outside the hotel. The tube station is a stones throw away from the hotel too. Plenty of cafes, restaurants, supermarkets with within walking distance also. When we got back to hotel out rooms had been upgraded which was a lovely surprise. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. It was a little bit noise as our room was facing the street but I'm not a great sleeper in hotels. The hotel offered breakfast but we chose to go to a cafe down the street. The hotel bar and lobby is lovely and quaint. Not too big and has a small bar. We ate in the hotels Indian restaurant which was really lovely and would definitely recommend it. In the rooms was a phone which you could take out with around London and you could find places to visit, book tickets, restaurants cafes etc. It's a great idea but unfortunately nobody told us about it and it wasn't until the last day that we discovered this. The staff in the hotel were extremely friendly, welcoming and very easy to deal with. Very attentive and i would definitely be back again to stay as would most of the party in the group.

Clean, comfortable room with great amenities and all an easy stroll to Kensington Palace, Exhibition Road (museums!!) and the Royal Albert Hall. The Gloucester Road underground station is right across the road, so getting around town is a breeze. The staff at the hotel and in the restaurant (delicious food!) therein were fantastic. I ended up cancelling another booking elsewhere in London so I could return here after a trip out of the UK. Great value...will definitely make this my "base" again when I return to London.

Easily missed from the road, the moment you walk in the doors you are greeted with a style and class that speaks of yesteryear. Gold silk wallpaper paired with rich red upholstery and beautiful cut glass chandaliers, the hotel is beautifully appointed inside and out. We were greeted at the desk by Aneel who was incredibly helpful in arranging a street view and offering discounts at the lovely house bar and first class indian restaurant (treat yourself you won't regret it).The hotel even handled large tour groups with ease. The room is beautiful, large and spacious with a great bathroom, nice big TV and a great view of the historic church just across the road. Breakfast here is amazing with a lovely continental range and bacon and eggs on offer. The hotel is right near the underground and only a couple of minutes from supermarkets, and lovely cafe's and event the tour buses. 10 out of 10 would easily stay here again and recommend for any who want to stay in inner London.

The hotel staff were warm and very welcoming. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and efficient. We didn't have breakfast but we did dine in the restaurant on our second night and the food was amazing!. The location of this hotel is fantastic for pretty much everything. Thete are lots of restaurants around the hotel to suit any taste. The Museums are a short five minute walk, the tube station is literally across the road. Given the location and comfort level of this hotel the rates are more than reasonable. This is definitely our "go to hotel" from now on - please don't change a thing!!!

It started the moment I walked in. Maria was warm and welcoming. My single room was small, clean, comfortable, quiet, and well designed. My shared bathroom was spacious and clean. The breakfast was good. The buffet was a little difficult to negotiate due to my diabetes. Gosia, Justyna, and Natalia helped me with some other choices. Wonderful focus on the customer.The location is perfect! Two bus stops (49 and 74) and the Gloucester Rd. tube stop are right by the hotel

I stayed in November last year for a short business trip, the staff were very helpful and spent time with me looking at food options. The room was very clean and tidy with everything that I needed, unlike some other very expensive hotels! I found a good parking option at the Holiday Inn locally through ParkBee.com, everything I needed was within walking distance or a short Hackney ride (wouldn’t touch Uber with a barge pole!). Over all a great experience, thank you :-)

We stayed here one night and that was too long. On first looks the hotel was in a good location near restaurants and museums, the big bus tour just down the road, but if you want a good night's sleep I would avoid, the traffic at the front of the hotel at night I could cope with but the paper thin walls were awful, we could hear everything the family next door were doing and saying from having a bath to going to toilet.

Had researched hotels for our short break in London. We knew it to be a great location for the Underground (Gloucester Road 3 min walk) We also knew the Montana Hotel was within 10 min walk of the Natural History Museum (Get there early! It can get claustrophobic. The V & A was a wonder of the modern world and its contents filled with wonders of the ancient world.The Hotel lived up to its website, images. The reception, breakfast and cleaning staff were magnificent.. They were polite attentive. Thank You for a great stay Colin and Sue

Good service and food was great and staff was very welcoming and friendly and is a regular visit for customers, special thanks to Ahmed for his kind nature towards us. Many customers spread the word about this restaurant because of the kind staff and the tasty food which is too the highest quality and is served within 15 minutes.

Quirky little hotel with a warm heart. From the greeting on reception through to all members of staff, everyone was cheerful and helpful. The room we were allocated was small, with a tiny shower room. On request We were offered 2 others to view and choose from. We booked direct with hotel so continental breakfast was included. On the day we upgraded to inc full English for £2pp. Great location for walking to Albert Hall, Kensington Gardens and a good range of restaurants are just across the road. Or you may choose to dine in their Indian restaurant.

We booked the Montana through booking.com. The price was fantastic and the level of service was high! Location is fabulous and perfect for the Albert Hall. The Indian restaurant Light of India is exceptional and the staff made recommendations based on our likes. Ruhel looked after us! Thanks x

My wife and I have just returned from a one night stay at this hotel whilst in London to see the Cirque Du Soliel at the Albert Hall on the 22nd of January. On arriving at the hotel we were made to feel welcome immediately. The gentleman at reception was extremely courteous, helpful and professional.He took our luggage to our room which was greatly appreciated and then proceeded to give us all the information about our room, the hotel and the surrounding area; he could not have been more friendly. The level of service provided by him and all other staff during our stay was excellent.Our room was on the ground floor just behind reception and we were completely satisfied with it, It was cosy and spotless and suited all our needs. There was a small refrigerator for our use, tea and coffee making facilities, television and a courtesy smart phone for free calls if needed during the stay. Maps of London and places of interest were also provided. The shower room was small but perfectly adequate and spotless. Plenty of white towels were provided. The room contained a double bed and a single bed (we obviously only needed the double bed which was comfortable) and had enough space for our needs. There was plenty of drawer space and clothes hanging space. We did not have an evening meal at the adjoining restaurant but did have the continental breakfast the following morning which was perfectly adequate. The staff at breakfast were attentive, friendly and efficient. Our morning toast was brought to us and our coffee topped up regularly. The staff really should be congratulated on the level of service they provided. The Montana really should be proud of the level of service provided during our stay. The location of the Montana is excellent. Close by is Gloucester Road tube station) literally you cross two roads and you are there) and there are also bus stops even closer. There are plenty of shops, cafes etc., close by. We would definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to London if rooms are available; it exceeded our expectations and for that we would like to thank all staff at the Montana for making our stay a memorable one.

Great place to stay. Comfi room, near of Gloucester Tube station,tesco and Argos at 5 minutes walkind from NHM and V&A museum. The hotel is safe as the area. Every day my room was cleaned. They lend a mobile phone for free,to be used during your visit to the city . the staff is very friendly

The Montana Hotel was a welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle of London. We walked up from Gloucester tube station and the hotel is literally a 2 minute walk across the street. Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly and knowledgeable concierge that shared with us all we needed to know to make our stay enjoyable. The lobby is a comfortable, old world space lovely for chatting or enjoying a cocktail. The location is wonderful and within reasonable walking distance to V & A Museum, Harrod's and HTB, just to name a few. So many excellent restaurants, patisseries, coffee houses, shops plus the easy access to the tube made our stay most memorable. We had one ground floor room and one on the top floor. Both were cozy and comfortable with everything one would need such as hairdryer; coffee/tea service; mini frig; TV and best of all a mobile phone for use while a guest at the hotel! The ability to have a city map, gps and to make local and international calls for no charge was fantastic! The Light of India restaurant in the hotel was some of the best Indian food I have had-and you receive a discount as a hotel guest! Our waiter Anan was superb as was the food. There is an extensive wine and cocktail list to choose from as well. Overall I feel the Montana Hotel is an excellent choice and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Stayed with my daughter for 1 night. The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk from Gloucester road tube.Lovely feel as you enter the hotel of cosy warm charm - the decor is in hues of red and gold throughout the hotel and has obviously been recently decorated to a very high standard.Very nice greeting at reception, lovely room clean and comfy - the bathroom was spotless, very quiet even tho we overlooked the road. We ate in the adjoining Indian restaurant and the food was delicious with excellent service. Breakfast was continental and also delicious served by extremely polite staff. Overall I was very impressed and will definitely stay here on our next visit.

Awesome hotel.Great facilities, excellent service and wonderful location. Great option for lodging!Special mention to the official Kempes who attended us in a polite and spectacular manner, certainly elevated our experience in London.

Highlights:Grate locationFriendly staff Clean Down-lights:family (2+1) room was small Very bad sound isolation WiFi was extremely slow (we could make online check in)Free mobile was not available Overpriced

I have often stayed in this part of London and have stayed in this hotel a few times. Very close to Gloucester Road tube station, restaurants and supermarket. Reception was friendly, rooms clean. Indian restaurant was excellent!!! I hope to return someday.

I was in London for a concert at the Royal Albert Hall. The hotel is situated about 15 minutes walk from the Royal Albert Hall, also from Kensington Park and Hyde Park. I came by train with Eurostar, underground station is right across the street. VERY FRIENDLY AND POLITE PERSONNEL. My room had all facilities. I had dinner in the restaurant of the hotel, "the light of India". Personnel here also very friendly and kind, range of choice of food was good, had lovely and not too spicy dinner. I WILL DEFINITELY / ABSOLUTELY COME BACK !!!

I have often stayed in this part of London but never here. It was a good decision, for instance the hotel is an easy short walk from the very well connected Gloucester Road tube station.Reception were friendly and efficient and the wifi worked well enough for a busy work session. The room was a little dated though the bathroom was more modern. Everything functioned well enough and the bed was comfortable. Price wise it was a little less than the surrounding bigger hotels but I thought the overall package was good and will return.

Found the Montana Hotel after a desperate search on booking.com to find a moderately priced room in Kensington with air condition during the massive heatwave seen at the end of June. I booked a classic double room for one night. I arrived early and was able to check-in thanks due the friendly, helpful staff. After finishing my day hiking the Cliffs of Dover, it was so refreshing to return to a room with air condition!!! Would have extended my stay an extra night at the Montana Hotel, but they were fully booked. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for those looking for a moderately priced hotel in the Kensington area. It was very convenient for the Tube, shops, restaurants, and pubs.

I had an economy single, and it sure was economy, very narrow. The lack of a private bathroom was more of a problem than i realized. The staff was helpful. Breakfast cost extra and was not interesting, the croissants were tasteless. They had the gall to charge extra for eggs! But the neigborhood was very attractife and vibrant with a nearby pub and other conveniences.

Stayed with my daughter and my grand-daughter, who was anxious to visit the nearby Natural History Museum.The open-topped bus and red bus stop was just outside the hotel. The tube station is just metres away so it was perfect for visiting all of London. Hotel has a restaurant and there are several other restaurants, cafes and shops nearby, including a well known chain next door for kids who love pizza/pasta!Staff were really helpful and very friendly. They looked after our bags before/after stay so that we could still continue sight-seeing and they arranged our transfer when we left.The room was clean and tidy. It had a TV and a fridge and tea/coffee-making facilities - complimentary mineral water would have been nice. The free wi-fi was good but we only used it for basics and there was a smart phone that you could borrow. We didn't have a big room but was fine for a short stay and it had three beds so we didn't need to share. Our room was at the front and had some traffic noise but the hotel is on a busy road so we expected that. Beds were comfortable (strange to go back to blankets - not as comfy as a duvet) and there were spare pillows, etc. There was a simple selection of toiletries in the bathroom but we used our own and there were plenty of clean, white, fluffy towels. We had an ironing board but there wasn't a lot of hanging space in the wardrobe because of the "extras" stored there. As it was a mid-priced hotel, we thought it was good value for money, not luxury but a comfortable room.Breakfast was a good continental and you could opt for a "full English" if you wanted. There were lots of staff to make service quick and easy. Staff brought toast and hot drinks and you could help yourself to the food. Being picky, Croissants could have been the fresh, flaky ones from a bakery (or the kitchen) but were OK and there was plenty of other choice so no complaints. Staff were very attentive to my grand-daughter, too. (I do miss marmite in many hotels - love it on toast!)We felt safe and happy staying at this clean and comfortable hotel. That was all that we needed for this particular trip so would happily recommend the Montana to other visitors.

Great price and great bathrooms, nice hotel for short trip and long trips, easy access to mass transport and great restaurants around Kensington and Gloucester st. There is indian cuisine at the hotel lobby. 6 minutes walking to the Natural History Musseum of London

We have stayef at Montana Hotel the last 26 years and it has always been very very good .Friendly staff, Nice rooms and excellent breakfast .We feel like home. The atmosphere is really nice and the hotel is close to the tube ( blue and green/yellow )Hanne and Per Henrik from Denmark

The hotel is very well located. Easy to walk to many of the sights such as Hyde Park, Kensington Palace and gardens, Harrods, etc. The only small thing is that some of the rooms are a little small. Our friends were in a twin room that was a little small more on the length side. The Indian restaurant in the hotel was very nice and very good.

This hotel is near the Gloucester Rd Tube - which serves three Lines making it quite easy to get around London and the tourist attractions. You are even provided with a smartphone to use outside the hotel. Staff are friendly and accommodating. I would especially like to personally thank the following hotel staff: Maria, Aneel, Kampas (manager) and Elvis. As well as the two waiting staff at the complimentary breakfast Gosia and Justyna who were almost maternal in making sure we had everything we needed duru\ing our breakfast, Thank you for the incredible stay. Sept 25 2018 to Oct 5, 2018.

We were 4 ladies and we stayed at this Hotel on October 2 to 5, very good and safe neighborhood.We were near to everything ... we walked to Kensington Park ... Hyde Park ...The excellency of this hotel, we would go back anytime to the hotel.The restaurant attached to the hotel >>> Light India. We were not familiar with Indian cuisine, the food was extremely good, the service excellent.We give this hotel an excellent rating.Carole + 3

My sister and I spent a week, location was great. Steps to Glouscester Rd tube station, close to numerous bars, pubs, restaurants, Waitrose. While the room was tiny, it was well kept and the bathroom was a good size. The front desk staff were wonderful and very helpful whenever we had questions. Breakfast was good, selection of fruit, cereals, meat and cheese, bread, rolls, etc. The servers in the breakfast room were also very efficient and helpful.

Just returned from a four night stay at theMontana. Lovely little boutique hotel with a great location and friendly staff. Would definitely not have a problem staying there again.Great restaurant in the hotel where you get 15 percent of your cheque.

The Montana hotel is clean , cozy ,and the staff give you the most loveliest smiles ,the food is awesome and there are many options for vegetarians too , the room is clean , cozy and somewhere you can relax , I have gave 4 stars because the is always room for improvement but I fully recommend the Montana hotel ............. from neroli aged 9

Hotel Montana in South Kensington : allthough the hotel is a bit older, furniture not really new anymore our stay was super. Room size was OK, bathroom OK. Streetnoise : during the week it might be better to keep windows closed, during the weekend no problem. Breakfast restaurant is in the evening a nice and tastefull Indian restaurant : "Light of India", fine Indian cuisine.Friendly, good service as well in the morning as the evening. Situated at +/- 50m from an underground station. Excellent for visiting the city.

We are still guests of the hotel and we just have to congratulate the structure and all the staff, especially the boys and two girls (Italian) of the reception, all are very friendly and helpful, always ready to meet the needs of guests. The hotel is very clean and tidy, the beds are comfortable and the rooms have everything you need. The location is really strategic to move to London, just a few steps from the subway.

I have been travelling extensively for the last few years and have stayed in both pricey and budget hotels. The service rendered by Montana South Kensington was amazing. The bed was super comfy and the room (309) and bathroom were clean. They even provide a free data iphone for tourists staying here. The underground Gloucester Road station is practically across the road so this is very convenient. The receptionists are well-trained and polite. I was particularly impressed with the Italian lady at the front counter that helped me with a printing document. These are services that will make guests feel valuable and pleasant that sadly most hotels these days are lacking. Despite Montana labelled themself as a 3 star budget, this Indian-inspired hotel is a worthy 4 star in my books. My only regret is i did not stay longer. If you don’t stay here, it is your loss! Period.

The Gloucester Road tube station is just across the street, giving access to the Piccadilly, Circle and District lines. You can get anywhere in London from here! The neighborhood is safe to walk after dark with children, and there are numerous restaurants within easy walking distance. I recommend Pizza Express next door, and Raison d’Etra which is just a 5-8 minute easy walk away. Our room was on the top floor, so we appreciated the lift. The lift is tiny, so our party of 4 with luggage took 4 trips! The room was elegant and comfortable. Obviously updated and well maintained. The en suite was small but excellent quality. There is another full toilet and shower just down the hall, if a 2nd person in your room is in urgent need of the toilet! That one has a window, which is much appreciated. Leave your key at reception when leaving for the day’s adventuring. I’m a knitter, so I left small handmade gifts for the service staff along with the usual gratuity. I would definitely return here.

I spent almost the entire month of July here. I felt comfortable and at ease with the room accommodations and the people who work here.I have worked around commercial properties my entire career and though I would love to see a "cosmetic refresh" at the Montana, at the same time, I appreciate the Victorian vibe. The service, whenever I needed anything at all, was instantaneous. It is very clean and well maintained and the location is unbeatable. If you want your trip to provide convenience to stores and restaurants, walking distance to landmarks like Kensington Palace and world class museums, as well as the Gloucester Rd Underground to well, everywhere, this is it. I would not hesitate to recommend the Montana Hotel, and will stay here again.

When we arrived, our check in was delayed due to suite not being ready. The staff gave a voucher for drinks from the restaurant which was appreciated. The suite was of good size. Unfortunately, the shower had see through glass walls and anyone else in the room could see the person in shower which made it very difficult for us considering the age of our children. When we raised it with the hotel, we were initially advised that there is a button to make the shower walls opaque. There was no button and the hotel receptionist could not find either. Then we were told that the shower was made just like that. This meant that all the family had to move out of the room when one member was having shower. We requested for change of suite. The receptionist told it will be done but then we never heard back from them. We managed somehow although we could not understand the pathetic planning and purpose behind the showers. The buffet breakfast was good.

My Dad and I stayed here on a Wowcher deal. We had a lovely spacious room, 2 queen size beds, separate toilet, bath and separate shower cubicle. Very clean. The staff on reception were extremely helpful particularly Paul who sorted some travel issues for us. Breakfast was excellent, everything you could ask for and very nicely cooked. Excellent location by the docks, 5 min walk to DLR station to take you into town. Also 1 minute to the Sunborn Yacht Hotel where we had a superb afternoon tea. The Emirates cable car is a 3 minute walk too. Tesco express and Nisa are 1 minute out of the hotel for anything else you may need. A lovely stay.

The hotel is in a lovely location to go to the O2 arena. The staff are very good. The rooms, clean and big. It was all great for my stay. But, and I hate to have a "But!" I came back from a walk at 1500, and my room had not been done, strange thing. I called reception and informed the young man there, told him I need to rest, so not to send anyone until after 1800. Twenty minutes later a couple of lady's came to do the room. I told them "after 1800". At 1745 I left, and came back at 2230, only to find a bag with towels by my door, and the room had not been touched! That was the only negative to a very nice two days.

Looking for somewhere to stay near London airport give this one a miss unless you like to be ignored and like mouldy bathrooms.No point in being a gold loyalty member as the rewards are rarely available and then only when complaints are made.Was given a free drink voucher and told I could order any drink but at the bar an told no this is not the case as the offer us for only some drinks.Then waited in the restaurant with no menu offered, I had to ask. Then had to ask to order. Restaurant was not busy and at least 4 staff where chatting at the bar. Burger was very good. Had to ask again for the menu for dessert. the brownie for dessert was just a piece of stale, dry chocolate cake. Had to ask for the bill Not once was I asked if I would like anything.Requested a wake up call as I had any early flight. That never came.There is no conceriege to speak to as it is all virtual. What's App for any requests - too bad if you don't use it or don't have a charged phone. Maybe could add some virtual wait staff too.Want help with luggage or a cab called - forget it.

Room was spacious and comfortable, everywhere clean and tidy. Breakfast was self-serve buffet with wide range of hot and cold food available. We took one evening meal in the Restaurant which also provided generous portions and well-cooked food at a reasonable cost. The location is ideal for the ExCel conference centre, which is just a 5 minute walk away. Hotel is on the flight path into City Airport but the planes are inaudible inside the building. 20 minute ride on DLR takes you into the heart of the City of London. We will use this one again.

Great Place to stay ... the rooms are spacious and the interior are very modern.. the view feom the window is amazing and the hotel is pretty close to the Metro Station..the breakfast spread is very good giving you a wide range dishes to choose from..on can order for egg as they like to have.. there are 3 foot massage machine which is a blessing for everyone..the staff is helpful..there are a number of restaurants and grocery stores close to the hotel..the cable car ride is 5mins from the hotel..*only problem was their Air Conditioning... it was not working when asked for help the said someone will be there but when someone did come after 30mins was a staff with table Fan. they later offered us another room but there also the Air Conditioning was not working so they suggested we opened the room window and sleepSeriously ... Please keep someone stand by to help for these issues

Stayed her the night for while at an exhibition at Excel.Perfectly placed fro Excel. bed was comfortable and the room showed a recent refurb. The shower was good but the controls fro overhead and handheld would benefit from being clearer.Breakfast had an excellent choice and the only gripe was that the hot food could have been hotter, the eggs were not so and therefore the meal lost its gloss, otherwise nothing bad to say. Would definitely look to stay again.

I stayed here for 3 nights last week as I had business at the Excel. Just a couple of minutes walk from the Excel its probably the nearest hotel to the exhibition centre so ideal location. I was really impressed with this hotel, the rooms were really large for London standards, housekeeping were excellent and I loved the large bathroom and huge shower (pleased to see you could frost out the glass screen!). My room was very warm and I found the air con unit a little lack lustre, and you can't open the windows. I also found it a bit stingy that they charge for bottled water in the rooms. Breakfast was excellent, plentiful and lots of choice and food in the evening was great, although the restaurant was closed every night of my stay so you could only eat in the bar, which was fine. I would say the wines on the menu are overpriced. The staff were without exception friendly and well trained. It was a pleasure to come back to this hotel after a very long day.

This hotel is perfect for the excel centre and 02 but a but far out of central London. It takes about 45 minutes to reach via the underground and DRL so if you have evening plans please factor this in. No complaints about the hotel, was really pleasant with an excellent choice for breakfast.

Special thanks to Asmena and Arnaud who made our stay extremely trouble-free. Our wasn't ready after 14.00 but they offered drinks from the bar on the house, an upgrade and a plate of chocolates in the room. The best experience so far in the West Europe.

the stay at london excel was absolute excellent and make me enjoy all time silent night times and top service all timeprovided food was in top quality, excelent breakfast as well as excelent dinner. the room was always in excelent condition

First the good points- Best location for the Excel center,within easy walking distance. The room size was excellent , very clean and the beds firm for comfortable. the front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. The bad points - ate at the restaurant both for breakfast and once for dinner. Breakfasts were not hot to start and went cold very fast. the dinner- service was dreadfully slow and the brought the wrong food out even though we pointed out on the very small menu exactly what we wanted as the description bad - 'vurger' for the vegan burger. Because both meals were brought out at same time one of us had to eat our meal alone or let it go cold whilst waiting for the correct meal to be brought for the other. We were offered no compensation for the mistake. The main issue in the room we had was the air cooling system. it did nothing but circulate the warm air in the room. Opening the window meant the noise from the outside was loud and the window wouldnt close properly without alot of force.

Unfortunately, I have had a bad experience at your Novotel in the Royal Victoria Dock.Ok, so before checking in, I called yourselves about my dietary requirements. I was informed by the person who answered the call after checking that you do provide halal chicken. I said to the gentleman on the phone, that if he could ring me back to DOUBLECHECK, that would be great. He replied that he would and took down my details. The next day, he called me and informed me that your hotel does provide Halal chicken, All of the chicken on ALL of the dishes that you serve is halal. So I was pleased to hear this.So on the 23rd, I came to check-in unfortunately I was unable to check in due to the pin on my card being entered incorrect. So I tried it 3 times and unfortunately it got blocked and declined. In the end my room was booked. however, I asked your reception staff whether I can still use the card in the bar or restaurant before I went to my room, he replied to me, that I would be able to use the card, because its using a different card reader/terminal station. (I didn't know what he meant by terminal station, so I apprehensively said 'oh..ok.'.I went to order a drink, believing what he said, and no surprise, the card got declined. So due to your colleague lying to me, I looked like a right idiot buying a drink and not being able to pay for it! So that really annoyed me.So after this I went to my room and OMG!! I was so disappointed in the quality of the room. it was soo small, very standard, had a horrible odour to it and the bath and showers looked like it was put in 40 years ago! The bed sheet had some marks on the bed, god knows what they were. I felt really uncomfortable and in the end I slept on the sofa bed. So a few things to complain about, but that wasn't the worst....I went to the restaurant later to get some dinner with my colleagues. I was keen to get some lovely chicken to eat. I was even saying to my colleagues that this restaurant is nice to cater to Muslims, especially in Ramadan (the time of month for fasting, 20 hours a day!) for his needs. So you had some great compliments coming from me, despite there was wrong information provided to me and the poor was is some serious low standards and poor hygiene. So the waiter came and asked me what me and my colleagues wanted to order, I ordered a salmon starter and a dish with chicken. At this point I thought I would DOUBLECHECK again. (This is the 3rd time I have checked at this point) Surprisingly, the waiter says, 'no sir, the chicken is not halal', I was confused, because I double checked this previously and told them, no you double check, i called the hotel a few days ago and they do provide halal chicken for ALL DISHES containing chicken. He went and checked in the kitchen and they told him, no only chicken on the pizza. this information was relayed back to me. I was confused.. I had checked with someone, they said its halal, I told them to doublecheck and call me back, he did and STILL said it is halal for ALL CHICKEN. I was soo annoyed with this. But I was with colleagues and I thought I would tell the general manager there and then, but I thought, no its ok. Order something else, something vegetarian. So I told the waiter, 'Ok, Since the chicken is not halal, could I have a vegan burger, he confirmed this and later on..he bought me a beef burger with BACON!! Now, not only is this order wrong, but he brought me some meat which is not halal, but he bought me a burger with bacon. I am not sure if you are aware of Muslims and the importance of avoiding pork. This piece of bacon was put right in front of me, whist I was about to break my fast. I couldn't believe the staff getting the order soo wrong and offended me soo much. You might as well have bought me coke and put wine in its place!! So all in all, a horrible and terrible experience with Novatel.What is your company going to do about this?Dishonest and not loyal, poor communication with colleagues, what happened to me could happen to anyone else.

Room fine, clean and functional. Breakfast expensive at £16.50. Particularly when most tables had not been cleared.Evening food service was shocking. They lost the order. As an apology we did get one meal free though. My email invoice was incorrect and the customer satisfaction survey follow up addressed to a completely different person! Then I was automatically added to their mailing list without consent.Overall not a good customer experience.

The check-in was smooth and easy, the staff despite being in busy environment (fully booked and Friday is usually the travel and arriving day for a lot of people) treated us lovely and showed no signs of stress so hats off to that. The lady that checked us in told us there might be 15 minutes delay with our room cards, we were absolutely fine with it - being quite tired after the travel, we happily basked in the sun rays in the beautiful bar area whilst drinking tasty cocktails. The sofa bed included in the room is extremely comfortable - very positively surprised.We thought we might go out but the room is so nice to stay in and comfortable that we did not bother haha! Saving energy for the weekend!It’s very lovely time during Comic-Con festival, plenty of fun people around! We will definitely be staying in this hotel for next MCM!!!

To whom it may concern, I am staying at Novotel in London. This is my worst experience with the brand of Novotel, as I am a regular traveller and a member of the Accorhotels. I want to draw your attention to the following 3 mismanagement things:1. Staff at the check-in desk both dishonest and deceiving2. Breakfast experience is just awkward!3. random people in the hotelAt the check-in I asked to give me a particular room, and the member of staff confirmed the room will be as asked. Upon arrival to the room I found that its completely different to what was asked and then promised. Breakfast. I book it hoping that I would experience the best service and breakfast. In fact - it was worse than in the Holiday inn. There was only eggs and bacon. All the rest was either close to its expiration or distasteful. And no service at ALL! Random people drink and laugh in the hotel disturbing stay. Those people flooded the hotel after some kind of a festival and were very disturbing. Worst ever stay!

Visited as a family for a concert at the 02 and an Excel visit. The hotel is very clean, modern and has a fresh look and smell. The reception staff were so friendly and helpful as were all staff. The room was perfect, immaculately presented. Nice touches are a fridge in the room with Still and sparkling water, and fresh milk. The children were given soft toys and headphones. Our room had views of the Excel and the Sunborn hotel next door as well as the dock area, as seen in the photographs.The hotel is ideally situated if you are visiting the Excel Centre and a few minutes walk away from the emirates cable car over to the O2 arena. Excellent transport links with the DLR again only a few minutes walk away.Good morning breakfast was diverse and perfectly adequate to start off the day. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Room was great, accessible for the train and city airport, breakfast was ridiculously expensive compare to the venues outside. Room was very quiet and clean. Hotel was easy to find- next door to the Excel centre

Excellent clean hotel, would definitely stay again. This was the start of our short trip to London to show our children the main sights of London in 24 hours. We chose the Novotel as it was close to the Emirates Cable Car Line which was the start of a whirlwind tour of London followed by the Thames Clipper down to The London Eye.The reception is large and immpressive, we had checked in online so the process took a couple of minutes. The children loved the foot massages at the bottom of the lifts.The bar was well stocked and had skysports. There was a good selection of bar meals to choose from, we had the pizzas, which were very tasty.The beds were comfortable and our youngest child (9) said she slept well on the sofa bed.The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choise and had views over the Thames Royal Dock, giving a great start to the day ahead. Overall an excellent stay which helped start our whistlestop tour of London Sights.

My wife was on business in London on Mother's day, so I called the hotel and asked if they could put a little special surprise in her room. I spoke with Sahara and she did a wonderful job. Sweets and rose petals, way more than she had told me about on the phone. My wife loved it. Thanks for making the day just that little special!

The stay was good overall, reasonably priced* hotel conveniently right next to ExCeL.(* for London!)Staff polite and helpful.Room was fairly simple but modern and clean with a safe.As is often the case the room was too warm for me and air-con/heating didn't help. I managed to prop a window open to get some cool air but not into the night - very loud aircraft frequently overhead (with windows closed the glazing was very effective at blocking this out).Breakfast was very good, buffet style english and continental. Food was pleasant and hadn't been cooked in advance and kept warm for hours as can be the case in some hotels.Will use again if going to Excel.

Firstly this hotel is pet friendly at an extra cost. The rooms are nice spacious enough with all mod cons. We booked this at the last minute as we hadn’t planned to be in this area but it all worked well. Excellent location with walks around the docks and restaurants also.The hotel restaurant and bar looked great also.Breakfast was lovely and fresh every staff member we dealt with could not do enough and was extremely professional such a breath of fresh air after a truly awful experience which actually was why we stayed here to begin with.We booked via phone the professionalism started there.Really had a great stay be aware the exit is quite narrow from the car park when you leave this is the only small comment I have.We will return as it’s convenient and ticks all the boxes Thank you great staff and great hotel

The hotel has excellent service, up to date amenities and spacious rooms. It is located within walking distance from the Excel Center in London and within 5 minutes from Custom House rail station. Very few restaurants around the hotel though.

The hotel was great' and the girl at the desk by the name Sahara was the nicest and the most helpful I've ever met in my entire traveling life. go there and ask for her! she changed our whole experience and made it so much better!

Arrived in the evening by local train. Just a short walk from the station. Luckily could see the hotel as the signposting is not the best.Lobby access via elevator, the lobby is on an upper floor. Nice bar area and all very spacious and modern.Arrived around 9pm, counters were staffed and checkin was fast. Got an update, which was a nice gesture considering that I stayed in total for only 6 hours.Suit with many windows and very comfortable. Great bed and bathrrom facilities.I have had an early flight and could not take breakfast, generally starting too late for a hotel which is close to an airport, even so it is only London City.Checkout in the morning was fine and fast as well. Called a cap for me, got easily to the airport.Considering the hotel prices in London this hotel is very cheap but still convinient, it is easy to go by train to the city. Airport City easy to reach. Good stay in London.

i cannot praise this hotel high enough everything from the staff the food the room was 1st class nothing was to much trouble for the staff i found the hotel bar very good and a happy relaxed surroundings but it was the staff that made it better for me very good

excellent hotel, great friendly staff. The rooms are excellent, proper, clean and trendy. Breakfast is excellent fresh and very compleet.Love come here if i am in London for work or leissure. Not too far from city airport or city centre.

Would I have chosen to stay here if I was visiting London for the weekend? No. However, if you are attending the Excel for a conference or concert, then look no further, the hotels location is perfect.The hotel itself is nice. It's clean and tidy and well appointed. However, if you are driving to the hotel, please be careful in the carpark as it's the most dangerous car park I have ever been in, in terms of space. Just to give you an idea, we had to fold our mirrors in just to get through the barrier and our car is a standard size. The scrapes and marks on the walls will show you where to be cautious.The room again was clean and tidy and well appointed and came with a bath (although not full size) and a walk in shower. The only thing missing from the bathroom was the toilet! This was tucked away in a separate room right next to the front door. This to be honest was a pain. They would be better off ditching the small bath and replacing it with a toilet. I know it doesn't sound much but when it's dark early in the morning and you have to trapes to the front door to find the toilet, then when you find it you have to squeeze your way in as it's that small, it can become a chore.That said, the room came with a kettle, minibar (payable), iron and ironing board, hairdryer and small TV. One good touch was there were USB charging points next to the bed, which was a bonus. One thing that did annoy me was the temperature of the room. It was just too hot. The aircon didn't work and the window only opened slightly for safety reasons. To be honest, I could not get a good night sleep for that reason and ended up clock watching all night.Breakfast was included in the rate and it was perfect. The restaurant was clean and tables were plentiful. The food was excellent and some of the dishes could be made to order. No complaints there at all.Would I stay here when visiting the excel again? Given that's it's a 5 minute walk away, maybe so. However, I did have a better experience staying at the Hilton last year, which was a 15 minute walk away, so maybe not.

Checked in and received a warm welcome , the room was lovely , the view was amazing , Breakfast the following day was good ,checkout friendly and efficient Would recommend, it’s everything you need from a hotel especially if your business is in excel

We have stayed here several times when attending Expos at the Excel. Great location, comfortable modern rooms, good breakfast. Very easy to get to and from City Airport too. DLR conveniently close by.

Well what can I say about this hotel apart from absolutely Amazing!!!! My partner and I stayed here last night for our anniversary and I wanted to make it extra special. I was in contact with the hotel to explain that I had a few things planned and needed the staff help to pull it off and WOW!!!! They went beyond the extra mile. I booked a Superior Queen Room and they upgraded our room to a Suite without my knowledge until I checked in. We have entered the room and they have made a love heart using some rose petals on the bed as well as 2 love swans. I had a bouquet of flowers delivered to hotel earlier and I had arranged when we went out that the hotel set up the room with the flowers and rose petals that I supplied them. On returning to the suite my Partner was amazed wowed and gobsmacked (very rare) with the amazing job that they did and they also did us complimentary Prosecco and a Happy Anniversary Cake. Sarah was the main part of this amazing night she has gone miles past the extra mile, but I would like to say a massive thank you to ALL the hotel staff and I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone. Once again thanks to all the staff and especially Sarah!!!!

Very basic hotel and I am quite surprised it is a 4 star! Unlike most 4 star premises it did not have a Nespresso coffee maker. There were no small face clothes, bath robes or slippers. The matress needs replacing as the springs are badly worn. The heating in my room was not working at all and even though I reported this it was not resolved. I refuse to pay £21-95 for breakfast that is sheer madness when I had a thoroughly decent full English in a cafe just 1 minute walk from the hotel! A very dissapointing experience !!

Very spacious and luxury hotel. First visit to a Novotel hotel and I was amazed by all of the hotel and staff were very friendly. I highly recommend this hotel especially if you are attending any events at the EXCEL!

As on previous occasions this was a perfect location. We had been to the Strictly performance at the O2 in the afternoon and it was just a short trip on the air line, and walk to the hotel. The staff were as welcoming as always and our room had a lovely view over the river. Breakfast was excellent though could have been a little hotter. Would we return - definitely YES>

I can’t recommend this hotel enough and even though it’s a budget price to stay the standard of the hotel is excellent. The rooms are large, clean and modern. The facilities, bar and foods are superb and lastly the staff are always amazing. On this trip Priscilla stood out, she was outstanding. Thanks for a great stay

Really nice, modern hotel with friendly staff. Very clean and welcoming!Obviously right next to the Excel but also handy for Canary Wharf which isn't too far away. Good choice of restaurants a few minutes walk away as well.

Just returned from 3 nights at this lovely comfortable hotel. Outside the city but just a couple of stops on the tube to anywhere in central London. Tube station at canning town short walk or dlr is close to hotel to bring you to canning town. Wonderful staff and lovely feet madsagers in lobby

Good hotel have stayed here many times and each time the hotel staff are very pleasant and accommodating. Rooms are always clean and beds very comfortable. It is also in a good location with DLR a short walk away that has connections to central London.

Clean,modern,good service with many facilities. Breakfast was perfect. In the restaurant was the food too spicy and just one women waiter, how was over work alone and did`t smile at all, could be more friendly. The wellness area was perfect, just sad that at 2 last nights the sauna was cold. Location is really nice and easy to get the tram and drive to the city.

I have stayed here a couple of times recently - once with my husband in a superior room and once with a friend in a standard twin. Both were comfortable and good value. Having a choice is good. The location is very good for the O2 and public transport and there are amenities such as a Tesco Express, alternative convenience store and a coffee shop nearby. There are other amenities but I did not visit these. What is particularly good is that if you are a loyalty card holder then the free drink voucher is not just restricted for example to basic house wine.

We enjoyed our trip at the Novotel London ExCel very much. The hotel location is good to reach by DLR and is close to London City Airport (a taxi ride to there is about 12 GBP) and also to the cable car over the Tames (about 7 minutes of walking). Hotel staff was very kind and helpful, especially in the restaurant. We would like to mention specifically Nicoleta. There are several small restaurants for every kind of tasted in the area for those looking for a meal outside of the hotel; we preferred to eat at the hotel as it was very good and at the right price.The only disadvantage is that the hotel is not so close to Central London, but it is easily and relatively fast to go there by the Jubilee Line from Canning Town. The only dis

The hotel is a short walk from the DLR and is a little out of the way if you intend on spending your time in the city centre but if you are looking at exploring Docklands or the East End then its perfect. The reception staff were polite and friendly, we were given an upgrade which wasn't expected and our room was slightly larger. The bar has a nice outside seating area overlooking the river and the pizza smelt good. The room was clean and usual Novotel standard. There is also a handy café nearby which does a great kebab!.

We have stayed many times at this Novotel and keep going back. It is handy for events at the 02 and easy to travel to by tube and DLR. We stayed this time for 5 nights and loved having the luxury of a suite for my 60th birthday. The staff couldn't be more helpful: from the people in the breakfast room who provide a delicious buffet to the people who tidy the rooms, and the reception staff who will look after your suitcase if you want a few more hours in London. We loved coming back in the evening by the Thames Clipper and seeing London lit up at night, and then travelling on the Emirates Line high over the river back to reach the hotel within about 10 minutes walk. We do hope that we will be able to go back again sometime.

Close to the Docklands light railway and O2 and Emirates cable cars. Hotel was clean and had coffee/tea facilities in the rooms. Breakfast buffet was great and gym, steam room and sauna was great. Truly recommended.

I stayed here for one night prior to a flight from London City Airport. The hotel is well connected to the Docklands Light Railway and extremely close to the western entrance of London Excel; it was only a short (and inexpensive) trip round to the airport in the morning on the DLR.My room was booked with a third party (via a 'secret rate', which offered a slight discount off the hotel's own rate) and whilst I appreciate that no points are payable on such a rate, it is a shame that points are also not provided for incidental spend (e.g. in the bar).The room itself was in very good condition and well laid out, with a comfortable bed - perfectly suitable for a single night stay. Food in the bar was good quality and reasonable value, although I would prefer to see some more standard tables/chairs as well as the less formal seating. There is a terrace with a fine view of the river and the O2, although it was a little cold to stay out there too long this time. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel so cannot comment on this.I would happily visit again, assuming a reasonable rate.

I called the hotel to request a rate for a room. The person working on the front desk answered the phone “err ... hello” with an attitude. Hardly the welcome one would expect to receive from staff at a Novotel hotel. The person continued to give me an attitude because they were unable to provide a rate and claimed he was looking into it. However he actually transferred me to a central reservations team who did not answer the line , and the cal bounced back to him . For this reason he was rude and unapologetic for his tone and manner. When I asked whether an early check in would be possible he seemed uninterested in helping and finished off by telling me that there is nothing more he can do , and was incredibly rude unfriendly and inexperienced. Terrible service and would not expect that level of poor treatment from any 4 star hotel

My second stay here, this time for one Saturday night. Easy check-in, very comfortable large bed, spacious room no 442. Plenty of breakfast choice, everything you could expect. Very courteous staff. Quick check out. Very convenient for the DLR and the local Westfield.

We Stayed at this hotel from Xmas Eve to Boxing Day! Me and my two kids (age 20 & 12) It was a change from the routine Xmas at home, so we were really looking forward to it! It didn’t disappoint at all. My daughter met us there, so had already checked in, so I wasn’t able to feel the reception at reception. My daughter said they were nice and friendly! The location was perfect, situated right next to the Sunborn London, floating hotel! Beautiful boat. You can go in for drinks in the main bar and stand outside on its deck to take pics. But back to the Novotel hotel! The bar was great, service was spot on, we ordered food (see pictures) a lot. The young lady and the bar manager/supervisor (Male short guy didn’t get his name) were so lovely, making an effort to chat to us! Nice touch! The bar food was amazing. We had the chicken wings and nachos. For just bar food it was good! Prices were standard for London! The room was nice and adequate! Seperate toilet by the front door and bath and shower inside the room! It was perfect for our short stay. The Car park was based under the hotel and for 3 days 2 nights we were charged £16. I was impressed with that, I assume we were not charged for a Bank holiday! All in all great stay. There is a local Nisa and Tesco Express a 1 min walk away! This place had all that we needed! Looking forward to returning. I would recommend, definitely. Enjoy. Keep up the good work Novotel Excel London.

We stayed here in room 735. We were 2 adults, 2 kids and baby.We had a view of the Excel and runway of London City- the flights kept kids entertained.The in house laundry is expensive but there are Xcel Dry Cleaners nearby who can do a service wash, or if you have car, 6/7 minutes away there is ‘Colours Launderette’ in Canning Town.The DLR tube is not far at all and there is s ramp up for buggies. We were in central London with only 2 changes. DLR Custom House, change to Jubilee at Canning Town and then get off at Bond Street-(this route is great for step free access).We ordered food once to the room, there is a £5 delivery charge to room and my soup was cold.We ordered pizza at the bar and they were great stone baked.Room temperature in December was great for us as we always get cold.The room had iron and board plus hair dryer.Positives-•Kids friendly hotel•Foot massagers at reception were brilliant•Staff were friendly •Small play area•Car park underneath hotel £16 per 24 hours Improvement required•Meat and veg items next to each other st breakfast so easy for people to switch tongs•repetitive breakfast•hardly any vegetarian choices•pillows in rooms hard •laundry facility esp as they are family friendly, or better laundry charges/options

We had a lovely stay and very good room,large, with nice view overlooking the Thames.We checked in late in the evening,quick and efficient with a lady.Room has nespresso coffee machine,complimentary water in the fridge and tea and coffee as well.Large bathroom but separate from toilet,very good shower and all amenities which always Novotel should have as standard.Following morning we went for breakfast,staff does not smile at all,I can understand it is busy time!!however some kindness and smiling would be better!Food was ok: croissants,pancakes,yoghurts,and all continental stuff you want to have.However the cooked breakfast was not so amazing for the price they give; bacon was cold,tomatoes not even cooked and so on,only nice was mushroom and fried eggs.Second day again went for breakfast,we were asked to wait a moment to be cleaned table,that is fine,but again people working,going up and down does not even look at you.All in all I would return due the room it is lovely and in a good location: you can get DLR and get off in Royal Victoria or take Jubilee line,get off in North Greenwich tube station and with cable car,it just drop you off in the other side of the Thames close by to the hotel.

Okay so I am always going to this hotel every time.Great location - just 25 minutes to Waterloo which is excellent. The reception was big and four people on when I checked in. Nice and friendly but struggled with the booking and had delays - system crashed - said I paid when I knew I had not. It took a long time. They sorted it and the rooms where very clean, good service and very spacious - thank you for a lovely time

Arrived home from a fantastic stay at this hotel on Friday, boyfriend booked this as a birthday treat to see Hamilton (which we are both obsessed with) back in May, when we arrived we were greeted with smiles and instantly felt like we were at home, parking was very secure and at £16 a night is a bargain considering what it would cost to travel on the train from Liverpool. We let ourselves in to our room and couldn't believe how beautiful it was with a view of the Thames and the ExCel business centre, with a waterfall shower. I work in a hotel my self so to be able to relax in such a lovely room was perfect, the rooms were quiet and basically soundproof, we went out for tea that night and came back and had a few drinks in the lovely bar, as we went back in to our room my boyfriend proposed to me and I really couldn't of thought of a better place for him to have done it. The pizza that we ordered on the Thursday night was beautiful and we definitely will be visiting again! Well done Novotel wonderful staff and beautiful hotel

This was quite a disappointment. We chose this Accor hotel because I am an A Club member and wanted to take my wife to London for her birthday. It is a fairly modern building and in a good location if you are going to the O2 as we were.I booked direct and asked a question at that time.No response.Later I emailed directly after my wife had an operation on her foot which meant we had to drive there.There was a delay of a day or two before I got a reply. They confirmed that there was parking and said we could have it for only £8 a day. They also said they would upgrade our room and it would be nearer the lift so my wife had less distance to walk.Very kind.We arrived and drove into the ground level car park and up a level. There was plenty of room but I was glad my car was not larger- the exit in particular is VERY narrow.We went to check in. Oddly there is a lift from the ground floor and mezzanine to the Reception which is on the second floor. You then catch a completely separate lift to your room. Not particularly convenient with luggage or if you have mobility issues.We were given Room 539. If it was an upgrade then the standard rooms can't be too impressive.It was not near the lifts. It was an OK room- as good as a Travelodge or Premier Inn. The view was nice. Good wardrobe and storage space. Mini fridge with free water. Desk and a smallish TV with limited channels. No details of the hotel and facilities to speak of.Comfy bedThe toilet was separate from the bathroom. And small. The bathroom was also small- a walk in shower and small sink. Not much room to put your toiletries.Free wi fi and a USB socket by the headboard.We didn't have breakfast there but had an unremarkable evening meal at the Upper Deck. I was glad I kept my jacket on as it was cold by the window. Service was casual and not really attentive.The worst example of the poor quality attitude from the staff came when I went to pay for parking. Three staff were on Reception - one was dealing with a couple checking in. The other two were studiously looking at their computer screens ignoring me.Another guest then arrived and went up to one of the Receptionists who duly served him, ignoring the fact I had been waiting.When I did get served I was asked if I had stayed at the hotel. I had to show her the email offering parking at half price.It took quite a while for her to validate my parking ticket and to pay (no contactless here) and then she told me that the pass was valid for only 10 minutes!Given my wife's mobility problem and getting our luggage to the car plus setting up the sat nav this was hardly up to standard.On the plus side my wife did get a free birthday cake after we arrived.Would I stay there again? Because of the poor quality of the staff: no. Urgent need for training in customer care here. Other hotels exist in the area.

What a really lovely event we had at the UpperDeck bar in the Hotel. The drinks event that was held there in the roped off area was well organised and all the staff really looked after us. Especially Diana who kept me fully informed how the bar tab was progressing and met all our needs along the way. We would definitely return to the Hotel and Bar for another event. Thank you.

Only one room was ready out of the two we booked when we tried to check in at 2pm, when questioned they stated that they try to have at least one room ready with multiple bookings when concerts are on. So after 5 of us got ready in a twin room! Later we came back after the concert and got the keys to our other room... which was on a different floor, not exactly ideal. We decided to order room service, unfortunately after trying to ring down to order 7 times we gave up and headed down to reception. When we got down there an upset guest was having a disagreement with a member of the reception team, security were present but the guest was clearly distressed and the member of staff on reception was a arguing with her and raising his voice! We then were told it was a 45 minute wait for room service so said we would go and check with the other members of our group to see if they were happy with that and that we’d call down, he assured us he would answer when we did.... he did not answer when we tried to call. Back down to reception we headed to say we’d still like to order our cheese toasties and margarita pizzas. After an hour wait we called reception to see how much longer it was going to be, they hadn’t put our order through!! No apology, nothing! I requested complimentary breakfast the following morning as compensation as we had stayed up until 2am and had to go to bed hungry. The next morning we were seated in the restaurant by who I assume to be the manager, only to be approached by a waiter and informed that breakfast had closed! Not happy, so we made do with what food was left over but the glares we got from staff and being tidied around made us all feel uncomfortable. I informed the member of staff on reception when we checked out as he asked how our stay was so I told him, the same manager that seated us then came out and said “What’s the problem? You ate.”

Great, convenient hotel. Prefer to stay outside main hub of City then tube in. Appreciate the green area outside hotel which you wouldn’t get in City. Facilities excellent at all times; day and night. Convenient for Wembley Stadium.

A great find, would highly recommend. Great location, very high quality rooms, excellent staff. Couldn't fault it. Always dubious staying in a good location as expect it to be noisy but couldn't hear anything from our room.

nice hotel with an excellent price-quality ratio.Really kind and professional staff. Far from the city center but very convenient for transport (bus and tube in front of the hotel).We were very satisfied with our choice.

Nice hotel very modern throughout. We had a room at the front which looks out onto A40, couldn’t hear the road. Some nice touches in the room with controls for lights and heating by the bed. Comfortable bed, nice bathroom with Elemis toiletries. Sky TV in the room includes movies and sport. I’ve only given 4 stars as I booked for a concert at Wembley, it’s a good half hour on the tube and not the easiest route. Also we had a meal before the concert, food was nice but a bit overpriced for what we had. Room was expensive, but you expect that in London

Great hotel with excellent service, comfy bed and pillows, I love the lighting in the room oh and Elemis products in the bathroom!Literally a few minutes walk to the closest tube station.We ate in the restaurant for lunch and breakfast...delicious. I left my ray bans in the restaurant at lunch, they were safely looked after by the staff.The bar is lovely with very friendly service.As if leaving my sunglasses in the restaurant wasn’t bad enough, half an hour from home in Oxford on the Sunday I realised I’d left my car keys in the hotel room!! Andrei couldn’t have been more helpful, my keys were retrieved, posted and back with me by Tuesday! I would definitely recommend and return to this hotel.

Very friendly staff who did everything possible to make my stay comfortable. The room and bathroom were good, but I was disappointed with the value for money, in that breakfast was not included in the room price of £250 for one night

Found this hotel last minute for a short stay away. Was so close to the station. We didnt park at the hotel but there is a travel lodge about a 3 minute walk down the road offering 24 hour parking for just £6. The hotel was clean, modern and really friendly.

We stayed here to go and see Pink at Wembley, great location, the room was fab the bed was SO comfy!! Breakfast the next day was nice would definitely stay here again! And would reccommend it to other people.

Partner booked this as she was lead to believe it's close to Wembley It's a good 3/4 of an hour walk and not on a direct tube line On checking in we were told we were upgraded to a room with a view , see photo !Room itself was spotless and comfortable and ensuite good size Bed comfortable and mood lighting and little extras all appreciated Bar prices similar to top central London hotel and actually went up when we returned from event ??

Hotel and room were good. Very pricey but expected as there was an event on at Wembley over the weekend! Fairly newly opened too I believe. Air conditioned through out. SKY TV available which was great. Lovely bathroom and decent sized bath towels and bath robes! Breakfast very crowded and a not much to talk about - I could do better. Tube station opposite the hotel so very good location for Wembley as we were attending a concert. Room Service however is another thing. Ordered food just after getting back from the concert , tired and hungry. 45 minutes it eventually turned up without any drinks and was cold. Complained and asked for a refund. Still waiting for the refund. They obviously cannot cope when there are events on in the area as other people were having problems with room service too. Apart from that great.

The staff were rude at times, it did put us off. The hotel was nice and the bedroom was spacious but the bathroom had a strange door for the shower and loo not much privacy when sharing with a friend.

Plus points for this hotel are that it is next to the Park Royal Underground Station, where the Piccadilly line runs. It means a direct train to central London, eg. Leicester square and Oxford station is possible. It is a long ride though. Amenities in the room are very basic. Room size is acceptable, fairly new and no frills. Breakfast was good and staff were friendly. Front reception staff are helpful. Loved the gym. Room service food quality was lacking. And the housekeeping team needs a lot of work- the room was barely done when we returned after a long day, at most the bed was done as bathroom towel exchanged. I’ve never come back to such a cluttered hotel room before!

had a meeting in London the location, out of town but the tube is at the back of the hotel The staff were so great Great rooms Sky TV.... lots of tea , biscuits , all the lighting is controlled by a pad , nice bathroom , lovely decor in the hotel.Opposite is a Nandos , chaquios , Pizza Hut , Chinese and Pure Gym

Expensive but understand because of concert at Wembley stadium.Room was exceptional with mood lighting a/c and beautiful bathroom. No noise from outside either which was good as near the road. Would recommend

Was here for a work conference for 4 days, room was a really good size and was cleaned daily. To my surprise after getting out of the shower went to grab the towel that the hotel supplied to find a massive brown stain on the towel, Looking further into it, it was someone else's fasces I was absolutely fuming marched down to reception and showed them they also looked horrified and apologised but that was it can you imagine if I didn't look and actually dried myself with this towel! At the evening I ordered the salt and pepper chicken wings and found a full fish that looked like it had been fried multiple times asked the waiter if it was supposed to be there as I ordered chicken not a random whitebait he just laughed and said i'll tell the chef. Cross contamination??Wouldn't recommend

I spent five nights at this hotel with my husband and my 13-year-old daughter. It is a well situated hotel, near the underground station. Rooms are large, clean, very well equipped. and the beds are very comfortable. The staff are courteous, helpful and kind. Breakfast is very good but the same every morning and is not very diversified.

A well situated hotel opposite the Park Royal tube station. Rooms were very well laid out and the bed very comfortable. If I have one criticism its that the car park is rather small. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast but found that there wasn't much space between tables so we kept getting bumped by people walking behind us. The food was very good with plenty of variety. Those coming down later for breakfast found they had to wait for a table.

Worst experience ever. Even a 2 stars hotel was a better service. We arrived on Friday at past 2 pm, room for 3. When we came into the room, all the dirty towels and bed sheets were on the floor, nothing had been cleaned up and it was disgusting. We complained at the reception, they decided to change the room. So we had to go back to the room (and we were already in a rush) and move our stuff. But.. This room was ready for 2 persons. Only 2 towels, third bed not done. The guy told us they would do call someone to do it. We left at approximately 3.30 pm. We went to Wembley for a show. We came back at 1 am. Guess what. NOTHING had been done!!! We went back to the reception and and told them.. We went to the bar for a drink, so that would give them some time. At 1.30 am we went back to our room. What the hell. Still nothing had been done and we were really pissed off. We had to wait for them to make the bed and bring towels to take our shower and go to sleep. Had to wait 20 more minutes. A total joke. A 4 stars hotel?! You make us wait 2am to get our room ready? I wished they would have made a discount at least!!! This is not acceptable.

All in all very good but some of the staff need to learn what they have got on site as ordered from drinks menu to be told we don’t have that, if there was a bar tender around, waited 20 minutes to be served at the bar and then bar tender trying to take the lid off a bottle of beer with an ice scoop( was frightened he was going to lose his thumb) put a bottle opener under the bar

Me and my husband recently stayed here for one night, as we were seeing a concert in Wembely Stadium. The hotel has good transport links from central London and the Park Royal underground station is directly opposite the hotel accessed via the underpass.First impressions were really good.The hotel is very modern and hi-tech.Check in was easy and the staff were very helpful.We asked them to pre book a taxi for us to Wembley Stadium as we found this would be quicker than catching the tube as despite the underground being so close,there are no direct tube lines into Wembley from Park Royal underground station.When we got to our room we were thouroghly impressed.The hotel had kindly decorated our bed with confetti and made our towels into swans!The room was huge and had everything we needed and more.The mood lighting was cool and the bathrobes,slippers and complimentary Elemis spa toiletries in the bathroom were a nice touch.We were gutted we were only staying the one night as the room had exceeded our expectations.We then had a drink in the bar while waiting for our taxi.Bar service was quick despite how busy it was due to the other concert goers being there.When we arrived back at our room after the concert, we were very grateful that we had been left 2 complimentary bags of crisps and there was 2 small bottles of vodka and 2 small cans of coke in the fridge.The hotel certainly went over and above by providing these for us.After a very comfortable nights sleep we then went down for breakfast.We went about 8am and we had no problems in getting a table.There was hot buffet,continental,crosiants and pastries and cereal on offer,fresh juice and tea and coffee machines.We found the breakfast to be very tasty.We could have asked for poached or fried eggs if we didn't want the scrambled that was on offer.Overall we had a fantastic nights stay at this ultra modern hotel.As stated the room had exceeded our expectations and we wished we could have stayed an extra night.My only bad point really is the hotel isn't as close to Wembley as first thought.It is not possible to walk there due to the busy main road,and despite the underground being so close, there were no direct tube lines going into Wembley.We would have had to get back into central London just to get on the direct line.Much easier and quicker book a taxi to get you to Wembley.I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

We stayed here for a recent concert at Wembley Stadium. The hotel is directly opposite the Park Royal underground station. The reception area is very modern and bright with really helpful staff. We were in a deluxe king room on the second floor. It was really spacious, the bed was comfy and the control of all the lights from the control pad by the bed was great. The bathroom/shower was modern and spacious, but what set it apart for me was the large bath sheet towels. As someone who stands 6ft 3", there's nothing worse than staying in a hotel with tiny towels that you can't even wrap around your waist!We didn't have breakfast, but glad we didn't judging by some of the other reviews on here. Overall, we were more than happy with our stay and would book again if in the area.

This is a fabulous modern stylish Hotel ,with extremely clean comfortable Rooms . So easy to get to on public transport, it's just over the road from Park Royal station, And the location is Perfect for Wembley events .

I stayed one night at the Park Plaza and generally found it to be a good experience. The good- modern, very comfortable bed, good bathroom and amenities. The not so good- breakfast was not a nice experience. Queuing to get in, coffee machine not working and the full English breakfast was just warm and not too tasty. I would advise just staying at the hotel but skip breakfast.

Good for Wembley. Don’t expect room service as it’s too busy after a show, don’t expect a relaxing breakfast. The area is ridiculously small. The bar and reception seating area needs to be reduced to allow for breakfast guest chaos. The wait for being seated is long (I understand this), however, the worst wait is in the buffet restaurant as there were no plates, cups, glasses. Want eggs other than scrambled? No chance. The poor staff are too busy trying to get cutlery and plates out. Guests were sharing a cup between them if they were lucky! Shocking. I attempted calling reception several times, room service, the works. No answer each time. The staff levels are terrible and the complimentary vodka, tonic and bag of crisps (between two guests) caused mass confusion as no card from the hotel stating it was complimentary. Rooms are good enough and clean (we had a king studio). I have never stayed at a Park Plaza and experienced this level of chaos before - ever! This hotel needs some serious fine-tuning.

Our room is lovely, spacious and an extremely comfortable bed. The bathroom is well equipped although the placement of the toilet roll holder is not ideal! There isn’t a bath but the shower is good. However the bar and subsequently the room service leaves a lot to be desired. The bar was slow with young staff who didn’t know the drinks menu. They had sold out of various drinks which I find most unusual in a hotel of this class. We then decided to order room service......... the phone rang for ages unanswered I then tried the front desk with again no answer. As we were very hungry I went back downstairs to reception. There I was told that as the hotel was extremely busy only the pizza margarita and the ham and cheese toastie was available. I ordered these an hour ago and we are still waiting!! I may update my review if the food ever turns up!

Came to the hotel for one night while attending a concert in Wembley. the hotel it’s self of lovely. The room was really nice a spacious and nice and cool. The Elemis products in the bath room are a nice touch including the slippers and robes. The staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was ok but unsure wether it is worth £11/£15 pounds. There is a good connection to Wembley station which takes approx 20min. I would return to this hotel. Also the view was lovely, and curtains do not let a bit of light in! The bed was comfy and the room was lovely and clean!

I stayed for business for 3 days. The rooms are spacious and quiet but some of the amenities are disappointing. The breakfast isn't Brill the coffee machines often stop working and they run out of cups or milk jugs. The dim lighting in corridors and dark decor give more of a gloomy feel than stylish, especially in the meeting room section. Staff were friendly and helpful. Menu choices were limited and a bit unimaginative for this type of hotel.

I went away with two friends overnight to go to a show at Wembley stadium. The hotel was wonderfully clean, staff were friendly, and we even ordered room service on our return which was fresh and delicious. Thank you foe making the trip just right.
