lovely and clean hotel and room with great transport links - kind and friendly desk staff made my stay a great experience. Parking was accessible for disabled travellers such as myself and facilities where easy to use.

Great hotel and very quiet considering the location is next to a motorway. Rooms were fantastic and better prices than premier inn. We had room service which was quick and tasty. Would recommend this hotel to anyone especially those visiting Wembley for a concert etc. Tube is very close to the hotel. We’ll be back!

We recently stayed for 8 nights and found this hotel to be excellent. Very close to the tube and if using a car parking was available and close to the A40. Rooms were very good and nice bathroom.Breakfast was good and bar and restaurant available

Booked as we were going to Wembley. Paid extra for a third person yet this person was not catered for. Arrived and sent up to the room where there was a pull out bed without any bedding, there were not enough towels or coffee for the machine. We called down but after no response, went and asked. They said they’d send someone up. This person came hours later after we had left. When we returned, a door person wouldn’t let us in until they’d checked our room key and when we went up whilst the bed had been made, there still wasn’t enough towels, mugs and toiletries. They had also taken our drinks out of the mini bar fridge (which had nothing in to begin with). Our room was clearly by the laundry as we were woken up by what sounded like washing machines. The bathroom sliding door didn’t fully close and this along with the fact the shower/toilet door not fully closing either meant you couldn’t be in the bathroom in privacy. The shower water leaked through from the shower into the toilet. We booked here as it said close links to Wembley Stadium. You can’t walk there even if you wanted to so add on travel. We expressed our disappointment at check out and were offered a complimentary drink but considering our room cost nearly £250 and we were actually treated as a couple, we should have been offered some money back.

My partner and I stayed here when we went to see the Spice Girls at Wembley. We were able to park on site and the check in staff were helpful with advice on how to get to the venue (we ended up walking and enjoyed that as part of our evening out). The bar staff were excellent and we were made to feel very welcome. Although the hotel is on a busy road, we were not disturbed by traffic noise. If I had to say anything negative, we had previously stayed in another of this chain's hotels in London and booked the same class of room. In the other hotel the room and bed were much larger, so we were a tiny bit disappointed when we first walked in, although it didn't spoil our visit.

all good with facilities, watch for small parking are and booking system which play bit of a catch mixing total cost versus individual room costs. nice from hotel members to accommodate 2 adults and 2 child in a room but that was not clear from the online paid service for booking

We were staying in London for four days 9-12.6.2019Our first hotel in Bayswater was awful, and we decided to change hotel. Luckily we got room for two nights in this Park Plaza London Park Royal. Here we get our best hotel experience ever! Friendly staff, and super clean and very well equipped room with air condition. Truly strong recommendation for this hotel and we will come back fir sure!

Fairly a good place to staff but there is room for improvement. Some showed they are happy with their jobs and happy with the service they gave while some were not and the quality of service they gave was not good . For example the check our process and rectifying the discrepancy in bills

The feeling of exclusivity, great design in the common spaces and the rooms. There were too small door handles, tight hinges and defective locks in the lobby. This made the doors difficult to open after completing the toilet visit. As well as the leakage from the shower door into the room, this was a sliding door that covered the shower or toilet. Neither the shower / toilet door nor the bathroom door could be completely closed due to the design. This knocks of a few stars right away, though the overall experience was very good!

room not ready at 2pm. Pull down sofa still not made up at midnight when we got back from Wembley. Staff not very attentive. Reception good enough to serve me a drink behind bar because nobody was around!! but didn't seem to understand difference between sav blanc and chardonnay.

A great place to stay, excellent location, public transport very close. Easy access to drive to and from. Prices for the stay were good and the restaurant food and service were way above average. Will stay again.

2 day break for the play off final at Wembley stadium. Close enough to Wembley and close to the underground for access to central London. Shame the piccadilly line was closed for work that weekend but we still managed Trafalgar square with 1 change

The hotel is very new & clean. Also its location is good, near to the train station & airport. The in-house restaurant is reasonable and tastes good. Staffs are very nice and hope to stay next time too.

This is my third time in Park Plaza Park Royal such a wonderful place to stay and so quite and clean room and bathroom. And the staff are so friendly and helpful and always offers you the best the can to find you the best.

The hotel is fairly new. Nice modern decor. It’s not in the center but very convenient. It’s less than 5 min walk to the Park Royal tube which is on the Piccadilly line. About 20-30 mins into central London.

i arrived in london from holland and had to negotiate my way via the tube . when i got to park royal station no lift only two flights of stairs.holy schweppes i was lucky a couple of young men helped me get the bags up the stairs. i could see the hotel on the opposite side of the road with no visible way of getting to it. at the station they told me there was a underpass up the road which i managed to negotiate with difficulty. the hotel staff were what id call ok not fabulous but ok . the room was really good no complaints there. when i went for breakfast the place was packed out. admittedly it was easter weekend. the funny thing was you couldn't put the cost of breakfast onto your bill you had to pay there and then . i had communication problems with the girl on the counter saying i wanted to be charged in pound on my debit card. it was like barking up a gumtree. people were asking when all the different things that had run out would be replaced. eventually most gave up . it appeared most staff didn't have english as a first language. this was something i found all over the uk . when i had to leave for heathrow i was faced with the prospect of getting my luggage to the station and hoping i could find someone to help me. when i booked this hotel it advertises that its close to heathrow.nothing about needing a car to get there. i asked staff roughly what the price of a taxi would be and nearly had cardiac arrest. note to self check that nearest tube station has a lift next .

I was not impressed with the staff service. Arrived at my hotel and there was no condiments (tea/coffee) in the room to go with my cup and kettle. I ordered breakfast to the room (no charge) on the first day and they did not bring the right breakfast. I had selected banana on the menu but they then said they didn’t do this anymore. The staff member went back down to get pastries and a different fruit and returned with only pastries. I then ordered breakfast the second day (included in my booking) and was charged nearly £5 just for it to be brought to my room. The following day I went downstairs for breakfast. I asked were the vegetarian options were as this was on the menu. Waited a while for someone to check and was told they would bring me vegetarian sausages. I had finished my whole breakfast and waited for an extra 5-10mins and this never arrived, I eventually left. Room was clean and of good quality and facilities at hotel are good. Disappointed mainly in the level of service.

This hotel is truly a gem!it is great value for money.The decor is modern and inviting there are lots if seating areas and a smart bat and resturant too.The checking in was quick...no messing about or hanging around which was welcomed!The room was amazing! Very clean...everything working and even mood lighting!Ate in the resturant...friendly helpful staff and great food.We would highly recommend this as a place to stay and would have no hesitation to book this again.One of the nicest hotels with the best service we have stayed at for a very long time!

Due to an exceptional case, we cancelled a booking for five nights at central London and luckily found Park Plaza at Park Loyal with reasonable price. It turns out to be a good choice. From the very beginning I was a bit disappointed by the location of this hotel because it is at 3rd district in London (according to London Tube map) so it takes more time to visit city center. However, we soon got used to this distance and became comfortable because of the easy access to the tube itself. The hotel is so close to the tube station that the distance does not bother any more. It was also disappointing when I entered into the room after check-in due to bad smell. I even wanted to quit staying here. The staff accepted my complain about the smell and tried to change the room for me. One day after I got to learn that the smell comes from the chemical cleaning stuff. The hotel has indeed a "Go Green" plan, for which you may even get 10 pound discount if you skip the room service per night. In order to avoid that smell, I've chosen the Go Green option. The towels got updated still every day, which is pretty enough for us. The bed is comfortable here. Space is enough to turn around. TV is also a good set. On the day for an early check-out, hotel has also prepared breakfast-takeway for us. This is also nice. The downside is that I don't like the detergent which this hotel has used. It smelled so awful and I got indeed sick of it after one and half hour stay. Luckily there is a spare room to exchange with.Overall, we are satisfied and feel comfortable staying here with a rather reasonble price compared to that in central London.

Is a lovely hotel with great attention to detail, clean and the staff were great. Elemis toiletries in the bathroom are amazing and a real treat. We were attending an event at Wembley Arena which would be no problem for fit and healthy (lots of stairs to and from the tube station) but Uber wasn’t too expensive and easy to sort. Staff were great and very attentive and helpful

Good parking, nice hotel plus friendly and attentive staff. easy check in experience. Rooms were nice, with good ac and welkin shower though for this visit a hotel with a bath tub would have suited best.

Rooms are small and uncomfortable. No privacy in bathroom. The room service food was not good. The best thing about the hotel is its location right across the street from a train stop. We reserved a double twin room. It took 3 trips to 3 different rooms before they found one for us.

I have been in London for a long working period. I had the pleasure to stay in this Hotel. Very good organisation, very nice rooms, thanks to housekeeping girls as well, who were always available. Regarding the food, I can say that I had a good experience, mostly with breakfast.The service was more then for a 4 stars hotel and I really want to mention Vito and Ioana (she always smiles!) that with their kindness and professionalism made my stay very nice. For sure I will come back!

Situated close to two London Underground stations and inside Zone 3. The hotel was clean and ideal for a business stay. The hotel room was a reasonable size and the breakfast was adequate. I checked out the fitness room and this seemed fine for the type of hotel.

Stayed here for an event in Wembley. Location is ok. The rooms are modern but have some odd design features that don’t work well. The shower pressure is weak and the water leaks under the sliding door. The door slides between the toilet and shower lacking privacy. The cleanliness is what really lets this hotel down. (See pictures) Rubbish in the car park, bins over flowing. Hair in the sink. Food trays left outside room , they were there when we checked in and still there when we checked out. The bed was large and comfy. The breakfast was good , but be prepared to wait. Very small dinning room. Wouldn’t stay here again, disappointing from a large hotel chain. I have given 3 stars due to the comfy bed and good breakfast and that is being generous. No excuse for cleanliness not being up to scratch.

This hotel is very close to the St. George's University of London and Hospital, (probably 100 feet apart). Hotel is clean and staffs are nice. It may not offer the same services as regular hotel, but for conveniences to the hospital, this is the best option. I have been staying here many times over the past few years visiting my child who is studying at this University.

Un professional, amateurish staff they do not know the meaning of hospitality. A simple mobile charger went missing from my room and I was accused of lying and making up the story.The housekeeping is made up of foreign nationals with no idea of customer relations they are just there to get paid coffee beans. Rude and arrogant to say the least especially the housekeeper. Hotel Manager of the same character not even bothering to meet me and explain the situation. A cesspit is 5 star compared to this barrack. i reported this attitude to Hotels.com staff which they tried to solve the situation, but they also were given the cold shoulder.

Modern, clean, rooms. I was on the ground floor. Was able so walk for 5 mins to St Georges University. I was at a conference, so meant I could shuttle back and forth in between breaks. Very handy if you need to be very close to the hospital.

This is a combined hotel and residence for staff at the neighbouring St George's Hospital. The hotel section and staff are welcoming and the hotel appears functional if not glamorous or exciting. The room we had was small but adequate for our needs. A comfortable double bed (hard mattress if that's your thing!), a clothes hanging area, TV, safe, desk and good bathroom with walk-in shower. The "restaurant" is small and very simple - almost hostel like in its design and decor. The only reason the hotel did not get a 5 for me was the fact that the drinks served as part of the £5.99 continental breakfast are instant. The food is cheap and unexciting but serves a fuelling purpose.The location is ideal for exploring Wimbledon, Richmond and the surrounding areas and is only 15 minutes walk from a tube station. There are local shops and a very good coffee shop around the corner that provides a good caffeine boost for exploring.

Just a stone throw away from St Georges Hospital... Rooms were extremely small but clean...ideal place if your visiting St Georges Hospital.A bit far from the train stations so you need to walk a bit if you come by train.

The Delux room had a very large double bed that was comfortable. It had a large chair that could sleep an extra person. Bathroom was clean with a good shower. Staff were very friendly and helpful.We didn’t have breakfast here but went to a really Fab cafe called H Cafe which does an excellent range of options at reasonable prices.

I have stayed here 3 weeks in a row for work but won’t be back. I paid extra to secure a ‘deluxe double’ room this week instead of the ‘cosy double’. There is absolutely no difference! I am sure the hotel manager will jump on this and reply that the room is bigger but it isn’t. I was in a cosy double last week and it was exactly that - cosy. But I expected it and paid for that so it was fine. This week I wanted more space as I’ll be in the room for longer doing some work - but it’s essentially the same room as the ‘cosy’ just with the bathroom door in a different place. Technically it might be bigger but only because there is a tiny bit of hallway (absolutely no extra not useful space).Very disappointed with the service when I called to query the room. No resolution offered.The first time I stayed I had an amazing ‘deluxe room’ with lots of space - so I know they exist!Also, the breakfast is crap (the cheapest supermarket style bread which can be toasted and pastries out of a packet), don’t bother unless it’s included in your room rate. Lastly there was noise all night from the hospital and the stupid doorbell that goes off every time someone uses the lift.Save your money and go somewhere else.Gave 2 stars as it was very clean.

Clean Rooms,Good spot and quiet neighborhood Bad breakfast!! Go there if you want an average charge for your stay but at least 20-30 minutes from the center of London...The Citymapper is the best app that will help you do anything in London and with great speed...

I guess the reviews weren’t so different from the experience in Pelican London. For a very reasonable price I booked a cosy double room, and it was really cozy. The housekeeping was more than excellent with how they take care of every small detail. Lacking a bar wasn’t a big deal, but overall a great stay. The location is very good and in a quiet area.Would definitely consider again for future visits.

Some may not agree but i feel like i still want to put my point across. I was very much looking forward to staying here as it looks beautiful and good value for money, and I still think that even after this review but id still like to say my bit.I was very disappointed with this hotel before id even arrived, as id booked this hotel via booking.com because its close to the hospital, my brother has been in and out of there for a few years. Turns out he got moved hospitals and I needed to change locations! Not ideal I know, especially with the hotel being non-refundable but I know you can request to cancel and receive a refund. Id emailed twice and still 3 days later had heard nothing, so I phoned the hotel to which they say they definitely do offer a refund, its booking.com who don't.. So, I call booking.com, they made numerous phone calls and emails to the property with no reply so I requested a call back. Received my call informing me that the hotel have given me false information about cancellation/refunds, they even tried to get at least half back for me considering the circumstances but still they wouldn't agree. Very poor customer service over the phone from the property, and to be told false information isn't good either. But, I'm sure in others circumstances you will have a great stay.

Small room but I did book a compact room.Clean tidy comfortable and quiet. Great shower and toiletries provided.Good value for money and a stones throw from the hospital.Helpful staff on the desk and easy check in/out. Didn’t have breakfast but will use again.

I stayed two nights for a meeting at the university. It was a very cheap stay. My room was large and nice with windows on two sides. It was quiet with closed windows even though there was a storm during the night. The internet worked OK. The breakfast was simple continental and cheap, but sufficient. There was no bar and only a small area to met with friends. Convenient for the university.

We had a lovely double room initially which was bright, clean and airy. The staff are really lovely and do their best to help you. Unfortunately, my husband had to stay in longer than anticipated but I was lucky enough to then have a single room which was equally just as nice. The rooms were lovely and clean as was the bathroom and shower and being a lady on her own walking back from the ward at night it is such a short distance and I felt very safe. There was also someone on reception. Thanks to the staff for helping

Our twin bedded room on the first floor was quite spacious with a lovely big shower. The staff were very friendly and the room and corridors were clean. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but a variety of cuisines are available just a short walk away. The hotel does provide a reasonable continental breakfast available at a price cheaper than Premier Inn.The hotel lacks a car park but street parking is available which is free overnight but has to be paid for from 09:30 during the day.

Booked 3 days and had to extend and stayed here for a total of 8 days. It's literally a minute away from St Georges hospital, perfect for us when visiting people there. Carpet was very dirty, but apart from that we had a good stay and the staff were lovely. You get a safe inside the room, cleaned everyday.

Single room with small twin bed, All clean and functional. I chose this hotel as I was visiting my wife who was an inpatient at St Georges Hospital, Note there isn't any off street parking except in the hospital car park. The only food shops close are those in the hospital where there is a small M&S and cafe's and canteen. The main high street is a short walk along the the road where the underground can be found. There is a lift to all floors.

Partner had a 2pm appointment for neurology dept.As we were coming from Cornwall 4hr+ drive needed a comfortable base for the one night.Booking in easyGround floor disability room was compact, tile floor, wet room area but the mattress on double bed had No protector on and was blood stained..pretty bad for a £90 room!Receptionist was straight on it and moved us to room 5 much improved room carpeted, and had a mattress protector on it, bathroom was newly done VERY PLUSH INDEED.Large TV also.Breakfast however was continentalWhich we weren't aware of when we booked.Parking IS EXPENSIVE £20 for over night. UNLESS YOU HAVE BLUE BADGE as you are in hospital grounds.7/10 due to breakfast n mattress.Perfect location for Hospital

Good quality spacious room and service with simple continental breakfast as extra option. 15mins from Tooting Broadway underground so quite a way off the London network. No bar or restaurant on site although a few amenities 10mins away. Unfortunately it was torrentially raining when we visited so not convenient.

Booked double room 24 hours in advance for 3 night stay to visit relative in St George's. In these circumstances it was ideal being a 3 minute walk from the hospital, had nice sized and clean room with good wi-fi, tv and bathroom. Staff were all helpful and although not overly interesting, the morning continental breakfast did the job.Considering the late booking the rate and value for money were excellent.5-10 minute walk to local shops and amenities and didn't notice road noise.Requested a late check-out on the morning of departure which was provided with no issue.Overall I was thoroughly impressed and would highly recommend.

Very clean reasonably priced hotel about 15 minutes walk from Tooting Broadway train station. Perfect choice if you need to be near the hospital. Staff super helpful and allowed me to heat up my own food. Beds comfy and room well equipped.

The hotel itself is great, everything you need and perfect location if going to St George's. It is noisy however - the fire doors on the rooms bang when they shut and if nearby your whole room shakes! Obviously it's on the hospital grounds so you hear everything from ambulances to the laundry carts rumbling along throughout the early hours. The lift also makes an arrival noise which is really annoying when people are coming and going all hours.The hotel is spotless and comfortable. Shower really good. Breakfast not really worth the extra money.Great if staying because of St George's but wouldn't stay there otherwise. Good 10-15 minute walk from tube.

Great stay. Couldn't fault it. Value for money. Will be back! The staff where really nice and very friendly. The place was clean and tidy. We had such a nice time there. We would recommend it. There was a great breakfast that was value for money.

Great place to stay in tooting.PositivesNear St Georges HospWalking distance to restaurants and groceries.Very neat and clean.Beds comfy.Nice bathroomsDoes the trick for a short business trip to tooting or its surroundings.

I was staying here overnight ready for an appointment at the hospital, very tidy hotel/residence, 24hr reception and very friendly staff. I arrived late, was dealt with very fast and went straight to my room. Nicely furnished, comfy bed and spacious washroom. No issues at all in staying here again if required.

Enjoyed my stay in this good value hotel with 24 hr reception.Great location and spotlessly clean.Only slight complaint would have preferred duvets instead of blankets in duvet covers on beds.Great location for my needs.Visiting my son who is currently staying in in St GEORGE'S halls of residence which is a 10 mins walk from hotel.Also only just a 10 mins walk from Tooting Broadway subway.Good regular bus service outside hotel.Will definitely consider using this hotel on my next visit to Tooting.Well done Pelican Hotel.

This was a last minute booking, having a relative admitted to St George’s Hospital it was reassuring knowing I was nearby. I used the hospital car park please note the parking around the area is restricted and very limited. Having been my first stay I was pleasantly surprised by the simplicity, efficiency and cleanliness of the Pelican London Hotel, making it an enjoyable stay. The single deluxe room offered the basic requirement one would like to have plus the hotel had a 24hr reception with friendly and helpful staff who are happy to assist at any point. It is literally a couple of minutes walk to St George’s Hospital, from there a short walk using the side roads to the high street near Tooting Railway Station. You will find plenty of shops, cafes, places to eat.

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and I have to say that we were very pleased with everything.The service exceeded our expectation.The breakfast was tasty and for a good value.Reception staff was very helpful and friendly all the time.Many nice restaurants close by and great transport too.Would definitely stay again.

For its location (12 mins walk from tube and at least 4 bus routes start from right outside the front door) it is clean and good value. Early (2pm) check in is useful too. Rooms are as pictured in terms of quality and good in terms of size given the price. I've stayed in much smaller and much more expensive double rooms in Hong Kong and Tokyo. Very helpful staff on 24 hour front desk. We needed to extend our stay and they were able to let us move our bags straight from one room to the other rather than checking out at 11am, leaving bags with reception, then checking in at 2pm. Tooting Broadway has a good choice of good eateries (cafes, restaurants, pubs) and shops too including Sainsburys, Aldi and Lidl Supermarkets very near the tube station. Tubes very frequent and it's easy to change at Stockwell to the opposite platform to get Victoria line to/from West End or stay on Northern Line via Bank for the East/City or via Charing Cross for Central London. Note: Pelican Hotel is next to St Georges Hospital with a busy Emergency Department so I was concerned we may get disturbed through the night by ambulances/sirens coming and going but we didn't hear a single one whilst at the hotel (for 5 nights Tue-Sat). This seems weird when you see/hear them all the time when you are on the street. Would recommend/stay again.

This place is value for money and ideal for business visitors or anyone just needing good facilities without any frills.Having stayed in ‘large’ rooms twice this month I was surprised how large the first one was and how small the second one was - pays to be specific when booking! Upper floors seem quieter than the ground floorThere are plenty of places nearby to get food and drink.

This was my first trip to London and the Pelican London was the perfect choice. My daughter and I stayed for three weeks and we enjoyed it a lot. We felt as if we were still home. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Our little room was just what we expected it to be. We dine outdoor as the location was ideal. Thanks for a wonderful vacation Team Pelican.

I tend to agree with one of the earlier reviews saying that the photos are deceptive. The rooms was much smaller in real life, there website did have the room dimensions on it, but if your like most people it will mean nothing to you, because we don't tend to know or use sq ft when we are talking about room sizes. The staff were very helpful and friendly, I was a bit concerned to see that they didn't have mattress protectors on the beds and only one thin sheet between me and the stained mattress. You had to pay £5.99 for breakfast, but I didn't feel that it was really worth it. It was a very, very basic continental breakfast. A few cereal chooses, few tea bags and coffee, a couple of croissants and cinnamon swirls with bread and a couple of apples and bananas and that's it! I would of gone to a local café if I knew the breakfast was that limited. I would say it is more of a stop gap rather than a place to stay for a longer period of time.Also please be aware that no other meals is provided at this hotel other than breakfast.

Arriving late at night, exhausted, due to flight delay into Gatwick, I was impressed by the hotel reception that could not have been kinder. Thank you, Hussein! The room, with en suite, was spotlessly clean and quiet, and the continental breakfast just right for reviving travellers like me, catching a morning train. The regular bus service from nearby Tooting Broadway makes access to Clapham Junction station very easy. I would highly recommend this hotel as a good value base for a trip to London.

The pelican Hotel is perfect if you want to stay somewhere cheap in London. The room was quite small but it was very clean, as was the bathroom. The decor was very contemporary and modern. I have no complaints about the room. There are a few buses that can take you into Tooting where you can get the underground ect. or you can just walk it. The hotel is convenient for St Georges Hospital as well. i would definitely recommend staying here, great value for money! The only con is that the reception staff were not the most welcoming, they didn't really smile or give us any helpful information.Other than that, you won't regret staying here.

Having very low expectations from this hotel, it being one of the cheapest in London, I was pleasantly surprised with the rooms. Spacious and luxurious to an extent especially in the suite rooms on the ground floor! Perfect for a short stay in London with the tube station being located about a 10 minute walk.

Stayed here for several short periods whilst visiting from South Africa during July. Rooms were clean and nicely appointed. Staff very pleasant and helpful, especially Charlotte who went the extra mile. Very convenient to underground. Would stay here again.

Very small room! Very deceiving from the description and images on the web page. Also got woken up at 7am by the cleaner hoovering outside our room. Only nice thing was they allowed us to check out at 12 instead of 11

Unfortunately the location was in a very rough area and very far from central London. Rooms where not too bad. Was relatively clean however it looked more like a hostel. Would not go again. At £80 a night was extremely disappointing.

I was not expecting much from this hotel, it was cheap and seemed too good to be true.I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived, although there is no car park there was plenty of space on the adjacent street. They warn you on check in about the parking restrictions so be sure to get a ticket or move before 0930.The room, whilst compact, was perfect. Comfy bed, coffee making facilities, tv, air con etc. Breakfast was a continental type offering, not lavish but absolutely adequate.Overall I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel!

Our stay could have easily very good if the staff had responded to a few simple request to rectify simple short comings. How many times do you have to ask/prompt.We selected the hotel as it was convenient to visiting friends. We booked a suite on the ground floor with a small cooking and sink area. There were no utensils or typical kitchen pack you get in similar European hotels. On request to the reception none were delivered. The light failed in the outer eating area again no response after reporting. Finally when you used the shower there was a smell of drains, again no response. We stayed for three nights, any longer we would have left.The hotel has excellent travel links and is adjacent to a major hospital and we were not disturbed by any noise.

We booked this hotel because it is within walking distance of Wimbledon but we will go back any time we are visiting London. Clean, comfortable and spacious room. Helpful staff and 10 minutes from the underground. Also the best value continental breakfast we have come come across in a while.

Hotel facilities and rooms were fine for the price. The aircon worked well which was useful in this heat. Reception staff were fantastic. Gerome / Jerome helped me print a document I had forgotten and was very helpful. Much appreciated.

I was looking for a hotel that was close enough to the AELTC so I could easily to get Wimbledon in a short time, and in that regard, the Pelican fit the bill, as it only took about 15 minutes in a cab to get to the grounds. I pre-paid via a travel site. It is located adjacent to St. George Hospital, and as such, not terribly close to much dining or shopping as it available in other parts of London, though Tooting High Street is a close walk, which as a few cafes and what not. The closest metro is Tooting Broadway, about a 10-15 minute walk, so I ended up taking cabs when I was pressed for time. The room itself was large, with a small TV, desk, an iron and ironing board and a safe. My particular had two twin beds and some sort of pull-out chair thing, which was not ideal for me as I was just one (large) person, but I just went with it. The bathroom was also a nice size. There are not drink machines, but you can buy Diet Coke and Coke Zero from the reception. All in all, a decent, if unremarkable stay.

The place is dirty the staff are unhelpful to the point of rude. We had a 3 day stay in June 2018 Due to a Funeral and this is close, we booked as it is part of the Hospital and should be good and clean as we suspect it is used by people that are there for sick and dying relatives, the breakfast continental so a bit of a joke £5.99 the hotel charge £282 for 3 nights (no breakfast) so that is the room cost. I will post some phots of the filthy state of the bed and the shower. I raised the issues with the staff and the only offer we were given was a free night. The noise outside the rooms keep you awake at night. Who in there right mind would want to stay any longer than is necessary. This hotel has a captive audience as part of the Hospital. There photos on line look like they have been photo-shopped. This is as we saw it and would never go back. Spoke to the manager when we got home as not available when we were there. His comment was do what you got to do and hung up on us.

If you can get a deal on this hotel, you’re in luck because you get a great little hotel for your money. Very modern, very clean and nice and quiet rooms. The worst thing, and this is a stretch to complain about anything, is the very slow lifts. There’s 2 of them and they take a long time to arrive, especially if they are stopping at floors.Will be staying again in the future for work.

This is an adequate hotel, but not worth the cost. I found out after booking for its proximity to something else that the reason it is priced well above what is provided is because it is literally on the grounds of St George's Hospital, so of course people stay there who are visiting relatives etc.When they say it is quiet, what they mean is that it is located approximately 15 minutes walk from any other shops or amenities besides the hospital. It was a pleasant enough stay, but breakfast was not included and I will not be returning.

The room Is nice.very small but nice, with kettle and tea/coffee. Free toiletries too. That’s about it. No restaurant. No microwave, nothing. How can they call it a hotel and for £80 a night? It’s a distance from the main High street, so, if you’re a lone female, or just someone of a nervous nature, best to catch a bus or get a cab. This is a no smoking hotel, however, the person in the room next door is smoking me out. Management have had a word, but, they’re still smoking. I won’t be coming back here.

Stayed here for one night on business. Basic no frills kind of place but very clean. Continental breakfast only which is not my favourite. Plenty of pubs and restaurants short walk away. Was able to walk from Tooting Broadway Underground in about 15minutes.Situated next to a hospital and not sure if suited for tourism purely due to location but for me, on this visit, was what I needed.

I visited here for 4 nights from the 2nd to the 6th April 2018 for work purposes.I stayed in the deluxe studio which are based on the ground floor. The studio is modern with a kitchenette (no utensils, not even cutlery, although was provided with it when asked) and TV.The hob is an induction job and I couldnt use it because i didn’t have the right utensils. The WiFi works fine.There is a buffet breakfast from 7am to 10am for £5.99 which is continental breakfast (cereals, juice, fruits, yoghurt, coffee and croissant). Not really worth the price. The TV cannot be connected to the internet so you can’t stream anything on the television from your smart devices.The closest underground stations are Tooting Broadway and Colliers Wood which are a 15-20 minute walk.Also, the deluxe studio is facing the cemetery across the road and is right beside St George’s hospital.Not a place I would visit again.

My sister and I stood at the pelican on our first trip to London, i booked really fast and didn’t notice it was so far out. It was a great hotel, cozy and perfect for two people. The rooms were clean and everything was perfect! I wouldn’t stay there again just due to the fact that’s it’s kinda far from everything. We would go out sightseeing and we would have to take the train to a bus just to get to the hotel. Not convenient if you are a tourist.

I needed a hotel close to St.George’s Hospital. This hotel is the PERFECT location as access to the hospital grounds is an immediate left hand turn from the hotel entrance. I felt save when walking to and from the hotel in the evenings. The reception staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean and stylish, excellent value for money, I was very impressed.The one down-side was breakfast. I had breakfast one morning, the rest of the time I bought fruit, yogurt and porridge pots to eat in my room. The continental style breakfast had limited choice and no coffee machine, only instant sachets, which was disappointing. Premier Inn charge a couple of pounds more for breakfast, with far more choice and a Costa coffee machine. I also found the woman who greeted guests for breakfast, rather abrupt. She was sitting at one of the tables doing paperwork when I arrived and did not smile when I walked in. This surprised me as the receptionists were so friendly as were the cleaners.I would recommend this hotel and stay again but would not waste my money on the breakfast.

This is a very good hotel. Although the room are very compact there is everything you need for a short stay. Clean modern room, comfy bed, tea/coffee making facilities, good housekeeping and friendly staff. Ideal for us visiting relations who live in Tooting.

Stayed just the one night (4th March) - wish had been longer! The room we had (111) was superb. Larger than expected, with everything we needed. The twin beds were super comfortable - firm but not hard, linen good quality, very good night's sleep. At one end of the room was a built-in wardrobe (with 7 hangers and not the annoying fixed kind)), dresser and desk plus a chair. All good quality. There's a very comfortable sofa too, with space for two people. A large TV hung on the wall opposite the beds, with a decent selection of tv and radio stations. There's also an iron and board (didn't use), safe (didn't use), kettle and selection of tea, instant coffee, milk and biscuits. Lots of different lights and lamps too. The bathroom was big, with an excellent shower: very roomy, very good pressure, no end of hot water. Little bottles of shampoo, conditioner and bodywash were supplied, as well as good quality toilet paper and plenty of towels. Both the bathroom and bedroom had large mirrors. Very large windows, with both muslin and curtains. Aircon/heater worked greated. Wi-fi was absolutely fine. Check-in quick and easy and friendly. Check out time is 11am. I really can't think of anything negative to say about this hotel... We didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on that but the hospital next door has a cafe and canteen (and small Marks & Spencers too) and The immediate vicinity of the hotel is quiet, right by a hospital, so no issues with traffic noise. It's a one minute walk from the bus stop, or about 12 mins walk from Tooting Broadway tube station and a large Sainsburys supermarket, and five mins walk from the main street where there is a great selection of cafes, restaurants etc. In fact, Tooting is a great neighbourhood. I was travelling with my elderly mother, who especially appreciated the spacious shower and room. Finally, our room was under £50 which is exceptional value for money. We will definitely be returning.

I’ve stayed here at least 2 nights a week for the past few years and found the staff excellent and very friendly. The rooms are modern and clean and if you want a light breakfast the food is fine. The tube station is a brisk 7 minutes walk away and Wimbledon a 10m bus ride.You could eat if a different restaurant in tooting every night for a month with great variety.

Myself and the wife stopped for one night. Its a pleasant clean and cosy hotel, we stopped on the lower floor, en-suite was nice. A very cosy room but thats expected in London. The only downside was the restaurant was under renovation and we wasn’t told prior to our stay. We took a walk through Tooting to find somewhere to eat. Not to far of a walk and the pubs and restaurants start. Overall a pleasant stay

Stayed for 2 nights whilst attending a training course at St Georges Hospital. Location on site for the Hospital so could not be better. Room clean neat and well appointed. Hairdrier, soaps, shampoos, tea, coffee & biscuits. Helpful reception who recommended where to find an evening meal. Did not try the continental breakfast as we had breakfast on the course. Not sure I would recommend as a holiday stay but otherwise perfectly fine.

I booked a single room for two nights while my son was staying in St George's Hospital. The hotel is almost in the hospital grounds and it only took 5 minutes from the hotel to my son's ward. The hotel from the outside looks like a 13 storey block of flats, but inside it is light and modern and clean. My single room was well equipped and clean ... all except a horrible mustard cushion which had a couple of nasty stains on it, but I chucked that on the floor anyway. I maybe should have taken it down to reception. The bed was bigger than the average single, about 4' wide, so plenty of room to stretch out. There was a wall mounted telly at the end of the bed and the usual kettle with complimentary tea/coffee/biscuits. The bathroom was spotless with a nice powerful shower, fluffy towels and complimentary bath gel, shampoo and confitioner. I didn't see a hair dryer but later found this in the drawer beside the bed.The price of my room included breakfast, although they also provide this as an addition at £5.99 pp for those rooms where it is not included.. This is a continental style breakfast and although not a huge choice included cornflakes, museli, fruit, yogurts, white/brown bread (with a toaster), jams, pre-packed cheese and a selection of croissants and pastries. There was also tea, coffee and a couple of different fruit juices. The hotel certainly served my purpose very well and the cost was very reasonable. The only downside to the hotel is the fact that it is about 15 minutes walk to Tooting High Street, there is nowhere to get any food nearby in the evening after leaving the hospital, and there is no car parking.

The rooms were better than expected, modern. The locaction is so, so as is not very close to the city center, Tooting, the price was good, the bad was the breakfast, too basic.Reception: Was fine, kinda cold but okRoom: The best of this hotel, it was modern, although you have the view to the street you also have the view to the cementery, but anyways is ok (if you dont care)Location: Is so so, if you come by bus is perfect cause the bus station is very near, but if you come by subway the city center is not that close you have to walk several blocks.Breakfast: I was in several countries and this was the more basic breakfast I had, I was the only on the breakfast room by the way. Just to tell you that there's not coffe machine but just instat coffe packets, the same you get for free in the room.... Will I come back? Possible if I have to be around the South West SW London,but it would be a lot better to have meat and a coffee machine on the breakfast.

I stayed in this hotel for one night only with my mother in a twin room. The hotel was relatively easy to find and is about 1min walk from the bus stop and about 10-15 min walk from Tooting High Street. I was very happy with this hotel. I was approached very efficiently and I didn't have to wait long before I could go to my room. Upon entering my room I was very pleasantly surprised how nice it looked. The room had tea and coffee facilities, iron and ironing board, desk and TV. The room was very spacious and despite being on the first floor was also very quiet. Free toiletries were also available. The bed was very comfortable and warm and the room also consists of heating which you can self control. Because I don't like the cold I was very happy about the self control heating. I found it a little confusing to use, but after pressing a few buttons got the room to my perfect temperature. The price was reasonably and without a doubt if I'm ever in south London again, I would definitely stay here and recommended others to do so too.

Stayed here for 5 nights whilst on a course. It's very clean and the shower very powerful. Good tv at the end of the bed. Cleaned every day and nice they leave shampoo if you need it and biscuits every day! The room was a bit cold think it was draft from the windows. Stayed on the first floor which did smell of smoke constantly in the corridor despite it being a non smoking hotel. The bed was really comfortable and couldn't hear much noise from other residents; however every time someone came back through the lift the noise when the doors opened is quite noisy. This didn't seem to be a problem if you're a bit further away from the lift having spoken to other people. The breakfast is very basic but sufficient. For the price of the hotel it was much better than I expected and was perfectly fine for my location for the week. I would definitely stay again if I was in Tooting.

Newly refurbished room which we were delighted with. No outside noise despite being located beside a busy hospital. Shower was the best part for me, could have stayed in it for weeks! €55 per night is serious value for money. Would recommend and stay again

Always looking for new places to stay when I visit London for work, and this one often pops up with the best deals. Normally that suggests it's not the best hotel because they are having trouble to shift the rooms, but that's not the case with Pelican. The rooms are modern, clean and perfect for what I need. The rooms are quite small but I have no issue with that when travelling solo.

Lots of good reviews but I think because I was in a disabled access room (my mistake didn't not check booking properly) I did not experience the best rooms. Although clean and tidy with a comfortable bed, good shower, safe and good size TV there was an overwhelming smell of cleaning materials. handy for visiting or working at the hospital. 10 min walk to Tooting High Street where you'll find bars and restaurants.

Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for our anniversary. We were so shocked at how pretty and modern the hotel was as we didn't pay that much for our stay. Great value for money! Also, it was extremely helpful that the hotel had a luggage room for us to keep our bags in as we obviously didn't want to lug them around all day while we out and about around London.The only downside is that at first we were given a room with two single beds so we had to push them together ourselves. We loved the hotel so much we are actually planning on returning as soon as next month for my birthday.

Very clean, modern and well equipped rooms. New hotel with deluxe single and double rooms, I've stayed in both and the single rooms are small but very well laid out and perfect for a one night stay. Right next to St George's Hospital. It's half way between Tooting Broadway and Colliers Wood underground stations and short walk from restaurants & bars in Tooting

The Pelican is located at the edge of St. Georges Hospital, so is ideally located if you need to visit the hospital. It is 5 minutes walk from Tooting High Street where there are some restaurants and a couple of quite good pubs. Within the hospital grounds there are a couple of coffee shops and a small M&S supermarket. There is no restaurant or bar at the property, although a continental breakfast is offered in a small dining room.We booked an 'extra-accessible' room which has an adapted wet-room style bathroom. This accessible room (No.1 on the ground floor) was originally designed for a single bed but has a double bed in it, which meant that it was impossible to manoeuvre a wheelchair inside the room or open the bathroom door wide enough to enter the bathroom in the wheelchair.It is well served by buses and tubes, although disabled guests arriving by train might find Wimbledon station more convenient as it is staffed all the time and has lifts (whereas Tooting and Haydons Road have no step free access)

My best choiche when coming in London. Clean and modern room, courtesy staff and affordable price. Close to Tooting Broadway tube station and in 15 minutes you are in the city. Lots of restaurants and shops around

Location is good for Wimbledon area as only 5 minute drive away and very reasonable price. Shop around between Agoda and Booking.com for best rates. Modern rooms and bathrooms. Rooms are on the small side but beds very comfortable.

I had a deluxe single room which was very pleasant, clean and well-decorated. Breakfast was available for 3 hours and there was plenty of choice. The staff were lovely and very helpful. I needed to be very close to St George's Hospital and I would recommend the Pelican to everyone.

The room is a tab bit on the small side however the modern fixtures creates a nice little home away from home. The room and bathroom is clean, great working complimentary WiFi (great for streaming ) , tea station moderately stocked but based on price , its perfect.

This was the smallest hotel room we have ever been in.However, it was clean, pleasant , had everything we needed and the best shower ever.The staff were pleasant and the continental breakfast adequate, plenty of choice.We were within walking distance of Wimbledon , our reason for staying in London.

Love this hotel it's our third year staying with them after spending the previous night in a tent in the queue for Wimbledon this is the perfect place to relax afterwards, the rooms are so clean and comfortable and a fabulous shower would highly recommend

Stayed here whilst going to Wimbledon and was pleasantly surprised. From the outside it doesn't look much but inside is clean and fresh with very pleasant staff. Don't be put off by the residence part of the title. It is staff from St. George's hospital that live here as the hotel is in the hospital grounds!! And Tooting's a really friendly area of London

They charged me twice after my stay by mistake and after I insist many times by making international calls, they take more than 1 week to give me back, and to make me even more upset the amount I got is less than how much they charged.

We stayed for one night on our way through London based on the reviews, the price and the fact that they had air conditioning. The reception welcome was fantastic. The room had a nice decor and the mattress was comfortable, but my 12-year-old daughter who has watched one too many videos on Youtube regarding the cleanliness of airplanes, hotel rooms, etc. noticed that the sheets weren't clean. I was skeptical at first when she told me but we turned on all of the lights and upon inspection she was right! There were several hairs and some stains on the white sheets and also on the bed cover which would have come out with a wash, especially with the use of bleach. The sheets did look freshly pressed but I'm not sure how to explain what we saw. The base boards and floor of the bathroom where nowhere near clean either. And there were various stains on the walls and baseboards of the room. Not the worst room I've seen in terms of cleanliness but clean is clean, right? As we arrived late and it was now past midnight we just dealt with the sheets but my daughter is turning me into a germophobe! We also noticed that the mattress had only one sheet over it with no other barrier between it and the sheet. That's just gross. I think this hotel has potential. The AC worked well on an extremely hot for London day. The doors are thick which contributed to a very quiet stay. The room and bathroom are decorated/outfitted fairly nicely(although there's almost no counter space in the bathroom). But the housekeeping need to step it up big time to earn my recommendation.

I stayed here while my daughter was in St George's . It was like an oasis amongst the chaos! It provided a clean, quiet , safe and secure room. It is about a five minute walk to the hospital, the staff very helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. No restaurant or bar on site but plenty options around. Highly recommend if you need to be near loved ones in hospital.

This is a good value hotel that offers clean and modern rooms of a good standard, with good facilities including aircon, iron, hair dryer, flat screen to etc. It is easy to find and service at reception is very efficient. There is no restaurant and therefore no breakfast.

Having just returned from 6 days there whist my husband under went surgery in St George's . I can only say it made the whole experience stress free I could leave my room and be at the ward in 5 minutes. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Although no food available they happily let you use the staff kitchen, with a cooker , fridge/ freezer and microwave to prepare food I tended to use the M&S at the hospital entrance to buy meals also there's food available in there coffee shop. I also walked to Tooting high street Sainsbury's. The rooms are clean and perfectly acceptable. Although not over big. They happily changed my last night to a double for myself and husband. We even ordered take away in. Also a great price i went direct through the hotel as other sites said they were full. They even price matched.

Cant imagine getting much more for the price. I would definitely stay there again. Its a little out of the way requiring a bus ride from the tube station. I generally walked and it was a pleasant and safe on a major steet. Staff was great. No refunds on my booking which gives cheaper rate. They wont budge on that. Nice and clean.

I stayed here at the Pelican for a week while exploring London. I consider this first class and as nice a hotel as I can imagine staying at. They keep the place immaculate, changing sheets and towels daily (even if you put them back on the rack), I particularly enjoyed the heated towel racks in the bathroom, perfect for drying socks and knickers! The area around the Pelican is interesting with a lot of different foods available from all over the world. The Tooting Broadway Tube stations is a short ways away, about 10 minutes walking. Several pubs and restaurants plus an ATM at the bank are also close by.

I went to this hotel last year for my job at St. George Hospital. I found it very clean. They cleaned and change sheet and towels every day! It isn't a b&b, but you have a tea pot on the desk in your room,for preparing tea by yourself and some biscuits and ! There is also a restaurant! Anyway I suggest it to who needs of going in St. George Hospital surely, but also to who desires to visit the city because it is to 10 minutes of walk away from Tooting station!

My review is based on the location / if indeed you have loved ones for an extended stay in St Georges Hospital. You're about a 10 minute walk to the underground. Only 5 minutes to walk to a pleasant pub and Tooting Broadway, which has dozens of restaurants and takeaways. It's a fair location and in real terms, "a bed for the night". The hotel is very clean - you get fresh towels daily too. Staff are attentive, efficient and reassuringly always around. There's basic stuff available in the fridge from reception, soft drinks and water. The rooms have decent TV's and are all efficiently air conditioned - Cool or warm, you can easily set for your own comfort. Lift access to all floors, again, very clean - they also have excellent security and cctv covering every floor. Walking distance to the hospital takes just 1 minute - The hospital has a Marcs & Spencer, a coffee shop (great baguettes) and the standard but efficient cafe (breakfast here works). All in all, great value, cleanliness is taken seriously, management care about who they employ - pleasant staff.

The hotel is about one kilometer walk from Tooting Broadway station. Even it is a big hotel, the hotel and the room are very quiet, Very good airconditioning. A small room but a great value in my opininon.

I stayed at The Pelican Hotel over Easter weekend. Our room was lovely, clean, comfortable and had everything you could need. The hotel doesn't any have any facilities but you are near to public transport and shops so you don't need them. For the money we were delighted as it was cheaper than getting a cab home.

I was put up here for work, so had no choice. I wish I had insisted on choosing for myself, and it wouldn't have been this hotel. It's in the middle of London suburbia - handy for the St George Hospital, but not much else. There was no breakfast, and no restaurant or snackbar in the hotel. The Receptionist wasn't particularly helpful in suggestions about what was nearby. I suppose none of that is the fault of the hotel, but they could gather together a bit of information about amenities & services in the local area, given that the hotel has nothing except rooms. The room was OK - a tiny bathroom, with a shower only, and a double room that was OK for 1 person, but 2 people would have been very squeezed. The desk wasn't quite big enough to work at, and not enough powerpoints at the desk for all my tech gear. A standard chain hotel room. Good if you're visiting the hospital nearby, but really not for much else.

a short walk,to tooting broadway tube station, (or in our case a number 155 bus) car parking is available on blackshaw rd,but beware its very expensive,,but free after 1730 pm and before 0930 am and free all day sunday,reception staff very helpfull,rooms excellent,well kitted out,ours was a family room,3 adults and 1 child(5),,£119 pn,over all a very pleasant stay and would stay again,,

My partner and I stayed here during a transition phase before it became Pelican and we were amongst construction for a few months. This was no issue for our stay however and in all honesty you hardly noticed anyone was there.The staff were excellent especially the manager at the time, Rahul, who was very personable with any request that we had. You could really tell that he led by example and his staff were happy working with him. Good location, close to amenities and restaurants and an excellent view of London if you're lucky enough to be at the top.

The hotel was in a very good location for what we wanted! The room was clean and tidy! Staff on reception were friendly. Tea and coffee making facilities were available in the rooms. Good value! Would recommend!

It doesn't look too promising from the outside but we found the hotel to be excellent internally. Our room was spacious and clean with great facilities: tea and coffee making, iron and ironing board, spacious shower with quality toiletries. One small criticism could be the duvet - they are rather thin, but it was fine for me. The staff on reception (open for 24 hours) were helpful and courteous. Highly recommended.

Reasonable, clean, cheap hotel with overnight street parking. No breakfast. However well located especially for the hospital. Friendly reception and a good refuge when found late at night that the Travelodge was full.

Unfortunately I had to escort my mum to hospital as Dad was having much needed surgery. The hotel was very clean, excellent location. We stayed in room 31 and sadly the WiFi was terrible which was infuriating as I needed to work and couldn't. The hotel would benefit in a bar or restaurant,

Located quite close to Kings Cross Station, modern hotel. No table for writing, unfortunately. No hot breakfast; one may buy for less in places around. Rooms not made every day. Hotel closes at 9 p.m.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: I spent an overnight stay at Point A Hotel, London Kinds Cross St Pancras with my hubby before our Asian holiday. Met some friends around the area. A comfortable hotel with comfortable rooms and good food. Enjoyed the stay with the friendly staff.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Fantastic location very convenient for the City. Room was small but comfortable and very clean. The staff were friendly and check in was very quick. Would recommend the hotel to anyone who just needs a base from which to explore London
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: I won't go into the details of the story, but due to travel problems I was stuck in central London in high tourist season and rooms were very scarce. I made a mistake with an online booking and reserved the wrong date: when I came to check-in, the hotel was fully booked.Thanks to the duty manager, Kinga, I was not only able to get a room for the night when another customer cancelled their reservation, but also got a full refund for the erroneous booking. She went above and beyond what anyone could expect to resolve a difficult and stressful situation, even going so far as to call me the next day to tell me about the refund.The room was clean and functional and street noise minimal despite being on the ground floor on a busy street. All the staff were helpful and exuded a positive attitude. The breakfast was a cold buffet but very high quality (and quick to serve for anyone needing to get out of the door in a hurry).I have not stayed at a Point A hotel before but I am now a total convert to the chain and will choose them for future business travel.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: I stayed at Point A Hotel for a week this June and would recommend the stay to all. After a long night of travelling I was greeted at the door with a big smile. It made my day. Daniella was a face I enjoyed seeing each day. She was funny, kind, and kept me on my toes. Fatima was the kind soul that I encountered every morning. she was so helpful and was just what I needed first thing in the morning before heading off for my day of work. What a great crew they have here!My room, although small was just what I needed. It was comfortable and clean and provided everything that I needed. The location was great as well as it was very close to the train station so we could come and go easily. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Hotel staff were very welcoming and polite and cheerful at all times. Room clean although a wee bit cramped with bed taking up most of the space. Bathroom excellent.Breakfast lovely with good choice of cold foods.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: It is at good location with very clean room. The service in general is friendly. However, the room is too small . There is no even a chair in the room. The price is a bit too expensive for such a small size.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Good location, just walk a few minutes you will get to underground and train station. But the room is quite small and with limited services. Cleanliness is my concern, a bit undesirable when you find your towel with smell of cigarettes... anyway this is good location.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Very clean, air-conditioned, and easy access to Tube/Rail. Incredibly helpful staff. Rooms small by American standards, but more than adequate. Will stay here again for sure when I’m in London again. Excellent value! No need to pay big bucks for a fancy hotel within walking distance of major sites or go cheap on an AirBNB outside of town. Perfect price for hopping on the Tube for short rides to everywhere in London, or rail to Gatwick, or elsewhere in the country.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Overall a nice stay with a central location but place for improvement. Unfortunately a bad quality of the bed/mattress ( you felt the spiral spring) and such a small bathroom where you couldn't sit straight on the loo... ;) Nevertheless it was ok and we would recommend the hotel. We just saw the chamber maid once. Felt like the other days nobody came, so minus 1 Point for cleanliness.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: My partner and i visited for our weekend in London. On arriving the receptionist was amazing, very friendly and helpful. The room itself was very clean and despite being on a main road was very quiet. However the room was tiny. The bathroom even smaller! I would recommend this hotel but only if you are under 5ft tall and 8 stone!
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: We booked for location and price. We knew the rooms were small. However one room out of three was in basement. No windows. THE SMELL OF SEWER AND WORSE MADE ME GAG! I would’ve slept on street before I stayed in this room. I don’t know how the couple managed through the night. But they were there for 8 hours total and went to lobby to wait for rest of us so they could get out of basement room. We believe this room might have black mold. The other rooms were extremely small but we expected this and since close to train station during London MLB series of Yankees and Red Sox we chose to stay one night. But the basement room is a no-go
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: An excellent budget hotel that was clean and close to tramsport links. The room was small but the price very competitive. Doris, the receptionist was very pleasant and welcoming. We stayed in a room without windows but this was not a problem.We will be back.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: All in all the hotell was great. The location was perfect. Near King's Cross and St. Pancras station and underground.Had a room underground. Was great. Air-condition. The only downfall was the bed was 150 and you got one double duve, little too close whene you are travel white your 19 years old son. But got one extra when I asked. The bathroom was small. Little difficult to get in the shower because of the wall and sink. They should move the shower door too the other end. Or else we loved the hotel, and if we are going to London again we will probably ordered the same hotel
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: it’s a great location but to be honest i wouldnt stay there for long as the room is just too small for comfort. we could still smell people smoking in their rooms on 2/F where we were. bathroom / toilet is clean enough but again too small. utilities were provided so were happy with it. price was ok for a night as we paid for the location instead. Staff members were excellent! Beds were comfortable enough. We were lucky to have a room at the back of the property otherwise would be quite noisy.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Location was good to King’s Cross Station and Coal yard. The rooms were very clean but very small. We had a hard time fitting our luggage in the room with us. However we made do and stacked it. We were only there overnight and the bed was comfortable and the room was clean.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Very friendly people and great location near St Pancreas station. Rooms are small, but adequate for a night or 2. Unacceptable in my opinion however is that they also have rooms without a window, which I got and was not informed about either. So great hotel, but I will never go there again, unless I am sure it is with a window.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Not good for people travelling for leisure. There is no room for suitcases in the room. We had to put our cases behind the main door and remove them when we needed to exit the room. The bathroom is way too small.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Perfect for an overnight stay, great location, reasonable price and friendly check in.Rooms are compact but had everything we needed and were clean and comfortable.Would definitely stay again and recommend to others looking to stay near Kings Cross / St Pancras
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: good basic hotel, handy for st pancras. we had a small room with a window, that actually had a nice view over the hills beyond the train station - view is probably pretty rare because the location is a little scrappy.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Hotel staff are friendly but the rooms facing the main road are incredibly poorly insulated so you will get really loud noise all night long. Impossible to sleep. They will provide you with ear plugs though...
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: excellent breakfast clean rooms good staff. Secure at night not too noisy and very near to train stations polite and friendly staff . Small restaurants nearby and good access to bars nearby. Three lifts for older people to use.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: The staff were very pleasant and the hotel itself looks updated and very clean.The only downfall of this very nice hotel was that the mattress was horrible. Every single spring protruded into your back. Made for a really poor sleep. The floor may have been a better option. Not sure if this was the special "Expedia" room that they give to those through the discounted booking. Honestly, spend 200# and replace the mattress. Due to this, the value was not good. If the mattress was even half decent the value would have received a 4.Only 1 working elevator when we were booked on the top floor.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Nice hotel, close to Kings Cross and St Pancras. Only a 10 minute walk or £5 taxi ride. Nice choice of fruit, ceral and bread for breakfast. Breakfast room was a little crowded.Room was very,clean and modern.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: I was satisfied with the service from all team members I met during the stay. Location is good as well as breakfast. The room is clean. The shower space in the room and the elevator is narrow but that does not affect my view of point for the hotel at all. The price/performance ratio is very nice. Very recommend for a short stay.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: This is a hotel if you are staying in a big city and do not intend to stay in the room. Very clean and design. Rooms are small but definitely enough for a few days. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast very nice. We chose location near St Pancras. Very handy, near Camden. Lots of restaurants and cafés. Very dynamic neighborhood.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: near to realstation und underground, all is clean, stylisch, joung people from all over the world, at breakfast we had fresh fruits, also glutenfree bread, very goog jogourhts, from the room a good view over London, all the personal was very friendly, to keep the luggage after check-out we had to pay 3 Pfund for 1 luggage, this is normaly free
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: The room is small. Just room to move around a double bed. No wardrobe or drawers. No tea or coffee facilities. No hand towels. So noisy. You expect to hear traffic in London, but this felt like we were sleeping on the pavement. To be fair the bed was comfy and was clean, but even so was very expensive for what it is. They even charge £3 to look after your bag while you go into London. Won't be staying again
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Very friendly staff, felt welcome straight away. Very helpful. Location was good, naar tube or walking distance 20-30 min. Room was small, but had everything we needed. Room was clean and airco worked great.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Very quiet(I did not use my ear plug, it'a first!!) minimalistic room, the staff is very nice, great breakfast, 5 min walk of the train/tube station, been there one week with my son, highly recommanded!
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: about 15 minutes walk to King Cross Station, ok price with a double room with no windows (in basement), good sleep but there is no kettle in the room so I can't make a cup of hot tea, this is inconvenient. Bathroom facilities are good and clean. I don't buy the breakfast voucher, 9 pounds each person seems reasonable as I can see the options are quite large. But quite surprise to know that keep luggage in the hotel after check-out needs to pay for them.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: We enjoyed are stay very much. We had a small 9sq room without a window downstairs, but we had no problems with it. There were some machine noises, but they were vague and we slept very well all our nights at the hotel. The location is great and the hotel was very clean and fresh.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: The hotel have a good location in the centre of London, there a bus and underground near by the hotel. A supermarket is located in the opposite of the hotel and some convenient store is open til midnight near by the hotel. Tho the cleaning service is once per three days, the room is nice and clean. The staff is friendly! The hotel will charge 3 Euro per luggage storage for 24 Hrs.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Great location and clean roomsMe and my friend stayed here for 3 nights. It was very beautiful hotel and the staffs were very friendly. The breakfast was very delecious and it was favorablefor all different cultures also.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Reasonably priced hotel, situated in nice location near King’s Cross station. Our room in second floor was very small, but worked all right for few nights stay. Good shower, and no problem with drainage as mentioned at the previous reviews of bottomfloor-rooms. Lovely breakfast included in the price, when booked via ebookers.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Impressed with the location, only a short walk from Kings Cross/St Pancras, along a busy well lit street. Hotel is modern and welcoming, rooms are clean and fresh, staff are friendly. Good value for money. The bed was comfy, decor is cute and quirky, and the room/bathroom had everything I needed. I will stay here again.Show less
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Overall it was hard to fault for value for money and location close to public transport and the international train station for the next leg of our journey. The staff we all very helpful, we enjoyed our stay.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Basic hotel, value for money, clean. Does the job, no frills. Mattress wasn't the most comfortable - could feel the springs in my back. Bring earplugs as the walls are thin and the road loud. All-in-one shampoo/conditioner/soap. Check in and out easy.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Small rooms although they have a few bigger. Advice you to ask before payment. Clean rooms, good breakfest, friendly workers.very good location. 3/4 people like our experience. The other complains about room size.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: vety cute stay and overall experience was great. The breakfast variety is big and choices are healthy and plenty. Location is perfect with many tube lines and places to eat and shop. The service and stuff were professional and helpful. The rooms are a bit small but enough to shower and sleep. Will definitely choose again in the future.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Room was very small. Even for a couple. The hotel is within a very good location. This is the value. Not bad if you only stay a night. The breakfast was the same every day, so we got bored after 4 days eating the same thing.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: First time we have stayed in one of these hotels & I was dubious, but totally unnecessary as it was perfect for an overnight stay prior to our holiday & just up the road from St Pancras. We normally stay in a Travelodge, but this one is so much cleaner & more modern.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Small rooms and many of them without windows. Good location. Breakfast enough. Near underground and train station. Kind personal. Expensive but this is a characteristic of london hotels. Hour of check-out too early.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Special kudos to Fatima at the front desk/reception. She is just awesome--she's welcoming, efficient and friendly. I've stayed with you three times now in three years, and each visit, she has stood out! As for the hotel itself, it is clean and safe. Rooms are small, but everything you need is in the room, and design of the space hints at how to live well in tight confines. For those in London to see things, and looking primarily for a clean room and a comfortable bed, in a great location, hard to do better.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras
