review_body: I stayed here for three nights alone. It was in a central location to Kings cross Station and also bus stops to get everywhere you need to in London. Staff were friendly and let me check in slightly earlier which was a great bonus. The room is big enough for a short stay and has everything you need. Whilst it isn’t anything fancy it is still clean and does the trick! My only frustration was at night you can hear people coming and going from their rooms but this obviously isn’t the hotels fault!
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: We spent 3 nights in this cute and modern hotel. Very well located just a very short walk from St Pancras station. Lots of food spots around, great for breakfast/dinner/drinks at night.Very clean and tidy facilities, although there is NO daily cleaning service (might be on request, didn't ask?). Room was great and quite big for a city hotel, also the bathroom very spacious! Make sure to get a room with a window, otherwise it might get quite claustrophobic!!!!! Didn't have breakfast there, but next door at the Water rats (highly recommend this, great food & reasonable prices!!). We've been there for a long weekend and enjoy it very much, could reach all major sights under an hour by foot, covent garden for example only about 25 minutes away!!All in all a very pleasant stay!!
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: It's OK - to good for a quick stay over on business - I would use again if Travel Lodge and Premier are not options. The room was very clean and modern. Staff welcoming 7 mins walk from Kings cross. I think the breakfast is too expensive (£9). For dinner, I eat in the Lucas Arms (opposite)- cheap and cheerful (you would most likely be disappointed - - food does not look like what they advertise on their website. The second night I ate in the Indian restaurant near Kings Cross - this was good. To improve the hotel a kettle, tea and coffee in the room would be nice. Black out curtains are needed.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Very nice hotel a few minutes away from King's Cross Station. Nice location, nice team, nice breakfast, wonderful quality of sleep. There are 3 elevators that can really help with large pieces of luggage and vertical transportation traffic.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: The Location to Kings Cross is really great. But there is no space for luggage and clothes. The bedroom and the bathroom werd dirty and dusty. The AC was loud and you can not open the window, because it is to loud outside. (in the night too).
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: There are rooms in the basement and even some on the floors that have absolutely no windows. So you sleep in the bunker or in the submarine. The bottom line is that the hotel is not a bad place if you get a normal room.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: But yet still costing circa £180 which is not tiny! But all the rest is :Smallest room ever with no wardrobe, no desk, hardly space to put your luggage.Bed quality very average and undersized for 2, fine for one. Shower toilet even more tiny.No sonic isolation But clean
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Laege room with much empty space, but the twin beds are very small. No chair or stool, only supplied with small bed side table. No area to hang clothes. Room clean and tidy. Said to provide custody of luggage when booking through agents but it actually charged £3.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Location great for travelers connecting to rail stations and Underground. Room and bath compact but comfortable, especially as a single. Nice open lobby with space to have breakfast or coffee. Friendly staff.
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Don’t listen to any negative review really about anything. Checking in was so easy and checking out was even easier, as we stayed for 4 nights we had a full hotel experience. Rooms were very clean and towels were changed daily at our request, rooms are a lot bigger in person to the pictures. I’ve seen a few reviews about bad checking in and being crowded but that’s like that everywhere and if it’s crowded leave it half an hour, there’s a pub next door! the team, especially Ara, Mehmet and Amina were helpful when we were checking out, getting our bags and chatting to us whilst we waited for a cab. I’ll be looking to stay here again next time we come to London. It was a great choice
hotelName: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

review_body: Great value option for quick access to central London. We had a family room for 5 nights, double bed and 2 singles. Beside Hanger Lane tube station on the Central line. From hotel to Oxford Circus underground station 30 minutes which is excellent for a well priced hotel in London. Also only 6 minutes walk to Park Royal station on the Piccadilly line. Friendly helpful staff also.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: My partner and I stayed here last weekend and were a bit disappointed with the staff. The room was nice and clean, the bed was comfy, we couldn't hear any noise from outside which was good as the hotel is so close to the station. However I'd try to avoid the restaurant purely because of the staff, we arrived at 7.30 and was told they didn't have a table for 15 minutes which we were fine to wait, at 8.10 I went and asked if the table was ready and it was (we were literally waiting in the bar for them to let us know but even that was too much trouble for them). When we entered the restaurant we were surprised to see that the restaurant had so many available tables and were confused why we had to wait 40 minutes. We than had to wait another 15 minutes for the waitress to take our order even though I told her when we sat down we were ready to order. and then another half an hour wait for the food to arrive.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Found the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean. Bed amazingly comfortable and the breakfast had great variety for all tastes and was filling and set us up for the day ahead. Overall a great stay. Thank you Hanger Lane.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: unhelpful staff no connection or conversation food was cold and slow don't even attempt the tube to get to Wembley no uniformed staff but the room was clean and tidy the only piece of conversation i had was with a male bar staff member
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: This hotel is a perfect base for Wembley stadium, the bus stop is a minutes walk & the 483 bus goes straight to Wembley for a few pounds. We got a lovely view of Wembley from the room. Car parks needs better signage.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Hotel had issues it’s very bd wi-fi and key cards did not work properly. Door was broken so worried about security. Could see Wembley but it’s a twenty min trip by taxi or fifty walking. Buses took about 35 mins.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Good AfternoonMyself, my wife and our friends have just arrived back home from a wonderful stay at Premier Inn London Hanger Lane and just had to write to advise what an outstanding trip we had and largely all due to the absolutely magnificent staff we encountered at this hotel where the service simply couldn`t be faultedEvery member of staff we met was so welcoming and the service throughout the hotel was absolutely first class from the restaurant to the bar and the also the staff that looked after our roomsThe service we received from Monika in the Restaurant and from Daniel at the Bar along with Lola at Reception was superb throughout our 2 night stay and these 3 colleagues in particular just made our stay the best we`ve ever experienced at a Premier Inn so thank you, your customer service was exceptional and above and beyond and made the trip so special for usVery Best Wishes and Thank You All 3 of you are a credit to yourselves and to Premier InnA,A,N & S
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: We spent fri-mon here as we were going to a concert at Wembley on the Sunday. We caught the train to London, the used the tubes for the rest of the weekend using approx £25 each on the journeys to & from our hotel. We caught the bus to Wembley & walked back. Room was vey spacious and clean. Staff helpful and pleasant. Breakfast choice good.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: The check in process was so easy, no queuing as we used the self check in service.This hotel is perfectly situated for Wembley Stadium on either the bus or by taxi, we chose Uber which was great too. The room was lovely, clean and cool.We were on the top floor and had a perfect view of Wembley Stadium which is impressive at night. The tube station is 2 min walk away and only half an hour to Waterloo station with one change. We enjoyed our stay so much we have already re-booked to stay again for 2 nights this time in August so we can do some sight seeing as the price is so reasonable for London. Staff are very friendly and helpful.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and comfortable, unfortunately our room was very warm and the aircon wasn't very good. The location to Wembley stadium is ok with plenty of buses to get there unfortunately for us the seemed to be a problem on the way back with a lack of buses which resulted in a 2 mile walk back to the hotel. This wasn't the hotels fault however a factor if staying for a concert that you need to be prepared to walk. Overall a pleasant experience.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Check in was a doddle. Only downside was no parking spaces left, no problem, download JustPark App (Parking space right outside) PI £6.30 for 6 hours! On par with Premier Inn CP charges. I would definitely use again.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: What a great Premier Inn, 2 minutes from the tube and the staff were all so friendly and helpful. Don’t be put off by the road, the windows are very effective! Benny was great with helping us with the taxi to get to Wembley. It was a super hot day but the room was lovely and cool and as always the beds super comfy.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Great location for Wembly Stadium and on the Central line for underground. Friendly staff who couldn't do enuogh tp make our couple of days a great trip. Bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked wonderfully
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: As above. Not the best for Wembley stadium but usual very good bed and room. Parking expensive but that’s London for you. Wouldn’t put me off prem in but will look for a better located one for wembley as it was more difficult getting back.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: We chose the Hanger Lane Premier Inn hotel to be located close to Wembley stadium for 2 music gigs & 1 theatre visit using London transport tube & Red bus services, the hotel was comfortable & clean, breakfast as always inviting, tasty & plentiful, reception staff & house staff very helpful
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: This is a great location if you are heading to Wembley. It was very handy to have a direct tube line to Kings Cross station (Park Royal station). Easy commute to the centre of London.The room was clean & very comfortable. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was plentiful and good quality. Dinner was very good value for money and good quality.We will be back.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: This hotel has a very convenient location, just minutes from the Underground and a short bus ride to Wembley. The communal areas were very nice however our room was very tired. Walls were scuffed, toilet dirty and sink and bath vvere very slow to empty. It was partiularly dusty around the hairdryer area. However the breakfast was quite good and the staff courteous, helpful and friendly.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Have stayed here a few times ,always clean and tidy and the staff always friendly. The convenience of the hotel and the underground is what makes this the ideal stay for getting in and out of London. Finding the hotel from the M4 is so straight forward.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Every was nice and clean. Bed was excellent. Breakfast was delicious On the downside I think some of you staff could do with training. I was in a wheelchair and even though I said I didn’t need a disabled room I didn’t expect my room to be right at the end of the building (room 419).
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Very good hotel staff very welcoming & polite & nothing too much trouble.very helpful with travel links & places to visit & eat.rooms clean & spacious & very quiet.breakfast very good & plenty of choice
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Amazing hotel comfiest beds great price perfect location for Wembley great staff all happy to help with any problems or enquires especially Simmy she made our trip easy and hassle free she’s a star ! !
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Really enjoyed our stay. Love the staff. They took care all our need. Very nice and friendly. The room was clean every day. The location is perfact. 2 minute from central line tube and 7 minute from picidilly line tube. Lots of bus station near the hotel. We surelly come again.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Great location, just off M4, on site parking enabled a stress free arrival. The tube station was just outside the hotel which was ideal, we just hopped on the tube and with one change we were at the o2 in no time. Clean and tidy hotel with a great breakfast variety which had good quality ingredients. Hum
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: stayed for 3 nights with vehicle and found all facilities to be very good. Parking was £10 a night which is now not run by Premier itself but still felt money was reasonable to pay and knowing car would be safe. Room and food excellent and one cannot fault the value for money. Travelling in to central London via underground was easy to get to and travel was some 10 - 20 away.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Have stayed at PI Hangar Lane on a number of occasions, has excellent access to public transport or road for central London. Wembley Stadium and Westfield shopping centre also easily reachable.Staff are always very helpful and happy to go the extra mile
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Great value for staying on a main underground line. Food exceeded expectations, absolutely fantastic. Staff were very helpful. Great little pub with food menu next door if you do not fancy the hotel bar. Surrounding area a little run down but if you barely see it if you are just travelling in and out of central London
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Travelled quite a while to get to Hanger Lane for a business meeting. Was welcomed by very friendly and helpful check in lady, good nights sleep, comfy bed, clean facilities, what more do you need. Thank you
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: We booked into this hotel to go to the BTS concert on Saturday the 1st June. We stayed at the premier inn Wembley stadium on the Friday night and couldn’t get in on the Saturday night as it was fully booked. The hotel on the Friday night was very modern etc and it was a lovely room. I was charged £172 for one night at Hanger Lane which I thought was very steep obviously they charge more when there is concerts on etc. The hotel is on a busy road and there isn’t much beside it also the rooms aren’t as modern as the one we stayed at in Wembley, we couldn’t watch the tv as it didn’t work. So we were quite disappointed with it. The staff were friendly enough and were there to assist you but I wouldn’t stay there again.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Attended due to a concert at Wembley. Check in was ridiculous no rooms ready reception full and deputy manager rude. Tried to tell me check in was from two and I would have to wait until they were ready as they had been busy. Families having to wait beyond check in time due to Premier Inn disarray
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Clean and tidy room, although very cold on arrival and had to turn the thermostat up quite high to warm the room. Enjoyed a good nights sleep in a very comfortable bed. The staff were very friendly and overall or stay was quite enjoyable
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: we went to london for the April 19 half term and were pleasantly surprised how convenient this hotel was. it had on-site parking and was literally next to a tube line entrance so it was so easy to get wherever we needed to go. the hotel was clean and spacious and really quiet. definitely worth considering if you are thinking of a break to see the sites of London
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Although the Hanger Lane Premier Inn is a little way out from the centre of London, its value for money and convenient location made it ideal for us. A short walk via an underpass takes you to the station, which is on the central line and a 20 minute trip to the centre of London. Together with the predictably good quality of the Premier Inn chain, we will certainly use it again.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Stayed here a few weeks ago after a flood in my apartment as it was the closest one to me. Turned up late, stressed and a bit miffed but the staff took good care of me. Nothing was too much trouble for them and rooms were nice. Its all basic but that was all I needed and it was clean. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone in the area and will be using when I have friends visiting from now on.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: The room is big and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Staff are very friendly. The breakfast is excellent. It is easy to use Metro to get around the city. We arrived in the morning, and the staff stored our bags, so we can tour around the city before check in. It was a very nice services.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: On arriving at the hotel I found the car park spaces to be very small, even parked with one side inches from the wall the other side was on the line. Check in was good, on walking to the stairs to the rooms I looked out and saw 4 rats in the car park. Room was ok but TV very small for the distance to the seating. Aircon worked well, bed was comfortable and shower amazing. The restaurant was very good. The biggest disappointment was the internet, I had to pay £5 for the enhanced internet as I couldn't get any pages to load using the standard one. This is inexcusable in 2019, obviously they have sufficient capacity to provide a decent service but expect people to pay for it. The last time I paid for internet in a hotel was 2010 and that was also the last time I stayed in a premier inn. Hopefully it will be 9 years before the next time.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: We stayed here last week as a base for a three day visit and we were pleased that we had booked outside of the London city area. We haven't stayed at Premier before but we were pleasantly surprised by how good value it was. We managed to find a parking spot and paid £30 for three days, great value.The room was large and bed was good and the bathroom was nice and clean. We requested a fan and this was provided swiftly.We chose to have the breakfast and evening meal deal and the food was plentiful. The breakfasts were very filling and being a buffet it was nice to choose whatever we wanted. I asked the waitress for poached eggs and the chef cooked them for me fresh each morning. I must say a mention to all the staff, who were all very friendly and chatty. The young man behind the bar in the evening was a great example to the hotel. I did ask his name and he told us but I cannot recall it except he said in the south of Italy where his home was his name meant 'happiness' which was what he gave out. Lovely friendly smile and a most polite and welcoming guy. Also the waitress who served us each night. I wish them luck with their futures in the UK. The underground was a couple of minutes away and we had no problems getting around. Next visit to London and we shall stay at this hotel. Great value. Thank you all.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Good value for money. Affordable price. Wifi a bit slow. Good location. Close to underground. Easy access to central London. Convenience service with car parking. Overally, I would recommend it and use again premier inn!
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Just near Hangerlane tube station so easy to get to Central London. Great price. Really friendly staff. Large room was a bit chilly initially but air conditioning is fully adjustable. There's a reasonable number of of parking spaces in the car park at the back (£10 for 24 hours I think) although we didn't use this.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Good value hotel on the outskirts of London. Close to underground but a bit far from central city. Room was perfect but wi-fi connection a bit slow at times. Buffet breakfast good value but scrambled eggs tasted as though made from powder. Clean and quiet room.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: very family friendly. The location is very convenient if your park your car at the hotel for the duration of your stay. The entrance of the Underground ist just outside of the hotel. We always at breakfast about 9am very much at ease. The business men and tourists travelling by bus where out then.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: I stay at Premiere Inns quite often for business and sometimes for leisure. I generally find they are a cut above other hotel chains that cater to business travellers. This one is no exception; a very friendly staff and lovely rooms. The beds are always comfortable and the food inthe Di i g room is good. Or much more that you can ask of a hotel when on business.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Not much else to say really, everything was great, staff helpful and friendly. Clean, comfortable rooms. Parking available on site (pay when you leave), close to Central line (5mins walk). Lovely breakfast with Costa coffee.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: I was very pleasantly surprised by the standard and variety of the food on offer at breakfast. The location of the hotel is alongside the busy A40 but it was very quiet in the hotel. The ability to park at the hotel for £10 per 24 hours was also a great help. The hotel is only a 2 minute stroll from the tube at Hanger Lane and 3 minutes from the bus route to Wembley Stadium (483). Also nearby is the Piccadilly line to central London.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Great hotel, it was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. the upgraded Wi-Fi is not great though; I had trouble connecting to it in the bar, it was slightly better in the room. The free one was a lot faster and stayed connected
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: The hotel was excellently located for travel into London being on the Central Line, however I was unfortunate enough to get a room on the A40 side of the hotel and suffered broken sleep from the traffic noise. My parents had a room on the other side of the hotel and experienced no such issues - something to be mindful of if you're a light sleeper!
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Situated within easy access to central London staff are very polite breakfast ok but better value if you have kids as they are free so doesn't seem so expensive room a good size and bed comfortable stayed her on a few occasions and haven't been disappointed
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Cost:-This was the cheapest out of all the other Premier Inns west of London that we have stayed at before (Brentford, Chiswick, Wembley,Ealing Broadway ), for the dates we wanted, and the third time we have stayed here over several years.Prices fluctuate according to events and demand.Location:-It is at the end of a service road for a parade of shops..quite hairy getting round the Hanger Lane gyratory system especially at rush hour, then a sharp hairpin left off the southbound A406 into the service road. I recommend checking out the google map on their website if you are not familiar with it.There is now a parking restriction 7am to 7pm outside, so we drove in (barrier raises and system remembers your registration even if you haven’t prebooked). £10 a night. Parking spaces were quite tight, especially as a lot of white vans were parked, and we were glad to have parking sensors as there are pillars and kerbs.Reception/Room:-There were 2 people on reception (training in progress I think), and check-in was quick and efficient, and we were given 2 key cards.The room was the usual excellent standard...clean and comfortable. Wi-fi was a bit iffy..had to keep logging in. There was some noise from the room above late at night .which we worked out was gurgling from their shower.Dinner:-We ate and drank in the Thyme restaurant without booking as it was a Thursday and not too busy.The waitress Monika was friendly and efficient. My sirloin steak was tender and cooked as I’d asked, and the peppercorn sauce I ordered as an extra was very tasty. Skin-on chips, mushrooms and tomato all nice. My husband had the cod and chips. Our only observation would be that the plates and food could have been hotter. The disc of garlic butter I’d agreed to and moved from the steak onto the mushrooms never melted. Just as well we were hungry and ate pretty quickly. The menu mentioned a meal deal for 2courses and drink plus breakfast for £24.99...but gave no details. I thought this probably didn’t include steaks, as mine was not cheap,or a large enough glass of wine! (I later discovered this guess was right..a125 ml house wine is included)so we didn’t ask , but I think that details of what meals were available should be displayed with the menu.Breakfast:-We hadn’t booked breakfast as we were meeting friends for lunch in Soho, but decided to go down for a continental breakfast advertised in the room for £6.99 each. On going down we were charged £7.50 each. When we queried this we were told that it must be an old price list in our room. She wrote down our room number, but in spite of putting it on the bin in our room it was returned to the desk, and was there when we left ..see photo (we put it on the bin again). So the “£8.99 full breakfast” next morning was £9.50 each. Having said this, breakfast is always great. I especially like the bacon, black pudding, croissants and coffee.The plates were nice and hot at breakfast..I had to get my serviette from our table to hold it!The hotel could not be more convenient for Central Line tube. It is accessed down a tunnel from the service road. We timed it ..25 mins to Oxford Circus.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: All the staff were very friendly and helpful, food was excellent as was the service, Hotel was very clean and the rooms were lovely and clean, bed was a little hard but other than that perfect. Location was excellent right next to the tube station so only 20 mins away from city centre. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Perfect for a short stay in London over the Easter weekend, brilliant location, very friendly staff, could not fault it. First time staying here but would definitely stay here again. Tube station 3 minute walk.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: If you are driving to London for a short break, this is the place for you. We put the car in the carpark at 11:00hrs one day and drove off at 15:00hrs the next day - this cost £10!Overall, typical of what you would expect from a Premier Inn with the added bonus of tube location and cheap London parking. Brilliant.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights over weekend when going to football at Wembley, staff really friendly and helpful special mention to Magdelain our waitress on Saturday night, bed and breakfast were really good only slight complaint was hotel getting a bit tired and could do with tarting up
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: I stayed here last night whilst working in the area and as always with a Premier Inn it was just the job.No one was on reception when i arrived, but the self check in is very easy now, so no issues at all with that.The wifi was very poor during my stay, so i was forced to upgrade to Ultimate, at a cost of 5 GBP!The following morning i had just got out the bath and walked naked into the bedroom, i was very surprised to see the door wide open and the maid stood there, as there had been no knock at the door whatsoever. Somewhat embarrassing for sure, but I’m sure we’ll both survive.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Excellent location & at £93 for 3 nights an excellent price for London. The hotel is a few minutes walk from 2 tube stations, so is ideally placed to get into the city within about half an hour. The area its in is busy but so is everywhere in London, it didn't feel unsafe at night. We didn't sample the food so can't comment on that. The bar was clean & comfortable as was the rest of the hotel. Our room was at the front of the hotel but we couldn't hear any road noise. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: We stayed at this Premier Inn in order to go to the Brighton-Man City game at Wembley arena.When we arrived we had a complication with our room booking (our fault) which was sorted out for us immediately by an incredibly efficient and helpful reception team. In the evening, after our match we walked back from the stadium and arrived to a warm welcome. We decided to eat our evening meal at the hotel and were offered the choice of having it delivered to our room if we wanted to relax in front of the tv. We chose to eat in the dining room however and were served by a top class waitress and waiter who were friendly, polite and efficient. The breakfast team in the morning were similarly as good. We recommend staying here because of the level of service that staff bring. There were a lot of people in the hotel who were visiting Wembley and we felt we really had made the right choice of where to stay. (The stadium was easy to reach on the way there by a direct bus (the 483) from the hotel. For a last minute booking in London we felt that it had been excellent value for money.
hotelName: Premier Inn London Hanger Lane Hotel

review_body: Budget hotel which is good for the money but unfortunately we had a bad nights sleep due to noisy people above us and next to us, not the owners fault, very friendly and helpful staff,personally I would say this is a hotel for young people not older people who like to go to sleep at a reasonable time, extra bonus was the cafe downstairs what a hidden gem was the best breakfast I have had in London.

This hotel was very noisy at night since we had to leave the window open because there is no air conditioning. The upstairs neighbors were also very noisy late into the night. The staff is nice and welcoming and the rooms are clean but very very small. There are nice outlets for charging phones. The shower water didn’t flow well-was difficult to get the right temperature water.

The hotel is in a nice area of London, many students, coffee shops, restaurants . I had a delicious vegan ice cream across the street, and loved to have breakfast at the Bloomsbury cafe. Delicious coffee and the avocado and egg sandwich on sourdough bread was super. The area is vibrant, The rooms of the hotel are small but the value for money is great. I appreciate that it was so clean. Coming into the showers in the morning was a positive surprise, Very clean and big enough room. Not a problem to share with others. If you like shopping you reach Oxford street after a 30 min walk. The room can be hot in the summer. I closed the window at night since there is traffic on the street. I sleep with earplugs so no problem for me.

I was visiting London at the end of a hiking holiday. The hotel is actually a series of buildings converted from homes. I think there may be apartments in some of the buildings. I was in 28 Tavistock Place (as I recall)--in probably the tiniest hotel room I have ever had, with a twin bed, but spotless. The room was ensuite, again, probably the tiniest bathroom I've ever had in a hotel, but also spotless. The staff was really friendly and helpful, and the location is wonderful--a few blocks from Russell Square. I spent all of my time out of the room exploring London, so it was great for me, but probably would not be good for someone expecting to spend time in the room because it was REALLY tiny.

Two rooms Booked for for football match clean and basic rooms , , great location not far from Euston station booking online fairly easy. well kept shared bathroom/ toilet , would book again for overnight stay overall good

Just love this place! The hotel was really easy to find, just a short walk from Kings Cross. Was greeted with a really warm friendly welcome. The room was clean & functional, we had the room with a bunk bed & a double bed. The beds were very comfortable, slept great. As it was a hot evening had the window open all night & didn't hear any noise (room was at the back of the hotel) Was useful that there was a fan in the room also. Loved the old solid furniture in the room and was pleased that proper coat hangers that you can actually take out the wardrobe easily were provided. The bathroom was compact as expected but we were only there a short time. Russell Square tube station is about 5 mins walk away, at night walking back to the hotel felt perfectly safe. Had our breakfast downstairs in the coffee house, was a delicious breakfast. Appreciated the 10% off & a free hot drink voucher. Would definitely stay here again as a brilliant base for a London trip, would recommend to anyone. Just a small bit of feedback, perhaps a headboard could be fitted to the bed? Was quite a large gap behind the bed due to the recess, was a bit difficult to sit up in bed comfortably. All in all, a brilliant place to stay and loved the quirky features. 10/10

St Athans is exactly as advertised on the website. The rooms are reasonable, simple and clean. We stayed for two nights and really appreciated the helpfulness and friendliness of all the staff. They let us put our bags in earlier than check in and helped us with converter issues. The location is fantastic (walking distance to the underground and to British Museum) and we enjoyed the coffee house downstairs. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for budget accommodation.

This hotel was exactly as advertised. Great value in a great location with a friendly and helpful staff. We had a family room with private bath....double bed and bunks for the kids. Our kids are 20 and 17 so it was a bit tight, but it was not unexpected.The staff was very friendly and helpful. The common room is cozy and the coffee shop downstairs is excellent.Location is very convenient to Covent Gardens and the British Museum. Highly recommended for a family that prefers to spend their money on things other than hotel room.

Tiny room and bath but we'll planned use of space an high ceilings relieve any claustrophobic issues. The room has everything you'd expect in a hotel -but smaller scale. Clean. Good location to get around London, but not near anything but several universities/schools. Pleasant and helpful staff.

The staff and location are the only great thing. It is a guest house rather than a hotel. Very old furniture and no facilities inside the room. No TV, no coffee factory, no bathroom. Shared bathrooms are disastrous. I wont recommend and I won't definitely go back again.

If you are looking for a budget Hotel in London, this is the place to be. Located in Bloomsbury, there are several cafes and Restaurants near by. The British Museums and Soho are in walking distance. Furthermore the Hotel is in between King‘s Cross and Russel Square Stations. Staff is friendly and always there for and question. The rooms are tiny but comfortable. Everything is clean. We would gladly come back.

We've just returned from a 4 night family stay at St Athans and we were very impressed. For this price point and location the standard of the hotel is excellent, high levels of cleanliness throughout the shared bathrooms, common areas and bedroom. The staff were friendly and approachable and the hotel overall had a very cared for feel.The area is excellent, leafy and quite quiet but very close to St Pancras, Kings Cross and Euston stations, and walking distance to the main central areas (we walked to Embankment pier on the Thames for the river taxi one morning and it took about 35 minutes).We stayed in room 17 which has a double, bunks and a single bed; large wardrobe, tv and sink. There was plenty of space for what we wanted, which was just a place to rest our heads after busy days of sightseeing. There are ample shared bathrooms, we never had any issue finding one free at all. There is no bar or restaurant, but the coffee shop on the lower ground floor is open for breakfast and lunch and the hotel has a comfortable and spacious TV lounge, with seating for 6-8 people.The only - very minor - issues were that you had to ring the doorbell to be let in the main door every time, rather than the key cards working here also. I understand this is a security issue but with three young children I don't think there was one occasion where we returned without one at least desperate to go to the toilet so the extra (albeit very short) wait was a little difficult! The other one is that the bedroom window was an original sash window, which opened fully at the bottom. As our youngest child is nearly 6 now it wasn't an issue for us, but might be if you have younger / more prone to adventure children with you!Overall we were hugely impressed and we look forward to visiting again!

I stayed at St Athans Hotel on recommendation of a friend. It was a fantastic hotel, very clean, perfect central location and wonderful staff. They could not be more helpful and lovely, especially Fa and Kamil! A great team! I have a single room which had all the facilities you need. There was a sink in the room but the toilet & showers are shared, there are 2 on every floor, they are super clean. The little cafe underneath is also fantastic to grab a healthy breakfast before work. All in all, a wonderful place to stay and I recommend it highly!

We stayed at the lovely St. Athans Hotel for just a weekend but were pleasantly surprised. We were able to check-in late and check-out early since there is a 24-hour reception desk. Kamil, who was manning the desk at the time, was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and so were the bathrooms.The hotel is located in a quiet street and just a short walking distance away from King's Cross Station, a supermarket and a pub.For the reasonable price we payed the hotel absolutely met our expectations!

St Athans provided decent value family accommodation that was walking distance to the main London attractions as well as the St Pancras station to get the train to Paris. To access the room, you needed to walk up a stair case. Our room had a bunk bed with a double bed, while the bathroom was smaller than a cruise ship, with a big step up, where you needed to be careful in using the hot water. The room did not contain a fridge.I appreciated the ability to check in slightly early and luggage store on our departure day as we caught an 8pm train to Paris. After walking around London from early morning, we were also able to relax in the lounge area at the front of the building on return for our luggage before heading to the train to watch tv and use the reading materials. This reinforced my positive impression of the St Athans Hotel.

I had a single en suite room which I found suitable for a four-day stay. It was simple and basic, looked and felt clean. My room had quite new bathroom fixtures, a large window looking into the rear (nothing to see, but it let in light and air), a closet with five hangars, and a small and wall-mounted flat-screen TV. There was room on the floor for a suitcase. It would be helpful if there were a hook for a coat or toiletries bag.The location is convenient to many things and quiet. There are no bars close by. There is a separate cafe on the lower level which offers a discount if you stay at the hotel. There is also a cafe across the street with a few more options. On the same block there are restaurants that are quick/cheap and mid-range, as well as a late-night shop for snacks, candy, fruit, wine. The Russell Square Tube station is about a 5-8 minute walk, easy even if you have a larger wheeled bag. We walked to Westminster, Victoria Station and elsewhere, but took the Tube "home" at end of day.St. Athans appears to be comprised of a few attached buildings, once homes, but converted into small hotels that are all now under St. Athans. So, after checking in, you may have to go out to the street and down a few doors to get to your room. It feels like a reasonably safe area.

Pros:We arrived very late at night and it was not a problem to check in.Affordable. Quiet.Room was clean.Location. Close to tube and Kings Cross Station.Cool neighborhood.Good pre-arrival communication.Cons:Tiny room - the pictures online must have been taken with a trick camera lens because they looked huge. They were not huge. We kept stubbing our toes and tripping over each other.Shared bathroom that was - hopefully? - clean. Light was too dim to be sure. Door locks were not always functional. Treacherous stairs that were extremely difficult to get our baggage up and down. The kids were frightened of falling.Tilted floors that resulted in our feet being higher than our heads - I suppose it’s good for circulation or something.I would NOT want to be in this hotel in a fire! Overall, be sure that your family is prepared for the shared bathroom. We weren’t even there for 12 hours, so it was fine. I would not have wanted to stay for a week.

This review is a little unfair on the hotel I know that and must stress this from the start of this review!I booked this hotel through hotels.com and it seemed from the reviews to be close to all the things we needed, it is further from the stations than I would have liked but that's personal preference I prefer to be closer to a tube station.upon arrival I checked in and was taken to my room and the lady explained that I got 10 percent off breakfast from the cafe downstairs and a free coffee (it was clear to me that breakfast was in fact not included) we walked past some steps and the lady (very polite and very friendly) explained to me that it was a shared bathroom, this is my own fault I never saw that this was the case or I wouldn't have booked this in the first place as this is not something that I would ever want. I got to the room and it was very dated and VERY small with a small sink in the corner and I have to say I felt like I was in some kind of a hospital rather than a hotel. I would never have been able to relax here which for me is what I expect from a hotel room. its a real shame as I really dont like to leave negative reviews but from my experience this is how I felt and I really do stress this is my own fault for not doing my research before booking checking location and not seeing that it was a shared bathroom.

They are very honest about being a basic hotel. But if you want an affordable, clean, lodging in a terrific location, this is a good choice. The pros are location, location, location. Easy to walk everywhere in central London, close to the Tube, and close to many lovely squares, restaurants, shops. It is also clean and the staff is generally very helpful and friendly. The con was about our first room there. For the first week, we stayed in a very small room which was not fun to come home to, and there was a great deal of noise in the hallway as we were close to a door leading into the back area. (I suspect the noise we heard was employees, not other guests, in general). But when we returned after a week away, we were in a larger, quite nice room, in a quiet hallway on the second (their first) floor. So I would advise asking about the room and being sure that it suits your needs. I do recommend it; just ask about the room.

200 year-old Georgian houses don't convert well to hotels. Ditto the St Athans Hotel, where I stayed 6 days.I had room 5 on the second floor directly above the entrance and the office. I could hear the front door buzzer all night long. The street noise and people coming and going died down between 4 am and 5. The tiny room and single bed lacked a closet, tv, clock and night stand. There was one electrical outlet in the room

Stayed here for one night at the end of October 2018. Location as many others have pointed out is excellent, being about 5-10 mins walk from Kings Cross and St Pancras mainline stations and Russell Square tube station. Lots of good historical sites and museums are nearby as well as many highly rated restaurants.My single room on the top floor (servants' quarters of the old house :-)) was warm and comfortable and more than adequate in size for my needs. If you have a big suitcase such as I did, you just need to be careful when navigating the tight stairs to get up to the 3rd floor but it's to be expected when staying in any older house with character. My bathroom was just across the hall, immaculately clean and never had to wait even though the hotel was fully booked that night. The cafe downstairs serves a great Full English breakfast plus a variety of other healthier options.For me though, the highlight of this stay was definitely the staff. Every single employee, without exception, was friendly, attentive and welcoming. Having stayed in many hotels around the world I know how rare it is to find one where every member of staff is smiling and looking like they are genuinely happy to be working there. After checkout, they kindly let me leave my suitcase there while I went to attend to some matters in another part of London. Unfortunately, on my way back, it started pouring with rain and I got completely soaked. However, when I got back to the hotel they were kind enough to let me sit in their lounge and use one of their hairdryers until I managed to dry myself off! Can't beat that kind of service! Will definitely stay there again next time I'm in town.

I stayed at the hotel for three nights in an individual room with a shared bathroom. Everyone that worked there was very nice and always willing to help or even just talk.The hotel is really interesting because it is over 200 years old and is a protected building, that is why there's no elevator, they can't "alter" a protected building (fun fact I learned from one of the members of the staff). The bathrooms were always clean and I never had to wait because someone else was using it, also, my room had a little sink and a mirror which were very useful as well... The hotel has access to a cafe that serves great beakfast and has a 10% discount. The bed (matress) wasn't the most comfortable but that is okay! I would definitely stay again! When I had to leave Hermo at the lobby helped me figure out how to get to the airport and at what time should I be waking up which was really helpful! thank you

Great early check in. Area we are familiar with and find easy to access London sights and attractions. Room comfy and clean would have liked tea/coffee facilities in room. Quiet accommodation. Great luggage storage.

Stayed there twice with friends in a 2 week period and had no complaints. Rooms came as advertised, were quiet, tidy, plenty of toilets and showers (shared bathrooms), super safe, great location and friendly staff. Not sure what else you could ask for in a London budget hotel. Will definitely stay here again

This is a budget hotel and therefore don't expect anything fancy. Once you accept that you won't go wrong. The location is excellent. The rooms are small but very clean and the mattresses and pillows were very comfortable. It would be an issue for anyone with mobility issues as the stairs are very narrow and steep. The showers are a bit basic (they shower head holder was broke in the one I used so you had to hold the shower head) but they were clean. The staff were lovely. I would definitely recommend it. Also, there is a lovely pizza place a few doors down called Pizza Sophia which we would give a big thumbs up to.

Excellent location! Bloomsbury is terrific! The hotel is clean, in a quiet and peacefull place. Easy to go to anywhere! The staff is great and there is Danielle, a great italian buddy!Excellent cost-beneffit ratio!I hope I can come back!

I´ve been there for 4 nights late September 2018 and I´ve been surprised. Usually you´ll get what you pay for. And in London this isn´t much. Buch not with St. Athans! It´s clean(!), quiet, comfy and the staff is very nice. The (cheap) rooms are very basic, but you´ll find everything you need... except of TV and electric kettle (you can buy one nearby ;) ). The staff is very friendly and helpful, you can leave your luggage before arrival and after departure w/o any concerns. Loaction is rellay great, it is a 5 mins walk to Russel Square subway or St. Pancras station. There are some nice pubs nearby and also a shopping center where you can get everything you need. Although it´s a busy neighbourhood it´s acceptable quiet at night, you can leave the window open :)Finally, I would definitely recommend this hotel. It´s a hidden gem in London! Nice, friendly, quiet, comfy and affordable.

My wife daughter and I just stayed here. This is absolutely a no frills hotel but for what it is it was great for us. We were in London for 2 days and did a ton of sight seeing so all we needed were comfortable beds and a hot shower and were were set. The staff here was great and I would definitely come back. We left London to Paris at St Pancras station and its only a couple of blocks away. Also the restaurant downstairs has an amazing breakfast.

Partner and I stayed for 6 nights, comfortable and affordable, right with in middle & able to get to any point in London. Staff are beautiful kind people willing to help in any way they can. Rooms are clean (everyday), we will be booking again. We found a great place just a walk around corner very reasonable price to pay for our evening meal

I needed a hotel room at the last minute, but didn't want to spend a lot. I just wanted a place to spend one night. The St Athans Hotel was very clean and comfortable. There was a decent bed, dresser, hangers and a sink in the room. The shared bathroom facilities were also clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The front door is locked at night, and the lobby is monitored 24/7. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for simple, clean safe accommodations near the center of London.

This cozy hotel is located close to the station “Russell square” and very easy to find! The rooms were small but comfortable and clean. The bathrooms were on each floor, very clean and nice! The stuff were always helpful and friendly!We would definitely go back again since we had a very nice experience in a nice location in the center of London!

I travel and have traveled around a lot. This was definitely my worst ever experience. From the moment one entered the hotel, there was an atmosphere of chaos and lack of the touch of businessmanship through and through. We got a tiny room at the basement. It was very hot during our stay in London, temperatures reaching upto 36 degrees Celsius.There were no ACs in the room. Nor did the come up with the thoughts of providing table fans in that scorching heat. The keys failed to function to evening in a row. Once, we had to wait long for the person at the reception to show up to fix the keycard. When we talked people at the reception that the hotel could have put up a table fan in some of the rooms, they started finding all kinds of excuses, and were practically rude, too! If you are looking for a youth hostel like creep in places, you might well like this one, too!

Positives - Spotless clean ensuite bathroom - but very very tiny - water was not hot many a times - Central location - <5 minutes walk from Russell square station - Luggage storage after check-out- Staff tried to be helpfulNegatives- The room smelled bad - The building felt claustrophobic- The linen did not feel very clean - felt a little itchy- No cooling / air conditioning / fan in the room, which is a major concern - Windows in the room were left wide open, at the time of check-in - Did not feel completely safe - No lockers in the room, only a really worn-out cup-board - Poorly lit room The stay was not terrible but I would not recommend the place to anyone.

We were looking for budget and close to center. St. Athan's delivered on both fronts. If you are young, not in need of lots of space or great comfort, this hotel is for you. We were traveling as a family of 5 and reserved the family room. It consisted of a bunk bed, a double bed and a single bed in the attic. The floor was slanted, space was cramped and with 5 people in the tiny room it got hot really quickly. Luckily it was early June, can't imagine what it must feel like in late July or August. If you are traveling alone or with 2 people and aren't too hung up on the regular chain hotel amenities, this is a great budget option. Oh, did I mention the toilet and shower were located in the hallway and shared with other guests?

Great cute little hotel. Very well located Central London. Well connected thru tube, trains, buses. Everything is within walking distance as well. Prices are good. They havr a cafe down from the hotel as well.

This place is centrally located near underground and rail station. Rooms are clean but space a bit tight. We were there during a hot spell. Without fans or air condition it is a bit stuffy unless we open windows which can be a bit noisy. The shower did not drain well and flood to the toilet side. Management was responsive and took care of the problem immediately. The staff is friendly and helpful.

This is a lovely little gem of a find.....5 minutes walk from Euston train station and close proximity to central London (20 minutes walk to Oxford Street). St. Athans has really nice helpful staff who happily assisted us with directions to get to places on foot.Our room was clean and cosy, it was in the basement below street level but this didn't matter to us. The only negative is the toilet is up a flight of stairs and the shower room is along the corridor.....again this didn't matter to us as they were available to use when needed.Breakfast wasn't included but we were given ONE voucher for a free coffee (two of us but only one free drink) and a 10% off voucher for the total bill in their little coffee shopAt £100 for the night would definitely come again

Perfect location for what we needed. Lovely,friendly staff and feels like a home from home.Fab place to stay will diffenitly come and stay again.Afew lovely bars in the area and with in walking distance of Euston underground station.

A very affordable hotel in central London. Was my second time in the city, this time on a cheaper budget. Got there and the “reception” couldn’t find my reservation. I had to go over to the computer and find it myself. I really liked the room. Free WiFi, tv, very cozy and a surprisingly good bed. Clean, but the shower drain was full and it took ages for the water to go away. Me and my wife went out and did the town. Got back and went to bed and that’s when I decided that I would never go back to St Athans. The walls are extremely thin. Stayed on the bottom floor and everytime someone entered the place it sounded like a horde of elephants ran through. You can hear a cough through the entire hotel. I laid awake till 2-3 every night because of it.Cleaning was good but they just skipped over it one of the days. Thanks. When we checked out I asked where we could get a taxi and got the answer “just go out and when you see a cab with a lit taxi sign just wave your hand”. Oh gee, thanks! Never would’ve thought of that. I actually asked because in the room pamphlet it said: “we’ll gladly book a taxi for you”. Guess not.It sounds miserable, I know. The room is still cozy and if you’re on a tight budget I guess you could reconsider St Athans as an option. Although I’m not going back.

Clean rooms, excellent staff that is available 24-7. Rooms are secured as well as the front door which can be opened by a staff member. Stairs can be a problem but again, if your bag is heavy, they are ready to help. Shared baths throughout the hotel are checked on a regular basis. Coffee House in the basement is fairly expensive/

This was a great find. Awesome value in a perfect location. We selected a room with an en suite for my family of two adults and two teenagers. It fit us perfectly. The staff were all fantastic. Very accommodating and friendly. This isn't fancy, it is basic lodging, but you can't beat the value.

I didn’t really know what to expect because I’ve never stayed with a hotel like this. It was cozy, had free WiFi, a convenient cafe with great food beneath the hotel for breakfast, and the staff are so, so friendly. I stayed in two ensuite rooms and they were both very cozy with all the basic amenities covered. The hotel is also a short jaunt from an off-license, a laundrette, a bus stop and the Euston train station. I would definitely recommend this place to travelers on a budget!

The St. Athans Hotel is in a great location and neighborhood. It is close to Russell Square Tube station and also St Pancras train Station (and tube stop). The hotel is dated but was clean and fairly comfortable. Our room was next to the street and with the windows open it was pretty noisy. The shared bathrooms were also clean and varied from large to small. The staff was friendly and helpful. A very nice cafe is located below the hotel and has good coffee and treats.

This is a green hotel and they actively follow the green protocols in servicing their guests. Staff very friendly and knowledgeable about the neighborhood and surrounding areas. Fees were very reasonable. Centrally located in the Bloomsbury neighborhood. Rooms are very small and better suited for single travelers. Bathroom small with tiled step to get out of shower(very slippery). Bed very uncomfortable. Hotel is 200 years old and the dwelling has settled, floors are very sloped. We loved the staff and we loved the area we just didn't like the bed and the shower step. Better suited for a young single person.

Hello everybody,We have been with you for four days this week and loving every bit of it!We slept well with the four of us in one room, with toilet and showerroom. It was on the groundfloor and there were no significant noises all week.Every day we had our breakfast at Bloomsbury Coffeehouse which was good with a 10% discount and friendly staff who helped us start our day in a good mood!All in all a great place to stay in London and very good money for value.Thank you all.Kind regards,The Smolders Family.

It's a fine place if you know what you are getting. If you are expecting what an American would call a Hotel, that's not what this is. So here's some helpful information for Americans looking at booking this place.Europe has hostels and hotels. This one technically resides in the hotel category because of private rooms, but it feels more like other hostels I've stayed in rather than a hotel. Rooms- are tiny from an American hotel frame of reference. It's fine based on other comparable products in the same category. Do not book this place if you are looking for space. This is room for sleeping and that's about it. Bathrooms-There are private and shared. I had a private bathroom that was within my room. If you are thinking of an American hotel bathroom, that's not what this is. It's a bathroom pod installed at some other time. After all, the building (like most other buildings) is a hundred years old. The pod is the equivalent of a small RV camper bathroom. That's the size. Most RV bathrooms actually have more room around the sink. My 5th wheel camper bathroom was twice as large as the bathroom pod in the room I stayed in. Same materials for finishes. Toiletries-bring your own shampoo, conditioner, and soap. This place doesn't provide those things. My personal experience: Staff was nice. I booked through Expedia and there wasn't enough information for me to make an informed decision and when we arrived I had my wife and teenage girls in one room and I was in another. My girls didn't feel safe and people were coming and going till after midnight. The doors were thin enough that it felt uncomfortable. There's a sense of privacy Americans are used to with hotel doors typically being solid core wood with gap seals so most hall noise is eliminated. That sense of noise privacy did not exist here. Our private bathrooms were not functional for our needs. The bed I slept in had a support right down the middle of it and the mattress was very basic so every time I turned on my side the support bar was on my hip and caused pain. I hope they fix that bed. I couldn't sleep that night. One other major odd thing was a painted cast iron plumbing pipe that came down in the corner of the room and you could hear water coming down when people used the bathroom. All in all-the other reviews didn’t properly convey what I should expect. It just was not up to our basic standard for accommodations and I booked another place the next morning and we left. The manager wouldn’t refund any money which was prepaid for a week long stay, and I lost over a thousand dollars by booking this place without a clear understanding of what I was getting into. The reason he gave was that we didn’t give him a chance to rectify our dissatisfaction. Unfortunately, there was no way to do that since it would’ve required a major construction remodel. Nothing against his hotel. It was just not what I was expecting. It sucks to lose that much money on a vacation, but I hope this review is helpful for Americans who, when they read the word “Hotel” and have a certain expectation, recognize this is not what we in America consider a hotel.

I spent 3 nights with my 2 children at a 3 bed-room at St. Athans. The room was very nice, lovely decorated, cozy, with a washbasin, heating and a TV - perfect for us. Although we had a shared shower, it wasnt a problem at all. The bathroom was always clean, and the one time it was not working properly it got fixed in a short time. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Location is just excellent. We will definetely come back.

I just wanted to say quick thanks to all the front staff and a couple of other workers like I said I would when I get back home. Thanks for being so helpful during my stay. Hotel was nice too and I love the location. and the cafe!maybe see you all again one day!!! all the bestkevin ( the man with too many bags)

You have to use shared bathrooms but these are clean and plentiful. There is no tea and coffee making facilities in the room however it is a friendly and comfortable place to stay and the café in the basement does lovely breakfasts and you get a free drink there. I always stay here when I have to be in the Kings Cross area.

A super basic budget option in a convenient area of London. I was worried about the shared bathrooms, but they were very clean and plentiful. Top marks for the friendly and helpful front-desk staff. Late-night checkin was an added bonus.

I found this hotel charming. The staff were exceptionally friendly at check in. The room was clean. Bed comfortable. Although I booked a single bed I got a double. For central London and close to Russell Square tube you can’t argue with the price. Shared bathroom and toilets both very clean.I stayed here 20 years ago and have to say this is a completely upgraded hotel.I will stay again

Excellent place to stay and very convenient. Friendly welcome when arriving, room was great, comfortable and very quiet. Really close to some good places to eat and places of interest. Ideal for a few nights stopover if travelling on business to London.

During my fifteen-night stay in the St. Athans hotel, I was fairly pleased most every day. The staff, from the front desk to the housekeepers, is a very friendly group of people that is always helpful and accommodating. The hotel itself is located perfectly, providing the feeling of a big city without the chaos of some other, more densely populated parts of London. There are plenty of places to eat nearby, and the British Museum is only a ten or so minute walk from the hotel. Additionally, the Russell Square and St. Pancras/King's Cross stations are both a few minutes away on foot. The rooms of the hotel are nice, but I can only speak to the more communal rooms (four and three beds). Our room had a little sink and mirror in it, but the toilets and showers are communal, and located in the stairwells. It was a little bit cramped for three people staying in one room, but nothing too bad. The beds are quite comfortable.Now for the less favorable aspects of the hotel. There is a system in place that requires all guests ring a doorbell to enter the hotel. This is an understandable security measure, but it can get a bit annoying (for the staff as well I am sure). As I mentioned before the communal bathrooms, while not a dealbreaker for me, may be difficult for others. There is also no breakfast offered with the hotel, but it is connected to a nice coffee shop (with a discount) that is convenient and tasty. Overall, the good definitely outweighs the bad, and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I would also recommend for those that would like a convenient hotel in London that is affordable, friendly, and clean.

Firstly the location is Russell Square, a street away from the tube, 10 or so minutes walk to Euston main railway station and about 20 minutes or so to the Eurostar. If needed the No 91 bus around the corner will take you to Trafalgar Square.The hotel is old, no lift so ask before booking if a ground floor room is available if stairs are of a concern. There is a café in the basement well worth a visit for a coffee or meal. Most rooms do not have a toilet but one or two so ask again before booking.But the main reason is the rooms are clean, staff very helpful and the rates are excellent for those on a budget and the location is excellent.

Stayed one night for a 40th birthday treat - fabulous! Staff couldn’t do enough, especially Lidia who was lovely to us. Felt very spoilt and pampered as we were off on our holidays. Room and hotel were amazing. Many thanks to all and hope to see you again very soon!

We stayed here Friday 5th & Saturday 6th July to celebrate my Wife’s special Birthday and our 41st Wedding Anniversary. From the moment we arrived everything was fantastic.Every member of the staff was friendly, efficient and totally professional.Our room had been specially decorated with towel-art, balloons, banners, chocolates and a cake.The room itself was large, elegantly furnished and immaculately clean with a huge and very comfortable bed.Both ladies in our party visited the Spa for the Signature Treatment and were totally delighted.The bar and terrace has table-service and although all the staff there were excellent we have to make a special mention of Jackie. She is a little bundle of joy with a smile that lights up the room and such a sweet and genuine nature – a definite asset to the team.Food in the restaurant was excellent and plentiful both for breakfast and our A-La-Carte dinner on Saturday. All in all we had a wonderful stay and will be back.Thank you Sunborn London for making our Special occasion an event so memorable it will always be in our hearts.

I just had to come on site and review this spectacular luxury yacht hotel.It was top class. My bedroom was massive more of a suite and luxurious. The bed was super comfy and lots of elegant wardrobe space. The bar lounge was superb and on the warm evening that it was you could go out on deck and sit overlooking the docks and the 02. Very relaxing. The staff were excellent and highly professional especially the bar area manager. The reception staff were warm friendly and very professional. The breakfast manager was very professional and courteous and my eggs Benedict was second to noneAll in all it was a very enjoyable stay and superb value for money

This is the best hotel in London! Prices are excellent, I have stayed with my mom for a weekend and honestly I am so happy we found this place. We felt special from the beginning to the end. The room was lovely, super clean with most comfortable bed I have ever slept on! Bathroom was very clean. Reception was very helpful in directing us to nice places in central London, so we have great day out as well. We tried food room service as well and in 20 min was delivered to our room! We are so happy with our stay that acually was sad to leave! Illona and Vigantas who checked us out was verry sweet and friendly. Overall I had the best stay ever in London! And definitely will back there and will recomend this peace of heaven in London to everyone!!

Visited the Sunborn for afternoon tea with my Dad. We were staying overnight at Novotel Excel 1 minute away (excellent hotel btw) so probably better staying there given the not so good reviews on the yacht's accommodation ....???Our afternoon tea was definitely one of the best we have had. Very fresh sandwiches, lovely warm scones and beautiful desserts. Totally delicious, sadly we couldn't finish it all !! Waiters were very pleasant and attentive.The foyer and beautiful staircase up to the Lands End restaurant were immaculate.The restaurant itself again was immaculate, beautiful white linen.Great place to enjoy tea or whatever. Would visit againThe only thing that spoils the docks in our opinion is the rather ugly black iron cranes.... understand why they're there but maybe too many of them ? Spoils the view

Stayed just for one night for meeting at excel. Absolutely perfect location for this part of town.Room was lovely, spacious, clean and well appointed.Very quietBalcony was fabOne of the nicest places I have stayed for quite while and highly recommended

Booked an executive king room which was delightful..spotlessly clean with large comfy bed and great veiws of the Thames from the balcony.Spent a delughtful afternoon sipping cocktails on the deck served by a lovely phillipino little waitress who couldn't do enough for us.Weather was superb ..which helped..but bar area was lovely so would not have been a problem if not.Delicious sandwich ordered..big enough for two to share..yes..pricey..but hey ho you don't book to stay here and expect it to be anything less.We had a delicious set menu 3 course meal in the restaurant..again..the staff were delightful..and a lovely breakfast from the buffet the next morning which had a great choice.Something for everyone.Overall..a great stay. ..well worth the money for a special occasion or treat..really cannot understand the poor reviews on here..We would go back without hesitation.Well done Sunborn..big thumbs up from us.Thank you.

It's in a great position in the Docklands, easy to get to the O2 across the water or into Canary Wharf or into central London. We had booked a standard room but were very lucky to be upgraded to a room with a balcony which was lovely. Very spacious room, I think the same size as the the standard but those rooms only have a small porthole.Was so nice in the morning sitting on the balcony watching the runners go past and seeing London wake up.We didn't eat on board so can't comment on the food. Had drinks in the bar at the end of the evening which was expensive. We didn't stay long as there was a noisy crowd who were quite drunk and kept chasing their child around the bar! Not the hotels fault of course!Overall nice hotel in an excellent and peaceful part of London.

Me and my husband £570 to stay here for 2 nights on wednesday 26th june for our 1st yrs wedding anniversary, upon arrival we were told that we still had 5mins untill check in so we went to the bar, the barman told us to take a seat as it was table service, after waiting 15mins i decided to collect my drink myself only to be told they didnt have my husbands drink and we was to choose something else, overall it took about 30mins to be served even though there were only 6 people in the bar at the time.The drinke were ridiculously overpriced with an added service charge. When trying to check in AGAIN we were greeted by a miserable,rude young lady called Ilona who then informed us that as we didnt have the card we had booked and paid on (altough payment was made days prior and booking confirmed) we wasnt allowed to stay and there was nothing she can do! she needed that exact card! so if you have been bought this trip as a gift im assuming you will need to bring the payees card with you?? on booking this there was nothing to say that bringing that card was complusary. Luckly enough for us we only lived the other side of the water so was able to get a black taxi home to collect the card which cost us £50! cant imagine how anyone travelling from afar would be able to do or afford to do this. eventually 2hours later we eventually checked into our room, after walking down the hallway with the worn out rippled carpet that tripped me over our bathroom had hair all over the floor. The balcony with sea view that we paid extra for was tiny i could just about cross my legs without grazing my knees, with 2 cheap garden furniture chairs to sit on, and when u did u couldnt see the sea only the sky as the chairs were low down. Its so close to the city airport, at first watching a plane go past so close was amazing untill we realised it was every 5 mins and was so loud you had to stop conversation untill the plane had past, this was from morning untill late.EVERY 5 MINUTES!! The room was big but not luxury, the cleaner left our dirty coffee cups and spoons after making up our room and left our room with 1 tea bag. Breakfast was ok, nothing to write home about, cheap bacon, had plenty of breakfasts like this in alot cheaper accommodation, wasnt worth the upgrade! Toilets in bar and reception were clean but the only time the sink water worked was when you turn on the bidet hose in the cubicle?? Some Staff were rude, some had very strong accents and were hard to understand, The only thing thats luxury about this Yacht is the stair case, it was beautiful,gives you the impression on arrival that you are stepping into a luxury, classy hotel but the rest of this hotel is standard and feel we wasted our money. The website for Sunborn is terrible, only promoting the spa and wont allow you to do anything direct with them, i didnt get to use the spa as you have to book via reception who had no clue as to prices and info etc, i was told that reception would call them and the spa would call me back at somepoint, when they did i was told the therapist had been working and was tired and could only see me at 9am the morning i was leaving. When checking out i was asked how my stay was, i explained that i was far from happy and the duty manager refunded our breakfast cost and our overpriced bar bill for 2 drinks which we waited ages for and got something compleatly different anyway which altogether came to £78...£50 of which wouldve covered our taxi bill home to collect our bank card, so to be honest wasnt much compensation for all the inconveniance we had! I wouldnt recommend this place to anyone unless you have money to burn and are not expecting to much in return.

First approached the boat and it looked lovely. Only way to gain entrance to boat is via the lift, I have bad anxiety of enclosed spaces. I had to wait to be let in the fire exit.i think this should be explained on booking. On booking I was told my card would be held the amount 48 prior and payment could be made on the day. They took the payment in full instead 48 hours before, even though I explained at the time of booking I had a £200 gift voucher to use. I now have to wait 3-5 days for a refund back to my card. In the Bar we waited 25 minutes for chips, asked for mayo and was given empty used jars from another table by the waiter. Service in restaurant was poor, waited 20 minutes for them to take our dinner plates. Explained at check out when asked if we had a good stay, receptionist not interested. Bar and restaurant add 12.5% discretionary tip to everything. How they can justify that with such poor service is beyond me. Not worth the money at all.

After booking this hotel for my Parents for a Christmas present, and for an engagement gift for my sister, we decided to go and stay ourselves after recently having a baby. I tried to book direct on the sunborn website however a box kept coming up for me to enter a draw for a spa break (sunborn promotion not a random advert) despite continually clicking continue browsing it kept coming up. I decided to then book via Expedia. Later on that evening I looked at the hotel for things to do on my iPad (the contine browsing worked this time) and I noticed you get benefits for booking direct, such as 10% of food bill, and upgrades if available. I emailed sunborn and advised I booked via Expedia (it was £3 cheaper despite sunborn promoting they offer the cheapest rates). I explained my issue, and that this was a treat & asked whether they could honour the loyalties or would I need to cancel and rebook. The response back, “no we are unable to honour this & as you booked a non refundable rate with Expedia you won’t be able to cancel”. I found this so frustrating as we were going to eat onboard, but knowing I could’ve saved left a bitter taste in our mouths! I mean I only saved £3 by booking elsewhere & did contact immediately to explain! I have spent over £700 with sunborn this year! The hotel is lovely & the staff are very friendly but due to the poor service on my booking this will be the last time.

Great location and great service, felt really well taken care of by Salomey for afternoon tea. Food was more than ample for us and we were asked if we wanted more! We also used the spa(I am sorry I didnt take your names) myself and ,my wife were very satisfied with our massage. If you want to try something different in London don't hesitate!
