Extremly dissapointed this was a wedding gift to me and my new wife from my mother in law on arrival we were greated by the most miserable bunch of staff i have ever witnessed we where then asked to pay a £40 charge of a card justvas a deposit incase of any damages etc this was fine but will return to this later , after getting our key we walked down the worn out hall into our room which looked nice ,my mother in law had asked the staff before we had arruved for an upgrade as it was a special wedding gift there was no sign of this apart from 4 small chocolates on table with a letter of what time breakfast was etc, even just a simple cingratualtions from your missrable staff would of been nice , any off to the bar we went just to be ripped of since when does it cost £9 for a draft beer , after this we decided to go out as would be cheaper seeing as this was supposeed to be a nice relaxing night on tge yaught we are now at the o2 arena having a few drinks . So in the morning i have a bit of a stomach cramp which had day before so didbt go for breakfast and my wife had a slice of toast which we were informed was included in the price , turns out that this is what the £40 deposit was for at checking in , after much discussion at reception explaining i didnt go for breakfast and my wife had a slice of toast are you reallt charging £39 for there reply was well yer , the resturant is open till 11 if you want more what a absolute joke this place is i will be posting this message on as many sites as i possible can.

I didn't quite know what to expect as I had never heard of a "Yacht Hotel" before, but I was very pleasantly surprised.The size of our classic room was unexpectedly generous. The queen sized bed was very comfortable and the nautically themed decor was aesthetically tasteful. As our room was below deck, the only reminder of being on water once actually on board was looking at the river view from the restaurant. The staff were helpful to the nth degree and nothing was too much trouble.The breakfast was absolutely delicious and you could eat your fill.My only bugging issue was the key card that is also supposed to operate the lift. It was very temperamental; in the 2/3 days we were there we had to get it re-programmed 3 times this was somewhat inconvenient. Other than that we enjoyed our stay very much. We'd like to try Sunborn, Gibraltar next!

Stayed here with my son after a day at Comic Con and was not disappointed, Rooms big, clean and comfy. would recommend this as something different to your usual hotel stay. Staff very friendly and courteous.

It’s the time to see different side of the most exciting city of the world from the deck of a luxurious superyacht hotel.Set on a luxury yacht moored in the Docklands, this upscale hotel is adjacent to the ExCel London convention centre and a 5-minute walk from Docklands Light Rail trains to central London.

Fantastic night aboard this beauty with great views across the Thames. Breakfast excellent. We traveled with a local coach company Vision Tours. The cabins were very spacious even bigger than a lot of Hotel rooms.

Some months back I booked this hotel as a birthday treat for myself. I read the reviews before booking & they were mostly positive, but the closer to our stay there were a few more negative ones & I did begin to wonder whether I would be disappointed. I needn't have worried, I can honestly say we had a fabulous stay & did not have any of the problems others have posted about, such as noise & poor customer service. Check in was quick & simple, the young woman on reception was very welcoming & efficient, in fact every member of staff we encountered was friendly & helpful.We stayed in an Executive King Room with river view. The room was spacious & spotlessly clean, with a small balcony, sadly we didn't get to use the balcony as much as I would have liked because of the awful weather but the main thing the room was so quiet & peaceful.We did not eat breakfast on the boat, as I felt £20 a head was rather a lot in view of the fact I need gluten free food & probably would not be able to eat much of what was on offer. We did however eat dinner on board on the night of my birthday, my husband checked with the restaurant with regard to my need for gluten free food and the staff could not have been more helpful. We had a wonderful meal which we both thoroughly enjoyed and fantastic service from our lovely waitress Neringa. Thank you, you made my birthday meal memorable.So all in all we loved our stay at this hotel, we have recommended it to friends, who have already booked for August and we hope to return in the not too distant future ourselves.

Why do hotels like this think they have the right to make up pathetic excuses as to why something happened when you make a complaint?I made a complaint yesterday morning as to why the reception staff let several people queue jump in front of me. Apparently the reason is that they have no control over queue jumping and the unwelcoming reception staff are happy to let that happen. So if you are going there just go straight to the reception desk by passing anyone that appears to be queueingMy compensation for my inconvenience was a late check out but I was told by email at 10:30. That was the time I left the room. Nobody could be bothered to phone me in my room the evening before. Secondly my advice is not to have breakfast there. Everything is bland and if you like several cups of tea or coffee you will be up and down as you can only get single cups. Better to go to Starbucks near the station if you want decent coffee. I go this hotel several times a year but the customer service and cutbacks are getting worse. The rooms are great but a hotel can’t be judged on the rooms alone.

An opportunity to try something a little different. The public areas of the boat are very attractive. The room was well appointed, clean and spacious and benefitted from a balcony where it was possible to sit. Shower room small but has everything you need. Very comfortable bed and quiet despite aircraft taking off from or landing at nearby London City Airport. Located next to the Excel and about a 5 minute walk from DLR where it takes about 30 mins to reach central London. Ideal if you like the contrast of being able to get away from frenetic central London to somewhere a bit more relaxed.

Great location for excel conference and for O2. River views give you amazing views of Canary Wharf and planes taking off from city airport - noise wasn’t an issue though. Didn’t try the rather overpriced breakfast and eat elsewhere but the room itself offered great ‘cruise’ style accommodation. Decor a little dated but clean and in good condition. Would stay again - better that an identikit hotel room for same value.

Lovely weekend, good location, easy to travel to the O2, room was beautiful, staff hit and miss, expensive but worth a little treat. Didn't eat in the restaurant but lots of lovely restaurants nearby (especially the Thai).

Stayed here for one night whilst watching a show at the O2. Great location and easy access to the Emirates cable cars (note cable cars stop at 10pm so you have to use tube and dlr to get back if after 10pm). Room very spacious particularly for London, amenities very good and check in easy. They take a £40 deposit on your card which is a bit of a cheek but you get it back if you do not use it. Views from the deck area are excellent.

Location is pretty good especially if you want Ex Cel. Our room was good although no Sky T.V. It had a balcony and a very good shower - but no bath which upset my wife. Had lunch in the bar area - this was very nice - and we were well served by the friendly bar staff. Dinner was not such a great experience - mainly because I think they were understaffed. The starter was tasty - a ham terrine - but it was advertised with sour dough and that wasn't on the plate when they brought it. It was impossible to catch a server and when I eventually got a senior staff member they offered to send it out - but I had finished. The mains - rib eye - was O.K. but the jus had a very funny taste. The restaurant did, however, offer very acceptable wine by the glass. So a mixed bag. I enjoyed my stay but see no reason to repeat it .

When we arrived to check in, there was a business convention taking over almost all of the yacht. We were unable to go out on deck or use the bar. This made us feel very unwelcome and confined to our room. We were also not told anything about this at check in. The room was lovely and spacious, with my only complaint being that our double bed was two singles pushed together which wasn't that comfortable.There were occasional slams from room doors and a fair amount of stomping from people above but that isn't the hotel's fault.The food was excellent and the staff were friendly.Our only negative experience in the bar was staff taking 15 minutes after seating us to take out drinks order, and a further 15 minutes to bring them over.The location is very convenient for events at the hotel.It would be great if the hotel had additional facilities such as a gym/sauna/steam room/jacuzzi.

My daughter and I treated ourselves to a night in this beautiful yacht hotel. The decor is stunning, the rooms are beautiful. We had ordered a family room which had a king size bed and a sofa bed. I am quite slight and slept on the sofa bed. Sadly this was one of the most uncomfortable and sleepless nights I have had. Staff put up the bed but one of the legs started to collapse in the middle of the night! Sadly we were unable to use the bar as a massive party of hundreds was in progress. There was a makeshift bar for residents but party goers spread there too. I would however like to thank and praise the staff who were having to cope with all these somewhat rowdy drunk people. They were remarkable despite being under great stress. Well done! I suppose it was just bad luck that we had chosen this one night to treat ourselves, but I will not be going back as very disappointed.

My family visited the Sunborn London for the first time for afternoon tea and we were greeted by the delightful Salomey who was informative about the menu. She and her colleague Alisha made our experience there memorable and ensured to include our little toddler in the afternoon delight. Not forgetting the chef themselves who provided us with consistency in the production of the unforgettable scones and miniature desserts. The whole experience exceeded our expectation that we will definitely being returning sooner with more family members. Thank again to the team it was joy!

2 rooms, one for me, another for my business partner, stayed for 5 nights.The Good... Two of the bar staff were great, Akkash and another chap (can't remember his name, on the same shift). Engaging, efficient and looked like they enjoyed working there. Breakfast on one of the mornings was good. Housekeeping were friendly & unobtrusive. Reception staff greeted with a smile.The Bad... The rest of the bar staff looked like they HATED being there. Getting a drink was a chore, frustrating & expensive. I kind of expect more than a miserable reluctance to be served, or even for asking for the bill. OMG the breakfast is not a great experience either... who cooks sausages on ONE side only, pink in the middle? Butter only on selected tables, plates whisked away immediately after your last bite, the worst toaster ever... and did I mention the half cooked sausages? The Ugly... Why oh why did they remove the luxury champagne coloured carpet in the rooms? It was literally LOVELY and a major selling point. My room had an industrial blue coloured carpet for some reason, my business partner described his room as "lino & laminate"! With rooms, food and bar tab, our stay cost us about £2.6k. Massively disappointed. Not value for money. There are other places nearby that are cheaper and better.

Went for an afternoon tea which was very good, lots of scruffy food and endless cups of tea. Situated near The EXCEL centre London so not the easiest place to get to. However well worth the effort. The surrounding area somewhat spoils the experience but would certainly recommend it as somewhere to have a lovely experience.

I had one of the most basic rooms and it was very spacious and comfortable. It was dock facing and level 1 but still was above the water line. Breakfast wasn't included so can't comment on the food. Staff were friendly at check-in and out.

Just returned from our fourth visit to the Sunborn Yacht and although the rooms are fine, clean and roomy ad always, what has happened to the breakfast? Limited choice of cereals, the cooked breakfast was at best lukewarm the fried eggs were rubbery resembling ones you used to be able to buy from a joke shop! I can't imaging how long the whole thing had been in the so called warmers to be in the state they were.We arrived at breakfast at 8am so perhaps they were cooked at 6.30am when breakfast were first served. Not only was the food terrible, since we last visited they have stopped serving fresh tea and coffee, you now have to collect your own from an urn, which by the taste of the tea bad been standing as long as the breakfast...stewed tea and tepid food, not good enough.At the price you pay for a nights stay I expect far more than this. Will we be visiting again I am not sure, there are far cheaper places near by who would do far better, perhaps the Sunborn Yacht have become very complacent?

Lovely place to stay, felt like we were on holiday. We would definitely stay again for the price. Took the cable car over to the O2 for lunch at Gaucho. Room was lovely but the bed was a little firm bordering on hard for me. There is a great tapas place just a few minutes walk away.

Stayed beginning of May. Checked in early to leave luggage, staff very friendly whenever we needed them. Whole hotel was spotless. Room was enormous, king size bed, huge mirrors around the room. Plenty of storage space.Excellent location as we were spending the day and night at the o2 arena.Couldn't find one fault with this hotel. Definitely recommend to friends and will stay again if in this area of London.

We booked afternoon tea here on a Saturday afternoon and had a lovely day!The drinks and then the tea took a little while to arrive but I suspect that's because they make them to order given that we made some slight changes to what we wanted. The hot chocolates were lovely as they were a cup of hot milk with a large chocolate stirrer. I've not had one of those anywhere other than at home before and it was delicious.The sandwiches were lovely, the scones were still warm and the cakes were perfect and all very fresh. We ordered extra sandwiches because we were all so hungry!When the waitress was pouring our prosecco she was chatting and asked us why we were there. Said we were celebrating a belated birthday and then the conversation moved on.At the end of the tea, she surprised us by bringing a large piece of delicious sticky toffee pudding with happy birthday written into a decorative chocolate. I was so impressed with this as she had just picked up on the birthday comment and done it off her own back. I think that extra touch really showed a flair for customer service and passion for her job plus a company that allows their staff to make decisions and I always admire that.We then moved into the bar area and spent another 4 hours drinking cocktails.Our experience was ruined slightly by an unreasonable family sitting next to us who were having issues checking in and were arguing loudly with the manager. They were making self-important statements about how much power they had at work and how much business they would move from the hotel and saying things such as 'I work in the hospitality industry'...generally just being a pain and also swearing which was unpleasant. The management team seemed to deal with them very well and resolved the situation.We ended up spending around 6 hours in total and all felt well looked after and relaxed. I wouldn't hesitate to return!

We Stayed for 3 nights in an executive room I cannot fault our trip the staff were amazing and the room was lovely the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in we enjoyed drinking cocktails in the sundown bar with an amazing view we will definitely be back

Well, we love the experience. We enjoyed a selection of sandwiches, cakes and scones and if we didn’t like some of them, we could have more of the ones we did like. The service was great and not over powering, the environment was top draw and would recommend afternoon tea for anyone wanting to experience the location.

Absolutely excellent caring, polite and efficient attention from every member of the Sunborn' staff. We enjoyed yet another couple of nights, and will return, again, soon, this year. Lovely [river side] room and facilities.

The charge alot and looks good but its just a shell. You walk in and there is a strong cleaning smell to hide. The key in the elevator never works.Cold rooms with only 19 degrees. The staff threw away a plastic bag of mine. The staff is not as nice as they seem. There is not one healthy thing on the breakfast table. Never stayed in a more none priceworthy hotel. Warning!!!!

overall I had a nice stay at the sunburn. it was expensive (£200 per night) for the area and time of year but there was a big event at the excel so all prices seem to rocket. it is right next door to the excel centre so very convenient and therefore very close to the DLR station and a few minutes walk from the cable car taking you to the O2staff were friendly and welcoming. I found room was spacious and very clean. however, the internet connection was poor and the TV was not working ie it was so fuzzy I could not watch it

Stayed here on a trip taking my sister to a concert at the o2. While the location was exactly what we needed, unfortunately this is where the niceties ended. Upon arriving your greeted with the charming "everything's an inconvenience" attitude of the reception staff. You head down to your room where you can enjoy your tired looking furnace of a hotel room (I set the "aircon" to 10... yes 10 degrees and the room temperature after 6 hours of being on had risen to 27 degrees). The hotel is a novelty and sadly that's all it really is. This is the 3rd time I've stayed here and the will definitely be the last. Each time I've been greeted by the same unwelcoming staff, overpriced room and bar rates and bog standard hotel rooms. The tablet in the room is frozen so you cant use it. What a waste of £170! Stay away from this hotel, you'll find a more comfortable stay for a fraction of the price down the road at a travelodge.

Stayed here as a surprise for a 50th birthday and its very impressive.The staff were all great, always helpful whether it was on the telephone, in reception or the bar. A lovely little treat of chocolates for the birthday girl was a nice touch.From the first steps to the rooms and everywhere inbetween was very clean and tidy and it looks extremely grand.Our rooms, classic river view, were large and comfortable.The nearest DLR station is custom house and you need to follow signs to the Excel centre rather than "way out".The only negative is the rather over the top prices in the bar for spirits, £9 a shot, mixer on top as well, is more than a little steep and uneccesary.Overall we loved our stay though and will definitely be back.

Stayed here for One night. The hotel I thought was lovely. Really comfty bed, very clean, staff all working really hard.We got a really good price on room so was surprised how nice it was.We had a private bar for a party and the bar bill nearly gave me a heart attack. Probably the most expensive drinks in hotels I have stayed in.Only 1 of the 2 lifts were working and the one that was, was really slow due to the amount of people sing it.Breakfast was really nice too.

We had an ok time here for a two night stay in London. The bed was comfy but the boat is starting to feel it’s age. Clean and tidy but quite far out unless you are visiting the Excel. The staff are friendly enough and the bar area is ok but I’m not sure why they charge a 12.5% service charge to deliver your drink some 25 feet.

We stayed for 2 nights and overall had a unique and enjoyable experience. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, room was large and clean. Great views of Canary Wharf, especially from bar on a night. Food in Bar was great, snacks etc. Only downside was our trip coincided with a large group of loud undesirable people who had loud brash cars which they enjoyed revving. Luckily this event only happens once a year. This hotel is far too good to accommodate this type of clientele!! Would recommend for something a bit different in London.

First time staying on a boat!Room was decent, larger than typical hotel rooms in London. Breakfast was sufficient.Toilet was smaller than expected, but considering that this is a boat.... The room I was in had a mini balcony/deck with seats. Got to enjoy a cup of coffee every morning on the deck and see the sun go up.Hotel had a couple of supermarkets in the vicinity, and is right beside ExCeL. If you're there for an exhibition, would recommend!!

i was staying at another place but went in for a few drinks lovely décor and a fantastic looking hotel the staff were friendly very close to the excel i will in the future book to stay here on what i have seen and heard

Had a family party yesterday (Sunday),Staff were great and friendly service.Food was lovely, nice and no rush.Room was good and clean, transportation if you need to get back into London is straight forward, dlr station very close.Thanks to all staff involved.

I booked the spa and afternoon tea through one of the discount websites. To be honest I didn't check trip advisor which is unlike me, so coming closer to our booking I was really nervous. The spa treatment was a back massage and facial. It wasn't the worst but it certainly wasn't the best. The treatment rooms were clean and well presented. However, there was no sink so the therapist had to leave the room to wash her hands. The room had windows and even though the blinds were closed, it was still quite bright. The walls were very thin so conversations in the next room could be overheard. The massage and facial were ok. I asked for very firm but felt too much pressure was applied to my bones which is still painful. My daughter had the opposite experience and said her treatment was fine.The afternoon tea was booked for just after our treatment. However when we got to reception we were advised that the restaurant didn't open until 12.30. Reception contacted the restaurant manager who came up and apologised that they had not received the email with the booking. However as the restaurant was not open, we could have a drink on the house until the restaurant opened. As soon as the restaurant was open we were promptly collected and seated. We were offered a choice of hot drinks and given the menu. We were served by Salomey. Neither of us eat red meat or cheese so the sandwich selection was limited as the only thing we would eat was the salmon. Despite this Salomey said she would check with the chef whether they had chicken or turkey. She returned with chicken and salmon sandwiches. They were to die for. The afternoon tea included mini scones, bakewell tarts, brownies, pannacotta and macaroons. Everything tasted great and was one of the best afternoon teas I've had. The tea was freshly brewed leaves hot and plenty of substance, not the weak watered down rubbish that seems to served in most places. Champagne was also part of the deal but as we didn't have it, Salomey spoke to the restaurant manager and asked if our bottled waters that were not included in the voucher could be substituted. She was a great waitress, friendly, helpful and couldn't do enough for us. Thanks to both her and the restaurant manager for making what would have been a disappointing experience more than positive. The hotel is in a great location, is attractive and the staff we came in contact with were all pleasant. I would definitely go back and would also love the opportunity for an overnight stay.

I booked 3 rooms for 4 nights for a business trip. The cabins are pleasant although a little dated, the beds are comfortable and it’s lovely staying riverside to open up onto the deck with great views. Reception staff are very pleasant, however the services levels with the restaurant and bar fall well below expectations and staff adopt a couldn’t care less attitude. The restaurant can’t accept more than 10 covers at any one time due to the size of the kitchen. I saw numerous residents turned away because of this reason. What type of hotel cannot offer reasonable restaurant facilities for its guests? Breakfast costs £20 for full and £15 for continental. Completely overpriced for self service with limited breakfast items. There is more fruit choice in my supermarket lunch box than what the hotel offered. Also, only 1 x 4 slice toaster available at breakfast time with constant queues. Various residents complaining it was unacceptable. After eating elsewhere one evening we returned to the hotel bar to be told it was closed - even to residents! Staff constantly apologising for the shortfalls. I was hoping for a great experience, but it was a disappointment.

Me and my friends had afternoon tea here a few days ago. It was a bit disappointing to find that afternoon tea had gone up £5 each since our booking made in January. Nobody got in touch to advise of this. £25 service charge was also added to the bill, which was wavered for us in light of the above mentioned situation.Afternoon tea was ok, to be honest ive had better for half the price.The yaught is lovely, and definitely a nice experience. But sadly i wouldnt return. Its very pricey for what it is.

Fantastic place to start your stay in London, first class rooms exceptionally clean, staff were very friendly & helpful, from here we travelled to the 02 ,this was another must for us, we crossed the river Thames via the ski lift, seeing London at night well worth it,

Good value from booking.com location is where we needed it to be. Unfortunately someone put drinks on my room bill but the staff sorted that out. They should always use both lifts for access there was some lengthy delays waiting to get on & off the boat.

We tried Sunborn for a different kind of hotel experience and we weren't disappointed. Our package included an executive double room, dinner for two and breakfast. The large room was fantastic with a polished wood finish to all the walls and furniture. It felt very grand. We had a small balcony with a view over the water to the far side of the dock. We found the room modern, stylish, very clean and equal to any 5 star hotel that we've stayed at previously. It was only the weather (poor) that prevented us from enjoying ourselves out on deck. The main stairway is quite elaborate and stunning and is clearly the central feature inside the yacht. Our dinner was excellent, with scallops followed by fillet steaks and cheese boards (1 each). All the food was fresh and cooked to perfection. The cheese boards had the biggest variety and largest pieces of cheese we've ever received on cheese boards - each board contained more than sufficient for two people. Breakfast was buffet style and once again offered a good variety of cooked, cereal and continental style food. We found service to be excellent and will be back again in warmer weather.

Upon entering the hotel I was kind of underwhelmed at the decor. The lifts were a pain as you had to put your card in the slot to enable the lifts to work and the card reader was playing up slightly, so time wasted playing around with the slot was irritating. The cabin was how a cabin would be expected to look with wood furniture. The bed was UNCOMFORTABLE and the pillows were lacklustre, I'd say that the beds and pillows in a Premier Inn were much better. The bathroom needed updating in my opinion. We decided to go to the bar area behind reception which was the only place open for a drink as the bar terrace upstairs was closed. The bar area was kind of underwhelming. I fancied a coffee and cake but was told that they only had a couple of muffins left over from breakfast so I had one of those. The coffee arrived and was luke warm.We drank our drink and sat there feeling that the common areas could be updated somewhat.Luckily we were going out to eat that night and managed to find an escape room nearby to do as couldn't have sat in the bar all evening.Breakfast was again underwhelming not a very good selection and was luke warm.Overall the whole experience left us leaving kind of deflated and seems like an effort to even write this review as the whole thing seemed very how would I say normal ! I think for this place to sell itself as an executive accommodation they need to seriously upgrade or have a look at the reviews written and think about their marketing.

My husband and I stayed at the Captain for two nights when we went to Wimbledon for the day and couldn't fault the accomodation for the price we paid. The rooms are spacious for London and the food at the pub is excellent. Would definitely stay again and would recommend to others.

My partner and I stayed at the Captain Cook during the first week of May 2019. We could not have been more impressed with the experience. Tom and Jack, who run the pub, were incredibly kind and hospitable, and the entire staff went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. The pub itself is warm and inviting, and the food is some of the best we've had in London. We felt as though this became our second home while we were in the UK. We cannot recommend this location enough.

Stayed here one night prior to an early appointment at Charing Cross Hospital, which was a short walk away (5 minutes by bus) The rooms have their own entrance separate to the pub, however reception duties are taken care of at the bar. Check in was friendly and efficient and we were shown to our room and the facilities explained to us.We had room 2 which was spacious, comfortable, and with en suite facilities. The pub itself was busy however you cannot hear it from the room. We spent the evening in the bar and both had very enjoyable meals. My husband had the burger which is huge and he said was excellent. My steak was very tasty but if I return I would have the burger. We would definitely stay again and recommend.

We had 2 bedrooms with shared bathroom. Everything was clean. There is coffe maker with big choice of capsules and a electric kettle in the room. I was afraid because of the pub downstairs but it´s not noisy. On photos the rooms look smallers than in reality

Chose the captains cook as was close to football ground. Lovely clean room huge bed and not as noisy as your out of the hustle of the main centre of Fulham. Pub was nice not a busy place being on the outskirts but that suited us, staff really friendly and welcoming we would return.

Just returned home to the US from a weeks stay at The Captain Cook, this pub along with the rooms above is a great place to stay while in London, the Staff are excellent and nothing is too much trouble, the rooms are clean and housekeeping comes in everyday, highly recommend this place, bus stops are right outside the door and the underground is a 15 minute walk to Fulham Broadway or a short bus ride

I booked a room here for one night for my son and I as we were going to the football at Stamford Bridge. What a find it was too. Where most hotels were quoting almost £200 for the night I paid £88 for a room here and it was brilliant. The room was enormous, beautifully decorated and well furnished with a Smart TV, Nespresso coffee maker and bottled water. The bathroom was separate to the bedroom but was private for our use only, was again really nicely decorated and very clean. We didn’t eat here so I can’t rate the food from personal experience but what I did see / smell looked amazing! The pub was a 15min walk from Fulham Broadway which was perfect for us and we were really pleased with the location and the value for money it offered. The staff are really helpful, friendly and welcoming and check in presented no issues at all. I’d definitely stay here again and would recommend for anyone looking for a value for money stay which provides easy access to Central London.

Great pub and great place to stay. Super friendly staff, board games in the pub open for use, clean and tidy rooms. Fantastic place to to base yourself to see Fulham. There are also plenty of shops and other pubs and restaurants nearby Would return

Stayed at the captain cook for 3 nights. Due to doing other things, only ate there once, I had fish and chips, it was beautifully cooked, the batter was nice, it wasn’t greasy. Very tasty. I didn’t have to wait very long, very efficient service

Walked in and found a stack of games - some for kids and others for adults. The service was friendly and accommodating. We sat outside and talked as our kids played Battleship. All in all a wonderful evening

Great B&B. We stayed in the deluxe double room which had a huge, queen size bed. It was very clean and well presented. There was free parking available on the road side directly outside the pub. There was also a bike rental stand right outside.

I stayed at The Captain Cook on a Monday night in November on my way through London, and it was an excellent stay. From Heathrow, I took the Tube (Piccadilly Line) to the bus (211), which stops very close to the pub (150 meters or so). The trip took about 50 minutes, including transfer at Hammersmith Bus Station. Arrived early (12:30), which was not a problem at all. Walked into the pub and greeted warmly by the barman, who escorted me straightaway upstairs to my room. I had booked the superior deluxe room, which was more than large enough. Very clean, well-appointed with comfortable bed and adequate bathroom facilities en suite. The wifi was a little spotty, but not a huge problem. I was a little worried about that there would be a lot of noise from the street as the room overlooked Dawes Road, which is fairly busy, but this turned out not to be a problem. As it was a Monday night, the pub was quiet as well; I did not go there for food/drink. I plan to return soon, and will grab a pint downstairs this time.All in all a very good stay, and although I had limited interaction with the staff, it was quite positive. I'm also a big fan of the Fulham neighborhood, as it's convenient to Heathrow but not smack in the middle of the tourist area of London. As I mentioned above, I plan a return visit.

Very nice big room high-quality bedding coffee machine, room very good bath or shower very good Wi-Fi fantastic location 10 minute walk from the tube and pay & display car park on the street less then one minute walk, Will definitely come back soon

Lovely room, huge bed, great shower (superior room with en suite), black out blind, Lavazza coffee machine, very quiet and airy - a gem in London!! Also very friendly bar staff. If there is a downside it’s that it’s nearly 15mins walk to the tube so it takes a while to get in to central London, but well worth it for lovely room and exceptional value.

Nice quiet place. The place felt genuine English, just what we were after. Good food in the restaurant on the ground floor. Lovely rooms. Nice privacy if wanted. Bus stop just down the street. Tub was a 10 minute walk from the pub.

I can strongly recommend this place. Clean spacious room with a very comfortable bed and reliable wifi setup meant that I could have a relaxed but productive visit to London. Fulham was a nice quiet neighbourhood to be in, and found the stroll to the Parsons Green station very pleasant for easy CBD connections on the District Line. Nice food and a cold beer just downstairs at the end of a day too, perfect!

Absolutely fantastic! Cleanest place I've stayed in in years!!!The shared bathroom was so clean it was as if no one else was using it!!Quiet and close to Chelsea to do shopping and spa services. You even have private WiFi just for your room. Super secure!I will always come back here.They even went to the store late at night to get me a toothbrush! !!! Best staff ever!

Hopefully my review will make up for my cheesy title. Captain Cook is a lovely, hidden bistro just passed the heart of Fulham. We were instantly seated, welcomed warmly and then a member of staff came over to explain that we are eligible for a 90 minute free flowing prosecco brunch. For the price of the deal, we were worried (but accepted) that we would have a very limited menu but we were offered a pastry and then a variety of breakfast choices or hearty main meals. The staff were attentive and were constantly topping up glasses when they saw they were at the half way point. The food was lovely-I had a fresh, almond pastry and a full English, which was DELICIOUS. I would recommend Caprqin Cook to family and friends and I would definitely go back for their prosecco brunch-with or without a great deal.

Had another 3 day stop in london on my way home back to australia. Once again i was looking fora place in Fulham. I posted for another Pub hotel stay after my last stop at the Malt House.The manager was helpful and shoed me to my room, Very nice room, looks new and was very comfy. Bed was good and the desk was large and internet fast, I had a lot of work to catch up on after being in Italy with no WIFI. Google maps clocks this place as 11-18min walk to fulham broadway, it also takes you the long way around i think. found a few back street options off the North road.They didn't offer breakfast, they did offer a 10% discount at a place 5min away. i walked passed it one day and it didn't look very inviting. Went to shot in Fulham instead.Check out was a little annoying. My flight wasn't till 930 pm i wanted to leave bags at the hotel somewhere and grab them later in the day.Unfortunately check out is at 1030am and no-one is actually on site till 12pm. i was told if packed a bag of things i needed for the next day i could i leave my bag in the bar over night and and collect it next day when i was ready. This wasn't very convenient.i ended up taking my bag to paddington station and leaving in there locker system for 12 pounds for the day, that would i could just jump on the heathow express and not worry about the tube traffic.That and breakfast probably the only 2 minor problems i had at the captain cook. other wise its a great place stay.Bus stops out the front too which head in every direction.

A charming hotel with friendly staff. Rooms have coffee and tea facilities, hygiene at an enviable level. There are several shops and several good restaurants nearby. Warm recommendation for the restaurant Fulham Kitchen nearby.

The Captain Cook is a lovely place to stay. Fulham is a nice neighborhood with nearby choices for food and drink, and there's a large tube station within a 10 min walk (Fulham Broadway) that has a large shopping center in it. The nearby businesses mostly operate during business hours do there are not a lot of people around at night, and it's a quiet neighborhood. The hotel room was very clean, but smaller than I was expecting because they don't provide pics of all the rooms, just the biggest ones. We had an ensuite room that was smaller than expected. It would be nice if they showed all the room layouts so you know what you are getting. Also, if you cannot do stairs, you won't be able to stay here. All the rooms are up at least 1 flight of narrow windy stairs. But they will take your bags up and down for you. That was nice. One last heads up, they fill the water tanks on the coffee and tea makers so they're ready to go for you. But they don't always clean them first and you have no way to know when it was last filled. I thought they just had hard water when I saw the coffee water was murky, but after dumping it out, found a good deal of slime at the bottom of the tank. We had to wash the tank out and ran a few rounds of just hot water through the machine before we could use it. Then the water was much clearer. Just something to keep an eye out for.

Super friendly and helpful staff, lovely comfortable room and really well fitted out. Everything you need for a stay. I was here for two nights and can't fault it at all. Will definitely be heading back here next time I'm in London!

Read reviews first and chose this place based on the location to my business meeting but also the food reviews. The room was warm with a really noisy air conditioner. There are a lot of stairs - be warned! The pub was actually dead (it was a Tuesday night but in the middle of a residential area). Despite the quietness of the kitchen, our food was burnt and overcooked, and disappointingly small for the price.

Popped in yesterday evening with my partner julie enjoyed a nice few pints of Guinness and julie enjoyed a couple of glasses of red wine, staff were nice and polite and the new decor is a lot nicer now, would definitely pop in again Bernie

Stayed at this gastro pub over a weekend, arrived quite late on the friday night but was greeted by Paul and Kim and showed up to room 1. The room was superb, very clean and warm, lovely layout and an excellent room to stay. We had the weekend breakfast which was delivered by Kim and Adam. It was the full english and was superb!. The whole staff at this pub hotel were great, very welcoming and friendly. Had a great time staying at this pub. Kim, the executive chef had some superb meals on the menu! Recommend you try!!

I am in London a lot I found this hotel by chance, a great place very clean, rooms as good as a top hotel lovely and would highly recommended . The price is amazing and staff so friendly . Great choice of food menu and ideal location, buses to Hammersmith and central London pass the hotel, good wifi a major plus in this day and age

great rooms and great service. Room was clean with wonderful furniture. Perfect for a weekend getaway with your partner. Close to a small shopping centre in Fulham and some nice local restaurants. Would very much recommend.

This was a great place for a weekend of food and football. It was easy to get to and from and if the weather had been better the opportunity for riverside walks was really tempting . Local pub recommendations too. Staff were very helpful both at check in carrying bags upstairs but also at meal times accommodating us around tables already booked felt like home from home. Brunch not breakfast was spot on - no rush to get downstairs on Saturday and Sunday morning, instead a gentle tea and coffee in bed, lovely shower and then a casual glide down to a mixed breakfast lunch menu. Lots of locals having bubbly and brunch! The room appliances and provisions were excellent and our room had a proper desk and light set up for those who need to work whilst away, also a comfy armchair big tv too. Friday night had happy hour .it was an easy walk to Craven Cottage for Saturday football And they had big screen football then live music in the evening. Locally supported establishment with a great feel.

We had an excellent stay at the Captain Cook! The GM, Paul, was so accommodating and friendly. The staff in the pub downstairs, from the bartenders to the kitchen were top notch. The food in the pub is delicious, especially their Sunday Roast, and it's a perfect place to enjoy a drink after a long day sightseeing. We spent nine wonderful nights in this lovely accommodation and had easy access to center London through multiple bus and tube stops. We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to many of our friends. Do yourself a favor and enjoy a stay in one of London's hidden gems.

I liked the Captain Cook the moment I saw its pictures. The maps on the wall, the wooden furniture, the colour of the light... It was just dreamy. I didn't even care to read many reviews before I booked it. Fortunately, it lived up to our expectation. True, the stay was not 100% perfect. 1. Our room faced the road, so when vehicles ran by it could be noisy. 2. Occasionally there were feathers pointing out from the blanket which felt scratchy. 3. There was a layer of limescale in the kettle. Despite of these, I absolutely enjoyed my stay there. The room was spacious and beautiful just like its pictures suggest, and the bed was very very big and comfy. There were lots of hangers next to a big window. The wifi signal was strong and stable. It's easily reached by buses going out from tube stations. It's situated in a nice and safe neighbourhood. And very importantly, its staff have excellent customer service. Overall speaking, good value of money, especially when it's more on the less expensive side among all choices in London. Definitely going back if I ever have the chance to visit London again, and would recommend my friends to stay there.

We stayed here as a part of our European trip. The location was awesome. Bu staying here, you are a 10 minute bus ride away from the Hammersmith station linking you to the tube and other buses. The room was nice a clean. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The price for this hotel was very reasonable. We opted to pay the extra to have a private bathroom in our room. We been took the time to have dinner in the pub downstairs. The food and service were excellent. We would stay here again.

Just spent three nights here. Everyone in our party was very impressed with the quality of the accommodation. Thought it was also a tremendous value. Granted, you are not in the centre of town, but all the sights and shopping are very much accessible, just a short tube ride away. The pub itself is also very nice with excellent food and service. Highly recommended!

What a fantastic gastro pub this is ......lovely gem hidden away in Dawes Road. Food excellent, atmosphere friendly and welcoming and a special mention to Florian who is amazing always over and above call of duty to make sure your visit is enjoyable. Quiz night is fun on Sundays and the brunch is fantastic value for money there are special deals on wowcher. Will definitely be back again. Well done all the staff at the Captain Cook.

A beautiful pub with great service. Maddy made incredible cocktails and Dave the chef cooked up a scrumptious feast. I totally recommend the mac n' cheese! Beautiful court yeard out the back to enjoy a few drinks.

Another lovely evening at the very hospitable Captain Cook. Great burgers. Kid's menu very popular with the younger members of the family. Mojitos always go down a storm, alcoholic and non-alcoholic alike. Visits to the Captain Cook are always delightful, but made especially so when Jimmy is on duty. For us (and clearly also for others) he makes the pub 'our local' - which is no small thing these days. Note to all: if you leave a tip it goes to the staff. Well done CC management.

When i arrived to the hotel, there was no reception.One lady in the hotels bar told me that the reception is at the bar.I waited around 20 minutes until the barman finished to pour the drinks to the customers, then took me to the room.The room was OK, but no air conditioner.Next day i had a reservation in other hotel, so i left my luggage in the Captain Cook, so i could go travel in the city, then pick up the luggage.The bar is closing around 23:00 - 23:30. So after 23:30 i couldn't pick up the luggage that i left in the Captain Cook and had to go to the second hotel without the luggage (clothes).I came back to Captain Cook next morning to take the luggage.At 08:00 the bar (reception) was closed.So i waited outdoor for 3(!) hours until some supplier came and opened the door, so i could pick up the luggage.As i understand, the bar is open from 12:00 to 23:30. So if you come to the hotel between 23:30 and 12:00 you'll find a closed door.

This is one place you don't want to miss out on! Our 4 night stay was perfect, from check-in to check-out. The rooms are spacious, very comfortable bed, and great amenities. The staff are awesome...very friendly and welcoming. Food in the pub is fantastic. Its about a 5 min bus ride to the Fulham station...15 min to downtown. Loved this place!

Had a great stay at the Captain Cook. The room (room 1), was spacious and very well kitted out. There was a coffe machine, heaps of tea and coffee available, an excellent hairdryer (I know, but it really makes a difference to me). The bed was huge and very comfy. A good location on a bus route for getting around easily. We enjoyed the pub as well. Had some nice cocktails on Friday night (on happy hour prices - making them even better! ). And I really enjoyed the Sunday roast, great roasties. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Thanks for a great stay.

This is in the Chelsea area of London. Takes about 20 minutes to get into London. Close to both bus and the Tube. The rooms were huge and very comfortable. The food downstairs in the pub was amazing. Free tea in the pub. Restaurants and a grocery store is close.

I booked this hotel for my sisters hen do and right from the start Mike the manager could not have been more accommodating and helpful.The rooms are all large and spotlessly clean - all decorated lovely and homely - felt relaxed from the moment we were here.We had all 8 rooms so this was perfect for the hen as we could all get ready in each other's rooms - definitely recommend for large groupsthat are after a classy weekend with in easy reach of the station.Very peaceful considering the location - beds really comfy - perfect nights sleep.Staff were amazing - made to feel welcome from the moment we got there and food excellent.I will definitely stay here again on trips to London - loved it.

We arrived at The Captain Cook well after midnight, but the wonderfully helpful hotel manager had given us exactly the instructions we needed to find our room and our bed. And were we pleased! For budget reasons, we had chosen a very small room with an external (but private) bathroom. The room was elegantly decorated (as befitting a ship's captain!) and the bed was enormous. Linens were crisp and white. Teas, coffee and a big glass bottle of water sat invitingly on a writing desk Captain Cook would have loved. And the bathroom, though down the hall, was spotless and very contemporary in design. (The little containers of shampoo and body wash were so charmingly designed I had to take some home.) For $175 Canadian a night, this tasteful, cosy room was excellent value in a city like London. My daughter and I were completely comfortable there, and I'd happily stay again if their prices don't shoot up. It is a bit out of the way, in an interesting but safe district called Fulham, but everything in London is connected by a brilliant transit system, so that wasn't an issue for us. Would highly recommend The Captain Cook to anyone.

This place is first class, we stayed in the rooms they have there and they were extremely comfortable! well equipped and spacious. Very helpful staff and excellent food in the pub too. We were a group with 10 children and they provided camp beds, cots and high chairs and somewhere to leave buggies etc. Couldn't recommend it highly enough such a great place to stay in London.

Absolutely amazing place. We booked all the rooms for my family when in London for our youngest sons wedding. 11 adults and 10 children ranging from 2 weeks old to 10 years old!! Mike could not have been more welcoming and helpful, nothing fazed him.Dave the cook came in specially to cook us all an amazing pre wedding brunch on the Saturday, and all the staff were so helpful in spite of a lot of kiddies to cope with. We are going to make this our London pad whenever we are in London it really is so good, I am a retired airline pilot and have stayed in some of the best hotels all over the world, all expenses paid of course! And I really mean it when I say this is one of the best.

We've been here a couple of times for weekend lunches and both times have been struck by how great the staff are - nothing is too much trouble and they're really smiley, kind (to the children) and happy to talk through the menu.There's lots of space to sit down, without the tables being crammed in, there's a box of toys for the children, and an encouraging open kitchen. The loos are clean, too.But the best bit (apart from the attitude of the welcoming staff), is the food - seriously top quality, generous, and well put together. If you knew this pub in its previous incarnation and weren't sure it would be any good, go, because it's utterly fantastic and my new fave for Sunday lunch in Fulham.

Couldn't have been made to feel more welcome when we arrived by Mike and the rest of the staff at The Captain Cook. The pub and the rooms are all decorated to a high standard and we really enjoyed the stay. Mike also recommended things to do in areas of London that we hadn't been before and this was very much appreciated.I would highly recommend staying here whenever you're in London and you enjoy staying somewhere where people appreciate your business.

It's not often I stay somewhere and fail to find fault with anything, so this is a first. The Captain Cook was perfect.Our room was incredibly spacious, and the bed was huge. Free tea and coffee, reliable wifi, unique decor, immaculate bathroom... there wasn't anything to dislike. As it was my wife's birthday, they even managed to arrange a bouquet of flowers for our arrival.Mike the owner was basically on call 24/7, so that was reassuring.You won't go far wrong ordering food in the pub restaurant downstairs, either - very reasonably priced for London, and much better than we had in the city.You've also got a Tesco Express within a minute's walk, Parsons Green tube about 5-10 minutes further, and the delights of Fulham in the other direction. All in all, it was a top stay.

Had a delicious meal in the pub and as it was a Saturday night there was live music too - great atmosphere and very cosy. Room was really clean and nicely furnished, with extra touches like a nice Lavazza coffee machine. Plenty of room and a really clean, newly done bathroom. Shower was amazing - rainforest style! We were also lucky enough to get a VIP welcome with bubbles and chocolate coins!

We had a fantastic time at The Captain Cook. The hotel manager, Mike, was a delightful host on arrival and in giving us a tour of our room, complete with insightful historical knowledge of Captain James Cook and his travels. The room itself was excellent and included a large comfortable bed, flat screen TV, wifi, modern en suite (a great shower!) and all impeccably clean. For dinner we ate at the pub restaurant downstairs. Try the scotch egg, one of the best I have had and I have tried many. The food was delicious, filling and accompanied by a glass of well-recommended red. Overall, an excellent and authentic British hotel and pub experience. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute of our stay and will definitely be returning!

Before we even rented a room, the service was extremely helpful. "Karl" and "Mike" took the time to guide us and when we arrived the atmosphere was amazing. Mike printed every route to the places we wanted to visit, and always was up for a little talk. Not only was the service perfect, the room was as beautiful and comfortable as it is pictured on the site of The Captain Cook. The overall experience this pub/hotel is able to give is absolutely unique, and we would recommend it to everybody.

My sister and I had a great stay at The Captain Cook. The pub is very well located, in a quiet neighbourhood, right next to a bus stop so it's easy to reach the centre of London. Our room was beautiful, very clean and exactly as shown in the picture, spacious and comfortable, and quiet too. It's really great value for money. The Manager, Mike, was very kind and helpful and always available for us. We hope to return very soon!

We had an over night stay at the Hide London in Hendon. We went for this particular hotel due to them having parking on-site at no extra cost.We were welcomed at reception and shown where breakfast (continental) would be and then shown too our room (nice touch).Lovely comfortable and up to date room with a safe and fridge and very clean bathroom.Nice place to stay for our visit for Wembley stadium not far at all in an Uber. And plenty of food available locally if you don't want to stay in.

Lovely hotel with contemporary furnishing and not easy to believe it's about ten years old. Friendly staff and real continental breakfast.The management have shared a little luxury with some nice touches: complimentary soft drinks, a variety of teas, coffee and hot chocolate, chocolates, facial tissues, hair conditioner and other bathroom accessories. A decent size bath towel would have been icing on the cake! Rooms quiet from traffic noise but be mindful that sound proofing between rooms isn't great and noisy residents may easily be heard. Parking spaces are just outside on private ground and would be suitable for motorbikes. For public transport, the London Underground is a few minutes walk away at Hendon Central... about 25 minutes takes you to King's Cross Station and further into the heart of the City. Ideal for sightseeing. Would highly recommend staying here.

This is a fab hotel. It’s good value and the facilities are good. Breakfast is really good quality and there are loads of lovely extras like chocolates in the room and loccitaine products etc which are a nice touch. Would stay again!

Every time the wife and I visit, we stay at the hide. It’s so nice and so much cheaper than staying close to the center. It’s literally a 2 minute walk from the Hendon tube station which is 30 minutes into Leicester Square on the northern line. The staff are all super friendly and the breakfast is a great fuel up for a day in London.

Love this place. Would stay again in a heartbeat. It's ideal. The good:-Lovely, modern decor-Comfortable bed-It has parking! That's right, parking!-Great value for money-A few minutes walk from the tube-Amazing breakfast-Friendly staffThe bad-I really can't think of anything-It's on a busy road, so you can hear cars if your window is open. But that's got nothing to do with the hotel

Easy to find with great road and rail transport links. When we first arrived the staff were very friendly and welcoming which continued throughout our stay. The room, although not particularly large was very well thought out and the was plenty of storage space. A nice touch was the chocolates in the room and the complimentary soft drinks. The adjoining shower room was perfectly ample and the addition of good quality toilet tissue, shower gel, shampoo etc was very nice.If I am being picky, the only thing that let's the hotel down is the poor quality of the final finish. The wallpaper in the bedroom was not perfectly lined up and there were gaps in the joins and the grouting in the shower room was awful. Not major issues but little things that I notice. Overall it was a very nice stay and I would definitly go back.

Really cute, chic and affordable hotel. The staff is lovely and excellent, they're always ready to help and serve and make things as easy possible. It's a 5 star hotel in my eyes and so is the service. Executive room is nice and new, breakfast at the hotel is free (that's amazing for London!). I high recommend this place, again and again if you ask me.

After awful experience with Airbnb I was lucky to find a vacant room in this gem of a hotel, which I wanted to book originaly, but was fully booked at the time.This boutique hotel offers much more than you would expect and it is worth all the money. Beautiful design of the interior amd rooms, fabulous breakfast, lovely staff, comfortable bed, above standard in-room amenities...that and more is The Hide London. My many thanks to each staff member for making my stay great and for taking such a good care of this place.

Enjoyed a restful night here with a clean modern room and pleasant staff. They offered an umbrella in the rain, help with luggage etc and were polite and friendly. In the morning the continental breakfast on offer was fresh and varied, all round no complaints. The only reason for not giving 5 stars is the difficult location if driving - luckily I had a satnav as it’s not easy to find if coming on the back roads, and is right on the very busy north circular, with cars flying by. So it can be hard to get in and out of the small car park. But this did not affect noise levels and would not be a problem if coming by public transport as there is a convenient underground stop 2 minutes away, plus local pubs and restaurants on the doorstep

Stayed here when we travelled to Winter Wonderland in December. We arrived early but checked in and were able to leave our bags. It's a lovely place with very clean and comfortable rooms. Nice ideas on space saving and making the most of every available space as we were in the top of the building under the eves as it were. Bed was very comfortable and the bathroom spacious with a lovely shower. Plenty of elbow room and suited our needs exactly. If I was being very picky, it was a shame the TV was not a little larger or on a swivel bracket - its was off set to one side so not that comfortable to watch when laid up in bed. One or two items in short supply for tea & coffee tray (why is it hotels only ever put 4 milk jiggers out!) and only one breakfast tea, tea bag - not a complaint, don't get me wrong, but with everything else so right about this place, just these little things detract. The place is quiet on an evening as pretty much it's a very nice B&B. The staff were very courteous and polite which was nice and very apologetic (although they didn't need to be) when they struggled a little with our drinks when we got back. Nice to sit comfortably and quietly watching a bit of news before retiring. Breakfast is continental and very nice it was too. Would we come back? Definitely as very convenient for us travelling from Yorkshire and even easier walking 2 minutes to the tube with only 30 minutes putting you in the West End. Thank you !

I was allowed to check in a little bit early, which was appreciated. All staff encountered were friendly. Room was nice. The bathroom was well decorated. Strangely the sink was really low, whilst the toilet was very tall. This isnt a criticism, just an observation. Unusual. The location isnt great being on the main road, but handy for the tube and for the University (where I was attending an event). Even with London prices I felt this was too expensive especially given there wasnt a cooked breakfast. There wasn't anything particualty wrong with the accommodation, it just wasnt great or excellent.

I chose to give this a 5 star review as I couldn’t think of anything bad to say about it. Modern, efficent, clean and fashionable. Great freebies in room, simple but good quality breakfast. Parking at the rear is tight, tube station 2 mins walk away. On the down side, not a huge amount to do in the area, and the road outside is crazy busy.

We stayed here for my graduation in London it was really easy and fast to get to London from the hotel took about 20 mins! The hotel was easy to miss at first we drove past it and had to do some loops to come back, when you hit the cross roads where the tube station is after the lights on the left is the hotel go slow or you will miss it! The hotel accommodated us leaving our bags early, there was plenty of parking, we came back later after my graduation and the room was amazing, modern with tea coffee, big shower, all the little things that make it feel like home, complimentary drinks in the fridge too! Bed was so comfy as well. The only thing is we stayed in Room 24 at the top and it was boiling, we tried to sort the air con out but it didn’t seem to work :( had it right down to 17 degrees and was so hot still. Breakfast was lovely the next day, lots to choose from and the staff are lovely friendly and helpful! I wish I had just asked about the air con so my fault really! I would recommend, and I will stay again without a doubt!!!

I like this hotel a lot, it isn't to difficult to get to from the M4, it has parking (but you may have to drive through a very narrow alley way). Rooms are very clean but a tad small , usual tea and coffee facility and complimentary soft drinks in the fridge. Breakfast is continental and very good in my opinion. It's always been quiet when I have visited ,mainly couples.Tube station is 150m up the road and there's a small 24hour shop between tube station and hotel.

I highly recommend staying at The Hide London. Everything was so clean and modern. The bed was comfortable, and the shower/bathroom was so perfectly clean as if it’s never been used. There was a small fridge that they kept stocked with water and drinks daily, and the room also had instant coffee, hot chocolate, and assorted teas with an electric kettle. They also have a complimentary breakfast in the dining room with assorted meats and cheeses, danishes, fruits, yogurt, juice, etc. It’s not in a very busy part of London, but it’s a 2-minute walk to the London Underground tube which is very convenient. If you do end up renting a car, I would suggest letting them know ahead of time to reserve a parking space because they have limited parking. I did this and my spot was reserved for the whole week without issue. The staff was kind and accommodating. So glad we chose The Hide London!

Amazing roomsGreat bedsGreat locationFabulous breakfast and friendly and helpful staff. Easy to find and free parking just down from Hendon station. This was my second stay here and I would definitely come back. Great location if visiting London.

This is small but very nice, clean hotel. Staff are friendly and it is walking distance from tube. They offer Chocolates on arrival and free bottled water during our stay. Free parking on site. Internet was fast. Breakfast was below average but was fresh and nice.We really enjoyed our stay. I have no hesitation to recommend this hotel. Thank you for taking care of us.

I stayed here for three nights with my teenage daughter. We arrived late and tired, but it was very easy to park, and we got a very friendly welcome.The room was lovely; well insulated from noise and clean. In fact the bathroom and shower was so clean that my tired daughter walked into the shower door! (Comedy gold)All the staff were lovely, the room was cleaned well each day, and the breakfast was good, with excellent coffee. (Even espresso). It’s really convenient for central London, we’ll definitely stay again.

Pros:- 3 min walk from Hendon Central (Zone 3, Northern line)- L'Occitane toiletries - Chocolates on arrival- Free bottled water (still & sparkling) & soft drinks- Free cookies- Nice rain shower- Bathroom slippers- In room safe & hairdryer- Relatively spacious room by London's standards- Well designed room with hangers, coat & suit hooks - Included continental breakfast (cold meats, pastries, toast, fruit, cereals)- Very comfortable bed (PS: what make was it?)- Plenty of plugs around the room at convenient locations- Helpful and obliging reception staff- Fresh flowers (orchids!) in room - Think there's free parking but we didn't need it- Quiet room Cons- Around 30-40 mins by tube from central London- No lift (but receptionist helped us carry our luggage upstairs)- No light in wardrobe (where full length mirror was - difficult to dress up at night!)- In room safe got very warm, due to its location just above the fridgeOverall, would definitely consider staying here again despite slightly out of the way location. Thanks!

What a gem we found ... it doesn’t look stunning outside... but the room is so good, not very big but very beautiful with excellent in room facilities ... cosy and compact.. Simple but very good quality continental breakfast. Also free parking and air conditioning are very rare in London.. it makes the stay even much much better...

We recently stayed here while visiting the RAF museum at Hendon. I found the property through a Google search. The Hide is only a 2 minute walk from Hendon Central Tube Station. It has been extensively modernised both outside and in and stands out from the neighbouring buildings. On site parking is a bonus. When we checked in we were immediately struck by the modern decor and cleanliness of the property. Our room, although not spacious was more than adequate. There was plenty of hanging space, the showeroom was well designed, well stocked and not cramped. There was a kettle with tea, coffee & biscuits and even complimentary soft drinks in the fridge. The staff were welcoming & friendly and there was a plentiful selection of fresh fruits, juices, yogurts & cereals along with breads, meats & pastries for breakfast.We would definitely book The Hide should we be visiting the area again.

The first thing I noticed when we arrived was how beautifully clean, tidy and modern the hotel was. We were greeted by the lovely staff and were very pleased with our room. The room has complimentary drinks and bottled water and a welcome gift of chocolates. The shower was great and really powerful. The breakfast was amazing and beautifully presented. We were very happy with our stay here and would definitely stay again.

the room was OK, everything new, comfortable mattress, very nice shower room (very strong water pressure). breakfast not so good, nice staff. In spite of being very close to a busy road, the room was very quiet. I could hear people talking in the lobby though.

Free coffee and tea was available all day. A lot of sockets in the room. Good location. The room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom was spacious. WiFi was very poor. Breakfast was substandard. The fruit salad was stale and insufficient. We had to always ask for refill. The staff was very reluctant to refill anything. We only saw the cake 3 days out of 7. The croissants were never fresh. One of the cleaning woman who didn’t know much English didn’t work properly. She left my dustbin full. Didn’t remove empty toiletries bottles and replace the bath gown.

We last stayed here over a year ago in a double room. This time we booked an executive double room which had more space and more comfort (also robes and Bluetooth speaker). We were welcomed by a surprise in our room which was greatly received! Air con worked very well in the room and it was not loud. Complimentary refreshments within the minibar in the room were a nice touch. Comfortable beds and pillows, powerful shower, luxurious toiletries and a divine continental breakfast makes this hotel a five star rating! We will be back! Thanks to all the staff at The Hide London for a fantastic stay.

We were attending a conference in London and wanted a clean, comfortable and wallet friendly hotel. The Hide fitted the bill perfectly. It’s small, with lovely decor and fittings. The bed was very comfy. The staff were courteous and helpful, the breakfast great, the little touches like complimentary soft drinks and high quality toiletries making it very competitive to the big hotel brands but all in all a great boutique hotel with parking and 2 minute distance from the underground. Superb

We stayed here when visiting Wembley for a concert - our room was lovely, really clean and tidy. The bathroom was lovely - really good shower and complimentary toiletries (as I forgot my shower gel). There were tea making facilities in the room which is always important and the bed was super comfy! We slept really well. The breakfast was good - continental but lots of choice. The price we paid was good and we were pleased with the service we got and will stay here again, highly recommend.

Nice hotel with easy access to anywhere in London. The overnight desk helped me print out my check in for flight .the location is close to big mall .the breakfast had something for everyone and I am a picky eater. The kind of place i always look for on my budget .Also free soft drinks and water in mini fridge daily .

Pleasantly surprised with the standard of this hotelThis is essentially a couple of residential houses that have been converted into a hotel.Parking is very handy, lots of nearby shops + underground is 5 mins walkThe rooms are of very good quality, good size and with very good quality fittings and finish.The biscuits, teas, shampoos etc are all boutique and very high quality.I would definitely use this hotel again and can recommend highly.I don’t believe the hotel has a lift which could be a problem for some visitors.

Booked here for a Saturday night in London. Changed booking a couple of times as the price kept reducing! Got a standard double room for £85.The hotel is on the main road about a 3 minute walk from the Hendon Central underground stop. Nice friendly check in and shown to our room on the first floor. Room 10.Not the biggest room, but enough for us. Great bathroom with large shower, good water pressure and lots of products. There was a safe, tea facilities and a mini bar with 3 bottles of water, milk and 3 cans of pop. The hairdryer did not work but I popped to reception and he gave me spare one. It was a nice quiet room at the back of the hotel with a large opening window which we kept open all night as it was so warm. We went down for breakfast at 10am (served 8am - 11am on a Sunday). There was a large variety of fruit, yoghurt, bread, rolls, cereals, cold meats, cheeses, juices and hot drinks. The dining room was nice but very hot! We had a good night's sleep and thought it was great value for money. Friendly staff.

I wanted so much to like this hotel, I went out of my way to stay here in fact. They have done an excellent job with the hotel decor, but there were some things that prohibit me from recommending it.Pros:Decor is lovelyBreakfast was sufficient to get the basicsBathroom amenities were high quality Location is very close to Hendon tube station Cons:The bed was awful. Thin, hard mattress and pillows that were flat and lumpy. I did not sleep well at all. Sheets were low thread count and scratchy. Why they spent so much time to have such a beautiful hotel and failed at one of the most important things perplexes me. The desk is not staffed 24 hours so if you need something you are basically out of luck.My hairdryer was broken in my roomThe wifi was so slow I could not get on or do any work. I had to leave the hotel and find a place with internet.The shower head in my room was installed so it tilted toward the wall and was fixed so you can’t adjust it. To get water in my hair I had to press myself against the wall to catch the full stream- I’m 5’2” and 100 lbs so I pity anyone larger than me trying to use that shower.Bottom line, if you want to stay in the area and don’t care about a comfortable bed,wifi or a courteous staff then you will enjoy this hotel. It has good potential for sure and with a few adjustments and maintenance it would be a good place to stay.

Stayed several times. Cans of pop and water in the fridge are included. Little chocolates are a nice touch. Clean, well decorated. Rooms on the small side (currently in room 2). The continentals breakfast is better than you may expect, enough to fill you up and tasty. I quite like the lack of temptation of a full English!I stay here when attending the university and it is a very short walk there.There is a decent sized park behind the hotel which is good for a few laps on a morning run.Aircon/heating is pretty noisy but can be turned off.Reception and breakfast staff have always been a pleasure to speak to.

The staff was very helpful and the rooms very comfortable. The provided breakfast was very good. I was surprised the drinks in the fridge at the time was complementary.This hotel exceeded my expectations.

Stayed here and saw a show with my wife. Lovely modern and clean hotel, with good parking and easy walk to the underground little fridge bar in room. Very courteous staff Next trip to London I know where we are staying.

Great hotel with parking.... quick commute to all of London sites via tube station 2 mins walk. Compact but well equipped room. Wifi was intermittent even with 3 different log ons (maybe just a prob in room#2?) Super friendly staff that provided great recommendations and informaton.

Had a lovely welcoming from staff. Small room but very comfortable. Beautiful orchids in room. Locitane things in bathroom. Gulivan chocolate on bed. Plenty of tea, coffee, hot choc and biscuits in room. Lovely breakfast. Wide range for a continental breakfast. HUGE muffins and plenty of pastries! All sorts of meats, smoked salmon and cheeses. Lovely fresh fruit. Cereals and toast available. Lovely rolls. Easy check in and check out. Able to leave luggage in the place until we needed them later on which was excellent. Will stay here next time in London.

stayed four nights whilst exploring London. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel,room was small but we managed,the bed bed was super comfortable. The breakfast each morning was delightful with a wide array of choices, nice way to start our day. Location was very good, only a very short walk to the Tube. The pub opposite the hotel was also very good offering good food and very fair prices. All in all a fab stay in a fab city.

This is a medium hotel located quite close to the Hendon tube station. It is very comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is ample although a bit ordinary, e.g. all the cereals are packet cereal. The croissants were not all that fresh but there was a good variety of breads and pastries. Although I don't have a full breakfast, it was available. Parking is available on site. The room and bed were comfortable. The room is not overly big but large enough for the two of us and our bags. The hotel is modern but in a conservative style. The rooms facing the back are subjected to a constant hum of the air-conditioning units. The bathroom is fine with a large shower but the basin could do with an extra shelf on the wall or on the mirror for one's accessories. The shower really needs some non-slip strips when you get in. I asked for and was supplied with a rubber mat after slipping a couple of times.

We really appreciated the very friendly and helpful staff. The bedroom and bathroom were well decorated,comfortable, perfectly clean, and well stocked with L'Occitaine toiletries. The heating was good and easy to use. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide range of cooked meats, smoked salmon, pastries, fruit and cereal..There is on-site parking but if you have a mid-size car bear in mind you need to go through a narrow tunnel to reach it. A large car will not go through but there is limited parking at the front of the hotel.

Absolutely fantastic hotel! Haven't got a bad word to say. The location is superb. It's a couple of hundred yards away from Hendon tube station which takes about 15 minutes to Camden. There's parking to the front and the rear. The rooms were great, fantastic fresh decor, bathroom was brilliant. Breakfast was great. It says continental but there's plenty extra to fill your boots. Finally the staff were incredibly polite and helpful!! Cannot recommend it enough, we'll definitely be back again!

Great little hotel tucked away in Hendon. Free parking, limited to approx 10 cars for 20 rooms, on a first come first served basis. 30 minutes into London via the tube. Free continental breakfast included. Have booked twice, first room was huge, second was smaller with no desk.
