First time staying here! What can I say, excellent Room and staff! Tube station up the road, good continental breakfast! Will be booking again! Although limited spaces parking available, would recommend contacting hotel re a availability!

I stayed at this hotel for one night. I received a very warm welcome from the receptionist who was very helpful and friendly. The double room booked was of a standard size and as expected. I did stuggle with having any internet connection in my room as signal is very low in that area. I loved the breakfast area which was very cozy. The variety of choices for breakfast was nice too!

Stayed one night with my daughter to visit childhood haunts..Great hotel in a good position for visiting London.Very clean and modern, awesome shower.Best continental breakfast, but could probably do with more tables.Receptionist on arrival a little brusk.Room a little on the small side, but there are larger rooms and the fridge is a great bonus.No lift, so have to cart suitcases up 1-2 floors.Great to have on site car parking.Loved the hotel and would definitely recommend and stay again..Definitely a 5

This hotel offers everything you need for a stay in London .easy to find just off the motorway.close to underground station.free parking.very clean and good breakfast.friendly staff .also good pub opposite .

I recently visited The Hide London and really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is a small boutique hotel run by very helpful and friendly staff. It is located close to supermarkets, restaurants, a mall and most importantly it is a stone's throw away from the underground station. Heading into Central London was so easy from this hotel. If you are planning to see the sites and explore Central London purchase an Oyster card for zones 1-3. The station for the hotel is on the border of zone 3/4. There is no need to purchase zone 4 if you are only planning to explore the sites and mostly Central London. That will save you a little money on the card. Overall I enjoyed my stay. My only con would be the water in the shower doesn't get too hot, but that is a personal preference. Absolutely nothing against the hotel or my stay.

One of the best hotel I ever stay... Free Wifi, Very clean, quiet, excellent and complete breakfast, Lovely staff. We have tea and delicious cookies everyday. They offer flip flops, L'Occitane products (shampoo, conditioner, cream, shaving products, nail file, toothpaste and toothbrush), The Bedding and towels are replaced continuously. They offer, water, and soft drinks daily at the mini bar; We can drink orange/apple/tea, everyday at the restaurant, without additional costs. We received a few chocolates at the first day.. This hotel is very close to Hendon Station. (5 MIN WALKING). Although there is not much stores nearby, we can count with an Indian restaurant and an Italian restaurant next to subway station of excellent quality. and there are a few local markets that may be useful ... The cost and benefit worthwhile ... I DO RECOMMEND THE HIDE LONDON HOTEL FOR YOUR STAYING!!!!

We booked to stay for an event at Alexandra Palace. The Reception team were professional, welcoming and very accommodating. The rooms comfy and well equipped with everything you need, water, soft drinks and little toiletries (Love!).Comfy bed and temperature controls, even complimentary fruit and snacks at the hotel. WiFi was excellent too.Continental breakfast was well placed and stocked.And free parking!Really couldn't ask for anything more. We'll be back.Thank you so much :)

I stay at The Hide regularly and feel I must respond to the review left by emzfab82. I appreciate reviews are subjective but I feel the comments made are unfair and in my opinion should be ignored for the following reasons:1, The staff are all lovely and will bend over backwards to make your stay enjoyable2, the hotel cannot be blamed for a cancelled concert. The Hide is a business and the T's & C's are pretty clear. Why would you expect a refund! I'm pretty sure The Hide didn't ask Adele to cancel her performance!3, this hotel is clean, tidy, well managed, customer focussed and reasonably priced4, personally, I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when I visit London5, for a more balanced view, have a look at all the other reviewsI cannot recommend The Hide highly enough!

We checked into the Hide for one night while in London for a concert. It's location at the end of the M1 and right next to Hendon Central Underground station was the main reason for choosing it but the good TA reviews persuaded us too. On arrival the staff on the desk could not have been more friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable and well equipped, even with a free minibar, and faced the rear of the property so it was quiet. Everything feels quite new and modern. Parking was not a problem as there seems to be plenty of space. Next morning we enjoyed a continental breakfast which I have to say is one of the best of its kind I have had anywhere in the world, and I stay in hotels for over 100 nights a year. Well done to the people who run this lovely little hotel, it really is a gem. We will certainly be coming back

My friend and i stayed here last night as it was close to Wembley Stadium for a concert. Welcoming staff (we noticed all staff were women and as 2 women ourselves we felt really comfortable with that) lovely decor, fab bed, beautiful bathroom and lovely little extras like complimentary drinks, toiletries and chocolates. The breakfast was delicious too. I'd book this hotel again in a second.

My husband and I stayed at The Hide London from Wednesday 17 May 2017 until Monday 5 June 2017. We have stayed here 18 months ago. We found the rooms were exceptionally clean and the hospitality was excellent. They include breakfast every day and my husband and I could not fault anything. The Staff are the most wonderful people and always very helpful. It is very central and Transport from here is excellent. The Tube is a 2 minute walk or less and the service from both the buses and the trains are excellent. We hope to return for our third time in 18 Months. We would recommend The Hide London to anyone who is very fussy about cleanliness as this place would be the best. We loved everything about The Hide London, Hendon. Cheers Wendy and Tony

This was our second stay here having stayed there Five years ago. This is a lovely hotel, with a great location just a few minutes walk from Hendon Central tube station. The rooms are spacious and clean, with wi-fi and TSV. We stayed in an executive room where they also supply bathrobes and slippers. Lovely L'occitane toiletries and Chocolates on arrival. The breakfast was continental, with a wide variety of cereals, fresh fruit, breads, hams, cheese, pate, smoked salmon etc. The staff are all really friendly. As mentioned this was our second stay and would definatley stayed there again on our next London visit.

Stayed two nights, arrived very tired, but were cheered up by the friendly and cheerful reception staff. The rooms are of a high standard and well equipped with toiletries. The mini bar in the room was well stocked with complimentary water and soft drinks. A good size, comfortable bed, no problem with sleeping. The decor is of a high standard and well maintained. Breakfast was continental with plenty of selection and well stocked.The northern line tube station is only 200 meters away, easy to get into the city.Great value for money, will stay there again.

Great refurbished hotel. Was a little concerned that it was a bit far away from central London but the tube was good to Leyton. As we arrived late we got an Uber from tube to hotel but the following morning we caught a bus from across the road back to the station - nice and convenient.The staff at the hotel were very welcoming. Unfortunately due to our schedule we didn’t get to try the food. However it looked good and the menu will tempt us back.We booked through Secret Escapes making this a great value break in a comfortable hotel!

Having lived locally for two years, the Lion & Key is my go-to establishment for a drink or dinner. Management are wonderfully friendly and staff are great - they really look after you. The menu is great - freshly cooked grills, burgers, pizza and salads, and their bar is well stocked. I pop in at least every few weeks on my own or with a friend, and they regularly give free starters/ or dessert if we dine. I have also stayed once at the hotel, which can't be faulted for the very reasonable price. Good sized, clean rooms and I am sure if any problems occurred they would be dealt with fantastically. I feel very lucky to have this on my doorstep and this review is long overdue! Thank you Lion & Key.

Stayed overnight as attending a concert at Olympic stadium .Hotel is spotlessly clean .All staff very nice and good selection of food and drink on offer .Small walk to the underground so easy access to any London sights .

The staff was super friendly and everything was extremely clean! I lost my Apple Watch in the room and only realized it when getting on my flight back to the States. The staff found my watch and sent it back to me. They even paid for the shipping! The staff was amazing!!

I had to decamp from my flat to the nearest hotel one night after being locked out in circumstances that are hilarious to look back on now, but the outcome was that I arrived at the Lion and Key in something of a state and had little expectation of the facilities. I was, therefore, very surprised to find one of the best hotels that I've ever stayed in, and certainly the best for its price category. The hotel opened very recently so everything is new and in the modern minimalist style. I happen to be super into stone effect and grey wood panelling, so this was great. Everything was clean. The hotel contains a restaurant that provided complimentary room service, which is ridiculous and amazing. There is an internal intranet on the TV. The bed is memory foam and awesome and the bathroom was spotless and stocked with the little gels. The staff were discreet and did not bother me when I needed them, if you know what I mean. I spent my night drinking my complimentary tea, eating my dinner from my complimentary room serviced tray, and watching BBC Parliament. I had such a great night. Honestly, I only live just down the road but have seriously considered just coming and staying again. Very highly recommended.

This review is one of the best and it is written with such positive energy and gratefulness towards the staff at the hotel.The staff, all from cleaning to waitors and receptionist get high recommends and are so kind and helpful.Even printed out our vouchers to different booked activities.The rooms are very clean and comfortable while also being very stylish and beatiful decor/colours.The food at the hotels restaurant is very nice and affordable, and you even get a 10% discount if your a guest at the hotel.Its about 45min away from central London (borough market) by bus, but you can also easily access the tube from Leyton st.We will surely recommend it to any traveler to London ❤️So thank you Lion & Key Hotel for contributing to an amazing vacation in London ❤️

Cannot fault this hotel in any way!Location is great, at the end of the the high street and in close proximity to all amenities! Hotel is spotless, rooms really comfortable and well fitted!Bad and restaurant food spot on!No faults at all to report!

Stayed here for a night whilst watching a football game at the Olympic park, the rooms are great, newly furnished, clean and modern, the hotel staff are so friendly, and the food they serve is fantastic. Would stay here again anytime, tube station a few mins away, and on the Central line direct into town

Excellent food, good choices on all menu's, even order food early or late. Vegetarian food on menu. plenty of room to eat. Rooms have ensuite with walk in shower and toilet area, ladies have air dryer. T.V. to all bedrooms.

I spent 6 nights in Lion & Key hotel during Christmas holidays (28/12-3/01) and it was lovely. First of all, the staff is extremely polite and kind indeed we arrived out of the check-in time and they made it anyway offering us some fruit because we didn't have dinner. The room and bathroom were warm, elegant and big enough for those who stay outside all day long. The room was cleaned and the bed sheets were changed each morning, making the atmosphere comfy and pleasant. The zone is ok, 10 minutes from the metro station on foot. Moreover, it is well served with different supermarkets, fast food etc... In the end, I definitely recommend it.

This is my second stay at this hotel, the first time was for the London 100 bike ride and they were amazing in accommodating all of the cyclists and their bikes. This time was just a flying visit whilst on business in the area, they were always polite on the phone and whilst at the hotel. The food is fantastic and the rooms are worthy of any five star hotel, the rooms are nothing short of perfect.

It’s a decent place to stay, carpark is a headache because of it’s size but the staff are helpful in sorting it out the rooms are nice and clean with a good shower facilitie. I wasn’t happy with the heating it was pretty cold in my room even though I had reported this to reception nothing was done to solve it.

I was visiting London on business and needed somewhere comfortable but decent value. I found the Lion and Key online and I wasn't dissapointed. The room was well equipped, a decent size and nice and clean and comfortable. Surprisingly for a hotel on a main road it wasn't noisy and sleep quality was good.The food was of a good quality and reasonably priced. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. One key issue is that of parking. I paid £30 to park in the hotel car park whilst I stayed. The car par is very small and getting in and out can be a bit of a faff, however be advised local parking is an issue so if you can arrange parking do so.

A really nice modern (recently refurbished) hotel. It has been converted from a pub and retains a nice bar/restaurant downstairs. The rooms are very clean, modern and everything works. They are large, by London standards. Bathrooms are equally clean and modern. The restaurant is great as well. Clean and spacious. The food is good, good value and plentiful, you won’t go hungry here. The staff were polite and particularly the restaurant staff were friendly. My only very slight issue is that the reception staff were a little brusque. A more chatty warm welcome would have been nice. The other thing to watch is that they need a form of ID when checking in. Quite why this is needed is not clear to me as no other hotel insists on it. The final drawback is that the hotel is a bit off the beaten track. It’s a good 10-15 min walk from Leyton Tube station. And the area of Leyton itself is a bit rough. But all in all it’s. nice modern good value and clean hotel that I will use again.

We picked this hotel as it was on wowcher and were pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. Staff were all very friendly and welcoming and the rooms were large clean and have everything you need including a small kitchen (which we did not know we were getting). The bar downstairs was good and not bad price for drinks. Didn't have any food but it looked delicious. Not far from the tube station and very close to a tesco and a sainsburys express. Would definitely recommend.

We stayed here for 1 night whilst visiting friends in the Leyton area. The hotel proved to be a perfect spot for the visit, conveniently located for visiting the East of End of London, particularly Leyton, Hackney Wick, Stratford etc.The booking process was straight forward as was the check in when we arrived quite late on Friday evening. The hotel itself was friendly and welcoming. The reception was clean and well presented. The room was modern with a great bathroom and shower, plenty of plug sockets (usually an issue) and the usual faculties in the room. Everything worked perfectly and there were no issues at all. We didn’t opt for breakfast but the ones we saw looked very good. Overall a top spot for us and we’ll be returning when visiting the area again in the near future.

Three of us stayed just for one night. What a welcome change from the usual branded hotels. This independent hotel was booked as working less than a mile away but didn’t expect too much in this part if town.Reception were helpful and efficient. Limited parking in a secure courtyard was a little expensive at £15 but street parking locally is probably difficult.Small but tidy room finished to a very high standard with reasonable free internet and freeview.After a couple drinks in the bar we ventured out to eat. Bad move. The whole street apart from this hotel is alcohol free restaurants!So back to the hotel for food. We were all glad that we ended up eating in the hotel restaurant as the food was excellent.A great find in an area thats a little run down.

An immaculate modern hotel behind an old pub facade. Has a mediterranean feel with polished stone flors and walls, well lit with natural light with a central atrium. Bedrooms and good, bar area attractive and the staff are really friendly and helpful. Free tickets for Leyton Orient football games too.

Well I was pleasantly surprised by this quite new renovated Pub, I rarely stay at pub hotels as I fear the noise and discontentment off rowdy revellers, but this was so not the case with The (Lion & Key Hotel), On entering the reception area although small and compact it was well designed wit the small space in which they had to work with, staff were on hand, and although the bar restaurant were keeping them quite busy thee was enough staff able and competant to book myself in. Arival to te room I was happy enough with the room at such short notice small but neat clean and tidy, though my room faced the High Street the double glazing worked well the air conditoning worked well as it was quite hot, the bar I found at £6 was decently priced, so I actually used it for a changed, I had requested two extra pillows which were already provided in the room, so I had no need to ask again which happens for me regularly, anyway my short stay went well, I would definately recommend a short stay there but alas if I was to be honest, I aquired the room on a cut price deal, on review I have seen it's true price and feel this is far over the top in prices, and would only recommend staying there when the deal is right !!

The blurb for this place promises West end Luxury in the East End..well I can't say it was luxurious but it was very clean and tidy, the room was sparsely furnished but everything was functional and spotless. The bed was comfortable enough but not luxurious and the same could be said for the shower room which was certainly no bigger than was necessary. We didn't have breakfast so can't comment on the quality of that but it was at least £10 per head which would make b and b for 2 pushing £160 which is not great value. I would like to give this 3.5 stars but I can't so 3 will have to do.

Chose this place due to the reviews and I must say it lived up to expectations. Room was great, the staff too. The restaurant was a revelation. Try the Turk breakfast, very impressive and great value too. Forget the full English, no comparison. Evening menu gives a wide range of options, fit for all tastes. Good location for Leyton and the tube. Parking is limited though and at £15 per night a little on the high side but worth it in my opinion as its secure. You need to book it in advance. Highly recommended.

I have lived in this area for a number of years. The Lion & Key is a welcome addition to the area because there is little or anything decent within the area. The hotel is a very small modern hotel. I got in very late in the evening time. I got dinner in the restaurant area which was ok but there are better alternatives in Leyton if you are around earlier in the evening. The 2 nights I stayed while going to see family relations were cheap compared to normal hotel accomodation in London. The room was lovely. Both bedroom and bathroom were clean and well equipped. One big word of advise though. If you are a light sleeper who finds it difficult to sleep with noisy traffic outside, bring earplugs. This is a area where there is a lot of traffic and the windows and curtain in my room were in my honest opinion poor and inadequate for the area in question and need replacing. This is a downside to the hotel.

I recently stayed at this hotel with my 11 year old daughter as a birthday treat. We was greeted by a very friendly receptionist, a helpful member of staff when we had problems getting into our room and then a excellent team working in the restaurant area. We both enjoyed both dinner and breakfast. The room was clean and beautifully designed just like the rest of the hotel. As our room was in the front of the buildibg i thought that the traffic would interfer with my sleep but i was wrong. The bed was comfortable and I had an amazing sleep. We had a really great time staying at this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

This hotel is wonderful from the reception to the rooms. Probably due to the area you are required to provide ID and have a £50 deposit against damage. Once you have gone past the warm welcome from reception that has a good open clean decor, you will take the lift to your room.A great sign for a good hotel is cleanliness and sharp chic design. This the hotel has in abundance. Moving to the room. It is spacious modern with an inviting bed and the essentials required for your stay. The TV provides hotel information along with your standard Freeview channels.The bathroom is immaculate with lovely marble and an excellent shower. The only negative point is having to leave. It is reasonably priced and can be reserved at lower prices if caught in time. Another plus point is the cafe, bar and grill alongside with a friendly front of the house manager. Service is fast and the food well presented. This is the gem of East London without a doubt and certainly the number one choice for the price. If you are in the area there is no better choice. Excellent!

I have been to the Lion & Key on a few mornings for breakfast and each visit has been excellent.There is a decent choice on the menu ranging from traditional English through to more modern choices. There is also a massive range of teas available.On my last visit I ordered the Turkish and for an excellent price I received enough food to last all day. Three different cheeses, Turkish sausage, cold meats, eggs, bread and preserves.Delicious.

Lovely little hotel in East London. Modern decor, clean and well presented. First room I was given was cold and uninviting, nothing like the room I’d booked. I spoke to reception who then showed me 3 rooms. Found the one I’d booked, it was lovely, spacious with floor to celing windows. Stylish bathroom. Lots of places to eat as well as at the hotel. We found Five Lads! A chicken and burger place. Food very nice with good service. Great value.

My wife and I stayed at the Lion & Hotel last summer, what a place! Great service.The rooms are very modern and so clean, really enjoyed our 2 nights at it.There food was great and we so much liked it, Our room shower is hot enaugh so we are so glad.The staff were absolutely great and helpful.Recommend to anyone visiting london

My partner Peter and I stayed at the Lion & key Hotel last week. It is such a lovely hotel and the staff are all fabulous. If you are looking for a beautifully clean hotel then this is a must. Everyone in the hotel really look after you and make sure your stay is a memorable one. Transport to and from the hotel is excellent, so you have no worries about getting about. We will definitely be going back to this hotel when next we go to London. Thank you everyone at the Lion & Key for making our trip a memorable one. Jeanie

Really enjoyed our six nights at The Lion and Key Hotel. Our room was very clean and spacious for sleeping three of us and the food was great. We liked the food so much it was difficult to venture out when such good food was so conveniently located downstairs. We didn't use room service, but the entire menu was available that way too. One note, the shower in the room we were in was small, but everything else was so great that we'll stay here again.

Stayed here last minute after a dreadful room with booking.com So glad . The staff was absolutely great , room was really modern and clean. Food in restaurant. Wow .very very good . Recommend to anyone visiting London

Good location friendly and helpful staff,close to station and buses so was able to go into the city and visit very nice bar and restaurant on site they even arranged the cab to get me to the venue, hotel desk maned all night so no problem getting back in.

Clean hotel. Comfortable bed and pillows (always a must when staying away from home!).Nice modern decor. Tea making facilities in the room. Nice cafe/bar downstairs.Downside. Limited parking and noisy hallways.

Hotel is modern and comfortable. Room was spacious and clean, furnished to high standard, towels changed daily, wi-fi access throughout the hotel. Food in the restaurant delicious, plates are full and everything I tried was delicious.Hotel is located close to Leyton Underground, 30 minutes by car from city centre.

Booked this as a cheap night stay whilst away for work, so not huge expectations. The place is all new, room lovely and clean. And what a breakfast! I couldn't finish it so they kept it so I could come back and have another go at it for lunch. Just wish I'd had time to visit the bar last night, as they have decent gin eg Tanqueray unlike so many hotels. Highly recommend!!

We stayed here when we went to see the Rolling Stones at the London Stadium.Absolutely faultless, room great, staff great, food excellent. Would definately stay here again. Thanks to all at the Lion and Key .

Booked this hotel as we were attending a festival in Olympic Park and it was very reasonably priced. So impressed!The decor was light and modern, the staff were really friendly and helpful and upgraded our room when we arrived. We also arrived almost 2 hours early and they still checked us in. We had lunch and drinks and were again very impressed with the price and generous portions and delicious food. The breakfast offering was fab with excellent variety and again, really well priced. Will definitely stay again!!

Very clean floors, rooms. Breakfast delicious, Rooms are in good condition and renovated.Only one disadvantage, to far to the centre and downtown.We ate good dinner every day. The proce for rooms is reasonable.

Booked this Hotel for my Daughters 21st birthday as a surprise, the staff were simply amazing and very helpful. They decorated my Daughters room with balloons, card, chocolates and towel origami, nothing was too much bother. My Daughter & her friends loved every minute of their stay in London (shopping/Attractions), the staff, the food, the hotel, the whole package...wonderful, cant thank Giorgio and the staff enough for all of their help. Recommended ***** Thank you all so much.

Needed to be working in London and booked into here for 6 nights. Wee bit of a distance from underground but easily remedied by 4 stops on No.69 or 97 bus (only 4 tube stops to Liverpool St).Fabulous entrance into reception / bar / restaurant. Lovely, welcoming reception staff and swift check in. Room was beautiful, exactly as per the pictures on website with a lovely modern marbled bathroom. I had a room at the back that was very quiet. Didnt try the breakfast as had to leave early each day, but the menu and dinner in evenings was really good. Loved the food!Grateful thanks to Gicek, her husband, brothers and staff for making my stay so enjoyable. Can easily recommend this hotel, without hesitation. Love to come back!

Lovely location, fabulous shef!!! (breakfast menu, steaks, mezze and the yum list goes on and on). Clean rooms, lovely room service.Staff very friendly and always helpful. Hasan and his brother are the best hosts, guys basically make you feel like you are at home! Highly recommended. Becides very convinient location wise both from buses and the tube side(15 min walk and you at Leyton station) it took me 30 minutes for the overall trip to get to Ofxford street. Highly recommended.

A very nice place to stay. Not far from the station. The staff is friendly and kind. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Make sure to taste the food in the restaurant downstairs. Glad we chose this place for our trip.

The Lion and Key has a major strength and that is the quality of its staff. Friendly from check in to check out and at all levels of staff. The place is very clean and seems well maintained. However there is nowhere in the bathroom to put make up and other toiletries even whilst in use. This includes nowhere in the shower to put soap, shampoo etc whilst showering, so a wash bag roll which you can hang on the back of the door would be very handy! I felt the rooms were designed for a man by a man since to make matters worse there is no full length mirror! But given the excellent price we paid and the super obliging staff these were only minor niggles. This was an excellent base for us to visited relatives in Leyton, it is not in a pretty location and the area may feel rather rough after dark if you are not used to urban areas although we walked everywhere or used cabs and at no time felt worried. We will definitely return...with our hanging wash bag!

I want to really give my thanks (and a great review) to all of the people at the Lion and Key for the kindness and enjoyable stay afforded me in my recent visit. I was in London for 8 nights (my first time in the winter) and was lucky enough to find this little jewel. The staff was always friendly and helpful. True, it is not in a touristy area, but I walked around the area and the short distance to the underground station, day and night, without any hint of problem. There are a variety of bars and restaurants in the vicinity. My room was quiet, cleaned daily, and larger than many I've had in Europe. The bar and restaurant we're quite good also, both affordable and good. I left sad to leave, and I don't always have that feeling. Thanks to everyone for my wonderful stay!

Needed somewhere local to stay as a result of helping family decorate their property. Check in was easy and staff were really friendly. Our room was excellent. Great furnishings and the shower was really good. We had eaten so we didn't try the restaurant. We had a really good nights rest and the following morning we had a late breakfast. The breakfast menu selection was really good and again the service was really good. We will definitely be using the L&K as a base for family visits.

Our second stay here this time for Christmas with our daughter and her partner who live nearby. The hotel is small, clean and very good value. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a good size with modern fittings. We will certainly stay here again.

Went to this hotel with family members to visit my son. Hotel is spotless. Rooms are a good size for London and have everything you could need. The restaurant is also fantastic. Food is delicious. But the thing that makes this hotel special is the fantastic staff. So friendly and nothing is too much bother. Will be back. Thank you all

Stopped her for breakfast before a meeting. The L&K Special breakfast is perfect. Fresh coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice using 3 oranges complimented it perfectly tooA definite visit next time i’m in town, just for this!

Rooms are spacious and modern, but bathroom is small. This hotel is bit far from Central London, but it's easy to get public transport and there are restaurants close by. Hotels restaurant and bar are also good. For shopping you can easily go to Westfield by a short cab or bus ride.

Cannot fault this hotel, very cool, great staff, good breakfast. Only reservation is the distance from underground, a good 20+ minutes fast walk to tube (in what feels like a fairly rough area.) but to be fair though it would be under 10 mins in a taxi if you wanted to jump a cab. Otherwise would highly recommend.

I have stopped in many London hotels and I have to say this is one of the best.The rooms are modern,clean and comfortable the staff are friendly and efficient WiFi was good ,not in the most fashionable part of London but about ten minutes walk to the tube will get you to anywhere you want to go.I will be visiting this area again so I hope to stay there again .In London this hotel is very good value for money and I would rate it as good as many of the better 4stars I have stayed at.

Nice and clean hotel with friendly staff, the rooms are tidy and still fitted out to a good standard. The shower was good and the Internet system allowing connectivity between my mobile and the TV meant watching programs on full size for once. Fairly quiet neighbourhood but it is surrounded by roads on two sides but on street parking only meant having to move on before 8am. I would stay again.

Stayed at this hotel before a big cycling event at the Olympic Park. The welcome was very friendly and extremely efficient. The customer service was exceptional. A really great room that was immaculately clean and very modern. My whole experience was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel

Stayed here on a business trip. Booked a double room just for myself. Was really lovely. Big comfy bed beautiful bathroom with huge shower. Interactive tv. Air con. Restaurant was really good and cheap. £9 for a fantastic chicken salad. Staff were helpful and polite. Really enjoyable stay. No parking at hotel but you can park on a side street a short walk away. Will definitely use again.

This is a new hotel just 4 stops along on the Central Line from Liverpool Street so great for Stansted Airport or GatwickLeyton area is very up & coming with lovely parks, open spaces, quiet streets and plenty of cafes and small shops - Tesco Metro right close by and a Sainsbury's Local too. The rooms are spotless and all new beds, bathrooms and fitting. A great place for a budget price. The Lion & Key is an old Victorian building steeped in history which the current owners are respectful to observe. The name may be hard to remember but they didn't want to compromise the history - think Lion King holding the keys - and look out for the lions holding the keys in their mouths protection and the gatekeeper of heaven all around the hotel. There is a small car park, you probably have to book it but we use the tube (3 mins walk to Leyton tube) or the very frequent buses into town. The restaurant is modern & comfortable with a great menu for breakfast, lunch or supper - we love the speciality 'Pide' stuffed breads, they are huge. We go with friends, grandchildren and all enjoy eating there. The staff are so friendly and caring, they love children and ours feel very at home. Good wine list, chilled beers and all in all a great stay.

This is in a great central location for exploring the CityThe staff are attentive and helpfulBreakfast is good value at £10 but the tea isn’t great, so take your own tea bags!The room is very clean, and has a fridge with some complimentary drinks, which is a welcome touch.Bathroom is good, shower excellent and towels softThe room is excessively hot, despite a fan, and this at times can be unbearableThe external noise is also a concern, despite asking for a quiet roomThere is building work going on nearby and each morning at 07:30 you will be woken by pile-driving machineryThe hotel isn’t cheap, but where is in London? There is a Pret and Waitrose opposite which is handyI would recommend and visit again

i visit this great pub about every 3 weeks for the great fullers beer.However on many occasions now NO ESB or LP?? Why?This has only been happening over the past 6 months?management please order more ale.I travel 100 miles for this pub, but maybe not in the future.Think I will go to THE Counting house in the future, no probs there.

This accommodation is well situated and close to the river themes. All your major highlights are a short walk away but there is lots of public transportation, buses taxi’s & trains. They also have an on-site English pub with what you would expect. The rooms are bright and comfy with a fridge & mini bar, the bed is very comfortable. Highly recommend The happy traveler ☕️☕️

Stayed for a few nights recently - is a good location for London I will give them that. The hotel and rooms are outdated. The bar smelled horrible and the WiFi rarely worked properly. It was so hot, weather I know they cannot control but with one fan and the window opened, it was still very unpleasant. I’m not sure how it has so many great reviews but they are truly in need of a makeover.

Lovely bar, fun staff decent prices, don't leave without a few photos in the hats! Good area for drinks. The rooms are well priced and the location convenient, handy for walking to some of the more interesting parts of London, great for river walks

My wife and I had romantic dinner and a night away at the Mad Hatter this May. We started with drinks outside watching busy Londoners go by, having way less fun than us. Dinner was delicious and the staff was friendly. Our room was cozy, but spacious, and there were some nice freebies included. (Next part edited out for children). For breakfast we both had eggs Benedict which we enjoyed thoroughly. What a great place right in town.

Very clean and exceptionally comfortable bed, everything you could want was provided, including a cafetière. The only downside was the breakfast which was very poor, so I would recommend going out for breakfast as we paid £12 per person for a very inedible meal.

As a family we decided to try dinner at this hotel/bar. We ordered our meals at 8.05pm and after some 45 minutes of waiting our meals actually arrived but all 3 meals were cold and had to be sent back. All meals had to be freshly made but even when they arrived we were not impressed with the quality of the food. As a result a personal letter is going to be forwarded to the CEO (Simon Enemy) to outline the errors of the evening and the staff actions.

This was our third visit to the Mad Hatter in London. Previously we had been delighted by the friendliness and efficiency of the staff which coupled with the location, relaxed bar and parking within walking distance meant that we were happy repeat customers. This time it was not so relaxing and the reason for this lies primarily with the evening bar staff.As has been pointed out by other reviewers the rooms are starting to look tired and will hopefully be up for a refurb very soon. We like the Fullers model and are also frequent visitors to another Fullers hotel/pub but this one seems to be facing some challenges. The room we stayed in this time clearly had some cleaning issues as the ceiling fan was coated with dust, a fairly thick layer, and there was further dust which had collected on one of the walls however any shortcomings in the standard of the rooms had always been outweighed by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff and this is still in evidence as we were dealt with efficiently and professionally at check-in despite arriving early. We like to arrive early so that we can have a pub lunch in the bar and as usual we did this and staff were attentive and proficient. No problems there. Later, as we left the hotel for the evening, we did what we had done previously and handed our order for breakfast in the room to the receptionist. The hotel advertises breakfast in your room at no extra charge but does not make it easy to do so with no actual breakfast menu in the room and no form to fill in. Nevertheless I had written it clearly on a piece of paper. The receptionist, who was notably dressed down in jeans and tee-shirt, seemed confused but promised to get it to the kitchen. We were going out to a show and another reason we like this hotel is that after the show we like to come back to the pub and have a relaxing drink and to wind down before going to bed. This time the bar was far from relaxing. Bar staff were loud, unprofessional and scruffily dressed. They clearly didn't want to be there, wanted to get home and regarded customers as an inconvenience. We know because we heard them telling each other so. They also stood outside one of the fire exits smoking whilst another used the disabled toilet for a very long time keeping my disabled friend waiting and not even offering a 'sorry' on exit. We felt that all of this was unprofessional and definitely not welcoming or relaxing and for this reason we will be looking at other hotels in the area and comparing with the Mad Hatter before our next visit to London. That's the simple effect that unprofessional staff can have on your business!We did get that breakfast in our room but only after a call to our room querying whether we did actually want it in the room which suggested that communication between reception and kitchen may not have taken place as it should have. Most hotels have a card which can be filled in and put outside your door, why not this one? Also it would be good practice to use plate cloches to keep the food warm, something I have flagged up before, but which are not in use at the Mad Hatter.

Staying in Central London for only 159GBP a night is great. And this hotel is wonderfully located, near two tube stops, with easy access to just about all the tourist sights, in a decent area. The staff is friendly, the breakfast is good (and can be had for 10GBP with advanced notice as a guest), and the rooms are spacious for London at this price. However, there are a few things that need improving. The climate control is minimal, which would not be a problem in the winter, but the room was hot and stuffy when the outside temps were in the upper 60s F in May. The cleaning products used were very strong smelling. And with the windows open (to deal with the heat) it was very noisy at night.There was a small issue with the bill - nothing huge, just some minor account tracking issues, which was handled appropriately by the staff. Overall, I'm happy with the choice for 7 nights in May. But a few small changes would make a world of difference.

I am reviewing the bar and not the hotel.I have several passions in life and high on the list are London Pride & Pies. Indeed as a regular tourist to London these are two things which I actively seek out and so came across this place like an oasis in the desert. Its a nice looking bar as you would expect from Fullers. There it sadly stops. The bar could do with a good clean, the food was average at best but the staff were unfortunately lazy and simply disinterested in serving. My recommendation is to go round the corner to Doggets.

This was our 2nd stay and won’t be our last, we visit London socially and stay when we can, now we have found The Mad Hatter we won’t bother looking else where. Short walk from Waterloo, excellent staff, large clean rooms (very rare in London), lots of complimentary items in the room & The southbank on your door step. Can’t wait to stay again. Thank you

Had a fabulous couple of nights at the Mad Hatter hotel in London. Everyone was super nice and accommodating I had an early morning and they had breakfast ready early for me! The place was clean and neat, and close to the tube...perfect little find!

You couldn't make it up really, visit a |Fullers Ale and Pie house only to be told they haven't got any pies. Seriously guys !!???!! OK they offered a few Sunday Roasts, but why can't they manage to maintain the pie menu too??The roast was a little expensive, and fell a little short on quality. Sure I've had much worse, but a small portion of pre-sliced beef does not impress.

We stayed here for two nights, a very pleasant experience, freindly and helpfull staff. Cosy rooms, with a big comfortable bed, we sleept like Angels. Close to a lot of Londons atractions. Highly recomended.

This hotel is probably one of the best i have been to. 15 min walk to Big Ben. Blackfriars station 5 mins away. The hotel is clean, beds comfortable. Rooms are just the right size. Coffee machine, free tea and coffee even hot chocolate. First night everything is free in mini bar. The pub wasn't at all noisy and i was above it second floor. The food was expensive and not brilliant but you only have a 5 minute walk to any other watering hole.Staff were so friendly and helpful. Check out is 1100 but they will look after your cases in reception no charge. Again i cannot stress how perfectly placed this hotel was for us. We did a lot of walking because we wanted to but tube service is literally 5 mins away. would thoroughly recommend and hope to return soon. Thank you

Friendly staff, reasonably good location. The pictures of the hotel do not accurately reflect it's tattered reality. This hotel is in serious decline. Our bathroom was full of broken tiles. The nylon floor was ripped and moldy in places. The shower screen was broken so water leaked everywhere. One window didn't shut properly. 3 out of 4 locking mechanisms for the 2 windows were broken. There were screws in the door to hold a now missing plaque, I assume a fire safety plan. I guess we didn't need one. In general a seriously dusty room. I would never stay here again nor recommend this hotel to others.

I was here as part of a large student group which spent about a week at the MH. The location is within easy walking distance to most touristy attractions, and several tube stations which open up the rest of London. Staff was always polite and enjoyed having a chat with customers. The rooms were nice with extremely comfortable beds and clean facilities. Judging by other hotels in the area, the MH has large rooms which made sharing the space with a roommate much easier. This is a great place to stay.

Hotel in beautiful English style, absolutly in Centrum of London.Hotel is clean, daily serwis room , change of towels, water, milk, coffee and tea in the room and delicacies supplemented every day. Very nice and helpful staff.Best Regards to you all.Thank you so much.I will come back.

We arrived ~2 hours before check-in time, and were able to get into our room early, which was appreciated since we were coming straight from the airport (note: we didn't call / intend to get in early. We planned to just drop our bags, so getting into our room was a huge plus). The included mini-bar and the coffee / tea was fab, we loved the Dyson heater to warm ourselves up after exploring the rest of the afternoon, and the room itself was big enough for two females getting ready with two big bags - plenty of space to throw things around and illuminated mirror area to do hair and makeup. We only stayed for a night before continuing to other cities in the UK, but I would return again without hesitation. Additionally, we stored our bags with the front desk for the rest of the day after checking out because our train wasn't until the evening. We were slightly concerned because there were a lot of bags just sitting around - granted all labeled, but not stored in a room or kept away from the public. We returned and all our stuff was there, no issues, but our one suggestion would have been to have a more organized / tucked away luggage storage system.

My partner and I stayed for our anniversary in January 2019. Upon arrival, it was so close to Blackfriars bridge and the tube station with a little Waitrose opposite which was handy. When walking in there was a foul smell in between the front door and the 2 doors for the pub or hotel everytime we walked through to leave or come back. The lady on the checkout didn’t give us any information about when check out was and didn’t seem to be interested in the fact we were even there, as 2 people that have worked in hospitality for many years it was the beginning of undertrained staff. When walking to the room everything felt rather dated and didn’t look as retro-modern as the pictures had led us to believe, sacks of dirty linen were stacked in the hallways, reassuring everything was clean but not the nicest to walk through. The room itself was very clean with a lovely stocked mini fridge that was free for the duration of our stay, probably the highlight of our stay, a really nice addition. The view from the room wasn’t the nicest, basically a dirt pit building site but not the hotels fault obviously. We saw a lovely 3 course veganuary menu in the room we were excited to try in their pub downstairs, with myself having a disability we felt it’d be easier to stay on site. We went downstairs to the pub and saw the cocktails were on from 5pm-7pm Monday to Thursday however when ordering one the bartender said they didn’t serve them after 5pm during the week, the exact opposite of what was advertised in the menu, blackboard, sign outside... basically felt that he didn’t want to make one. We were then told we could sit at a table that felt we were intruding on a private function and saw the veganuary specials board only had 1 meal on out of the 6 starters and mains that were on the website and menus on the tables and in our room. We wanted to be able to have more of a choice and more than one course for our anniversary so decided we should probably start searching else where. We came back to the room after dinner and went to sleep. The next morning I was woken up to knocking on the door several times by the time I was able to get out of bed no one was there. We rang the front desk to double check the check out time as it wasn’t on the welcome letter either. After checking out, we went to our prepaid breakfast in the pub at 10.20am, it stated everywhere that breakfast ended at 11am however when we arrived the continental breakfast had been put away, tea, coffee, juices, everything put away. One of the waitresses rolled her eyes when she saw us walk in which then made me feel really bad but as we’d already paid when booking, we weren’t going to miss the food. We ordered 2 vegetarian breakfasts, my partner asked for a tea, we weren’t offered any drinks or anything else at all so I didn’t ask for a drink as I felt guilty being there and everything had been packed away, luckily I had some water in my bag. The breakfast came, and we shouldn’t have been surprised it wasn’t great, the hash browns were really oily and the veggie sausage had a really odd, strong, not appealing taste to it, I left it and my boyfriend with a stomach of steal felt ill for the rest of the day. Honestly, I was really looking forward to staying at the mad hatter, it looks like a really nice homely pub and B&B but, the staff let it down more than anything. Uninterested is what I’d describe the service as, not wanting to adhere to any promotions advertised ie. cocktails, breakfast end time, standard check in info. I’ve never felt like I needed to write a review before but honestly, if this was my place of work I’d want to know how bad the customer service was. I hope this helps enable staff to not ruin anyone else’s stay or special occasion. I’ve rated 3/5 down to cleanliness and general special touches alone.

Spent 3 nights here in january with my husband. It's in a great location near 2 tube stations. There was a great little Waitrose across the road too. It's like a small family run hotel and it's not the most modern hotel but I loved it. The staff were friendly the room was cleaned each day and the bed was super cosy...I think this is very important especially after walking around sight seeing all day. Added bonus is the mini bar is always full and free! There was also free tea/coffee and biscuits in the room. The bathroom was lovely and fully stocked with hand soap, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner and those great little emergency sets ie sewing kit. I would have no hesitation staying here again and bringing the kids. I seen reviews about the noise outside, the hotel is situated beside traffic lights but the noise was not excessive at all.

Decided to call in on the off chance as simply liked the name. It’s part of a hotel, but we just tried the bar. Nice atmosphere, with several booths for about 4 people making it cosy and personal. Lots of guest beers to try, I recommend a pint of Festival as it’s a full bodied Suffolk Ale. The pub interior is immaculate. All very clean, clearly well tended woodworks surrounds to beautiful mirrors. Friendly staff so when I’m back in town I’ll call in. Didn’t eat on this occasion but saw someone else with fish and chips and it looked superb.

We are visting from wales and staying at the hotel. Rooms are beautiful and reasonably priced . Mini fridge in room with free drinks was a nice touch. Pub downstairs is very comfy. Was served lunch by two ladies they was very welcoming and delightful. My husband and I both had Sunday roasts. Yorkshire puddings tasted very eggy and stale, which was a shame because the rest of the food was good. Will definitely be returning next time we are visiting London.

Enjoyed the good fortune to bunk here for a couple days to attendance a conference. The property location is excellent, a comfortable 7-10 minute walk from Southwark tube station. The rooms are on the smaller side, consistent with most properties of its age. The amenities include a coffee press, hot chocolate, ale, cider, and a full menu of other beverages which come with the price of the room. The rooms are clean, the reception helpful, and the breakfast is fantastic, buffet and ala carte. On the down side, its a little pricey, and the wireless is extremely slow during peak business hours. Breakfast begins at 7:00, which for those of us with early flights, meant we did not benefit from it.

My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a night to celebrate our 4 year anniversary (we went for lunch at Bob Bob Ricard & to the theatre to see Lés Misérables so thought we’d go the whole hog and stay the night too!). It was absolutely BRILLIANT. After scrolling through endless overpriced hotel rooms on booking.com with photos of terrible decor and rooms without windows (...really?!!), I was a little apprehensive about our stay in the city. My boyfriend emailed them in advance to say it was our anniversary after seeing them asking guests to let them know if they are celebrating a special occasion and they went out of their way to decorate our room. There were balloons, special pillows, faux rose petals and even a free bottle of prosecco on ice waiting for us which was absolutely incredible and very generous!! The minibar is also complimentary for the first night for all guests which is stocked full of various drinks (including beer!) plus a great selection of coffee (with a special cafetière alongside the kettle) and even hot chocolate. I find this amazing and again, very generous of the hotel to provide all of these things free of charge to their guests. We arrived an hour and a half early before the check in time and asked if there was any chance we could check in early and they were more than happy to help, the manager calling the housekeepers to ask and in the meantime asking if we’d like to store our luggage with them at the reception. We had a drink at the bar, being served by a young friendly barman (the bar is stunning with the most fun, cosy booths, Alice in Wonderland themed touches and house plants), before going to our room early after being given the go ahead from the housekeepers. The room was a lovely size with a large, bright window and a bath which I took full advantage of the next morning! We explored the city for the day and returned after 11pm, buzzing to be let in by the night porter as instructed earlier that day who was very friendly and helped us with our query regarding where to find late night food in the area. The hotel is in a great location just a few minutes walk from the tube station. We ended up getting a taxi home from Covent Garden and it didn’t cost much at all as it’s so close to the action! We had a good night sleep at the hotel although the road outside was quite noisy - though this is to be expected in the capital and easily handled with some comfortable ear plugs. My only suggestion would be to perhaps provide bubble bath for the rooms with bath tubs even for a fee (I attempted to use the shower gel provided to create bubbles which didn’t last very long so this would have been a great option for me). This was an amazing hotel and if we return to London for a night in the future we will definitely stay here again unless we decide splash out on a swanky five star option just for the experience. This has become our go-to hotel for sure!

Wow what a great hotel!! Wasn’t expecting much as was a good deal for London but boy was I surprised, lovely room, fab bed and lots of nice little touches. Will definitely recommend to friends and family and will not hesitate to book next time in London.

I’ve spent many hours drinking wines and eating snacks at this pub, which is original in nature. Yeah ... all you would imagine as typical! The old building with its dual door entrance (one to the hotel, the other to the pub) is charming! The center bar, wood booths and wooden chairs add to the delight! The wine list is adequate, the beers are great and the hot cider is yummy. Small bites are not bad either. If you’re in the neighborhood, stop by!

Didn't want to eat at our hotel so figured we'd walk down the street and see what else was open. Saw that they had breakfast on the menu at this pub so figured we'd go in and check it out. Took forever for a menu. Then we ordered coffees, juice, English breakfast, and pancakes. Food took literally 40 min to come out. Seriously, how long does it take to make scrambled eggs, heat up beans, and fry some bacon? The pancakes weren't homemade but rather were just reheated from the freezer section...so why did it take so long?? The pub wasn't even busy --there were three other tables. I wanted a latte but the waiter said that he'd bring us coffee. ?! Coffee wasn't anything to write home about. We asked where our food was at one point, and the waitress told us that we had to wait because there were other tables in front of us. ???! I'm a loss for words. We left after paying quickly and were glad we didn't stay at the hotel and had to put up with this kind of service and food every morning.

Best of the best for service location and staff. Breakfast with huge choice including in price. Bed is the most comfortable bed I have slept in. I would not change a thing in my experience in that hotel. Close to all London attractions. London must experience as it is very traditional hotel. Huge recommendation.

Stayed for three nights in December. Great location, close to Waterloo and Southwark tube stations. Room was clean, cozy, and for me a bonus - a full size bathtub!! Paid upfront extra for breakfast which was good, lots of choices. I had a room on the first floor; being above a pub there was some noise one night, but it was over by 11pm (closing time). Yes, there was some construction noise as building is going on behind the hotel but again, they knocked off by 4pm each day, so again no bother to me. Selection of free booze in the room fridge appreciated. Would definitely stay again.

We arrived after 6pm and went down to bar/restaurant at 7 pm. Only one person behind the bar....very long wait for service. Not his fault, too many customers. Then we ordered a Sunday roast, their specialty, oh not on tonight!! Why? no explanation. VERY disappointed. So we ordered fish and chips with mushy peas. The peas had died....fish in batter ok rest chips etc cold! Not good. Chicken tikka masala pie very average. Not our night!Will definitely NOT have a meal here again. So poor. No excuses.

For the same price as a budget chain hotel room you can get a room here and experience a more intimate London hotel experience. My room was big, very well equipped and even had a FREE mini bar (yes, non alcoholic, but still free). Comfortable big rooms and a great location (provided you want to be near Waterloo or Southwark). The restaurant downstairs was quiet and therefore lacked a bit of atmosphere but I think it's still a great alternative to bigger and much more expensive hotels in London.

What a lovely place to stay! Located next to Blackfriars bridge we felt that we close enough to everything we wanted to be.The hotel staff were polite at check in. Which was also efficient and quick as was check out. We really appreciated being able to leave our luggage until it was time to leave.Our room was lovely, massive and very comfy.All in all a great place to stay and will stay there again

From the first glance it seems quite dated, however, it has everything you need with very freindly and helpfull staff. Great location and to top it off they have a complimentary mini bar. Buffet style breakfast with full english from the kitchen cant go wrong.

I will start on a positive, the room was clean and the breakfast waitress was lovely but... food quality appalling, shoe leather pancakes, soggy, greasy chips, veg that was overcooked and several days past its best. Over an hours wait for breakfast. Bed soggy, stiffling hot, so noisy even with window and secondary glazing shut. I've stayed before so can compare and it is in serious decline. I will never come back and I recommend you find somewhere else too.

Visited London Friday/Saturday 23rd/24th November, combining a business conference with a rare night out and a West End show.Decided to have dinner at the hotel Friday evening in the bar.Unfortunately we experienced a few problems while ordering our meal and, as a result, we met the Manager (Rachel). She was absolutely superb from the moment she came to our table.First thing she did was to unreservedly apologise without offering the usual excuses. Then she asked what she could do to resolve the situation, listened to all that we had to say and came up with a resolution instantly.I must compliment Rachel and her team for fantastic food, tasty beer and wine on what was obviously an extremely busy evening in the bar.Our room was light, airy and spacious and the bed was very comfortable.We enjoyed a delicious breakfast before checking out the following morning.We will definitely recommend The Mad Hatter to friends and, will definitely be staying there again.

Stayed here for one night on a work trip. I had visited the bar previously a few years for a beer and food, so booked as knew location. It's a small hotel just a few minutes from Southwark Tube and walking distance to Waterloo. This makes it very accessible from Gatwick or London City Airport. Double room was good, comfortable bed with a small bathroom. The phone is a mock old style model, quiely! In a rather nice touch, everything in the mini-bar is free - a London Pride (it's a Fuller's Hotel), a cider, selection of soft drinks and water. Will definitely stay here again, superb location, friendly staff and a nice bar on the premises.

Stayed there for a week; the room was clean. The water was hot. The minimal interaction with the staff was perfectly adequate. Location is great; short walk to the Underground. Noise-It's a big city, so it's going to be noisy. That being said there is a high probability the when the construction starts on the surrounding lot(s) that noise will be an issue. I would verify with the front desk before making reservations. As with all older buildings in London, there is no air conditioning, and at this time of year it wasn't a problem, but I would hesitate to stay here in the summer. Note: When you walk out the front door pause for a moment and look at about your 1 o'clock....you'll have a great view of St. Pauls from the front door of the property. The pub, like pretty much every pub/restaurant we ate at, did struggle with customer service. Not sure why that is, but it's not unique to the pub at the property. Staff was super friendly....just struggling. Will stay again.

A little shabby in some ways and a very limited menu but free mini bar ... soft drinks, water, tea etc. and no room service charge was perfect. We were working at Kings, just along the road and made the most of the hotel’s proximity to the South Bank to walk and see London. Good service and we hope to be back

My husband and I stayed on a cold Monday in October but had a warm welcome and were told we were guests of the week! Cue much excitement on our part! This meant we had a bottle of prosecco waiting on ice in the room, and complementary breakfast the next morning, which was a lovely surprise. The room was spacious and comfortable, the breakfast was good, and everyone we met at the hotel was very friendly.We liked the location so close to the Thames, and within easy reach of everywhere we needed to go. we'd happily go back another time.

My partner and I stayed here for our 1st anniversary. I expected a little more Alice in wonderland memorabilia than there was so I was a little disappointed.The room was perfect and the staff were so helpful. The room came with a mini fridge the contents were free of charge. There were lots of nice touches in the room: a variety box of teas, hot chocolates and coffees, a jar of mints and a bar menu for room service.I can't fault the staff at all. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here.

Hotel staff were lovely. Great selection of amenities in the room: Iron, fridge, lots of power outlets, kettle. Free mini bar is a nice touch.Fantastic location, 2 minute walk from the south bank.Only improvements would be firmness of the bed. And don't sandwich 2 single beds together.

We thought the Mad Hatter was excellent. It’s just round the corner from Southwark Tube Station (Jubilee Line) and only a moderate walk to London’s attractions via Blackfriar’s Bridge. The food served for dinner in the pub is very good and the rooms are a decent size and comfortable. Reception was happy to look after our luggage on check-out day, giving us a few extra unencumbered hours before heading home. Highly recommended.

Excellent little hotel with character, excellent location and service, good breakfast (à little bit overpriced ) , great area, charm... heater was too high in the room at night though but that was the only disapointment we had.

Fun and easy to walk from this point over Blackfriar Bridge. The price included items from a free mini bar that was quite nice. The room was a little small but clean and comfortable. The beds were a bit hard but we slept just fine!

This hotel is in a great location and is definitely value for money. I have definitely found my go-to hotel in London from now on! Easy to get to, clean, comfortable beds and spacious room. Plus, it's an old hat factory so it's steeped in history. What more could you want!

I stay in loads of hotels with work and this is definitely a good one! Despite its busy location, my room was sooo quiet! I love that the room comes with free drinks (in fridge) as I don’t drink tea or coffee, so always end up buying water etc. I had room service, there was a problem with my order but I didn’t mind as everyone was so friendly and it was fixed really quickly. The room was dark, the bed was comfy and it was clean. Can’t really ask for more than that...I’ll be back!

Stayed one night at the Mad Hatter which I selected due to its location, very close to meetings the next day. I was absolutely impressed! Everything was perfect and designed to make the guest feel welcome and pampered. Check-in with Nikki at reception was peasant - she was very friendly and helpful. My room was large and the bed was high with a mattress you could drown in- super comfortable and lots of pillows. Shower was great and very hot water. Tea and coffee (and biscuits) provided and also a mini bar stocked with a selection of soft drinks - all complementary!! Cant ever remember staying at a hotel with a free minibar! Bathroom large and well appointed. Hairdryer (real one, not those small ones that don't blow hot) and iron and ironing board, and mini-safe in the room. Inside chain bolt on the room for extra security. All really nice and tastefully decorated. Very clean.Breakfast the next morning was no less enjoyable - super-friendly waitress offered us cooked options and a selection of cereals, cheeses, toast etc were available from the buffet. All excellent. Pricing for the Mad Hatter is very reasonable for a central London hotel. Unfortunately I didn't have time to eat in the pub - the meals looked fantastic but I was there for just a short stay. I will certainly return if I get the chance - will even go a little out of my way to stay here in future even if my meetings are not so close by - it's worth it!

The hotel is a very convenient, easy ten minute walk away from the Blackfriars underground station. The rooms are awesomely equipped for business travellers with iron and ironing board, kettle, coffee and tea if you don’t have the time for breakfast. Furniture is cosy, bed very comfortable. Reception staff is outstanding.The downstairs Fuller’s restaurant provides the perfect English pub experience with a good selection of pies and beers. Reasonable prices both in the hotel and the restaurant.

We loved our stay at the Mad Hatter Hotel! The staff was friendly and it was close to two tube stations, which made travel through London a breeze. We also found the decor of the room really cool and the history behind the location. Our only complaint was that the cleaning of the room was hit or miss.

Recently stayed at the Mad Hatter Hotel and i can 100% recommend it and look forward to my next stay. Good location, very friendly welcome. Niki was great on reception and helpful. Nice clean room with a good mini bar and a quiet room so had a great sleep. Great bar downstairs with a really good choice of real ales. Lovely Breakfast and great service. This really is a hidden gem and a great price for central London. Well Done!

To be honest I only booked this hotel purely because of the proximity to the venue I needed to be at in the evening. It is literally 2 minutes from Blackfriars Bridge train station. However....Now we have stayed here, we will definitely be back. Ideal for a quick overnight in the nicer weather and a stroll along the Thames which we have planned.Easy checking in. I had already paid in advance and rang to see if we could have a fan in our room ....which was done...thank you. The bedroom is not the biggest but certainly ample space for one night. The bed and pillows were uber soft and comfortable. The bath was just the right size for a shorty ( me!) to relax in. Hot water was spit on heat too. Himself used the shower and said that was good too.Lots of little nice touches in the room. Complimentary drinks, plenty of tea bags, a cafetiere of coffee ( ) and biscuits too.Breakfast was reasonable priced as was supper the night before. It's seems to be a very busy and popular pub / hotel. My only comment would be the lack of bar staff on a Friday night left us waiting for ages to be served and ages to get the drinks. Prices not too bad really but a great pint of London Pride....apparently himself said. Our friends stayed here with us too. All in all a successful evening. Thank you.

Excellent hotel, loved the real milk in the minibar. Great facilities and service and good location. The bed was really comfortable and very quiet. The fan was appreciated too. Overall it was a wonderful surprise and would definitely recommend again.

Stayed at this hotel following our trip to Wimbledon Ideal location , very clean there were 3 of us, we were given a room with a single bed in a separate part of the room which was great The only complaint I have is we were woken by a member of staff hoovering leaves up on the decking outside our room at 6.15 !!! It was quickly sorted when we rang the receptionOtherwise no complaints I would strongly recommend this hotel

W14 was a very good 3 star hotel. The triple room was small for 3 people for 9 nights, but it was ok. Very clean. Good beds, tv, nice sheets. Plenty of outlets for 3 people to charge phones, and one place could just plug in usb charger. Rainfall shower head was nice. Didn't really like the shampoo and wished I had brought my own and conditioner, but not a big deal. Very good blow dryer in the room. Breakfast was ok but went out for full breakfast a couple of mornings to change things up. I would stay there again. It was very convenient to tube stops and not far from a lot of restaurants, but a very quiet street. We were on ground floor in the front and there was no traffic or other noise.

I stayed here for 2 nights on our recent trip to London and the hotel was ideal. It was close to the underground which took you into the centre of London or when we felt energetic we walked in which took us about 1.5 hours. The rooms were spotless and beds were very comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet location so there is very little noise from the street. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was good with a choice of different cereals, fruit, croissants and pastries. The hallway in the hotel are in need of redecoration but I think this is in progress as there was decorating going on while we were there. The only downside to this hotel is there are no elevators so it wouldn't suit if you have mobility problems

Firstly, all the hotels in London are small. I loved my solo room it served its purpose with a comfortable bed, a hot shower with two shower heads to choose from. The hair dryer was great. The room provides a Heating/ Cooling unit. The ladies who prepare the breakfast are very friendly and welcoming and provide a great breakfast selection. The reception crew are very welcoming and provide assistance for any of your travel requests. Would stay again with no hesitations.

Stayed here on Saturday night with my wife. Excellent location, 5 mins walk from the tube (Barons Court). The room was clean and tidy, friendly and helpful staff, basic breakfast but did the job, would certainly recommend this hotel to others.

The W 14 kenniston is a great hotel. Quiet area and affordable. Very clean and comfortable. Includes a continental breakfast. Staff very friendly and helpful. Just a five minute walk to nearest subway. Easy to get around

Normally these places (hotels made out of converted houses in residential streets) tend to be poor. This place is anything but. I was on my own for a business trip to London which I do weekly, so I get to stay in some proper dives, as I have limited budget, but this place is priced about right, if anything good value. The room I had was on the basement level facing the front. At least there weren't bars on the windows. I could hear people walking past at street level, which is an indication of how quiet it was...I was amazed. It was a sunny summers evening and I could hear the swifts chirping away to one another - very nice. There was a bit of noise later on, when the laundry was picked up, and again when staff came out to get something from the lock-ups outside the window, but nothing too onerous.The bed was very comfy - I slept very well. My room had a double and a single bed so it would have been perfect for a small family too.The en-suite was big and very well appointed. They provide soaps and stuff but I prefer to use my own, and the towles were big, clean and fluffy! The shower was powerful, and very well done, in fact full marks all around for the fit, finish and decor, and everything worked, including plugs by the bedside table for charging stuff overnight (little things eh?!)I don't do breakfast but it was included in the price which was another nice surprise. I had a wonder around the restaurant area (its only used for breakfast, no evening meals, you'll need to find your own) and it looked well laid out, plenty of seats, and some outside space for the sunny mornings, and bean-to-cup coffee (most important)I had a coffee in my room, so theres a kettle and all the usually stuff like tea bags, instant coffee etc.So, quiet, comfy, safe, well appointed, and only 5 mins walk from Barons Court Tube.Will use again if I can get a room!NB: If this review has been interesting/informative please like/thumbs up.

The hotel is in the middle of a residential area (tube stations (Barons Court and West Kensington) are a 5-6 minute walk away). Good value for money given the location, better rooms than most London hotels in this price range and some very helpful staff make this a good choice. Special word of appreciation for Oleg and the other staff on duty during our stay who were extremely helpful and friendly. The fifth star is for them. The breakfast selection is ok but can’t really crib about it at this price point. Bear in mind that there are no elevators in the property.

no frills, breakfast bearable, rooms acceptable. great value for money. staff helpful if you need anything. Not that you do. Easy access to the picadilly line. Nice shops around. Close to amenities and an easy tube ride to central london. highly recommended. it is hard to find anything better when it comes to price to quality ratio.

The room was clean and had everything I needed. The bathroom was very modern, even though it was small. The entire room was small, but it was good enough for me. The heat/AC worked well. However, the Wi-Fi was very weak. I don't know if that was because of the location of my room, but it was very spotty and connection was only decent whenever it stayed connected. Overall, I would recommend this place as a budget hotel for anyone traveling that doesn't want to stay at a hostel. Closest train station is "West Kensington" and it is about a 10-minute walk from the hotel

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I don't usually stay in 3-stars, but my room was clearly worth at least 4 stars. A lot of luxurious touches (in my opinion). A very good mattress, giving one of the best night's sleep I've had in a hotel. (Great pillows, too.) Black-out curtains, so no early wakening. I was on my own, but they gave me a very spacious room with a big double bed (and another spare single). Great bathroom with generous proportions and a fantastic rain shower (with extra hose). All very clean. It's exactly as it looks in the photos - everything looks brand new, right down to the carpets. The road itself is very quiet - you can't believe you're in London. A very nice, quiet area, yet a really short walk from the tube - practically round the corner. The staff were all very friendly and ready to help in any way. Breakfast was included, which is a bonus these days, so I wasn't expecting much, but what I found was a nice, spacious light-filled dining room with a generous come-again buffet. You could stuff yourself, if inclined. I had cereal, toast, juice and fruit, but I could have had croissants, meat, cheese, yoghurt and much more. Endless tea, coffee and juices. Great service from staff. I'll definitely be back and it's on my list of favourites.

Very nice hotel, clean, modern and comfortable, close to 2 stations.Only did continental breakfast.....could probably do cooked breakfast too.Would definately stay again.Lovely area, you have to pay for parking on the street but it worth it.very nice hotel.

The hotel is down a quiet residential street a little bit out of the way. I stayed in a petit single room. It was fine for the night just for me. The room was off the stairs though which was a bit odd. The room was en-suite with an extra door you could close between the door in to the room off the stairs and the section with the bed.
