I’m glad there was - people weren’t that quiet going up and down and I felt a bit vulnerable. With the extra door closed it was ok.Reception were very helpful - they lent me a phone charger because I’d forgotten mine.Breakfast was ok, not the best but perfectly acceptable, it’s served in a cabin in the garden and it’s nice they do have outside space it had furniture out there so you can go outside.Overall, I would consider staying there again.

Stayed here whilst on business in the area. A very pleasant hotel and enjoyed my stay there. It was reasonable, clean, stylish and the rooms were well appointed, the staff were very helpful and attentive, and also updated all of our booked rooms foe a very small fee which was lovely! The breakfast, I guess was a little limited- drinks, croissants, cereal and cold cheeses & meats, but it was enjoyable and was satisfying. Would certainly return.

The main reason I chose the W14 was due to it's proximity to the Hammersmith Apollo; the hotel was within easy walking distance, so I'd definitely say it's a suitable place to stay if you're attending an event nearby! Overall, the hotel is nice, if nothing special. Everything worked as expected, beds were comfortable, and the booking in/out was a breeze. Only complaint I'd have is that it's quite expensive for what you get, but that's London for you!

I’ve spent 5 days at this hotel and it went really great. The hotel is located in a nice and calm neighborhood and right in the middle between the district and the Piccadilly line which were perfect to go and come back from central London.The room was clean and big enough. The breakfast included with the room has wide variety; fresh fruits, yogurts, coffee,tea,hot chocolate, toast, ham, cheese... Nevertheless, we’ve noticed taped-up electrical cables in the bathroom and in the main room. Otherwise, everything was fine. There are a lot of offers for hotels in London but with this one be sure you pay for a nice room.

For the price, I was happy with my room. Staff went out of their way to accommodate me and were very pleasant and polite. I stayed here to attend the London Book Fair in Olympia and it was around a ten-minute walk, and around £6 / £7 by taxi. I stayed in a treble room as I was with a colleague and it was great as we had separate bedrooms. The room was quiet, the shower was lovely and I would stay here again.

Tiny hotel room, however it was scrupulously clean, comfy bed and had a really good shower... What more do you want?I was doing a conference at Olympia and I did get a cab back at night as the hotel is off the beaten track (which does mean it's quieter at night).

I stayed at this hotel as i was working at the Olympia. This is the 2nd time i have stayed here and both times the room has been fab. Its spacious, amazing shower and has everything you could need. Close the Olympia and great access to tube to other placed. Lots of restaurants and shops close by. Only bad thing i would say is the hairdryer needs a longer lead. I had to sit on the floor to use it otherwise it didnt reach - but only a small thing. Fab place otherwise - so much so i have booked again for my event @ Olympis next year. The breakfast is continental but totally has everything you could want.

Nice clean hotel, rooms are small but modern and perfectly adequate for a night or two. Breakfast is continental and served in annex built in the garden, there is also outside seating here for smokers. The hotel was in walking distance of the tube station and about a 15 min walk to the Hammersmith Apollo. The hotel does not have a lift, we where on the top floor which was a four story climb from breakfast, if you have mobility issues you may need to contact the hotel to request a low floor. We would stay here again.

A surprisingly excellent hotel !Quality - cleanliness - friendliness - location - truly excellent!Value-for-money outstanding !2 Underground stations in very short walking distance.Perfect connection to Heathrow (25 mins with direct Underground) !Quiet and pleasant neighborhood.For sure we will be back soon !

Great city break hotel. Rooms are small but warm and clean. Breakfast is decent continental fare. Would recommend for families visting London as hotel can reached via District and Piccadilly lines. Very good experience.

The standards set in this hotel far exceed the cost, and the room and shower is very well appointed. I booked for three nights and had a three person room. It was spacious, clean and the beds had Hypnos mattresses - I had the best nights' sleep I have ever had in a hotel. The rainfall shower was lovely, and I would say the only improvement would be if there had been hooks on the wall for the towels, which would have made it easier with three sharing and they were also mentioned as being the way to prevent the unnecessary washing of towels.Breakfast was included in the reasonable cost, and the buffet was perfectly adequate with choice. The croissant/roll warmer could have warmed them slightly more given the cold temperature outside. The breakfast room is great. Vending machines useful. Equidistant from Baron's Court and West Kensington station making District and Piccadilly lines both within easy reach.I will be back!

I am a recurring customer, I always book this hotel for my family, when they are coming to London to visit me (it’s in my area).Friendly and professional staff, good location, clean rooms, good breakfast. You feel welcome. Thank you very much!!!

Decent hotel in a very convinent location on the lovely, quiet street next to all amenities and tube. Nicely decorated room with comfy beds and elegant bathroom with an amazing shower. Good place to stay, especially for those who want to explore the city, having at the same time quiet sleep. Very good value for the money.

Stayed her for a few nights and I have to say it is perfect if you're visiting Olympia and it is within 5min of two tube stations, however the wifi is truly awful. Like insanely slow and that when it doesn't just stop working all together. Breakfast was the standard and the staff were friendly.

The hotel was located close to an underground station enabling easy travlling in London. Enviroment is surprisingly peacefull. The room was clean and spacious enough for three of us, good place for a family with a child. Breakfast was simple but good.

Travelled solo, really liked the affordable rooms for being so close to central London. Small room I had but it was very clean and comfortable and had everything I needed, well thought out space. Excellent service and greeting. I stayed for 3 nights there in September 2015.

Upon arrival this hotel looks great.It’s also close to the London Underground on both the direct and piccadilly line which is the airport line.I was able to store my luggage in there storage room given I got there before the 2 pm check in.Staff were very friendly and happy to give advice and directions.There are however a few downsides 1 there is no lift, so it means in some cases you have to carry your suitcases up 3 flights of stairs.The 2nd downside was I think they might have bed bugs. The first night I was bitten and assumed it was a mosquito, but then the same thing happened again, I raised the issue with staff who mover me to another room however it was much smaller then what I had paid for.Finally the shower did lose pressure, at times it came to a complete stop.Overall whilst not the worst place I have ever stayed it’s not the best and if I had my time over I prob wouldn’t stay there again

Stayed for one night. The staff are friendly, and the rooms are clean, in a good state of repair and comfortable. There are no lifts, only stairs. I was on the 3rd floor. People with heavy big suitcases will struggle.The breakfas room is the usual self service buffet affair, but I was disappointed with the pre-prepared toast and kept-warm croissant which were dry and hard. The yoghourt was a big help-yourself bowl kind, not individual servings.My biggest (and my colleagues too) gripe was that the shower didnt work properly but rather suddenly slowed from a gentle cascade to a mere dribble from the showerhead. When I and my colleagues complained the management appeared surprised... neither myself nor my colleagues believe their surprise was genuine, more of a 'B' movie act. Would I stay again? Yes, but I will find my own breakfast next time in the plentiful nearby cafès, and check the water pressure before lathering up with soap!

Comfortable and clean rooms though they were a bit small. Very friendly staff, they helped me with everything I needed. Breakfast could have been a bit better but it was fine. The last but not least, the hotel is located close to a tube station (actually there are 2 of them which are both for a 5 mins walk) and also many small shops and restaurant are in the area.

My wife and I stayed at the W14 for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful whenever we had a question. Our room was clean and the bathroom was updated. Best of all, we loved the location. It was convenient as it was close to two tube stations that easily took us to the major points in London and it was walking distance to many good restaurants. While it was convenient, it was still far enough off the beaten bath that it offered a quiet stay.

Stayed her for one night on business in a single room. The room was small but that is typical for London. It was super clean and thankfully quiet, had a good night sleep. Service at breakfast was attentative and quick. Staff overall very pleasant. The hotel is very close to West Kensington station, just a short walk.

Especially for a three-star hotel, it was great. Not too expensive, and in a nice neighbourhood. The subway station is about two streets away, and using this you can be in the centre of London in about 10 minutes. The hotel itself looks gorgeous. It seems like an old fancy English city house from the outside, and the inside is modern and cozy. The reception personnel was exceptionally friendly and gave us all the information we needed on transport in London. They were also patient, since they remained friendly as I didn't understand at all how oyster cards worked :) Our room was beautiful, cozy and clean. The bathroom was nice and modern.Breakfast was simple, but everthing you need is present. The orange juice was obviously a powder though, but the other beverages were good. The hotel also has a nice little terrace outside, to relax, which I liked.

My husband and I stayed here several nights so we could be close to our daughter and son-in-law's flat. It was within walking distance, so it was perfect for us! It's a quaint hotel that's been renovated and is located in a lovely neighborhood. The room was tiny but that was fine with us. The rates are quite reasonable by London's standards and the hotel had a homey feel about it. The bed was cushy and nice and the bathroom was magnificent! The shower was heavenly--the best one of our whole vacation, in fact. For the shower alone, I will stay here again. :) We felt very much at home here and will definitely stay again when we travel to London.

Now I have to travel for business, I've stayed a few times at this hotel. I find it very good value for money, great rooms, some can be a little small, lower ground definitely better, the stairs are a killer.!I find the breakfast spot on and although not your full english, a good quality continental. Free WiFi and last but definitely not least, lovely staff from the breakfast area and most importantly the front desk, you guys are brilliant.Hopefully see you next time I'm back down for work and don't forget my lower floor room this time.....

A really great stay at the W14 Hotel. We have recently visited an event at Olympia for the weekend. Really convenient and within easy walking distance to Olympia and the underground. Really helpful staff and a lovely hotel. Very clean and well presented. My daughter is Autistic and the staff went out of their way to make her stay as comfortable as possible. I really liked the breakfast and the self service set up suited our family. Would definitely stay there again. Thank you.

We made a very last minute booking into this hotel as we needed somewhere to stay ASAP. They were very helpful over the phone and reception staff were polite and smartly present when we arrived. Free WiFi is available and the room was clean, modern and comfortable - no complaints! Breakfast the next morning was lovely and in a nice area in the garden! Would highly recommend for a London city break!

Did 2 nights there in May. Thought it was a great find. Very good value for a London hotel. Rooms are understandably but well appointed. The staff on the front desk were very helpful. Definitely recommend.

My wife booked us into the W14 overnight whilst visiting London for our daughters exhibition with her University colleagues. Having stayed in these types of hotel before, we are a little unsure, because many of them are really not very good at all, despite the cost! But this one was! Externally it looks smart and clean. The chap at the reception desk was very welcoming and smartly dressed. Our room on the third floor (no lift) was obviously recently refurbished, smart and very clean and well presented. The bathroom had a very effective shower and again, everything was immaculately clean. Breakfast was a Continental type and substantial. Everything was very good. Overall we rate this hotel highly and only reduced to four stars because of the lack of lift and a lot of stairs.

My sister, daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights in May. The hotel is ina suburban neighborhood on a quiet street close to the Barons Court tube station. Our room was a triple and located on the third floor, which is 3 flights up. No lift. However, the lovely gentlemen at the desk take care of your luggage so that is nice. Make sure to call them to get your luggage when you're leaving. Our room had a queen and a twin bed. The way it is set up, it was as if the twin was in its own separate area. Modern fixtures (rainfall shower head) and we did not need adapters even though we had them. The room was small and clean and we had room for the 3 of us comfortably. Since hotel is located in a neighborhood setting, it was nice and quiet. Breakfast is offered with the stay. The best part is it is located in its own separate building steps behind the hotel next to a cute outdoor seating area. Breakfast options were the standard cereal, hard boiled eggs, pastries... Nothing special, but doable. (We ended up eating at a good cafe around the corner called Cafe Continente. Good food and good prices.)The gentlemen at the front desk were very helpful with suggestions on what to do and when we needed things printed. We three would definitely stay at The W14 again.

Stayed at this hotel this weekend. What a lovrly find! Staff were so helpful and friendly. It was in such a quiet location. Rooms were clean and modern, not the biggest but comfy beds and had choice of air con. . Only 25mins from kings cross and then about 5 minute walk from West Kensington tube station. Breakfast was fine, continental style and had a coffee machine. My only quibble and it's so small but there wasn't any decaf options with the hot drinks in the rooms or at breakfast which I know isn't a big deal to most but that'sy preferred drink so would have been nice to have some options. .

A very friendly, very clean and modern hotel located close to the Underground and a seven minute walk to Olympia Exhibition Centre.The staff is extremely helpful with a round the clock reception. Continental Breakfast is also good.

Great price in London for this gem of a hotel. Staff was very informative and helpful. Beers available in the lobby, a plus for me. No lift so pack light! Continental breakfast will save you some cash so you will have more to spend in the excellent pubs around around London. Easy access, 5 minute walk, to the Underground.

Came to stay for the weekend in London to take an exam with LAMDA which is located nearby. From the minute we arrived they could not of been more helpful and friendly. The rooms are big enough and beautifully equipped with everything you need. Bathrooms with great showers. Beds were amazingly comfortable with crisp sheets. Lots of stairs which may be a downside! There is a garden to enjoy and a separate breakfast room. Breakfast was buffet style. You could leave your luggage safely even after checking out. Barons court is a 6 minute walk so location is perfect. I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly. We will be back!

We booked to stay for a night on the 26th May. Unfortunately both my Mum and stepmum passed away within four days of each other and we aren’t able to stay as planned as the funerals are consecutive days two days prior to our visit.I emailed the hotel to find out if there was any way we’d possibly be able to have a refund under these difficult circumstances. They responded a day later (in a nutshell) with “Hope you’re doing good!! It is sad about your step mum but I wish we could be more helpful but we can’t refund you.” It appears they didn’t even read my email properly as there wasn’t a mention of the fact it’s my mum as well and a double bereavement.The event we were attending has a non refundable policy and they were compassionate enough to fully refund us, I’d hoped that the hotel might have been the same.

The W14 serves it purpose of a good location hotel no frills at a good price. Great proximity to the subway 3 blocks, and services of good residential restaurants. The beds and lines were comfortable, bathroom linens were threadbare and fraying, the rooms very compact in size. Stairway is very narrow and steep, there are no elevators so if you are not on the first floor, you will have quiet a hike. Overall the neighborhood is safe and quiet. Breakfast is pretty weak in content.

Overall a positive experience - in a good location, but needs attention to a few fundamental areas.This could so easily have been 4 or 5 stars but the hotelIs unfortunately let down by a few small points that cumulatively lower the standard of the experience as a whole.The welcome was ok - but lacked warmth or sincerity. We asked about the possibility of a late checkout and were told that it is possible but at an additional charge of £10 per hour after the standard checkout of 10:30....when will London hotels realise that this is a significant opportunity? While we were at reception, two other guests enquired about late checkouts - and at typical inflated London prices, anyone with a decent business head should simply absorb the slight extra cost of keeping housekeeping onsite for a couple more hours and offer late checkouts - come on people, it’s a big selling point!The public spaces are fine - relatively recently refurbished, clean and pleasant.Our room (on the ‘lower-ground’ floor) was small but well-appointed, with plenty of options for charging phones and other modern necessities! The hairdryer was a good one (often overlooked in hotels) and the bed (mattress) was decent quality.The details around the room however were rather disappointing:We repeatedly stood on the sharp carpet strip between the bedroom and bathroom - as it had been exposed by the fraying of the carpet.There were a few damp patches in full view on the walls - which should have been cleaned off the wallpaper as soon as they occurred - as they are now a permanent feature.The ‘air conditioning’ is pretty much ineffectual - I tried varying it quite a lot while we were there, to no discernible effect.The tea/coffee selection is pitiful - and would have been barely acceptable ten years ago.The toilet seat didn’t match(fit) the bowl, and therefore moved constantly in use.The bathroom bin lid wasn’t attached and therefore flew off onto the floor every time we used the foot pedal at the base of the bin until we finally got used to it (when we checked out).The shower, on the other hand was fantastic - I will be buying one of these units for home very soon!So in summary - despite the hotel’s accessibility (like most places in London) and almost-reasonable price level, it lacks attention to detail and doesn’t quite feel as welcoming as it should.A missed opportunity - that can be easily rectified by the management team I would say.

I’ve been here overnight. The quality of room is surprisingly good for this price. It’s new and nice! Another thing, that I need to stress is the speed of checking in and out. SUPERFAST! Literally, I just came, filled the form and that’s it. The payment is done automatically via Booking.com. I love that, really However, something needs improvement. The breakfast is very modest and not the best quality, but at least somethingAnyway, I probably will come back here

Having stayed in a few hotels in the area, also used to live around the corner, thought it would be a standard B&B, and just somewhere to sleep. However pleasantly surprised, staff friendly, rooms and shower room, small but well proportioned, breakfast in the annex, simple system, fresh and clean.

This hotel met most if not all of my expectations. Very modern, newly rejuvenated . Very comfortable rooms. No complaints on the service, courteous and good but nothing extra beyond that .For me traveling to UK, the lack of Full English breakfast was something clearly advertised, but I thought it would be ok for me. But afterwards it bugged by more than I expected. Probably because there were no restaurants close by where I could get full english.The only negative surprise was the lack of elevator, which was something of a disappointment, I had not noticed that in the description. Carrying heavy suitcases between floors after 4 days of shopping with the family was a chanllange

Stayed at the W14 hotel for three nights in March for the first time and will definitely stay again. We chose this hotel mainly for it's proximity to Blythe House (at Olympia) and the Picadilly Line. We found the hotel to be much more than just convenient........it was surprisingly modern, clean, quiet, friendly and really well placed for transport (both Barons Court and West Kensington tube stations only a few hundred metres away - giving access to three underline lines for easy travel into and around the city, and to Heathrow).The room, although small (the hotel is in Victorian houses so should not be a surprise) was very well fitted, with modern boutique style furniture, the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in in any hotel, the bathroom was also excellent (the shower probably the best of any hotel) - the room had everything you would expect from a modern hotel.The staff where attentive and friendly. The continental breakfast was adequate.The area was surprisingly quiet especially at night given the proximity to the busy North End Road and Cromwell Road.All in all a great small hotel in a good location - a great find that fits our needs. Will be back

Nothing special but cheap and clean. The rooms are modern and in pretty good condition. The bed was good and the sheets felt new. The location is quiet, close to the Hammersmith Apollo so was good for us.Would be good for families because it's quiet. Breakfast was pretty good and lots of it, croissants, toast, cereal etc. I would totally recommend it for a quick break but not for a special occasion.

I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The bed is comfortable but note that the pressure from the shower isn't great. Also note there are no lifts but the staff were helpful with luggage. I found the rooms very loud with doors constantly banging.Breakfast was extremely poor in both choice and quality.The main reason I would never consider staying in this hotel again is because of what is have mentioned in the title. The person who cleaned my room used my lipstick. I found the attached tissue on the desk where I had left my make up. I am not someone who blots my lipstick in this way so therefore I can confidently say this was not left by myself. On finding the tissue I looked through my make up bad looking to match the colour and found the lipstick right at the bottom of my make up bag so who knows what else was used. I reported this to reception and was told to send an email. I returned to my room at the end of the day to find the remains of the cup of tea I had earlier still on the side.I sent an email to the manager as advised and received an extremely disappointing response where he claims the tissue was left by myself - even though I have made it clear it was not and also that the cup of tea was left there because they thought I was still using it. He is not prepared to look into the matter any further and so he clearly does not take it seriously that his staff cannot be trusted in the rooms not to invade peoples privacy. I asked for the lipstick to be replaced but he refused.If you do stay here I would put do not disturb on the door but really I would advise you not to.

All of the workers but specially josh, kenzie, Deb, and the manager (sorry I forgot your name) were the absolute best when it came to hospitality, service, and friendliness. Gave my friend and I so many recommendations on what to do around the city and where to eat. When we first arrived they let us store our luggage until checkin time. We stayed in a room with 4 other people and a private shower for us. Everything was clean and the private lockers worked well. If you don’t have your own lock they can provide you one with a 5€ deposit that you get back once you turn the lock in after your stay. I read a review about the “dark bar” and the only time it is dark is at night time lol. They have happy hour Thursday- Sunday in the afternoon and it is a great time as it seems like everyone in the town knows about this place (but not too crowded). I definitely recommend this hostel to anyone who is traveling to London, either with someone or by yourself, you will have a fantastic time meeting other travelers and the friendliest staff.

Train noise maybe isn't an issue in every room, but in ours (top floor, north side) it was comically bad. It started early in the morning, and could hear the brakes screeching thru our earplugs. Shower pressure at 8am was literally a dribble, but water was still warm. Breakfast was pretty fair, toast/spreads and cereals. Four floors and no stairs as its an old building. Wouldnt come back here but they've done a fair job w what they have.

We stayed at Walrus only two nights but we had the chance to see many of the main London attractions thanks to the central position of the hostel. The only problem is that the hostel is situated close to a railway and the noise could wake you up early in the morning if you are a light sleeper. The breakfast includes toast, cereals, tea or coffee, milk but no hot food. The hostel offers the opportunity to cook your own food in a well equipped kitchen. You can lock your stuff in your room and leave your luggages in a storage. Also they provide you with towels, lockers, adapters and whatever you need. The rooms and toilets are clean. I certainly recommend this hostel if you want to meet new people from other parts of world and visit the city centre without spending too much!

This hostel is good value for money and great location. The staff were friendly and the free breakfast was a great bonus. I was worried about the noise from the trains because they are right next to the hostel, but it was actually fine during the night! The main downside was the bar was not the social gathering place I expected. It was full of locals, an older crowd, so it was tough to hang out there with other backpackers. I found my bed to be fine, but be warned that in the 22 bed dorm there are some bunk beds pushed so close together that those guests were essentially sharing a large bed with a stranger. I definitely would not have been happy if I had been assigned one of those beds, because it seemed inappropriate and awkward. Otherwise the experience was fine.

Very clean very helpful the bar great for relaxing after a day out breakfast is included so close to alot of things to see and do hop on hop of buses normal buses train stations Big Ben Westminster Bridge etc

id never stayed in hostel befor and was really quite nervous, i was shown to my room by 2 really nice staff, one manager type and a girl who was super helpful and got me a towel etc, room was bit daunting, number locks on doors make it simple as you dont need keys, about 24 beds, bunks, all quite close together, everything clean, lockers etc, toilets clean, all really great, i half slept half lay awake worrying i snored to much, haha but good fun and for £19! bar prices are however very high, but its london, you do get 15% off, but im not sure why but even after i told the chap i never seemed to get it, but its really nice in the bar, chilled out, worth half an hour to collect yourself.id stay again

Good location, very good breakfast and good price. There are some things to improve such as the cleanliness, the bathrooms and the kitchen, but in general the bar and the rooms were okay (small lockers). The temperature was perfect, although outside was very cold and the staff was very friendly. We could also print our boarding passes in reception and they kept our luggage safe for one day.Thanks for this nice stay

The Walrus can be described as eclectic & homely. I stayed at the Walrus for 5 nights, the staff were so helpful & accomodating, my bed was really comfortable & the whole place was really clean! It's right near waterloo station, which I thought would be a problem for noise, but it absolutely wasn't. It's in a fabulous location - within walking distance from lots of the tourist hot spots. Breakfast is basic, but has all the things you need. I had a really good time at Walrus in comparison to other hostels, I think it's that homely vibe that I got. Would definitely stay again, would recommend you to as well.

Cool pub downstairs to chill and hang with new people. The building is old but very clean. Has some really goo character, really central location, I loved walking everywhere and coming back to a great feeling London vibe place. Would recommend.

The location is amazing we can go to much of the places by walking. The pub is cozy and has a nice environment also the guys are really nice and I will de finally go back.. The place itself is a little bit old but is also cozy which makes us feel like we are in our grandmother house. The bed is really confortable and the room warm

For the happy traveller vibe the bedrooms had enough spaciousness to make enjoyable sleep.. My 8 bed dorm had a late booking on the last day, and she was able to get to bed comfortably without banging around, so I felt at home; no problems with location, lots of fun places to eat and drink so if the weather is wet, cool.

So I stayed in a 22 mixed bedroom just last week. The overall experience was great! A good breakfast (toast, spreads, tea, juices, cereal...), towels provided for free when asked, lovely staff, great pub downstairs and awesome location - just around the corner from Waterloo station and many other touristic places. The overall atmosphere of the hostel is amazing and I met so many great people during my stay! I would stay here again if the opportunity presented itself. On the downsides: the kitchen was tiny tiny tiny but I didn't really use it so it didn't bother me, just FYI. Also, I feel like the (small) amount of bathrooms and toilets can be a problem if ever you get up and go to bed at the same time as other people. Again, it wasn't an issue for me because I get up earlier than most guests and also go to bed earlier than them. Beds are a bit squeaky so if you have trouble sleeping, make sure to get earplugs, just to be on the safe side ;)

2nd time staying at a hostel in London and loved the location of this one.Just behind the embankment under the bridge near waterloo.We stayed only for 1 night and booked with free brekfast included the next morning. Great based all of the rooms had lockers did have to take your own towel shower room was abit naff but done the job.Lovely bar area had free brekfast toast cerial biscuits tea coffee etc great for a kick start for the day and we could even leave our belongings there for the daywill defiantly return all local attractions and tube station within walking distance.

Came here the last time I was in London 4 years ago, had a great experience then, and another great experience now. We originally booked an Airbnb, but after our host never came home and didn’t contact us, we had no choice but to find a hostel for the night. The Walrus took us in, got us two beds, free towels, and everything we needed. They’ve done a lot of renovations since the last time we were here, and the place looks great! New beds, more outlets, comfier beds, and new showers. Great breakfast with toast, fruit, cereal (and even soy and almond milk options!), and tea and biscuits. They truly saved us when we had nowhere else to stay!! Thanks guys!!

Walrus H. its good located with Waterloo station very close. Its confortable and have a good price. I spent there like 4 nights, but there occured me something. I saved some package in a save spot as told me the mannager and when I went out, there wasn’t nothing there, could be someone took my stuffs that I bought during my eurotrip during almost a month traveling. I sent a mail to the mannager about my case and the answer really surprised me. This place showed me two things really important that you have to be sure when you’ll booking in a place, that its safe and a responsable attention from their workers. In London its a lot of more good places to stay too, I wish for the travelers think that until twice times.

I stayed at the Walrus Hostel for only one night. I got a great price for one night, the location was good, right near a tube station where it was easy to get anywhere in the city. When arrived I was greeted by friendly staff. The hostel had great safety features. The bed and the bathroom were clean. The bar was a great atmosphere. I had an accident where one of my items got damaged and the staff fully compensated me while I was back in the US. I would recommend to anybody.

I recently stayed at the Walrus as I live on the London Waterloo line to attended a gig at the O2 Arena. Being a 5 minute walk from the station the hostel is ideal for connections to underground/overground. The hostel itself is a bar on the ground floor with a side door providing 24hr access to the hostel. Up a flight of stairs was the kitchen that was compact but well equipped. Each floor had a bathroom and toilet, being able to use any floor. These were clean and tidy, though not top-spec. I stayed in a room on the top floor which accommodated 8 bunks. The room and bedding were clean and comfortable, lockers provided as well as a deposit safe available. In the room there was a single plug with a multiplier for electrical items. The WiFi was free and of a decent speed too. The state were friendly and helpful if you needed to ask anything. One word of caution: the aforementioned connectivity with the railway means earplugs are essential as the hostel is on the edge of Waterloo bridge (i.e. trains running most of the night/morning). With that preparation sleep is easily reached!

I enjoyed my four nights at this place. Good bar where you get discounts as a guest, quality free breakfast every morning, and close to Lambeth and Waterloo Tube stations. The staff are extremely knowledgeable about London and and happy to help. The WiFi doesn't reach the fourth floor but works well on the lower floors. It is directly next to the train tracks, exactly where the trains stop and squeaking brakes can be heard loud and clear at any time. The lockers in the rooms are small but they have extra secure lockers that no none but staff has access to.

The Walrus was the first ever hostel that I stayed in and i was also on my first solo trip. The staff was nice, the beds were decent (I had a top bunk in a 4 female only dorm - I soon learned top bunk is not for me). Breakfast was basic. Very close to 2 tube stations and other attractions such as the London Eye and Big Ben. I had 3 very noisy roommates, but I know that's not the hostels fault. The only thing I would change is if the bar offered food, other than that I really enjoyed this place.

Had a wonderful time staying at the Walrus hostel....great location and amenities....Alex and the rest of the staff were wonderful....so welcoming and knowledgeable of the area....The free walking tour was great...lots of facts and a great way to meet other guests! Would highly recommend! Thanks for a great stay!

Just south of the The London Eye, The Walrus Hostel is in between two tube stations and in a nice neighbourhood. Comfortable beds in the rooms and an amazing breakfast with a great selection including Nutella. Great staff all around and a great bar where you can meet other guests and locals with really nice furniture as well. Will definitely return.

This is a real backpackers hostel, full of soul and personality. Walking through the hallways upstairs made me feel like I was living in a cool old mansion. The whole team is super friendly, and Alex is a champion! The rain showers were big and had plenty of pressure and hot water. They even give free towels. The bar is comfortable, with great drinks, fun music and nice people all around. I slept like a baby every night. There’s a shop right across the street so you could cook in the kitchen if you wanted to. With the food tents along the streets outside it’s more tempting to grab something hot and fresh though. Really close to the Tube, train station, Thames, London Eye and all of the attractions of the city. It was a great stay, and I will definitely be back!

I have been at the Walrus during my last trip to London and I must say it's a great choice for who wish to stay in the heart of the city in a cheap accomodaton.I have to admit that I'm quite an ambiguous traveller, because I like luxury places while travelling with my husband, and young and budget accommodations if travelling with frends. In both cases I look at details and I always make my choice after reading reviews.On this occasion I was with 5 other girls, so we were looking for a young place full of live. Reviews was good, so The Walrus would have been our place.I must say that the Walrus is the right place to make party. The Pub is full on nice people, nice music and fast service.Dormitory was also nice, but common bathrooms was not always clean, that's why I left a score 4 out of 5. Of course it depends from the good manners of guests, but probably they could organize an extraordinary cleaning service expecially at night.In any case I think it's the best choice in you are looking for an hostel.Top location, close to underground and London Eye.The manager is a gentleman and I knows perfectly how customer sevice works.We strongly suggest this place and you will not disagree.

Alex and his team warmly greeted us at The Walrus hostel and bar. We had a lovely welcoming where Alex showed us around the hostel and explained a few events that were going on throughout our stay. The hostel was very easy to get to with 2 train stations within a 2 min walk. Only a 5min walk to Westminster Bridge and the London Eye as well as the first stop for many of the city bus tours. The room was clean and had lockers and a small sink. Each floor had a shower and toilet both of which were consistently clean and also the showers looked newly renovated. There was also a well-equipped kitchen. Each morning we had the free breakfast in the hostel bar, which consisted of toast, cereal, fresh fruit, tea/coffee, and juices. In the evenings we would have a drink down in the bar, which was often quite busy and had a great atmosphere. A bonus of staying in the hostel and drinking in the bar was the 15% off as well as 15% off food at the sister pub just down the road. My only qualms about this hostel is that it could get quite loud due to being so close to the train. As I’m a heavy sleeper this didn’t particularly bother me but it did for others. Also, the WIFI wasn’t great, but enough to download emails. All in all, I would 100% go back to the Walrus on my next trip to London. The friendly staff, cozy atmosphere and location are all big positives for me and I would recommend to all my friends traveling here!

I visited The Walrus for drinks with a friend after having walked past on numerous occasions, but having no time to pop in.We were always a bit hesitant to make a special trip as it looked a little run down, and the hostel part put me off, but when we went in, there was a great cocktail menu, curious but lovely furnishings and very friendly staff. We stayed for a second drink... I'd definitely go back if I'm in the area, or waiting for a train at Waterloo!

Overall, this hostel was good and had all your basic needs. The wifi wasn't strong, but they did had a complimentary breakfast. The staff were friendly, and the rooms were clean. I did find it was priced fairly. They did provide towels and lockers for luggage. It wasn't extravagent, but provided what I needed.

My daughter and I stayed here for one night. We liked the vibe, clean and comfortable beds, and friendly staff. Easy walk to the tube. Co-op Foods right next door. We didn't cook this stay but always appreciate it when grocery is very near the hostel. Good breakfast included- toast, cereal, muesli, fruits, juice, coffee and tea. Would definitely stay again.

My husband & I went for a quick trip to London ans we chose to stay at the Walrus Hostel. The location is just perfect! Nice & clean, breakfast included in the moning (not a complete breakfast, just cereal, toast, coffe or tea & fresh fruit but it's enough to get you going on your sight seeing) Walking distance to the main atractions that we wanted to see (London Eye, Westinster Abbey, Big Ben, Buckingham Palace)! We'll defenitely be returning soon & we'll be staying at the same place! Great staff, very friendly & the pub was awesome!

I was there in three times and every one was great. I love english breakfast - toasts and jam and fruit and coffee. I was in room for 2 people, 6 people and in biggest one. Everything was ok. Hotel is realy near to centre of London.

This hostel is ideally located on Westminster road, just across the Thames from Westminster Abbey / Parliament, etc. The bar area is really cool looking and is a good place to grab a drink. The facilities / rooms could use an update however. The bathrooms were really outdated and there were only two showers per floor. I recommend waking up early to use them.Our room of 6 was small, but confortable with large storage lockers for our bags. Unfortunately the wifi was very spotty throughout our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the free breakfast (toast, cereal, fruit, juice) was appreciated and good.I would recommend staying here if you're alright with an older place, simply for the great staff and excellent location, if nothing else.

Really easy to get to from Gatwick using trains. Nice little pub in the hostel where they operate the hostel from. Free breakfast which is basically toast, cereal, fruit, coffee/tea/juice, but it's enough to get you going in morning. Welcoming staff, gave a tour and full explanation of hostel facilities upon arrival. London eye 5 min away.Toilets didn't flush properly sometimes but it's nothing to ruin a stay. I would have liked a locker in the room even though I was in a private.Many small cafes and pubs around to eat in if you like going out to eat.

Super close to the London eye and Westminster with a great bar below that offers a discount to guests. The staff was friendly and offered advice on what to see and places to eat. Only issue was the trains being loud but that's what you get to deal with if you want to be close to the train station and they offer earplugs!

This hostel is in a great location and the staff are friendly and helpful. However, the guests in our room were very loud and inconsiderate, and the wifi didn't work all weekend. For £60+ a night for just a dorm, hopefully you'd at least get some working wifi.

Location, location, location! For where its located this place is worth every penny! Free breakfast in an authentic pub? Yes, thank you! I regret not being able to stay a whole weekend because when I got back Friday night the place was packed and filled with great energy. Too bad to leave at 2am Saturday morning. Womp! Regardless of my short stay, I enjoyed my time here. I will definitely be booking here next time I'm in London! This hostel is conveniently located one block away from the Lambeth North tube station and right in front of a bus station! The only downside was the mold in the bathroom.

An excellent stay, fast balled at 08.45 at night with nowhere to stay, rand the Walrus and spoke to one of their outstanding staff.No problem for this highly professional team.I was the only guest in this warm, clean comfortable establishment, in a four bedroom room.If you are an experienced traveller or just starting out a great place to be.If you are a bit precious this isn`t the place for you. High stairs to accommodation and can be noisy with trains and traffic etc due to location.I love it, thank you to the Walrus and it`s team!

We recently visited London on a euro trip and stayed here. We found it super affordable and the staff was super awesome and knowledgeable. The atmosphere was super cool but the beds weren't very comfortable, but for the price you can't expect a pillow top mattress.

I haven't been yet, but I'll be going in Summer 2017. I'm spending a month in Europe with about 10 days in the U.K. I was trying to figure out how to store my uk souvenirs while traveling the rest of the continent as I won't really have space to bring it all with me in Europe's budget airlines. So I emailed ahead and the manager said it would be okay for me to drop my stuff their and leave it for nearly three weeks. Obviously I won't leave anything pricey, but you can't beat this kind of service and kindness.

By far the best introduction to London. My phone died and I had no adapter. After many hours of both exploring and looking for the Walrus, I finally found it :) I must have looked sweaty, lost, and thirsty, because I was given a beer right away -haha. Check-in was easy and they have specials for guests. When you get out make a left and go through the tunnel.. It was amazing --there is a venue in the middle of it. After a long night, you can hangout and watch the street artists paint their heart out. If you are looking for a quiet paradise.. This is not it --this place is for the open minded and for those who are truly seeking to submerge into the English culture. Can't wait until I visit again!

I found the Walrus on my first trip to London two years ago, and have been staying there ever since. The building is definitely on the older side, but it's quirky and unique. I've stayed in several different rooms, and they have all been clean and well looked after. Free breakfast is basic, but filling, and having the pub just downstairs is convenient. Aside from the great price, this hostel has absolutely prime location. It's just a few minutes walk from a lot of the major monuments (Big Ben, London Eye, etc.), close to a tube stop and Waterloo station, and I've never seen a reason to stay anywhere else. I would definitely recommend it to budget travelers looking to save a few pounds in London.

The Walrus Hostel was so-so, nothing amazing but decent enough for a short stay. The bottom floor is a very busy bar, which is also where you check in. Bar has good prices, but was too busy for my opinion and didn't seem to be all hostel guests. There was no common room besides this area.The room itself was fine, bed was comfy with bedding and towels provided.Showers were okay as well but no space or hooks to put your items. Overall the hostel seemed a dated. Also, if you are bothered by train noise then bring ear plugs. It didn't bother me, but I've also spent a lot of time sleeping on trains so I can sleep through the noise.Breakfast in the morning was quite nice - bread, cereals, fruit, coffee, juices, etc.For the price of £26 you can't really beat it. But if you are looking for a more modern, updated hostel then this isn't it.

I stayed in the hostel for three nights.The building i charming, rooms are a clean and despite the train I managed to sleep decently. Location very handy. Friendly staff. Decent buffet in the morning, nothing handmade.No hangers in the room to hang your coats, and the power sockets not always are closed to the bed.It would take a little effort to improve the overall experience, especially with the toilets and the showers. All the taps I put my hands on were half broken, with leaks and the shower head water didn't want to stay in place, keeping on falling. No heating whatsoever. No bins for paper towels and a generally poor looking environment. Kitchen was handy but poorly equipped, sign with "free coffee and tee" but no actual tee was there. Few pans but no decent cooking tools. Also cold room, which is a shame since it could be a nice alternative meeting point for hostel's guests. No markers or labels to to use to put your name on the food as requested. I would keep the music in the bar lower, so people could actually interact more.

You absolutely can not beat the location of the hostel. It's a couple streets away from Westminster bridge (how you get to Westminster Abbey, Big Ben, Buckingham Palace, etc.) and close to 2 different subway stops. There's a charming bar downstairs and upstairs is where the rooms are. I stayed in one of the 22 bed co-ed rooms and have no complaints. The room was clean, bright, beds were comfy. The bathrooms and facilities were clean and the staff was super nice.

We chose this one because of location and good price. We spend 3 nights in mixed room up to 6 persons. The service is the best thing in here. Rooms are tidy, bathrooms are ok, the bar service and food are pretty nice. Only one problem - this hostel is placed nex to the railroad - and almost every ten minutes you can hear some train passing by. Anyway this is probably my second favourite place to stay in London.

This location is perfect--it's right around the corner from the Eye (just checked, 8 min walk according to Google), and in an OK area (not the safest feeling near the train tracks). Rooms are small but cozy, heat worked fine. Lockers at the beds were adequate. Shower was clean-ish, but cold--one of the windows had broken so it kept swinging open so it got pretty chilly in there. Hot water was iffy as well, but adequate for my needs (quick showers are a must for hostels!). Overall this place was nice, I'd stay here again if I needed a spot right downtown. I didn't like that there were not a lot of bathrooms but I never had to wait in line either, and it was pretty busy, so that's probably just my own weird paranoia. This is a pretty decent hostel given the price, but it's really nothing fancy. Would probably stay somewhere else given how great London's tube system is, but if you like being near the river, this place is perfectly good. Bar downstairs is also pretty nice, though they cant pour a decent Guinness which makes me think the bartenders might not be that great on mixed drinks--but it's a cheap kind of hole in the wall feeling place, so again, get what you pay for. Overall this was decent and tolerable, but given how great London transport is, I'd probably never stay here again unless it was New Years and I wanted to be near the Eye. In which case I would 100% stay here if the prices were ok. Also, you can get to the roof if you schmooze your way with the right people. It's a great view up there, but I understand that they dont really want to invite people up to the top for safety reasons. If you get a chance, get up there though!

Pros - CHEAP, convenient location near Waterloo station, nice staff, good breakfast.Cons - Not having decent wifi is a killer for me. Third floor toilet doesn't really flush and there is no soap to wash your hands, no bath mats outside showers so expect more water outside shower than inside, the mop to clean the water up isn't clean, lots of stairs, The noise from the Waterloo station trains and the noise from the traffic light crossing is VERY loud. People only spend a night or two here so maybe that is why the ratings aren't bad. Staff cleans but the carpet and linoleum simply have to be replaced. No a/c so it could be hot in summer.

Everything seemed fine till i actually tried to sleep but bar kept playing very loud musicCannot recommend and will not be returningBlocked toilet was also less than idealThe staff were fine but it is bit rich to read about how guests should be considerate of each other when bar is just offensively noisy

I really enjoyed my stay here. The location is amazing, it has breakfast included and it's really good, plus the staff is very nice and helpful. The toilets were clean and workes properly. Rooms were not very big but were acceptable, you know, it's whar you'd expect for a relatively cheap hostel in London.

Good for a hostel, very friendly sweet staff is what it makes it worth while! Fairly clean, very basic rooms, close to 2 tube stations in a touristy area not far from the London eye, Big Ben etc. If you're looking for a hostel for a few nights this one is super cute, the bar downstairs has friendly old fashioned decor and fun drink specials

Popped in for a quick drink and made use of the £4 mojitos deal.. Very nice they were too... great staff, very friendly... funky interior with mismatched comfy sofas.... good for visiting The Cut market and Waterloo..

Great place to stay, especially if it's your first time in London. The hostel is supereasy to find - once you see the Big Ben or London Eye keep the direction and you wouldn't be mistaken :)) Hostel is at walking distance from many touristic places. What's important for female solo travelers - area nearby is safe, even at evening hours walking alone back to the place. Staff ir helpfull and nice, makes you feel welcome.4-bed female room is located above the bar entrance with people having fun outside, so if the windows are open, it can be difficuilt to get asleep.Breakfast is bacis - bread, jam, nutella, some coffee and fresh fruit.

I booked a shared room for my wife and I here due to the location. The bar downstairs, which is also the reception area is very charming and was not an issue noise wise. However, our room was right next to the railway station making sleeping early or sleeping in impossible. I would not stay there again.

I didn't think to take any pictures, but I loved my stay here! It was my first hostel experience and I was happy with the: clean facilities, clean sheets, free towels, free wifi, nice location, great breakfast selection (for a hostel), you even get a discount at the bar in the lobby, and you can even borrow power converters if you don't have one. It has a cool, very vintage or almost flea market vibe to the common room, but I loved spending time there- kitchen is small but bearable for sure. The hostel is across from the co-op if you want to save some money on food.

Great place great beer old style clean friendly staff if I'm in town again il be shire to visit again lovely atmosphere and must I say again the beer is TOP NOTCH !Though could do with more toilets and cleaned more often as they where a bit smelly

We loved the Walrus! The staff is super helpful and do whatever they can to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are small, but they are clean and nicely kept. Its in a great location with Big Ben just across the river and right next to the station. We will definitely be coming back. Also, they offer a ton of drink discounts!

Had a really lovely stay. Was only there for one night but super convenient as its so close to Stratford station and the staff and facilities were lovely. Would 100% recommend! Could of easily stayed there for longer and maybe next time will try the food!

Nice, clean, tidy rooms with good beds. Overall very good hotel with nice staff. Location is close to bus and undeground station, though not in the nicest aera. Easy to reach from London Stansted, 50 min bus ride.

Down in London for 3 days and because of Wimbledon, was unable to stay in the city. Westbridge is my go to for when I'm in Stratford so booked in here for the 2 nights.The room was pleasant enough, though not sure if it's only because I tried working in the hotel this time I noticed it's but the space between the desk and the bed makes it quite impractical to use (with ease). This was room 112.Amenities are still just as good, and it's the gym that truly makes this place shine over the other hotels.Ate in here for the first night as it was late and I'd been traveling/working all day. The menu has changed since the last time I was down, so got to try a few more delights.Opted for the confit duck to start, followed by the fillet steak (with a side salad), and finished with the triple chocolate cheesecake. All in very pleasant. It's a shame it's not licenced, but I can live with that.Breakfast is the same buffet style that I've come to know when in London. They don't appear to have takeaway cups in the dining room at breakfast so unable to grab and go (though I think you could ask the waiting staff).All staff are pleasant and overall it was a very enjoyable stay, and will remain my go-to place when in Stratford.

In looking for a place to stay the night, I loved the look of the hotel, but was convinced when I learnt it was fully halal. The hotel is well situated- only a few minutes walk from Stratford Station and Westfield. It has a garden and a beautiful lounge, a delicious breakfast buffet, and a room which is well considered in its amenities. The staff were really friendly, helpful and considerate. My husband surprised me by upgrading us to a suite and as each one is different (which I love) the staff really kindly showed me the available suites so I can choose which one I wanted to stay in. I chose the King Edward Suite as this was really spacious although faced the main road which wasn't really a problem. They provided us with a cot for my 2 year old daughter and brought up extra bedding and towels for her. The only only downfall is that the hotel does not have its own parking but there is parking nearby and a stay here is worth the trouble.

Nice hotel, rooms are clean and cool. Small bathroom but also clean and has everything you need. Also perfect location, nearby a train station and walking distance from a big shopping mall with lots of shops and restaurants.

Suitably location - station nearby, but away from the hustle and bustle .Staff very efficient and friendly. Room was neat and clean, as was the bathroom. Breakfast was good . staff were very courteous anf friendly

We loved everything about this hotel from check-in to check-out. Sebastian (at Reception) was as accommodating as any hotel employee I have observed, and I usually stay at high-end hotels. We’ll be back soon.

So rare in our experience but the air conditioning was almost silent and very effective. One of our party celebrated her birthday during our stay. To our surprise and delight we found balloons in the room, a kind handwritten birthday card and a box of chocolates. Really excellent.

Very good stay in London , son lives very near and this hotel was chosen by him for a birthday present , great location, close to tube station, shops etc. We will definitely stay there again. Wonderful nights sleep, very comfortable bed and pillows

We went for a two day trip to London for the birthday of my wife. The staff was very friendly and i had a special agreement for a special room decoration with roses and a very very good chocolate mousse cake. The breakfast was very good and the choice plentiful. On our next trip to London we will definitely choose this Hotel again.

I stay at the Westbridge every time I'm in London on business. Good location, 6 minutes from the station, though initially not obvious if you're not looking for it. Room quality excellent, staff friendly and welcoming. Thoroughly recommended :-)

For once a proper professionally run hotel - the staff are a great asset and understand customer service. Rooms are comfortable and always surprisingly quiet for the city. Excellent food too - I don’t stay anywhere else in London now. Transport links great with DLR 2 minutes away.

To be honest, we booked The Westbridge simply because of it's location. However, the staff were all really helpful and friendly, our (base) room was all brand new, functional and comfortable, and breakfast was good, though catering for a wide range of needs. If I am staying around Stratford again, I'll be booking this hotel.

The welcome we had on arrival was lovely and we really enjoyed our stay here. What a find. Lovely room, and food was delicious and reasonably priced. Just a shame there’s no beer or wine. Practical location for Westfield and the O2

Chose to stay here based on it's close proximity to the O2 stadium and didn't disappoint. Stayed in Twin Room G2. Really well appointed, Spotlessly clean - lovely crisp bedlinen. Complimentary Tea, coffee, water, biscuits, complete with mini-fridge. Small, but perfectly formed, shower room, with fluffy towels and mini toiletries. Staff were very welcoming, and stored luggage for us before check in and after check out. Breakfast was a real treat, self-service buffet style, with plenty of choice. Hotel is located within 5 minute walking distance of Stratford Station and Westfield Shopping Centre. Can't find fault with this charming place and would not hesitate to book again.

A surprisingly perfect stay. Clean, comfortable room with everything you could need.Staff were pleasant and extremely helpful.Breakfast was good and soup at lunch was really tasty. Staff couldn't have done more.Happy to stay again

Staff extremely pleasant, rooms are on the small side but comfortable, we had a very large balcony so relaxed outside. Note hotel doesn’t serve alcohol but no problem taking own which they will serve and supply ice bucket and glasses for the room. Vegetarian breakfast one of the best we’ve tasted. Restaurant menu limited but what we had was cooked perfectly. Pleasant courtyard to have morning g coffee. Beautiful lounge, with computer for your use. Five minute walk to Stratford shopping centre which was excellent plenty of shops, bars and restaurants. Tube station near too, seven stops to Covent Garden. Get Apple Pay and save on ticket prices. Parking, we used JustPark and parked at Stratford shopping precinct , easy to use cost £23 for two days. We walked to the Olympic village took about 10-15 minutes. Enjoyed our stay here.

The Westbridge Hotel is well located near the Stratford shopping center en the Olympic Stadion. The hotel is charming, staff is very professional and even the rooms have everything you need. So why only a 3 star instead of ... much more?Well for a 250+ EUR/night room you expect the rooms to be bigger. The rooms are extremely tiny, with all the luxury you need, but all packed in a tiny, tiny zone as if you sleep in a caravan. So don't go there if you tend to be claustrophobic.

Stayed for 1 night. The hotel is modern, beautifully clean, comfortable and the rooms are lovely. The bed and pillows were so comfortable and the rooms had everything I needed and looked stylish. We had a late lunch after check in, which was delicious and good value, and equally the breakfast was beautiful. I was aware before arrival that this was a halal hotel and therefore no pork products in the breakfast, but it made no difference to me as the selection of food on offer was much wider than I had expected and the quality of the food was amazing. There are signs saying you can bring your own alcohol if wanted. Every member of staff we came in contact with was very polite and friendly. Well done Westbridge, excellent service, facilities and value, we were impressed!

Easily the worst room I have ever stayed in. Tiny-with a horrible view. £220 a night without breakfast and all the manager could say was- ‘well you did book with booking.com- like we deserved to be punished’.

I used the live close to this hotel, so returning to the area for business was very enjoyable as it lived up to my expectations of being a very nice place to stay. The service was also extremely good.

Always a pleasure to come here when working in London. Staff are very welcoming and rooms clean and well equipped .The breakfast has lots of choices and the staff are always very accomodating with any extra requests if needed.

The location is about 7 mins from the Stratford station which is 25 mins from Westminster on the Jubilee line so very handy. The building is a bit old but has its charms. The floors aren’t level, the subway shakes the building from time to time, and the stairs are quite steep, but the food and service is excellent. We felt like royalty. The staff were unbelievable. Recommended

Lovely welcoming staff - always helpful and positive. Very comfortable and well equipped rooms. Great spaces for working or relaxing outside rooms. Good food. No alcohol bar/restaurant makes the hotel quieter!

For me in London this is my home.Always the same very friendly staff and value for money.Very central and safe.The only problem is parking otherwise it's fantastic.Transport is not an issue .Shopping nearby is great

Overall staff were friending and the facilities were absolutely fine for what I required. The food was great and the options available really good. Near to the Westfield Shopping Centre and tube station so made it easy to get around and to other parts of London. Would recommend it as the price was really good for the facilities available. Also had gym which was great for me to have access to 24 hours a day

I needed a hotel that was close to Stratford Station which took me less than 5 minutes to walk to. The hotel was clean, and the hotel reception staff were very polite and sweet. I was here on the business trip so it was handy to be able to walk to Westfield shopping centre in the evening as something to do. I would definitely return here.

Very clean, friendly staff. 10-15minute walk to Stratford station, so good access to the city.Perfect for a one nighter and easy to access if travelling by car, although you will need to find parking.

Overall it was a good experience, however the room was very small and there was no dresser. We were able to get extra hangers and the two closets did ultimately work for us. The large balcony/terrace was a nice bonus. The Westbridge Hotel was close to public transportation, but a little far from the city of London (sightseeing areas), it was about a 25 min train ride. Our stay here was pleasant, the restaurant food was very good; however this is a 'dry' hotel so they do not serve any alcohol. It you want a drink with your meal or in your room, they do allow you to bring your own. From this hotel to London Heathrow airport it took about an hour and 15 mins by taxi and cost 78 pounds ($101). You can get to the airport by train very easily 'IF' you are not dragging more that 1 suitcase per person. Cheers!

The bathroom needed a thorough cleaning and the breakfast food was nice if there was more variety and the gym was very good and the wii fi had no reception in the gym area It would be nice if the water pressure in the shower was stronger

My experience of the Westbridge Hotel was how utterly professional the Staff were, but still presented a warm and caring manner which flowed throughout the Hotel. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone requiring a relaxing break away from central London bustle

Excellent hotel and locationAmazing staff that attended to every question no matter how small or bigMade us feel as if we were the only ones staying thereLovely restaurant, food was very goodWish we stayed longerWill definitely stay again

I found this hotel clean and comfortable and good value. It is within a short distance of good transport links to all areas of london. The nearby shopping centre is great. I would recommend this hotel.

I have already given a 5 star rating and glowing review on Google and am happy to do so again as this hotel is exceptional value, I had a lovely balcony as well. The breakfast is an absolute banquet, I literally cannot fault anything, I had a great stay, thankyou to all the hotel and team I will definitely stop again and recommend.

Walking distantie from public transport to the center of London, easy to get to by car and good price for quality hotel if you look for a clean and nice hotel... the pillows are super and the breakfast

Great location to Stafford Westfield Shopping Centre and underground and rail to London . Walking distance to rail station and close by restaurants /cafes. There is a handy laundrette within ealking distance also at 42 West Ham Lane. Excellent room....very quiet and breakfast exceeded expectations. Loved the turkey rashers as bacon substitute.

i would say that the noise from road side was at times too much.Maybe windows need upgrading with sound proof.Also sometimes noise from people walking and talking in corridors.so i suggest llook into sound proofing.Also put some sports channels.

This review is for the restaurant only and is rather late, sorry! We had a lovely dinner here in December and opted for the festive menu. The dishes were presented beautifully, delicious ingredients and great service! Ivaylo looked after us, was attentive friendly and polite. Will be popping in again if passing :-)

The hotel is lovely, a real hidden gem. The staff were wonderfully friendly, and keep an eye out for the lounge as we stumbled across it by accident. We didn't have eat but we did have drinks in the lounge and the staff were fantastic and so helpful. The rooms are quite modern and very clean, perhaps a little smaller than I was expecting but served perfectly for all we needed.

Great stay for my husband’s birthday. Lovely breakfast with ample choice. Modern and clean bedroom. Pleasant staff. Great location for Stratford train station. Bring your own alcohol policy. Would definitely stay here again.

All the staff was extraordinary frienly and polite. Our room could have beern a little bit more spacious, but was well- eqipped and very clean. The food was rich and the hotel is tastefully- furnished. We felt very coy and will come back.

I stayed at this hotel two nights during a business trip. I chose this hotel because of the good reviews and I wasn't disappointed! The room was extremely clean, with a lot of amenities like kettle, fast wifi, room service and even a cell phone with internet that you could bring with you out of the hotel (super helpful for Google Maps). I really enjoyed the breakfast, many choices and also fresh fruit! The location wasn't a problem because Stratford station is near and there is direct tube connection with many lines.

This is a gem of a hotel, my room - suite actually - was large, clean and have everything you could ask for.The only thing I found strange, after a long day at work, was that they dont serve alchohol in the restaurant? You can take drink in with you, but unless you know this in advance then you woudlnt know to do this.I would stay here again, now that I know thisAlso ther eis no car park, and parking locally is expensive, even for London (£25 overnight)

This is a good hotel close to Westfield. It is well resourced and appointed. The facility is immaculately clean . However the room was on the small side and the twin beds were very narrow..There are many high quality additions in the rooms and the guests lounge is luxurious and comfortable. The staff are very helpful and friendly

This is a very nice hotel to stay in. We spent 4 days there. Also had afternoon tea one day and it was very nice. Staff are really friendly and really look after you. Rooms are very nice and clean. Only a 7 minute walk to Westfield if you want to shop.

Wasn’t sure what we were going to walk into when we arrived in an unfamiliar part of London to stay here; both were pleasantly surprised. Absolutely lovely reception staff, rather large, clean & tidy room, close to the Stratford tube stop, easy to get to the O2 arena & around London. Decent price for staying over a weekend too!

Stayed in the Westbridge suite which was absolute luxury. The jacuzzi bath was fantastic and the room was large and very comfortable. Staff were very friendly. Breakfast was good only thing we didn’t like was the lack of sausages which didn’t appear the whole time we were there. Would recommend this hotel 100%

At first impression the hotel is really nice and well presented with efficient and friendly staff. The restaurant food is good although the menu is restrictive (especially formstays more than couple of days) and breakfast is turkey bacon not pork. The rooms although very modern lack space. The fancy electronic display air conditioning seems to make no difference what ever you set it too. I’ve stayed here for over a month so know this applies to all rooms. The biscuits in the room get replaced everyday but the water doesn’t, might do if you asked but shouldn’t have to. Some nice touches and great staff though. Would stay again and for the area is very well priced. Handy for rail links and the tube.

If you are visiting the Stratford area of London, visiting the Olympic Park, West Ham football club, Westfield Shopping Centre or just in that area, this hotel should be your first choice.Great rooms, amazing technology, wonderful breakfast and terrific staff.The hotel is close by the main Stratford station and close to the park and Westfield.Rooms come with a mobile smart phone for your use free of charge while your staying there, free calls and roaming. The room tv gives you access to multiple functions and the beds are really comfortable.I would recommend this hotel to everyone for a great stay, and value for money.Have a great stay.

Lovely hotel - great staff and a good breakfast, However room much smaller than expected with tiny wardrobe and very hot.! Shower not the best and washbasin with no plug (no overflow?) which meant my husband could not shave easily! Overall a nice place to say - perhaps opt for a larger room or suite. Nice, large lounge for guests and the staff did not disappoint.

I couldn't fault a single thing from our stay at the Westbridge. Very easy to find, great location just a few minutes walk from Stratford station. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were lovely and clean and comfortable. I will definitely be staying here next time I am in London!

Great little find, so convenient to London trains and also for exhibitions and conferences. the staff are amazing and the breakfast is perfect. I cannot fault the hotel at all. Theres a great little gym in the basement too.

Close and ideal for the orbit! Very clean. Hotel doesn’t have a bar. Good for a short stay. Hotel is on main road but in room didn’t hear any traffic! Ideal for Westfield centre! Book early to get there promo!

Great position near to a very big exchange node for underground, train and coach. Very cozy and clean room, good breakfast. Warm and kindness is part of the service. I will suggest to my colleagues for next trip to London.

My husband and I stayed in London for a few days and stayed at the Z hotel city. Our room was in the basement and it was a bit of a surprise when we saw the compact and window-less features of our room. But we adjusted easily and the complimentary wine and cheese every evening more than made up for it. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful to us. The rooms and building were very clean. We really loved the area the hotel was situated in and how close it was to the Temple metro station. Overall Z hotel city is a great find.

My husband and I booked to stay here due to it's proximity to a social event we were attending on a boat on the Thames. The room was smaller than expected (as advertised) however for a short stay that was not a problem. The cleanliness, the welcoming staff and the complimentary cheese and wine more then made up for the room size. Lovely big TV also.Would definitely book here again.

The Z Hotel is a fantastic hotel in a central location. The rooms are clean, accommodating and come with a range of facilities included such as tea/coffee, tv, toiletries and water. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are fitted with Air Conditioning. An added bonus is free wine and cheese in the evenings from 5pm to 8pm. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, I could not recommend this hotel more.

I spent one night here whilst I was a conference at the Law Society in Chancery Lane. The hotel was about 3 minutes walk. When I arrived I was to,d that they were upgrading my room to the accessible room I had requested. Room 19 was fabulous, lovely view of a Temple Church. Wonderful room with a great shower. Good mirror and hairdryer provided. The free cheese and wine was a lovely touch. I took the wine to my room and drank it while changing for a black tie dinner. I slept very well. I hadn’t paid for breakfast but went into the cafe attached to the hotel and was able to order what I wanted. The staff were absolutely superb. If I’m at a conference and need to stay in London I would definitely stay there again.

Booked through company for a week for me to work in The City.Based on Fleet Street, it was a pleasant 45m walk along the river, 20m walk to Covent Garden and St Paul's Cathedral.I was a bit worried about having a room without windows but, I was in the basement so understood the layout. Needn't have worried, Ron was well laid out with air conditioning. It also encourages you to head out.While there is a place to eat, you are in a cafe that will be frequented by commuters. I used it once but decided to use a cafe in the office campus I was working in. Just like the other hotel I stayed in the previous week, there are plenty of pubs.Check in and out was very efficient, staff always said hello. Room was clean, always fresh everyday. Very important, the glass pod shower room was fantastic.Very comfortable place to stay.Gripe? The lack of a decent desk to get that last hours work crammed in.

On arrival to the Z hotel staff were lovely polite & let us keep our cases there till we could check in . First impression lovely clean hotel Once checked into the room couldn’t believe how small it was. Three adults had to share this room . When you walked in the door bathroom was on the left bunk beds the right . No room to move about . The toilet door was frosted but you could see through it . My mom was not impressed . The steps to the top bunk were not the best & the bottom bunk we kept banging our heads on the top. We struggled to get ready for our west end show ! This room is one person two at the most . It was clean & had plenty of tea / coffee / hot choc but the room was a big dissertation a shame really has the hotel itself was in a great location & the free cheese & wine on the night was a lovely touch . The breakfast was a buffet style hot food toast & pastries .. was lovely . If your ok with being in each other’s faces & bearing all in the toilet ha ha then this is a good hotel not very good for more than 2 people & again the bathroom door could of been more frosted !
