Great from start to finish.easy booking.Arrived early but were able to leave bags.On return our bags had been taken to room and we had cheese and wine.Every member of staff was chatty and helpful.Room was clean and comfortable.We have stayed before and will be staying again.

My boyfriend and I have visited this specific Z hotel several times, I have also been with family. We were apprehensive to visit at first due to the size of the rooms, however, the hotel is so clean and tidy. Even though the rooms are very compact and quite small, they are all you really need when visiting London. The beds are amazingly comfortable. Having Sky TV is also a bonus! The location is perfect, when we visit here, everything for us is in walking distance, however the nearest tube is a very short walk away. So really location is perfect. The staff are always so welcoming and cannot do enough for you. Able to leave bags in storage upon check out if you are staying in London after checking out! Don't hesitate to book this hotel if you do not mind compact rooms, because you will not be disappointed! My boyfriend joined the Z member's and that offers deals, which make the price even more reasonable. We always stay here upon our visits to London! The ONLY thing if we were being picky would be the breakfast is quite expensive when there are cafe's down the road which are cheaper, but it is a lovely place to eat, and in the evenings they offer FREE cheese and wine which is always lovely!

When we arrived there was a fresh pitcher of complimentary ice tea to sip at while you’re checked in - which was very nice as it was very hot when we arrived. All the staff were so helpful and friendly and nothing was too much to ask. The rooms are on the small side but for a city break that’s all the room you need as you don’t spend much time there anyway! However, this doesn’t take away from the fact that the rooms are very stylishly decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The room was also equipped with a large flat screen tv (with sky and all the catch up channels), air conditioning, a water jug, a kettle and a variety of teas, coffees and hot chocolates to choose from. The free cheese and wine from 5-8 was amazing and we were there every night! They’re not at all stingy with wine and staff even come to the table to ask if you want a top up, and you can have as many helpings of cheese, bread, grapes and chutneys as you like. You can even take your wine to your room if you don’t want to drink it in the dining room. My only wish is that we were given more coat hangers as there was 4 coat hangers in a room so we only got 2 each - but apart from that I can’t fault it. We had an amazing stay and are looking forward to staying with them again.

Myself and 3 friends booked a family room for one night while in London to see a show. When we first walked in, we thought, OMG!! We will never fit!! BUT we did, and although it was a tight fit with cases etc, the beds were wonderfully large (bunk beds) room was spotless, free water, tea, coffee and toiletries. Large enough shower, staff very helpful and friendly! Offered the free cheese and wine but we had dinner booked already. Only pre warning I would give is if you are sharing a room, make sure you are all very close and not shy! The bathroom glass is pretty much see through enough that you can see whats going on! Luckily we were a close group of girlfriends so could laugh about it! :)

First stay at a Z Hotel, for business on a weekday in the City.Pros:Very comfy bed, big TV, excellent en suite and shower, staff very welcoming and helpful on front desk. My room had a second queen sized bed on a mezzanine over the floor level bed: could be fun for families for a one night novelty. Complementary wine and cheese 6-8pm is a good idea. It's a slightly bigger bedroom than Bloc Hotel, Birmingham - I haven't tried Premier Inn's Hub format yet, but am keen to.Cons:It's not the sort of bedroom you would want to spend much waking time in, particularly if there is more than one of you: if you want that sort of room, book a Premier Inn or other hotel with conventional larger rooms. Breakfast was in a cafe next door (run by Z Hotel) - not as good as PI, but still not bad.I will return for business trips.

Don’t be fooled by the photos. The rooms are the smallest I’ve ever seen in my life. The bathroom eats up half of the room (see attached photo). Can not express how small they are !!! They were clean and the beds comfy, but with 2 people staying in a room, we were climbing all over each other and no room to relax and enjoy.

My husband and I paid £60 for a room on a Sunday night which is AMAZING value for central London. Yes, the room was small but it was spotlessly clean and because it didn't have a window and was underground (level -1), we had a brilliant night's sleep with no disruption from sunlight or traffic noise. We also loved the complimentary wine and cheese from 6-8pm. We have enjoyed similar perks at hotels in America but they have never been as good as this. There were several cheeses to choose from as well as olives, bread and chocolate - and the staff kept coming round to top up our wine! I would definitely stay here - or indeed at any other Z Hotel - again in future.

In an ideal location for the Old Bailey area of London. Was quite surprised how they managed to fit a bed and shower/toilet in such a small room. Wouldnt want to stay more than one night though. Would say basic, but too small.

Convenient for those coming from Gatwick as it’s walking distance to Blackfriars station, one of the stations you can get a train to/from Gatwick. It’s also a great location with respect to taking Ubers. We found it more convenient/cheaper for us, being two people, to take an Uber from our hotel than to take the Tube, despite the close proximity to the underground.

We paid for a standard double with no window but we’re lucky enough to get a family room with two double beds stacked on top of each other, we didn’t need the extra bed but it was nice. Having sky tv was a really good addition! The room was just big enough for 2 and the shower was great and the room was clean and comfy. Complimentary coffees and tea was fabulous. Really central location and about 7 mins walk from temple, would definitely stay again for the night!

The only reason I have given this hotel 4 instead of 5 stars is due to the size of the room. The location was superb and considering how central this hotel is, it was incredibly quiet and I had a great night’s sleep! Sky TV was a great bonus as was the complimentary water and hot drinks. The room was spotless and a real luxury to have fluffy towels in the bathroom! By far the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in in London for business. The only downside is the size of the room and if you are claustrophobic this is not the hotel for you. However if you are looking for luxury at a reasonable price and just looking for somewhere to spend a couple of hours at the end of a long day then I thoroughly recommend! The staff were also extremely pleasant at the front desk.

I expected a small room but not so small that my feet touched the wall when i slept (I am only 6’ 3”). Very cramped - you could not get two people in this double room (317). Amenities good, great shower and toiletries but the TV did not work in the room. I mentioned the TV but it was not repaired for my second night’s stay - very disappointing. No compensation offered. The Hungarian lady in the Z cafe was superb - very helpful and delightful company. I wish the desk staff were as helpful and got the TV fixed. Assuming all the rooms are as small as 317, i will not be returning.

First and last visit - it tries to be like Citizen M hotels I.e small and chic cubicle rooms, but instead it is more like Stalag 17. I was put down in the basement - claustrophobic and gloomy. Does not have, drawers, wardrobes, Bath, biscuits, iron, laundry, safe, phone etc etc etc - I guess that it’s like ‘doing time’ at Ford Open Prison.All kinds of moaning and groaning from pipes, aircon etc, plus can hear the neighbours movie on their tv.Positives: nice staff, free wine (OK) and cheese (good), good location - these are the only reasons that I could consider giving a second star.I’m typing this at night, hoping that the neighbour’s movie will finish soon and that I might sleep. Torture!A Last Minute secret hotel will usually give you a Grange hotel for £50 less - better/proper hotels in decent locations. Over £200 for room and brekkie - not worth it!

Travelled to London for an overnight stay with my daughter and had a great trip! We knew from the start that the rooms were going to be small from the hotel's description (which would appear honest) and trip advisor reviews, but was intrigued by the concept and was not disappointed, we both absolutely loved it!!! The room was small but modern, loved how all the space was efficiently used, totally comfortable bed, wide screen TV on wall, clean and modern shower & toilet, tea/coffee facilities, heating/aircon and quiet room! Good shower and toiletries provided. Toilet/shower had glass screen/opaque glass doors, which whilst still provided modesty, may not appeal to everyone (depending how familiar you are). Wall hooks to hang clothes, under-bed storage for small cases (may struggle with larger luggage). Had every convenience associated with larger hotel rooms - just more compact. Check in and check out was quick and efficient. Loved the complimentary wine and cheese served between 5 - 8pm, which was a nice touch. We didn't book breakfast but just paid on the morning which was lovely and so reasonably priced. Lovely, friendly staff. Good location close to Covent Garden and many of the theatres. Overall, loved our stay and would definitely stay again. Thank you..

Great value. Clean and modern. Cost was good considering in the centre of London and it was 20th Dec. Our room was on the ground floor. Large with a walk in shower. Water pipe were a little noisy but all in all a bargain. Go for it.

Friendly, professional welcome at reception. The deco was modern and minimalist and the hotel felt quiet and calm. My room was a double, and the clever use of space in such a small room was impressive and interesting. Bed comfortable, everything very clean, tiny desk, massive tv. Unlike some other reviewers I liked the en suite's glass walls, it was private but didn't feel claustrophobic like some of the "plastic pods" can get. Nice and clean, powerful shower, fluffy white towels and not a hint of damp. Breakfast was ok, the dining room was interesting but the choice was a little limited. I was unlucky in that the salmon and boiled eggs I'd fancied from the menu weren't available. Unfortunately I didn't have a great night's sleep because I couldn't get the temperature warm enough without leaving the noisy air con/heater thing on all night. When I turned it off there was an icy blast still coming through.All-in-all I think that this was a very functional and comfortable stay for a business trip when you're not needing anything more than a base for showering and sleeping.

Stayed 1 night in a double non windowed room. Great very compact bathroom- shower very good.Bedroom was tiny every inch is used very well but there really isn't my inches! Sadly when turning all lights off there was still some sort of alarm led on ceiling that due to compact room and full bathroom wall being glass meant that the room was just too light to sleep properly Couldn't imagine sharing this room just not enough room to dress in the morning but for 1 night business fine of you travel light and have a good eye mask

Me and my mother stayed here for the 1 night as we were seeing a show in the West End. This hotel was well within walking distance and also a 10 min short walk to Covent Garden. The staff were exceptionally friendly and very welcoming. Rooms were a bit on the small side. But fine as we were basically only sleeping in it. Lovely comfortable bed and TV came with Sky. Comes with tea/coffee facilities. Amazing complementary cheese and wine was served between 5-8pm. Overall a lovely stay. Right in the heart of the city and very affordable.

Sunday night so cheap rate =£85. Very fast check in & was positively encouraged to have free cheese & wine which was a nice touch. Room was very small but really well thought through so felt larger. Wine & cheese was great quality & staff were just really friendly .Bed - fantastic sheets . Shower powerful & nice freebie shower gel . Sleep quality excellent as blackout blinds really blocked light & noise.Nice amenity tray with good coffee bags & hot chocolate sachets Check out was very speedy & they looked after my bag whilst I worked & again bag collection took seconds . Really great place especially if working in the Royal Courts of Justice but brilliantly central for tourists too. As with all London hotels the rates are higher mid week but this hotel ticks the boxes for giving a stress free stay ! Will definitely stay again when working in area . Thanks Z hotel for a great nights sleep ! Zzzzz

Excellent hotel on Fleet St close to everything. Small but comfortable rooms ideal for 1 or 2 nights. Staff are always helpful and cheerful. Excellent choice of breakfast. Free cheese and wine from 5pm - 8pm for residents. Will stay again

I stayed for 1 night in London...The Z hotel is a stay of luxury. All staff that we encountered were exceptionally polite and professional. The rooms are small - correct - but are perfectly designed to include everything that is necessary. The standard double room I stayed in is ideal for either 1 person or a couple (if you don’t mind being close with them).The bathroom was separated from the room with elegant, tinted sliding doors that gave a classy, modern feel. The shower was very impressive- black glass/tiles that made it seem brand new! The cleanliness of the room and bathroom was faultless. I personally cannot stand an unclean room, so for it to impress me was a plus! The appliances were all top quality and again seemingly brand new. A huge flatscreen was sunk into the wall directly in front of the bed, and was using sky so I was able to watch any programme (movies for me). Breakfast I payed for when I checked in and it was lovely! A wide range of hot and cold foods were set out in a buffet style for you to help yourself to. Luggage room proved useful the next day to save me and my friend dragging cases around the tubes! This was also free of charge! 24 hour reception is always a comforting addition especially as it was my first time staying in London!Will definitely be returning to a Z hotel.Thank you

Great 3 star hotel the Z hotel City in London. I will recomend this hotel and I will come back next time.Pro:- location- quiet- efficiently furnished- wifi- public transport nearby (10 min by the underground)- clean- coffee and tea facility in the room- big tv- bed and pillowsCon:- no window unless you pay more- small- information front desk not always clear

We were not expecting much as this is not a pricey hotel and is obviously small and meant for shorter trips. Traveled with a friend and reserved two rooms, the staff was great, very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are very small but this is be expected when reserving single rooms. Both of our rooms were very clean, well decorated, cozy and considering the small space were laid out quite well, plenty of storage and hanging space. We only stayed 3 nights so for short trips and traveling solo I would definitely recommend this hotel. The location was perfect and very accessible to all of the great sites in London. I will absolutely stay here again and have zero complaints.

My partner booked this hotel for us for a theatre weekend in London staying Friday 21st and Saturday 22nd September. First of all the location is great, it really is a base for you to explore, Covent garden and the theatres are literally a 10 minute walk away and with plenty to see along the way it's a nice little stroll. The tube is the same about a 10 minute walk and from here you are around 2 stops away from Tottenham Court Road and Oxford Street and with a simple change onto the Victoria Line you are at St Pancras very quickly if this is where you need to travel to/from. First impressions of the hotel were great, extremely clean, it smells amazing when you walk in that was one of the things we first picked up on! The check in staff were lovely and the process was quick and simple. I had obviously done my research into this hotel and it is very clear that this is a modern space spacing design. We had booked a room without a window which was perfect for us, but perhaps if you are claustrophobic it might not be the best idea! We stayed in room 615. Extremely clean, very cosy with the large TV equipped with all sky channels is fixed to the wall directly opposite the bed and we loved this. There isn't a lot of floor space, but again this is expected, if you hang your clothes on the hanging wall and store things down the side of the bathroom area, it's easily done if you are only staying a couple of nights.I have seen mentioned before the fact of the frosted glass bathroom area, I know from responses this is to create the illusion of more space, however if you are staying in these types of rooms, you need to be extremely close to your partner/friend/family member as you can see everything and hear everything and I really mean that, there is no privacy whatsoever. Luckily this wasn't an issue for me and my boyfriend but if you have only been together a short amount of time, it may be! The view of your companion sat on the toilet is literally a stones throw away as you relax on the bed. Rooms had a kettle, two large mugs, tea bags, coffee, hot chocolate sachets and sugar/sweeteners. I myself only drink decaf so the sachets of nescafe decaf coffee were a very welcome sight, however I really would like to see hotels introducing decaf tea bags as not many do.If I had to make a comment on anything that was slightly inconvenient, again I have already seen this mentioned, there is one single light that is a green colour and it is the only light that doesn't turn off, I personally am someone who likes complete darkness when I sleep and this is quite off putting as it's almost like having a TV still on in the middle of the night. Also although no fault of the hotel's i'm sure, on the Friday night, our first night stay I was awoken to the sound of someone forcefully trying to enter our room for a good 5 minutes before probably realising they'd got the wrong room number. As we had booked a room with no window we were on the very ground floor and you do get a lot of banging around from people walking around above quite early in the morning unfortunately. These small points where literally the only things that were ever so slightly inconvenient about the whole stay.The hotel umbrella's that were available to borrow were very welcome as this weekend was extremely wet and cold so this was a really useful feature. It was a shame that we didn't find the time to sample the free wine and cheese, but we will definitely be back at some point in the future to be able to do so.Little tip, the pub right next door is lovely for drinks and food. Nice atmosphere and really reasonably priced!

This has to be the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in, and yet that didn't matter. The space was designed to be incredibly functional, so it had a double bed, a small desk, some hanging space, and an en suite shower room, all packed into an area marginally larger than two double beds. Opening the door took up most of the available floor space, but the room was designed that way - and as it was just me and an overnight bag that wasn't a problem. I was more interested in a comfortable bed (yes), clean (yes), reasonably quiet (yes) and location (yes - right on Fleet Street).If you're in town for a short business stay, definitely book it. If you're here for longer on holiday, or travelling as a couple, the room I had might be a challenge, but worth checking whether they have anything bigger available.

Yet another Z hotel stay for us, a mixture of business and pleasure. The welcome was, add always friendly and professional, the room, as always clean, comfortable and compact. Our first evening we had a most constructive business meeting, ideas boosted by free flowing wine, and our thoughts assisted by the wonderful staff helping with ideas (nothing better than a fresh pair of eyes or three to find new angles)... Probably the most useful meeting we've had! Thank you to Mateus, Dora and the lovely blonde lass who's name escapes me (too much wine?). Hope to be back again soon, you guys really made our stay fabulous. Thank you.

This hotel is very centrally located. The queen room we booked was beyond tiny. Access to only one side of the bed. No shelves, luggage space or room to move. Very modern. Staff are exceptional. Breakfast for £9.95 was not worth it ... take a walk up the road to the theater district for a full English breakfast for 2 for £12.

Okay, it is a small room but everything else was good. No point moaning about the size of the room when you know that when you book it! The shower was good, large enough and plenty of hot water, big tv with free sky, bed was large and comfy, bit tight to get round and hang up your clothes, location was perfect for the shows and that is what we wanted, another good point was the ‘free’ unlimited wine and cheese from 5-8 pm, bargain you can top up before going out! The breakfast was under £10 each, not bad but more continental than good old fashioned full English, staff were very helpful and friendly, I would say it’s a convenient bed for the night, maybe 2 but probably would stay here a week...

This hotel was very clean with new amenities. The room was very small but we did not spend that much time inside the hotel. Great location and helpful staff. They assisted me with figuring out the best public transport to the airport. Wine and cheese in the afternoon was delicious and a great bonus.

The cost of my single room was £110 for the night including breakfast. Given the incredibly central location, I felt this was very reasonable. The room was extremely clean and quiet, with a comfortable bed and nice touches (a bottle of water in the room, some toiletries, etc). It was incredibly small but absolutely fine for what I needed (and was advertised as such), and had effective air con. Customer service was very good, and I was given a complimentary glass of wine which was an unexpected bonus! They were happy to store my suitcase for the day once I'd checked out, too. The breakfast was fine - quite tasty scrambled eggs - though I hadn't realised it was essentially in a cafe that's open to the public, which meant it was rather busy. I would definitely stay there again if I needed to be in that location and it was still the best deal on offer at the time.

This hotel has a fantastic location for Covent Garden, the City and the Aldwych and is opposite The Royal Courts of Justice, and backs onto The Middle Temple (our room overlooked The Middle Temple and The Temple Church).The reception was friendly and helpful, the room (we were given a free upgrade) was large and comfortable with no unnecessary frills. The en-suite was really well designed and equipped.Every member of staff we met was smiling and greeted us.Most people who visit London for short breaks couldn't care whether the hotel has a chintz-covered armchair. They just want a great shower/bath and a comfortable bed. This hotel certainlyprovides those essentials, and to a high standard.

My mother and I stayed at the Z for 3 nights in July 2018. First and foremost, the entire staff was, by far, the best I have ever encountered in all my hotel stays. Helpful, polite, always smiling and quick on their feet to carry out visitors' requests. Alessandra in particular (an Italian native) went out of her way to make restaurant and tea room reservations for us. Another unexpected perk was the complimentary wine and cheese offered every night in the cafe connected to the hotel. The selection of cheeses were varied and the choices of wines exceeded our expectations. The hotel is centrally located...a stone's throw away from trendy Soho, a 15 minute walk from Trafalgar Square, a 2-minute walk from the river Thames and Temple Station, 20-minute walk from St-Paul's Cathedral, etc THANK YOU FOR THE MOST ENJOYABLE STAY! We'll be back :)

The only thing that really commends this hotel is where it is, assuming that you have business in that area. The room was not small - it was tiny. It was spotlessly clean but did not have an available drawer or even a shelf (other than in the bathroom) to put anything, and the 'wardrobe' consisted of a series of hooks on the wall. The 'desk' was about the size of a chopping board, taken up largely by a kettle/coffee tray. The bed was comfortable, the aircon efficient and the roll-down blinds effective. The aircon, however, 'spits out' its accumulated condensation regularly (about every 15 mins) with a nosy pump into the loo cistern. At first I though that my neighbor must have been suffering from incontinence, but it was the aircon...all night. The staff are brilliant, and the in-house café has reasonable breakfast and a very pleasant cheese and wine buffet in the early evenings. It is by no means cheap - over 550 quid for three nights - but is less expensive than its immediately adjacent competitor Apex Serjeant's Inn (where the rooms are infinitely better).Not somewhere I would chose to stay again, and certainly not a place for a family.

Great hotel , super clean and has friendly staff. We stayed just for the one night but it was an amazing stay. massive tv at the end of a good size bed and a super modern bathroom. The room is small but its set out really well. And a lil bonus was that we had complimentry cheese and wine in the resturant :D

This hotel should feature on George Clark’s amazing spaces our room was approx 12 x 7 and in that was a double bed that you had to scramble over each other ,coat hangers on a wall and a see through shower and toilet screen , we were unable to unpack also no room for suitcase storage we only stayed 1 night thank god , Staff were great and free chessboard and wine was a plus but no way would we return also they put us on the 5th floor so you have to carry your cases up 2 flights .

Had a good overnight stay in one of the small windowless rooms. Very comfortable. Excellent shower. Everything you might need. Had a drink in their bar before retiring. Paying seemed to be over complicated and took quite a while.Wonderful location.

Z Hotel has everything you need for a short stay. Small well designed capsule rooms with all amenities you need: quality bed linen and towels, toiletries, hair dryer, sky tv and catch up channels, tea and coffee, black out blinds, all for superb value. Surprise treat was the early evening offering of free cheese and wine in the bar. Will definitely be back.

Very swish, small rooms - ideal for a city centre stay. Great location not far from St Paul's Cathedral and within a few minutes' walk of 4 tube stations. Staff excellent - printed off a rail ticket for me which I had forgotten to do and put it under my door, even though they were very busy. Free cheese and wine looked good but i couldn't partake as i had a dinner to go to. .

We had a night here in June 2018. All communication before our stay was excellent and we dropped our bags off early. The staff we fantastic, helpful and friendly. We checked in on time, and the room was as expected. Very small, but modern, perfectly clean and just what we needed and what we expected. What more can you ask for at this price. It was an excellent stay

The staff was very helpful and the hotel and restaurant are very clean. Room did not have a wardrobe so we had to leave everything in the luggage during our stay. Rooms are quite compact, not much space to move around but we had everything we needed for our stay since we were out for most of the dayThe location is very central so not a problem to travel and visit other areas with the bus stop right in front the hotel. The area is busy during the week but very quiet during the weekend

One can only imagine that the original ocean-liners had sweet staterooms like the Z Hotel room I stayed in. Absolultely perfect fit for me--in the spirit of the TINY HOUSE or the berth on a railcar--but more spacious...Think Bento Box, only comfy bed, perfect shower, hot-pot and enormous TV screen! Only wish the screen had a port so I could attach my laptop and watch my favorite streaming...

First time staying in your hotel would total recommend it to all my family and friends. Fab service staff very polite and friendly, room was comfy bed amazing! Towel and toiletries were provided! Breakfast was value for money and could not fault the breakfast you offered with drinks

This is definitely a place for a short stay. Very small rooms but comfortable bed. I had one of the larger rooms apparently and I still felt like the TV was nearly as big as the floor space. However if you want a bed for a night it works. Relatively cheaper than most in the area but definitely not a budget price.

Stayed one night ahead of a business conference. Room was tiny but good for what I wanted. Very clean, double bed , great shower room. Located on Fleet Street so great for exploring if you are visiting. Close to temple station and not far to walk to Covent Garden, Holborn areas also St. Paul’s in the opposite direction. Breakfast served in the cafe . Limited choice but good for what they offer e.g porridge, scrambled eggs, bacon toast, yoghurt, croissants plus more. Would stay again

Spread out across several properties on the same street, the rooms are v=everything you need as a traveler and nothing more. Minimal, practical and clean. Do not go with five suitcases, though. Ask for a big room, because if not, the small ones are for solo travelers. Great wine treats / happy hour at five in the breakfast room. Very hip and chosen by the Mad Men crowd. Close to public transportation. Walking distance to great Chinese restaurants, Oxford str. Etc.

I know it's Fleet Street but £210 for an 8ft square room with no windows and no breakfast seems a bit less than good value. I seem to remember Easyjet hotels in London being a similar size but they were £10 a night. The walls hug the bed on 3 sides. The floor space that isn't bed is as long as the bed and as wide as the door, so it can open. The bin is under the bed and the kettle would touch your face if you were in bed. But my actual gripe is that there's a green night light over the door so the entire room is bathed in green light all night. The TV is over the bed and set into the wall so you can't turn it off. The red sleep light has to stay on all night 7ft from your face. All the electronic lights do not make for easy sleeping, although if you're afraid of the dark I suppose it might be a plus. There is a free gift, a cloth mouse mat with a map of London design if anybody still uses mouse mats and There is a 3 hour period every night where they provide unlimited free wine and cheese but wasted on me as I don't drink wine. I'd rather have a cheaper room. Or breakfast instead! I wouldn't stay here again unless it was proper cheap. The staff, however deserve real credit. They are friendly and helpful.

The absolute smallest room I have ever been in, literally 8ft x 13ft & that included wall to wall double bed, full shower cubicle, basin & toilet. Wardrobe were pegs on the wall behind the door. All very new & clean, food hall facilities looked fine but we ate out. A very expensive shoe box to sleep in for two nights, but London is in a world of its own.

Great find on Fleet Street and ideal location for overnight stay in London on business. Rooms are compact but very clean and well serviced and the level of service afforded by all staff is excellent. Friendly greetings from Reception staff both at check in and upon departure and the service from staff in the cafe area is excellent. A special mention for Agnes who looks after her customers with a winning smile! She is very efficient and couples that with her relaxed but professional manner.

Great location, clean and spacious room, excellent staff and most importantly quiet so we had a good nights sleep. Breakfast was good and the bar prices were fair, hotel is within two minutes of the tube so ticks all the boxes

I was hoping for a good experience from the reviews but this is the best Travelodge I have stayed at. Minutes from Aldgate Tube and in a quiet traffic free street (amazing for London). Rooms were clean and functional with a great aircon system and very quiet with lots of sockets etc. Only tiny negative was the layout of the bathroom was tight between toilet and sink but a minor issue. Nice airy bar and restaurant area and the food, although pre-prepared was hot, tasty and served with a smile and there were plenty of staff on hand. That brings me to the final point. the staff were smiley, welcoming and helpful from the time I checked in until I left after breakfast. A good breakfast at that. Cant single any out but I stayed on the night of 10 July and they were all great. It isnt always that way. Would I stay again- yes my hotel of choice when in London on my works budget

Great location 4minutes from Aldgate underground.Fabulous self service breakfast.Comfy rooms .Shower was excellent. Tea & coffee facilities provided only negative no hairdryer in room.Helpful reception staff.

Polite staff with quick check in. Family room was big (119) but the bathroom is tiny. Not a great view of a block of residential flats opposite! No iron or ironing board, so had to go down to collect them myself. Good location for Aldgate tube station. Breakfast was fine.

Generally a good hotel facility. Neat and clean room. No in-room phone. A bit of a distance to get into the London City Centre (Trafalgar Square, Covent Gardens. Used Uber for the first time for local transportation. Liked the nearby restaurant. Not far to pubs in the area. One simple dinner in the hotel restaurant was fine. Stayed a total of four nights. My only reservation would be the proximity to the City "hub", but otherwise reasonably priced. Stayed as a solo traveler.

Friendly staff clean and modern hotel very nice breakfast and stores luggage for free Rooms are very modern a very nice shower the only thing I didn’t like was being able to see out of the window as they was a frozing film on our room ( family room ) but over all great stay and hotel is very easy to get too

The hotel in excellent condition with very good location. Staff and services are really good. Recommended for stay at reasonable prices. Hotel seems like new with air conditioning and large rooms.....

Travelled to London and stayed in this hotel great location very close to tube station. Very clean and rooms have everything you could want. Very Handy if you are flying from stansted. Highly recommend !!

Checked in today, single male has been given a twin disabled room. Requested for the room to be changed as clearly i do not have special needs and the room is not suitable for me. Being told that they are fully booked without checking booking information on the computer.... the manager was equally unhelpful as the front desk staff. manager just came and repeated the same story of being fully booked without checking any booking information ... never staying in Travelodge again...completely spoilt the visit/stay.

The hotel is very new, shower very good, comfortable bed. Good tea/coffee facilities in the room. Very comfortable and pleasant hotel. Two subway stations and buses stations nearby. I haven´t tried the breakfast. Wifi is charged separatedly.

This is a new(ish) Travelodge located near the financial part of London, and very near the Aldgate and Aldgate East tube stations. It is what you would expect from a Travelodge hotel, clean, a bit basic, but perfectly adequate. I stayed with nights and was more than happy with my room. It was a cosy room and while fine for a couple, it might feel a bit cramped after a while. Some points to note: while there is basic coffee/tea making facilities, there is no fridge so nowhere to store food. This means you pretty much need to eat out. Secondly, there are no laundry facilities so you will probably need to use a local laundromat/laundry or dry cleaner. There is also no safe deposit facility in the room but that isn’t an issue these days with card-only access to rooms.I liked that you had to explicitly say you wanted your room serviced by leaving a sign on your door. If you don’t, then your room isn’t serviced.There is a local restaurant where I had breakfast most days. Pretty cafeteria-like, and there are nicer places around to have breakfast to be honest.There is paid-Wifi for more than 30 minutes. Only two devices though are allowed on the same paid access.I booked well in advance and got a good price - about GBP120 a night from memory, which is great by London standards.Near to two tube stations so very handy. Takes about 20 minutes to get into say Oxford Street.You don’t stay in a Travelodge for style, but this is a very comfortable place to stay for a reasonable price near major transport routes.

In the heart of London’s east end, a couple of Underground stops from city centre with 2 underground stations on the doorstep of the hotel, great place to stay if you fancy a curry at the famous Brick Lane

We stayed at London City Travelodge for one night during a recent trip to London. The room was very clean and tidy, and was perfectly suitable for a short sight-seeing trip.We have previously stayed at the Travelodge in Covent Garden. To compare the two, we would choose the London City branch for future visits. Although the room and bathroom were smaller, the main advantage is that we were able to store our luggage before check-in and after check-out, which we weren't able to do at Covent Garden and was a huge inconvenience. The London City hotel is very close to Aldgate tube station, so it's easy enough to get around and is in a nice, quiet area.The cons of this hotel are that there is not a lot of storage space (which was fine for us, as we were only staying one night), but there is no wardrobe - just a few hangers on a rail. The bathroom is also small and basic-looking, and the breakfast price is far too high, but it's easy enough to head over to the nearby Pret-a-Manger or EAT instead.For a cheaper hotel for a short break, we'd recommend. Comfy, clean and easily accessible.

Very good value hotel Clean and modern rooms. Friendly staff on reception. Quick and easy check in. We didn’t use The bar area or restaurant as we went out ... but it looked busy and seemed very good value from the offers on show. We asked staff for more towels and were given them straight away. No problems. Aldgate East tube station is about a two-five minute walk away from the hotel, depending on what entrance you use... I think there’s at least 3 entrances to the station! The only thing that could be improved is maybe providing a bath mat or a smaller towel for people to stand on when they get out the shower. Also there is no mirror in front of the dressing table. Only very small issues and nothing major ....I Would definitely stay again if the price stays at a reasonable rate.

This is basic accommodation but it has everything you need, it’s clean, fresh, comfortable, welcoming and the staff are very helpful. The room was quiet - I didn’t even hear the traffic. As a woman travelling alone I felt very safe and comfortable. I’ll use this hotel again.

Came here at a weekend to crash after a gig. Clean, comfortable and very reasonable for London prices. We paid £10 to check in early. Only issue was that they only set the room up for one person... one towel one mug... bit frustrating in the morning. Great location for tubes to wherever you want to be.

A great place to stay, breakfast was excellent and well worth the money, room were spotlessly clean and staff very friendly and helpful! Plus only 2 mins from the Tube so getting around was London was easy!

My entire experience at London City Travel Lodge could not have been improved upon. Every single member of staff were courteous, friendly and welcoming. London sometimes has a reputation for rudeness but this was certainly not the case in my experience at this Travel Lodge; reception, security, bar, kitchen, waiting staff were ALL lovely. The hotel itself was scrupulously clean, as was my room which was so welcome after a particularly unpleasant trip up to London. The toilet and shower were almost sterile looking - and no hairs left in the plug holes!! I have no hesitation recommending this hotel and plan to return myself soon!

A bit impersonal but a great stay. Very nice rooms and comfortable bed. Keep your key you will need it to get into the hotel etc. Good location if you have a meeting in the city. Close to underground.

Situated just a couple of minutes from two tube stations, this new hotel is in a quiet location. The room was excellent with aircon which was needed as it was a very hot day in London. Brick Lane is about a 10 minute walk away so plenty to do without going too far.

Very helpful staff clean and comfortable room location was ideal for our visit breakfast was good (self service) nice and fresh with plenty of tea and coffee has a restaurant and bar. Would recommend this travelodge to friends thanks to all the staff

Good clean hotel with handy room facilities: iron and board, coffee machine and ultra quiet air conditioning. Friendly efficient staff. Bed not as comfy as expected but overall excellent value for money.

The double room is not big but it's expected for a hotel in London. The big star for this hotel (in my opinion) is its location. Just 2 minutes away from Aldgate station and 5 minutes from Aldgate East station by foot. It's a 10 minute walk to Liverpool Street station which isn't bad at all either. Spitalfields and Brick Lane markets are not far away from the hotel. I took a 30 minute walk to Columbia Road Flower Market on Sunday morning - certainly helped to have lovely weather for that. I would come back to this hotel on my next visit to London.

We've stayed here several times. The rooms are always clean and fresh - staff always very happy and helpful. 10 mins max walk from Liverpool Street - 2 mins from Aldgate tube - 10 mins from SkyGarden, 15 minutes walk from the Tower - excellent location - excellent hotel. This is the only Travel Lodge I would stay at in the city - several others we have tried need improvement!

It is a relatively new Travelodge with a bar/cafe and my room was a good size. On the fourth floor it was quiet. Aldgate tube station is very near, and Aldgate East not much further. It was excellent value for money and is the better of the two Travelodges in this locality. I thought for a moment the room had aircon, but it only heats and does not cool.

Perfect for families to visit London, especially if you arrive from the Stansted Airport. You can go on foot from Liverpool Station.Very easy acces to public transport: Several Buses and Metro Station Algate Practically new hotel with extremely confortable beds and pillows to rest after a day of sightseeing.The breakfast is adequate with eveything you need to start the day and the personal is very friendly, always ready to help you.

The hotel is actually new and in mint condition. Reasonable room size and awesome location for tourists. 10 min walk to Tower of London ..3 min to aldegate and aldegate tube station. Breakfast is value deal and filling enough...worth a stay. A lot of eateries in proximity in case you wish to grab a different food

My partner and I stayed for 2 nights as we were attending a concert. The hotel is very modern and the room size was good. Easy access to the tube as Aldgate station is an approximate 2 minute walk. A large hotel with lots of guests but was quiet and we were not disturbed. We stayed in one of the ‘super rooms’ and were overall really pleased - great that there was an iron and hairdryer in the room!

We booked a Family Room, which was great with 2 kids. And the free breakfast for kids is a good extra as they are "no big breakfast eaters". Location of the hotel close to 2 Underground Stations is perfect. Bus connections and walking distance to the Tower very good.

Stayed here for 4 nights with two small children. Good location and 2 minute walk from Aldgate station. Room was compact but functional with two sturdy fold out beds for my kids. More and better coffee in the room would have been nice. Room was clean but rubbish was found under the double bed by my four year old. Bathroom was clean and functional but needed focus to mountain climb in and out of the shower over the bath. Breakfast was plentiful and good quality and the dinner menu was satisfactory. Staff were pleasant and helpful. I would go here again.

perhaps we are easily pleased but our hotel stay on our recent trip to London was great, staff are always super friendly and very helpful, rooms kept clean and smelled fresh, air con a deciding factor to book this particular hotel, the hotel was well located around the corner from Aldgate station and a 10 minute stroll from Liverpool st station, we used to pay a lot for 4 and 5 star hotels until we realised we only slept in the rooms and were out and about all day and into the evening, what's the point of a luxury hotel?

Very clean, quiet, modern, building, with new fornitures.Very confortable beds. Spacious bath, new and clean.Perfect positionIf you arrive in weekend at late night you can get piccadilly line til liverpool station.Ecxelent value for money, expecially if you travel with childrenWe havn’ t try breakfast, but We’ll do it the next time!

this hotel is very good, great position and very calm. the staff easy. the room clean and very comfortable, very good breakfast. i'll return for sure. it was a surprise to discover this great place. raccomended

Ali and Mike were absolutely fabulous! We had trouble finding the hotel and when we finally arrived just after midnight, they couldn’t have been more helpful. They advised us of the best place to park the car and truly couldn’t have been more obliging. After a brief nights sleep we came down for breakfast to find them still on duty and still smiling! All the staff were friendly and polite but Ali and Mike arena absolute credit to the hotel.

We stayed here for one night on a recent trip to London as we were going to see a show at the Globe. We checked in through self service as reception was busy. This was fast and efficient and we were in room 8. This was on the ground floor and was surprisingly quiet. The room was fresh and modern and the bathroom was very clean. We opted for breakfast on the Sunday morning. I can honestly say it was the best Travelodge breakfast. The coffee was hot with a very good flavour. The buffet had a good selection and was well maintained. Very tasty sausages. There were 3 members of staff cleaning table who were attentive and friendly!! I would definitely recommend this Travelodge for a few nights in London.

The accommodation, staff, location, breakfast were all praiseworthy. The evening meal let these down, as first the wrong meal was delivered, and when the correct one arrived, it still took long wait for the side to appear.

Clean, comfortable, tasty British breakfast, location near Tower Bridge/Tower of London (10 min. walk), good service, friendly staff, quiet at night, uncomplicated check in + out, near Liverpool Station (5 min walk, busses to Stansted Airport), all twin rooms are accessible by wheelchair, free coffee and tea all time,

The Room Was Not As Big most Other Travelodge I have stayed, It was neat and clean.. I CALLED The room was small but comfortable. There was nothing outstanding about the staff on duty that day, However, I had no problem checking in. It was a clean, quiet and perfect place for me that day. It was not noisy considering the location

Good central location, good value, very nice and clean. I didn't have the breakfast so can't comment on that. I appreciated the 12pm checkout as lots of places are 11am. I would definitely stay again if I needed a night in a budget hotel in London city.

Only complain is no free internet and there are some rough streets around the hotel but everything else was just fine. Clean room, opt-in housekeeping, new bathroom facilities, breakfast ok, staff/service just fine. Absolutely ok hotel.
Good simple location, good price, clean and friendly stuffGood breakfeast, could be a little bit more of bread joice. Good cappucinoWe liked the hotel.Very clean room, good service, verynice stuff.

The whole experience from start to finish was a pleasure. The staff were welcoming and attentive, the room was ideal and the cost of the stay represented good value for money, The hotel is in a good location, just a relatively short walk from two Underground stations (Aldgate and Aldgate East) and not too far from Liverpool Street either.

I stayed at the London City Travelodge last night and had a really good stay. I seemed to get upgraded to a 'Super' room which was large, with a big comfy bed and all mod cons (hair dryer, coffee machine, air con). I slept really well and liked that the check out was 12noon. Recommend, especially for those in London on business.

The hotel was new, clean and staff were very professional. The room was lovely, spacious and bright and fully equipped with all the essential amenities. A great shower room, with space to move! Air con was modern and fairly quiet

Great position and Staff but awful wifi policy: you have to pay your wifi access and even though you can connect only 2 devises during all the stay (in our case we were 4 poeple with a family room .. but only 2 os us can connect).

Really nice hotel. Rooms clean and tidy. Comfy beds and good size bathroom. Friendly staff. Good selection of food for breakfast. Right near a tube station so easy to get around. Nice location with a good selection of restaurants nearby.

Somehow, I managed to get a Friday night, super room here for £62 which is astonishingly cheap for Central London so my expectations were not high! However, I was so pleasantly surprised! Staff were friendly and helpful, although small, the room was spotlessly clean and well equipped and it was exceptionally quiet. A couple of minutes walk from the Tube at Aldgate and not too far to stroll up to Spitalfields market and beyond into Hoxton so plenty of places to eat, drink and shop nearby.We didn’t sample the restaurant at all but it looked new and nicely done. Highly recommended if you can get a good weekend deal.

My husband and I were in London with my brother and father to celebrate my dads 80th birthday. We had lost our mom the previous fall and this trip was to reconnect with relatives and some of my dads old friends from the UK. From the time we arrived our experience was top notch. The room my husband and I had was the super saver and was small as expected but we asked if anything was available a bit larger and they gave us an accessible room which is much larger. The room was spotless and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The location could not be any better as it is a 2 minute walk from two different tube stations. There are also plenty of dining options within a 5 minute walk.My dad and brother were meeting us 2 days after us so after telling the host at the front desk our story she offered to decorate their room upon their arrival! I hope I am giving her the credit she deserves as I thought her name was Yasmet but the card she gave me said Sultana, perhaps this is her last name. Also Bagi who was the head of housekeeping helped and the result was incredible. They had specifically purchased 80’s decorations with confetti, balloons and banners and a nice bottle of wine with glasses for their arrival. Talk about 5 star service!We cannot express our thanks enough and highly recommend this hotel. Obviously the service surpassed any expectations but it is also a fantastic value for the rate.

Clean budget hotel.Some rooms have no view of street but a bonus if you like it quiet. Found internally the rooms were well insulated for noise too.Aldgate station (Circle Line) is really close. You could walk to many London landmarks really easily.

I wasn't expecting much from a hotel at this price range but was very surprised. It felt new and was clean and the staff was helpful. Also good communications from Aldgate, Aldgate East and Liverpool Street Station. Would recommend to anyone.

This hotel was in a great location, plenty of bars and restaurants in the area and just around the corner from the tube station. It was spotlessly clean, although it is new. The staff were friendly and helpful ( apart from the lady cleaning the restaurant at breakfast, must be a stressful job? ). The breakfast was good, lots of choice but the coffee machines are slow and only one was in use both mornings we were there.

Hotel was lovely, room was absolutely spotless and hotel too. All staff were helpful & happy especially Emma, Tyrone, Sergio and Kamila. Breakfast was good, location was ideal for what we needed with tubes near by - we definitely will stay again. :)

Great hotel clean comfy friendly wouldn’t stay anywhere else ! Been to many in London this is now my number one choice breakfast great and well worth the money good selection to choose from self service

We wanted to stay centrally located near Carnaby Street, but affordable. It was one major street over and close to the tube station. First off, great staff and clean rooms. But compared to an American hotel, it was small. You really don’t have anywhere to do anything but sleep and have your suitcase closed if you want to walk to the bathroom. But, they have a bottle of water and daily reception which was very nice. For the price and convenience, I would stay again.

Stayed here with my husband for 3 nights while seeing a show and shopping , it's ideally placed for shop's , food ect and generally getting out and about , we was greeted warmly and booked in quickly , the room though small was absolutely spotless and contained everything we needed , there's no wardrobe but it does have 4 pegs with hangers and if you don't mind living out of you bag for a few days this is ideal , let's face it your not in London to sit in your room all day so does size really matter ? , the room had tea , coffee , hot chocolate ect and there was also a cafe which you could go to for snacks ect , they do cheese and wine tasting between 5 and 8 but we was always out so never attended , we also didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that either , if I had to be picky the only thing I could complain about was that we was in a disabled room and in a morning housekeeping piled the sheets / towels ect up outside our door so is I had of been in a wheelchair I would of struggled to get out , all in all great place and next time we visit London we shall be staying here again

This hotel is amazing. The room is little small. But the service is so good, the workers are very nice and they ready to help you with everything. The best thing is the cheese and wine that serve for free at 17:00-19:00 . The hotel located near everything: soho, Oxford street and more . So I’m recommend to go

Pros:Location, clean, staff, large TV screen.Cons:Cheap room (still 220£ a night - and when I checked out I was told the price for that day went up to 350£).If you can sleep in a tiny room with no window and feel like being enclosed in a box, then you're fine.If you can sleep with a strong green led from the fire alarm from the roof that is lighting the room, then you are fine too.Otherwise, run away.

Had a meeting in Wardour Street the following morning and didn’t fancy a morning rush hour trip on the tube, so looked for somewhere more central. Was surprised to get a night in this place for £155 which in Central London is reasonable compared to other places nearby. Having said that it’s still a rip-off compared to the rest of the UK. Hotel is a modern office block conversation right in the bustling heart of Soho, and very handy for west end theatres etc. Modern well equipped room in a boutique style. Friendly front of house staff, and spotlessly clean. Would recommend to anyone looking for a night up West.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel during our time in London. The hotel is strategically located in Central London (Zone 1) and making it extremely easy to navigate around all touristy sites and of course, convenient to shop around Oxford and Regent Streets. The closest tube station is Oxford Circus (Central Line) (not more than 10 mins by foot). There’s also yummy snacks and wines for all guests from 5-8pm daily on the 1st floor. Be sure to be there early to get a table as it gets packed quite easily. The hotel room is compact in size and hence, we were required to go minimal and compartmentalised our items and luggages during our stay.

Fantastic staff - couldn’t have stayed anywhere better for the money. Yes the rooms are small but perfectly formed!Birthday card and gift of chocolates were a lovely touch - will be back! Thank youGreat tea & coffee making facilities and very clean!Bed was one of the most comfortable I’ve slept in.

Amazing hotel! So close to everything! You can walk anywhere. Close to Oxford Street and to the center.The staff is amazing, especially anna and larissaThey serve cheese and wine every evening Very clean hotel Yes, the room are a bit small but it is not a problem at all Thank you! I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know

Stayed here following a business meeting. Rooms compact. Very clean. Beds are firm (a big plus for me) . Modular compact bathroom. Breakfasts brilliant good choice of cereals and nice bacon sandwich. Staff really polite.

A nice modern hotel in centre of London BUT the room was so small that it was uncomfortable and inconvenient. We are not overweight but two fairly tall middle aged travellers. The room was so small that it was only possible to get in and out of bed on one side. There was no chair to sit on and when one of us wanted to get dressed or go to the bathroom, the other had to sit on the bed to get out of the way. Never ever had such a small room - designed for dwarfs ! Would not return as it cost the same as hotels with much larger rooms.

I have stayed in four of The Z hotels in London (Soho, Piccadilly, Covent Garden & Tottenham Court Road. All of them are very good, but this one is my particular favourite. The hotel is very close to Soho, so the location the perfect location.The staff are excellent, both friendly and helpful. The rooms are small, but modern, with a good shower room and large TV. Breakfast is good value, and the free cheese and wine in the evenings is a very nice addition. I am always happy to return

Although staff is nice, breakfast is very good and location is excellent, this is probably the smallest room I've been in all my life.Enough room only for a bed and a very small bathroom with shower, that's all.

We were able to check-in early and found check-in and out to both be quick and easy. The room itself was quite tight with the bed taking up the full end wall. The TV had a large range of channels available and the room had an easy access wall control for the lights, blinds and air-con/heater. The bed was comfortable and the staff switched the pillows from feathers for us too. It's one of the better run hotels we've stayed at in London.

Was a bit underwhelmed by the tremendously small rooms (you can literally reach to touch the toilet while still lying in bed), windows can't be opened so overall room felt claustrophobic, also note there's no closet or drawers. BUT still very clean rooms and a big plasma screen. Complimentary wine & cheese every evening on 1st floor and very kind and helpful staff make up for room size issue.

Location is great - 3 mins for Oxford St/Carnaby St/ Soho/Regent St. Lots of gentrification of this part of Soho. NB: It isn't on Tottenham Court Rd - its on Poland St closest tube Oxford Circus. Only a 10 min walk to Tottenham Court Rd though (if that) and Leicester Square/Covent Garden. Very central for everything.Friendly & helpful team, check in easy and very pleasant and helpful staff. There's a cheese & wine hour each night which was a nice touch, good food and good wine (very drinkable!!) Room was designed well, good quality linens, clean, compact but very well presented and added extra touches in room - drinks, cotton wool, buds, shower gel etc which you don't get with budget hotels normally. Felt safe too (stayed alone although friends were staying in another room/floor.)The price was amazing. I hope I get to stay again and it doesn't get booked out!

Really lovely room, I was only staying for one night which was a shame as the room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. Friendly staff 24 hours, easy to access and find. Definitely would stay again!

We stayed in this hotel for two nights. I have to say that we really enjoyed our trip but there were some shortcomings.Positive aspects: complimentary cheese and wine every evening from 5 pm (also coffee, tea and water in the room is free) friendly staff, small but practical room with high-tech facilities and last but not least very close to Oxford street and other attractions in London. Negative aspects: late check-in from 3 pm, the breakfast room is too small to get everyone seated, they forgot to clean our room even though our door hanger was hanging. When we came back in our room the next evening, we informed the girl at the reception and she assured that someone would bring towels, soap and water but actually nobody came. Upon our check out we informed the staff again but we got no compensation. However, they took our complaint very serious so I hope this won't happen anymore in the future.

From the outside this hotel looks small but the staff and rooms are contemporary and clean x staff absolutely lovely and complimentary cheese and wine very welcome on a very wet day in London x highly recommend as close to great shopping areas x

We recently had a great one night stay at this hotel. The rooms are compact but the fact that there was no window made for a great sleep. Lovely modern and powerful shower with plenty of room. Very comfy bed. Overall a great experience. Excellent staff too.

Weekend Christmas break, perfectly positioned for shopping and evening out in soho. Super clean. Helpful staff. Couldn’t fault the hotel. Rooms are small but everything else makes up for that. Wine and cheese served in bar between 5-8pm, what a fab touch can’t wait to stay again !

Really close to subway stations, second from all the best Soho bars and restaurants.Service 24/7, nice and helpful. I loved the wine & cheese from 6pm to 8pm. Rooms were perfectly clean with all needed amentites. I would recommend anyone who comes to London for business or private trip.

Stayed at the recommendation of a colleague, who had previously used a sister hotel.Staff at the front desk friendly and efficient, and was checked in quickly. Room was (v) small, but well appointed with a comfortable bed and good shower in the bathroom.For two nights it worked really well, but would not want to be here for much longer in any single stay. Complimentary cheese and wine every evening in the bar is a nice touch.Why not 5*? I found that I was unable to work in my room with the desk/stool combination, and had to decant to the restaurant.

The staff were exceptionally polite and courteous, and the room - though small - was very comfortable and well-appointed. Everything was easy to use, there was complimentary tea, coffee and hot chocolate, and the shower was great! The hotel’s umbrellas came in very useful indeed given the autumnal weather, and the location is excellent. There are a range of great little eateries nearby and a fab little bar across the way. I’ll definitely use this place again.

We stayed in the Z Hotel just off Tottenham Court for one Friday night as we were out in the area for a birthday party. If you're looking for a hotel for that kind of occasion, where you know you'll only be in there for a few hours just to sleep, then I would definitely recommend this one given it's price in comparison to most in this part of London.The rooms are tiny and dominated by the bed but the space works well - everything tucks away neatly. The bathroom is clean and modern with a great shower. Good set of amenities for a hotel of this style - various bits in the bathroom and a tray with a kettle and various teas and coffees.Staff at check-in and check-out were friendly and helpful. Special mention goes to the guy at reception when we arrived back at about 2am, somewhat inebriated, who helped us find somewhere nearby to get some late night food!All in all, definitely recommended for a short stay, especially if it's just one person. Two people, or a longer period of time and you will probably feel a little claustrophobic.

The location could not be any better! The rooms are beyond tiny but if you look at the size when booking that does not come at a surprise. The rooms are very clean and modern just no space for anything. Our room did not even have a closet and so it was extremely difficult to figure out where to put our clothes. The room contains the bare necessities and it was difficult coming from 5* hotels to go to not having a robe/slippers and hair dryer. You can see and hear everything going on in the bathroom which was fine for me but I would not recommend staying in these rooms with someone you are not super comfortable and close with because you will see and hear everything.

Couldn’t have a better location, 5 minutes walk from where I needed to be in Soho, and for a great price (for London) at £75. Room was small (like a pod) but that’s the concept. Ultra modern, shower room and a huge TV taking up almost an entire wall. I really like this idea of small but well equipped rooms that are starting to become more common- like here and Easyhotels. Ideal when you just need a comfortable bed and a good nights sleep.

the room was small , very small butr it is very smart to be that comfortable,it has a large screen, comfy bed, bathroom that has a showerroom,it has one of the best locations in London,they are very friendly and very helpful,wifi is fastroom is very cleanlight is very comfy to eyes

Amazing hotel, yes the room is tiny but the value was great and it has everything you need. Excellent location. Love the cheese and wine evening. Staff were friendly. Would definitely go back to this restaurant.

We stayed here during a recent visit to London. We have stayed in Z Hotels before but never this one as this is reasonably new.Arrived Early and managed to leave bags until we were able to check in. Went back later in day and managed to check in early due to room being ready.Hotel rooms same as other Z Hotels and we opted for the Queen Option. Small rooms but great for a short stay.Café Bar on first floor where we had the Free Cheese and wine before going out for the evening.Location is great just a few minutes walk from Carnaby Street.My only moan regarding this hotel is only having one lift for all the floors and rooms. Seems to take ages for lift to turn up. Apart from that all is good and would stay again if having a night in London again.

With our rescheduled flight, we had to look for a place to stay and we found this gem through Booking.com. I've already read some reviews and a common comment is that the rooms are small. Well, they are indeed but come to think of it, since you'll be out most of the time, the only thing that you'll be needing is a bed to rest at the end of the day and your very own bathroom, right? Anyway, the room, albeit its size, is very clean, comfortable, modern-looking and automated. The utilization of space has been thoroughly thought of. It has coffee/tea making facilities, television, ac, h/c shower and basic toiletries. The bed is VERY nice. Did I mention that they have this wine and cheese buffet in the afternoon? It's located near Oxford Street (shopping!). There are also restaurants nearby and it's only a few minutes walk to the nearest tube. They can store your luggage if you still have places to go before you head out to the airport. Special shout-out to the very accommodating front desk personnel -- Pablo and Dominic. They made sure that our check-in/out and baggage handling is comfortable and convenient.

This hotel was a great location for walking and catching buses/trains. Café was adequate and staff was friendly enough. The rooms are tiny as everyone else describes. I was by myself so it was fine but I can't imagine sharing with someone. only 1 elevator so always long waits when you have luggage to take up various flights of stairs. Overall a good place and I would stay here again on my own. Had a/c which I didn't realize was going to be a rarity in the UK.

New hotel from the Z chain. Trendy check in with young hip staff but still friendly. You are slap bang at the start of soho and just behind libertys and oxford street. So perfect for a business man or single/couple who want to shop eat. Not ideal if you want to have a quiet place or for families with kids.Room was small yes but for central london perfect. Bed comfy and big for the room , massive flat screen, kettle etc. I stayed for 2 nights but anymore and i'ld opt somewhere where i had a view and near a park etc. But i would come back if i needed a quick stay and the price is the best for the quality of the hotel

Went for a work event so spent very little time at the hotel but it was perfect for such an occasion. Small rooms but really clean and modern. The complimentary cheese and wine is a nice touch. Would highly recommend for solo travellers.

loved our stay, we were already upgraded when we checked in, the wine and cheese is a nice touch and the staff super friendly. location couldn't ask for more.rooms are very small but functionally offer everything you need, and the shower was unique. Love the massive tv that literally was so big and close at the very end of the bed.

Stayed for one night and it was more than ample. The room is very small but there's plenty to keep you busy in London anyway. If you're simply looking for somewhere to sleep and show then this in the place. Far better than the likes of Easy Hotel. The only downfall really is that there is one lift to serve all floors and it's very busy and very slow. Taking the stairs is an option though if you're willing.

Really enjoyed my stay here. The hotel is centrally located and only a short walk from Oxford street. There’s plenty of bars and places to eat close by. The rooms are modern and clean albeit small. There was free cheese and wine for guests in the ‘cafe’ every evening which was a nice surprise. The staff on reception were lovely and very helpful. The only slight negative really is there is only one lift which dependent on the time of day can get rather busy. Regardless I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend.

Nice hotel for the centre of London, rooms were a little tiny for a couple. Overall clean tidy and staff were great, a nice touch was guests were invited to have free wine and cheese put on by the hotel very nice touch. Overall please and will be back in the future.

Myself and my wife stayed in this hotel over the weekend of 13th - 16th July, the first weekend the hotel was open.We really enjoyed our stay in the hotel. The room was small but the quality of everything in the room was very good including the air conditioning which was important because of the heat.Because of the weekend that was in it the breakfast was complimentary and that was great to get. The complimentary wine and cheese in the evening was super quality.The rooms are small and en suite close to the bed but if you are ok with that then this place is a great potion when visiting central London as a couple. Very suitable for business people on their own.Overall we also found the staff very helpful

Absolutely loved our stay. The staff is very nice and helpful. I told them it was a special day and they definitely made it special and I could not thank them enough. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Super clean, perfect location and the room looks so futuristic. It was just perfect. Thank you to your staff for the amazing stay.

We stayed here for one night during August to see Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, Parts 1 And 2.I contacted the hotel prior to the visit about dropping our bags off early as we could not take them into the show and the room wouldn’t be ready until around 2-3pm. The hotel couldn’t have been more accommodating to our requests and said they would put our bags in our room once it was ready.We stayed in a Queen Size room. The rooms were small, but did not feel cramped or too small for showering, getting ready and sleeping. The shower cubicle is extremely large, with good pressure and towels were provided. The TV at the end of the bed was huge and had the Sky channels and catch up channels all to watch for free! The bed was extremely comfortable with sufficient amounts of pillows for both of us. The room has air con with a fancy electric panel to control the lights and various things. The air con stayed on all night and we slept very well. The hotel is in and around Soho with lots of places to eat in a walking distance. Although outside the hotel was noisy as it was a Saturday evening, we heard no noise from our hotel room all night.We got off at Tottenham Court Road station and walked the 0.6 miles in around 10 minutes. However, upon leaving the hotel we realised Oxford Circus was the closest station to the hotel and did the walk in half the time - it was literally only two short roads and we were back!The staff were very friendly and couldn’t have done more to help. Although we only stayed the one night due to our show ending late in the evening, it was an comfortable nights sleep and the condiments tray had lots to enjoy.Thanks for having us we will be back again soon.

Absolutely loved our stay here. Central location but not too noisy. The staff were so lovely and helpful, made our stay that extra bit special. Was my boyfriend’s birthday and a card and chocolates were left which was very thoughtful. Rooms were small but modern. Lovely comfy bed with big ‘smart TV’. Would definitely recommend and will be going back.

Just returned from a stay here. Really conveniently places for theatres and Soho. Rooms are quirky, small but enough for somewhere to sleep for a night after a show. Lovely extra touches like toiletries, cheese and wine in the evenings and breakfast but don’t expect huge rooms, that’s why it’s cheaper than most but nice for what it is. Would recommend for a night or two at the most

Brand new hotel in the heart of Soho. Smooth check in process, lovely staff. We were their first guests ever so were greeted with a glass of champagne when we checked in. Excited to hear that they have complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings and breakfast in the morning! Room is very modern and clean, it is on the small side so luggage placement has to be carefully planned, and the bathroom is very close to the bedroom but it’s fine for us. Just make sure you are very comfortable with your travelling partner!! Huge smart TV in the room as well as tea and coffee facilities, USB ports, hairdryer- they really have thought of everything. Lots of bars and restaurants in the area, plus Oxford and Regent streets are only 5 min walk away for lots of shopping.Great place, would definitely stay again.
